Ratings.comment: I took her PLTL. Everyone was illegally coerced into signing an NDA burried in the sylabus.  Aparently Faust gets off on coercion in general.  She has posts on social media and there are comments here in this vien as well. The PLTL is science by conscensus as no answers are ever given to the prompts. We were given topics far past our abilities.

Sara modified my class schedule without my permission and delayed my financial aid/refund by WEEKS, which almost got me evicted. When I tried to talk to her about this she showed no remorse. Her actions made my mental health spiral that semester, got me extremely behind in work, and no one involved in the situation even cared. Thanks, Sara!

PLTL is a waste of time. Avoid it if you can. It is just a bunch of busy work and completely unnecessary to learn biology. I guess if you don't know how to study you might find it useful. If you know how to study and have important things to get done, it is a monumental waste of time.

The absolute best person to learn bio 1113 from in PLTL. She makes the best workshops and knows all her stuff and is too intelligent for us. Just too intelligent. In a good way though it's cool. Take PLTL just for her workshop packets you'll love it.

Really enthusiastic about teaching and eager to help. Will schedule extra office hours if you need them & checks e-mail a lot. Grades really hard, but is clear about expectations and spends extra time making sure you're prepared for assignments and exams. Actually cares about teaching unlike most TAs I've had.
Very helpful. She really explained all the information from lecture in detail and was eager to help any student. Best TA I've had at Ohio State.
Absolute worst teacher I have ever had. Super belittling and expects you to know everything and if you ask her to repeat it she says you should've studies harder. She shouldn't even be. a teacher.

I love OBrien. All of the work besides the big Health Plan assignment was super easy. And the health plan (3-part project with 2 essays) wasnt bad either. Shes incredibly knowledgeable and kind. Shes an easy grader too.

O'Brien is a great professor. We have pre-work assignments and reflections every week that usually take 15-25 mins to do but are super easy. The tests are online and its easy to score well. My class was late on Mon and Wed which was sometimes hard but she had zoom optional classes and you could watch the movies on your own if you can't go to class!

O'Brien is a great professor. Her lectures and course material are straight forward. She gives a few article reflections and PackBack assignments that have all been extremely helpful and informative to the course. The tests reflect all information presented in lecture and lab. Attend lectures and labs and the class will be simple.

Dr. Daniels is a sweet professor and you can tell he knows his stuff but he is an awful lecturer. He tries to brain dump everything on students. This class is extremely dense and Dr. Daniels expects you to know the details and be able to explain everything covered in class. This is impossible. Awful class. Way too much material. BORING. Hard exams.

Dr. Daniels is such a sweet and kind person, but dear god his lectures were so boring. Im usually a straight A student but I cant even bring myself to watch half the lectures for this class. The exams are a bit difficult when you dont study at all or watch the lectures - but hey I have a solid B right now. Overall, easy class.

Dr. Daniels is a great professor who makes it very easy for students to do well in his class. If you go through the notes he provides and pay special attention to the sample questions he provides the exams should be pretty straight forward!
One of the best science professor I ever had. The class was based off exams but the exams were pretty straight forward and studied. He was also very easy to reach out to after class.
Really listens to feedback from students. As long as you answer the questions at the end of his slides, the exams are easy.

Dr. Daniels is super knowledgeable and easy going. Hes a really sweet professor and easy to talk to. I just thought his exams were difficult and that there was way too much memorization involved but thats just how it goes. Overall learned a lot. I think the class needs more exam prep material though and take bio chem first. He likes archaea :)

he just is hard to follow. he's old and kind of a broken record, you can tell he's a genius, but they really need a new 4100 professor. exams were tricky to say the least. just know all the material, you should be fine. used the book more than the powerpoint.

Dr. Daniel's really helped the students in his class do as well as the possibly could. He was helpful in what to study for his exams, very accessible outside of class, and gave us review sheets for what the exam was exactly covered on. His open answer tests tested you on how much you know but his multiple choice exams are difficult.

lab is 40% of the grade which helps but the exams are horrible.  challenging material but its not impossible. Dr. Daniels is just so hard to listen to.  i actually slept in the back of this class almost every day.
I listened to him for a whole semester and understood maybe 4 words he said.  worst professor I've ever had.

went to class maybe 4 times the last month of the course, worst professor in the micro department.  doesn't give you any help on what is going to be on the exams, which are just as vague as he is.  the take home parts of the exams are impossible.  the lab is an easy A, but its only 40% of the grade. the other 60% are 4 exams, all nighters mandatory

a LOT of information to internalize in not that much time.  I read the book along with the lecture slides on weekends.  i only got a B and usually get As in bio classes but i took this class along with physics and physiology with Bronson (a whole other story).  tests are long, usually gives extra credit at the end of the term.  mono tone reader.

Dr. Daniels is an okay professor. He just reads off his slides. He covers WAY too much material and glosses over important stuff, so you just memorize instead of learn. He gives ideas of what will be on the exam, but it's not too helpful. You practically have to memorize everything or you won't be prepared. Get ready to memorize like never before.

Extremely nice person, however the group project (worth about 10% of the grade) was extremely annoying if you got stuck with a bad partner. If you go in to talk to him, you will find him to be extremely helpful. Just treat this class like a 5 credit hour science course, give it the respect that it deserves, and you'll be fine.
Worst professor I've ever had.

Dr. Daniels is incredibly sedative; by the end of the course, only roughly about 1/4 of the class was showing up regularly. The key to doing well in his class is meticulously studying every detail of his notes (which are usually about 20-30 pages long but packed with information) and answering the questions at the end. Do this and you'll succeed.

Daniels is ok. Hard to understand and exams are challenging, but not impossible. However, for assignments and projects his instructions are practically indecipherable and offers little to no clarity on them.

Nice guy, exams are fairly straightforward. Questions are mostly taken from the study guides, but there is alot of material. If you spend the time to go through the study guides an A is definitely possible. Very friendly, almost like a teddybear, and very willing to help if you need help. No cumulative final.

Dr. Daniels is a nice guy, but he does just read his slides. All the information you need to know is on them, and all the exam questions come from his study guide in the back. You don't even need to attend lecture, the exams are easy if you know the slides well. He is picky about weird things but he is very accessible if students need help.

He reads off some slides, which all end in the exact test questions. Easy enough, but he has a monotone voice and even managed to stand in the dark part of Hitchcock's stage, so we were listening to someone's whose face was too dark to see haha.

Dr. Daniels was very boring during lecture and just read straight off of his powerpoint slides, which are posted online. You don't need to attend lecture or anything as long as you study the powerpoints he posts. Book is not needed either!

His lectures are very dense and fast; he often makes comments like, "For those of you who have taken advanced genetics, I apologize because you will be bored. I'll try to keep it quick." Result? blank stares.  Lectures are difficult to follow, exams are managable if you read the textbook and answer questions at the end of his powerpoints.

A very nice prof who cares about his students and will help in any way possible. Exams were tough, but I got A's by completing the questions at the ends of the powerpoints and memorizing. I opened the book occasionally, but pretty much just crammed the day or two prior to the exam and went to class regularly.

He is very good at explaining confusing concepts and is a nice guy. I didn't open the book once and got an A, but I basically had to memorize his powerpoints to do so. This is by no means an easy class but is really very manageable if you sit and memorize his slides: memorization sucks but is necessary to build a foundation in the subject.

answer questions at end of lecture. material a bit boring. way too detailed. exams are hard, especially the take homes. Use the book to study. Study a lot, work for your A. Nice teacher, take the class

Dr daniels is a really nice guy.  His exams are really difficult because his multiple choice is A or B, B or C, ect so you always second guess yourself.  Lectures aren't necessary but he gets a lot of his questions from the book so definitely use the book as reference and spend alot of time reviewing each lecture. Start studying early

He seems nice, so you think it's going to be okay.  Wrong.  The exams are unbelievable and it is almost impossible to do well on them.  They test random details instead of whole concepts and he acts like he's helping you out by giving extra credit, but it really doesn't make a difference.  This class was awful, and it didn't need to be.

This class is very easy.  He puts questions at the end of lecture so be sure to answer those on your own before the test and basically just memorize his notes. After many students complained about the first test he made the midterm and finals extremely easy. Extra credit is awarded to those who go to class on days that a lot of people are not there
Made the class very easy, not hard to pass tests, very good teacher
Material is pretty hard because it is both memory and conceptually intensive. However, Dr. Daniels does a very good job in explaining the material. The power point slides are extremely helpful.
really hard to pass his tests
kicks ass!
he's funny and helpful. One of my favorite teachers this quarter.

honestly one of the most ableist people that i have ever communicated with. he truly only cares about getting his paycheck. accessibility is not in his vocabulary so if you have any issues, do not take a bio course with him as course coordinator.

Oof tough class to open up my first semester. IMO, interesting material, but I would have rather taken an easier science class to fill the credit. Tests were very difficult and required a lot of critical thinking. Good luck

He doesn't care about if the student is actually understanding the material but would rather show off his knowledge and use big words. Doesn't listen to feedback and thinks he's right about everything. Don't take him!!!!!!!

Seems way more interested in the material than actually caring if the students learn. Frustrating that he doesn't seem to listen to any feedback. Bad at communicating with students. So glad I won't have to take a class with him again.

Adam Andrews was a really nice guy, always had a smile on his face and you could tell he loved teaching and had a passion for Biology. However, his class was certainly not the easiest. Exams and quizzes were full of little details that you had to really be paying attention to in the lecture. Luckily, labs and discussions were easy points.

He is such a sweetheart. He was one of my first classes I took at OSU and would definitely recommend! He was a bit challenging at first, but once you know what to expect on his tests, you'll be good to go! Awesome lecturer, great teacher!

Adam was not horrible but also didn't blow me away. Make sure you attend lecture to get your points for TopHat. Exams were quite difficult, but know the material and you'll do fine. Labs were mostly annoying and I can't say I learned much more from lab than lecture. Timed biweekly quizzes on Carmen were also pretty tricky. He's very nice tough!

I have never liked science, but Professor Andrews made this class interesting and for the first time I actually gained something from science. Tests are really tough, but he makes it almost impossible to fail the class with other points. He was always invested in our conversations and made class worth going to. Would happily take again.
Great professor. Please keep in mind, he doesn't make the labs or the tests for Bio 1111.

Dr. Andrews cares a lot about students truly understanding the information that he teaches in lecture. It was a 3 hour lecture so it was hard to pay attention, and I highly recommend not skipping because he only tests on material covered in class. I failed the first exam but still ended with an A due to many cushion assignments or "fluff".

Class overall is very easy but he makes simple topics that are easy to understand into hard test questions that don't make any sense. Attending class isn't mandatory, but he shows pointless videos occasionally that he may test you on.

I took his Bio class for a gen ed and I actually didn't have a hard time at all. Andrews is a great lecturer that takes his time going through subjects of the class, and if you still have questions you can ask them at recitation. It was okay to miss a few lectures but never miss recitation.
Adam is one of my favorite teachers. He made long lectures very interesting and unforgettable. I would take his class again for sure. Just be aware of pretty hard tests:)

I took Mr. Andrews for BIO 0100 at Columbus State. He's a very intelligent man with a clear  love for science. His lectures were good, but it can be a little boring if you're not completely invested. Discussions were easy and interesting. Overall he's good, but the exams are VERY difficult. The book was pretty much useless as well. Take good notes.
Quiz questions on material not covered and worded to confuse. Poor explanations of expectations. Not open to comments or questions. Google is a better science teacher.

He is very intelligent but he cannot teach worth a lick. He is to smart to be teaching such an easy class. His tests are worded like we are all doctors...Its BIO 100...use the book and give some sort worksheets if you are going to challenge us. but overal he is so intelligent

I thought he was great! Very smart. If a concept wasn't understood, he took the time to explain it or attempted to explain it a different way. You need to put in the work though, it was obvious that some people didn't. He  was more than willing to help

I THOUGHT HE WAS A GOOD TEACHER.  YES, THE MATERIAL COMES AT YOU FAST - TAKE GOOD NOTES AND PUT SOME EFFORT INTO IT ALREADY AND YOU WOULD WINE LESS...HE WAS EXCITED ABOUT BIOLOGY AND I ENJOYED THE DISCUSSIONS. GO ADAM GO!

Really dumb class, made it harder than it should have been. Lots of points, but remember to take the quizzes online. Difference between an A and a B for me. Exams I thought were pretty straightforward, although many people thought they were difficult.

The class is hard but only if you are whiny and lazy.  This is college, get off your butt and work a little and you'll be fine.  Adam is extremely helpful and a great professor because he is so knowledgable.

Class is harder than it should be. Lecture notes are pretty dumb because they won't help a whole lot when it comes to quizzes. Quizzes were pretty hard though and exams were also tough. It is nice though because the lecture activities, blogs, and labs do count for alot of points which add up. I got a B

This class is very unfair. DO NOT TAKE BIO 101 WITH ADAM ANDREWS! Take it with chordas if you can...Adam's quizzes are very difficult and pull bogus questions that are not from the notes at all.  No matter how much you study, it is still difficult to get an A which is BOGUS for a 101 GEC class.
Quizzes are too hard. Overall this class was extremely difficult for a GEC 100 class.  The notes are so unhelpful and exams/quizzes are full of trick questions.  Labs are pointless.

He isn't a bad teacher. The material is dry and comes pretty quickly, while he does nothing really to make it easier. The first half of the curriculum is tough, but it gets easier. My TA is the only reason I am going to pass this class. He makes it understandable and really cares about his students. Try and get Joe R as your TA.
very knowledgable but not exciting
easy. take the online quizzes every week. i missed one and that made a difference between an A and a B

the exams were hard. alot of trick questions. most people failed the quizzes. the labs are designed to waste 3 hours of your life. i hated this class with a passion. he is enthusiastic about biology but not very good at teaching it. and the syllabus' suck!
Notes are very little help for the quizzes sometimes I had to google questions.
No Comments

Taking Cancer Genetics with Dr. Fisk was a great choice. We had hybrid delivery due to COVID, but it didn't affect the quality of the class. He was great at answering questions, and he was appropriately flexible with the exam formats. Very fair grader. We ended with a group project analyzing a cancer genome for mutations. Very applicable to life.

Prof Fisk is one of the most passionate and interesting professors I have ever taken a course from at OSU. He TRULY cares about the things that he is teaching and just wants to share his passion with you. At times the lectures are a little boring, as they are in all classes but his love for the course is what makes it enjoyable. I enjoyed the class

I had Dr. Fisk for the second half of Biology 3401. There are questions due almost every lecture, so skipping isn't really an option. While his lectures about cancer were interesting, the final in class exam and online essays were brutal. He asked extremely specific questions and points were taken off for little details in the essays.

Sometimes his teaching is boring,  but overall it is not bad. The class was horrible though. There were two midterms only and that's how you get you points, that's it. His exam questions are easier than Paul Herman's but could be asked for tiniest details. Don't teach biology by the way of making students to cram hundreds of pages for one exam.

Dr. Picking broke my 4.0. I have taken CHEM1210 and CHEM1220 and have gotten A's. I can see why people like him, he is funny however he was so condescending to me, and made me not even like bio. I was pretty confused in this class and felt that he either really liked you, or really didn't. I was on of the ones he did not like I think lol.

Dr. Picking is the most caring and funny professor I've ever had. He genuinely cares for his students and is there for you. He lets you know what exactly you need to know or not know. His exams are slightly intimidating but if you study then you'll be good.

Dr. Picking is a good choice for bio 1113. He genuinely cares about his students and is willing to help one on one at any time. The learning outcomes for the exams and his lecture slides are pretty clear and he doesn't include anything you don't need to know. I would say that this class is generally hard but he truly does a really good job.

Bio 1113 is a challenging class, more challenging than most people expect. I took 1113 as a Picking/Booton hybrid. Dr. Picking's lectures left a lot to be desired, as they normally just consisted of him telling you what to go and study for yourself. He is very helpful in office hours. I believe I passed the class based of those and the book alone.

Dr Picking truly cares about his students. After the first exam the class average was low so he gave us extra credit to get pts back. Use the study material he gives and you should do well. I didn't use them on the first exam and got a C, but once I started I got A's on the rest of the exams. This class is definitely challenging, but worth it.
His teaching style is really poor. If youre a fast learner you should be fine though.

Warning y'all now. Don't take this class with him. I was a bio-chem major but after the first exam I changed my major. Wasn't helpful to students at all! Most students didn't pass first exam but he didn't curve it.
he had pretty intense lectures but made the class easy to succeed in. Labs were pretty easy to do and he dropped your lowest lab grade and offered extra credit.

Dr. Hunter has very long lectures, however, if you can get over the long lectures he is an amazing teacher. The labs are insanely easy and as long as you pay attention the exams are pretty average in difficulty level. I highly recommend his class.

I didnt like Professor Hunter at all. He is a terrible email responder and his lectures were terrible. I had him during the pandemic, and his slides were not good and his lectures were very long. Would not take him ever again

Professor Hunter is passionate about what he teaches & cares about his students. His lectures consist of him talking & hand-drawing on the board, which I found hard to follow because trying to write down what he's saying & draw at the same time was rough. The tests are tough & the questions are very specific. With effort, a good grade is doable.

One of my favorite professors ive ever had. He was interested in helping me not only pass, but truly understanding anatomy and taking the learning with me past what was needed for our exams / course. Helped me look up numerous reasons for my migraines. Went to every office hour i could. Amazing man. Amazing lectures. Blessed to have him at OSU N
Awesome professor. If you dont study you wont do well. Rewriting the notes after class in a more organized way was a very good technique to study.

Not a bad professor.  His notes can be a little confusing at times, you may just have to ask him to slow down a little bit or explain things. Tests can be a little difficult if you don't study. The key for this class is to get help if you don't understand something.  Overall not a bad professor.
He is the best professor ever! The practice exams are very helpful. His lectures are very clear & to the point. If you want a good grade in anatomy 200, TAKE HIS CLASS!

I had to study and work like crazy for this class, and I only managed a B. Very hard class and professor. Alot of information especially for the lab practicals. If you can't memorize things well you shouldnt take this class.  He's a really nice guy but if I had known what the class was like before I scheduled it I would have taken something else
Worst professor at the university. Truly embarassing that shes a part of it.

I took her class in 2017, I've graduated now. Prof Buell is absolutely, without a doubt, lying about her "I've never associated Jews with a group of people" comment. Regularly, in class, she made antisemetic remarks. One time, I remember she said something like "Jews are f**ing grifters and cheats. They're diseased." I wish I reported that.

Dr. B is a fine professor. Do the homework assignments and take notes during lecture and you'll get an A. Complete the study guide before both exams because the exams reflect the topics she writes down. She answered my emails all within 24 hours, even on weekends. Lectures are also super short. Super easy class.
I wouldnt take course again from her.

This course is very disorganized & unnecessarily hard. The content is interesting and Prof. Buell is a kind person who will try to help you- but not great at explaining things. Navigating this online course was impossible, assignments were VERY unclear, and lecture content did not always cover necessary test information. Be ready to teach yourself.

She's amazing! I took HTHRHSC 4530 in person & loved the class. Take it in person if you can bc I can see where it could be a lot for an online class. Reading the book isn't necessary but is a good reference. Know her study guide and you'll do great. Always willing to answer questions and always applying concepts to the real world. She's hilarious!

Take a different elective. Not helpful at all when trying to ask questions... Asked if we had to remember specific number statistics (i.e. formulas, percentage of daily diet, etc.) and her response was "I don't remember" for the exam. Didn't buy textbook, but stick to the study guides. Assignments were vague with little direction.

The class sounded interesting, but don't let it fool you. If you can avoid this class, do so by all means. Or take it with someone else. A ton of information that you need to know for the exam, and the study guide is your best friend. thankfully i didn't read a ton out of the text book, but assignments were vague in direction and tedious.

The online class was Nutrition 4530 with HealthSciences. The class is online but she has in-person exams. She posts so many links for you to read and expects you to memorize everything. She is also rude. Her instructions on assignments are broad and when you do not  do it correctly she leaves rude comments instead of trying to tell you what do.

Her online course is not set up well. She doesn't use the Dashboard to notify you of upcoming assignments. The way she set up the modules is also very confusing. Assignment instructions are not laid out well. She is also very rude when responding to e-mails - not helpful whatsoever. I would recommend taking anyone else possible.
This class was not that difficult. The assignments weren't that bad and as long as you studied, the exams weren't awful. Dr. Buell was very helpful and always eager to answer questions.

Probably the easiest class I've ever taken. Got a VERY easy 'A', and I can honestly say that I may have put in 8 TOTAL hours of work the entire semester (Summer '12- Online). Students who moan on this board didn't; read the material, look at the slides, follow the Carmen DISCUSSION board, hand in the due assignments. Plus there were bonus points!!

I took the online version of this class. Super easy, and she responds quickly to questions on discussion board. A lot of people acted confused about stuff but I never had any problem, just have to read through the syllabus and instructions.  I only used the book twice, quizzes are easy & if you fill out the study guides exams can't be failed.

Super easy, just read the lectures and take all the quizzes a few times and go off the study guide and you'll be fine. I'm in the pharmd program and it was easy to work it around my other classes. Just make sure you take the quizzes until you get them perfect and you'll be fine. Easy A

Like Archie Bunker a love or hate relationship quickly.  Many past comments very true!  other job takes priority.  Very concerned about plagiarism and cheating.  Opened ended answers to closed ended questions Work it yourself and with others

Honestly, this class is easy if you put a little work into it. You must read & take the time to do the projects but it's simple and straight forward. If you don't like to read, then do not take. She answers questions but not really clearly. Her spelling is horrible in emails, discussions, and lectures. Overall, I recommend for last science

Very difficult to contact online or by phone. Evades answering questions directly. Can't commit to office appointments because she's committed to her other off campus job.Unconcerned about students. More interested in catching students cheating.By all means, take a different class !

Prof Buell is an asset to OSU. Never have I had a prof reach out to each of her students in the way that she has. I could see how some students will rate her poorly but that must simply be because they did not attend lecture;Prof Buell believes in giving time to those who have put in the time. Show you care and she will do more that that in return!

I almost didn't take this class due to poor reviews, but so glad I took it. Buell is very good at responding to discussion questions. A lot of students just ask every question that comes to their mind and complain about not being helped. Put in a little work, remember deadlines, and you will do just fine.

A good reason she is not tenured but here long enough to be tenured.  Rude slow to respond crazy about academic misconduct.  A student did not pass the extras down and threatened to call police and search everyone. Closed ended questions receive open ended answers.  I.E. She does not answer questions

Have needed help with several inconsistencies in lecture notes and textbook.Buell not available to answer questions and TAs unknowledgeable as well.MyPlate info conflicts with MyPyramid. No onw cares enough to clarify info.

Very rude. Not able to reach her by email or discussion board.Those students she does answer must be pharmacy students because she favors them!It's so obvioous she doesn't think anyone but pharmacy students belong in this class!She says it's an easy A for them!

She does not have any regard for her students. Study guides replicate the exam so she doesn't have to interact with the students. If you can memorize the questions vebatim and ignore the high school histrionics you are in charge of your own grade. Simple as that. Each point is tallied by a computer or scantron.Smiles,words, understanding ABSENT !!

I think Dr. Buell does a good job.  She is passionate about nutrition and wants the students to understand the material. She may come off as strict but I have never had a prob with communicating with her. Makes study guide that is just like the exam!!! TAs are useless though. Not bad for online class!
Not worth the time nor the effort.Confusing dates make it even harder to stomach the aggravation of not being able to contact Buell to get straight information!TA's don't even know!

The night of the midterm she bragged that "she busted someone" for trying to use a cell phone during the exam. She said she took the exam from the student and made them leave. Her obsession with student cheating rings is obsessive. Take this class from someone who cares about the content of what's taught.

Very rude both online and in person. Directions for projects unclear. Best to see who else is teaching this in person if you need to know the information for your intended career.Afterall, patients will be asking you information and You need to know it to tell them for their good health and nutrition.

Really not a class to take if you want to learn anything at all. Buell isn't availble for office hours and her TA's could care less. maybe she doen't tell them to do anything but grade the tests and projects. They didn't even know where she was for orientation. Basically, you teach yourself and they get paid for it.Don't even think about help.

In a word....She is RUDE! Her off campus job takes priority.TA's were available only 3 times the whole quarter and they were doing their own work and couldn't answer questions about the midterm and final test .Useless !
The lecture notes were hard to understand. The best way to get questions answered is to use the dicussion board.
Never available to help. My questions went unanswered.Now, my GPA suffers. 5 hours of credit lost.
This is not an easy A like everybody says. Lots of busy work. Due dates hard to keep up with. I would have rather taken this class face to face and not online. Avoid it at all costs.

Cannot recommend this teacher at all! Expects you to buy the most current edition of the textbook, but can't tell you where in the new book to look for answers to study guide questions.She's not available for office hours because of an off campus job,but she looms over your shoulder during midterm and final to make sure you don't cheat.

You get what YOU put into this class and nothing more! TXTBK unneccessary.Software too slow. Projects have pastdue dates which are confusing. Teacher overstresses possible cheating rings.She also insults students' abilities.very cold individual to try to communicate with online and especially in person.Off campus job intereferes with on campus job.

This teacher has an off campus job and it was hard if not impossible to ask to meet for help with the computer. the metabolism animation was being tested by Dr. Buell and her collegues, but it wouldn't open for the pyruvate section.I needed help but spent 6 hrs trying without help.If you aren't familiar with computer glitches, don't take this class

Class is less than low priority to instructor. She missed first class and didn't let her TA's know.They stood around talking to each other like they did during exams.Her lecture notes are  cut and paste from wherever .Only 5 possible extra credit points because she doesn't like "point-beggars at the end of the quarter."Use your tuition money better
She missed the first class and her TA's did not know where she was. Her lecture notes were hard to understand. Tests were hard. Overall, I would not take this class again.

Insults students .Expects accuracy, but lecture notes contain grammatical errors,due dates are for previous quarter,animations don't open.Insists on current txtbk edition, but doesn't use the book.sidesteps answering questions which makes you feel like she didn't answer at all.Tests are color-coded to PREVEVT cheating which she says everyone does.

Exam questions straight from study guide which she releases ONLY upon request.She skipped orientation and left her TA's clueless about her whereabouts,yet she makes no allowances for student needs   Says the class is an easy A for Pharmacy students.Others use cheating rings.Email answers are snotty.Txtbk unnecessary if you get the study guide.

Dave's Top 10 List NOT to take any class from Buell     1. Unecessary txtbk           2.Late study guides                         3.Condescending to students                       4.Says students use cheating rings                          5.Snotty                     6.Forgot orientation

She is not helpful at all. Not approachable. She does know what she is talking about and gives good lectures, but if you try to ask her a question she will make you feel stupid and tell you to "go drink a cup of coffee and rethink your question."
dr. buell's class was not easy by any means. the tests were hard and the material, though presented very nicely, was dry to read and therefore hard to remember.
VERY ARROGANT NOT HELPFUL MUST BE RELATED TO SOMEONE ON ACADEMIC MISCONDUCT PERHAPS IF YOU TAUGHT THE MATERIAL AND GAVE CLEAR ANSWERS INSTEAD OF ATTITUDE THE COURSE WOULD BE MORE ENJOYABLE

Professor Buell was very clear on requirements for assignments and made the assignments easy as long as you got the concept. The quizzes were a breeze because you could take them as many times as you needed them to and 75% of the info on the exam is copied exactly from the quizzes. Good info too!

The only thing difficult about this class are the exams. You don't really need to read the book to take the quizzes because you can take them as many times as you want. We had our exams on Sundays, in person. (which I thought was weird). She doesn't communicate a lot with the students, but she's quick at answering emails. Projects aren't difficult.

interesting class, got a lot of useful info out of it. she's nice but isn't much help when you ask her questions thru email. you'll write a long email explaining yourself and get a two word non-helpful response. her notes are good, but she uses a lot of abbreviations and if you don't write down things she says, some of the notes make no sense.
This class was harder than I expected but still pretty easy. Just do all of the KC's and study hard for the exams and you will at least get a B.

Pretty easy online course. The quizzes you can take as many times to get a perfect score. Don't buy the book. Study a lot for the exams though. This is how she makes the class not look like a joke. She gets very specific!! Also you have to be organized otherwise you can forget an assignment or 2 which can kill your grade. Easy 5 credit hour A or A-

AHH WATCH OUT BIG BROTHER IF YOU ARE NOT TECHNOLOGICALLY ADVANCED.  A LOT OF ATTITUDE EVEN IF NON DISTANCE COURSE.  YOU'LL LEARN A LOT ABOUT HER 2 CHILDREN.  READ THE BOOKS AND LITERATURE CAREFULLY SITE.  POINTS OFF FOR NOT BEING PERFECTLY JOURNAL READY FIRST TIME AROUND.  ASK HER SIMPLE CLOSED ENDED QUESTIONS SHE WILL GIVE YOU OPEN ENDED ANSWERS A

Overall much easier than I had expected.  You don't really need to do the readings since you can take the quizzes as many times as you want.  Just make a study guide for the exam out of the study guide she gives you and you'll be just fine.

Terrible prof. Doesn't take feedback (even good feedback) very well. Only goal is to trick you on exams... not test your knowledge of the material. Don't take her class (online or otherwise). It's ridiculous. Take Bio 102 instead.

She worries too much about cheating, that the class becomes inconvenient for all. She takes her frustration on the large class size out on students. She rescheduled the midterm for the Superbowl... but it took alot of convincing for her to reschedule due to a Level 2 Snow Emergency. I've lost interest in Human Nutrition due to association with her.

Worst professor ever!  Does not seem to understand the meaning of "online course" Too much material, not helpful, ridiculous tests.She makes you take tests in person and the work is way too in depth for a 200 level course.Don't go to her with problems, she won't help you.  Takes forever to post grades.  Generally unpleasant.  Worst class in 4 years

She is straight-forward about her expectations, and the class is fairly easy.  The exams are tough even if you study, but the extra points from quizzes should cover you as long as you do them all and complete all assignments on time.  I don't think I retained very much of the material I learned.

for being an online class, the workload every week was considerably heavy, but Dr. Buell is always willing to help. She usually answered questions posted on the message boards the same day, and really is interested in making sure everyone understands. Tests were pretty hard, but she's recommended =)
Very easy class, online workload is a bit heavy but it's easy to navigate through. Her exams were a little difficult though.

Class was very very easy, she responds within a day to any posts you put on the discussion board. Online quizzes are a breeze, make sure you do them all to get an extra 5pts towards your grade.   When it comes to final grades, she gets pretty mean. Don't expect any help from her past what is stated on the syllabus because she won't bother with it!
The class was easy. You'll get a good grade if you do the work. But if you really want to learn and grasp the material, this isn't the class for you. If you just want an easy A, take it.

humntr210d was an online class that was very easy, it's hard to get ahold of the professor, she doesnt email back very quickly, but stay with the material take the quizzes, and you'll do fine.  Don't bother buying the book, got an  A w/o it.

Professor clearly explained the topics.  Would not recommend online course unless have ability to studey individually. Online require a great deal of time to keep up with the topics.  However, I thought the notes were well organized and professor response to questions was excellent

bad teacher. insults students and offers no help. the class isnt really that hard but theres ALOT of reading because its online.  i would not say its an easy A and its not hard to fail, but if you try anyone can pull off a B.
Not worth my time to comment on how terrible of a teacher and a person this prof. is.
Buell is bitter and not helpful.  Online workload is heavy but not too tough.

horrible horrible teacher. i hated this course. i am a 3.5 gpa student, i am on the deans list and i got a 70% on her exam. her exams are hard and she tries to trick you. when the class average for an exam is 74% (C) maybe is time to stop being so conceided and realize maybe you dont know how to teach, instead of blaming the students.
She is a little bit rude and tries to trick you on exams. The class is still relatively easy if you take it online because you can take the quizzes an unlimited amount of times.

Material is easy enough to learn and there are plenty of easy points in the class. Quizzes are poorly worded and designed to trick you rather than test your knowledge, however. Instructor also tests on obscure details and once in a while there is a question that is not answered in the provided material.

Easy, do not take another GEC for your science credit. The online assignments are the easiest things in the world.  Midterm and Final were pretty easy if you study but there are so many other points it doesnt matter how well you do. If you can't get at least an A-, you either  didnt try or you are stupid and should enroll at OU.

easy class, mean teacher. Buell doesn't care at all about students. She is lazy. TA's do basically everything, but the actual teacher won't do anything but deny your requests for help. I recommend the online version of the class cause it is VERY easy, but stay on top of material and STUDY for exams and do EVERY quiz-- it'll save you in the long run
great and easy class.  she knows her stuff.
easy is you keep on top of the material, material itself isn't very complicated and is easy, ta's answer all of your questions in a very timely manner

I've have applied practically no effort to this course and I'm doing great.  You can literally wait until the last minute to do everything and not suffer for it.  Very happy with the way it worked out.
not very interested in students. won't meet with them when they need help. I think shes just selfish and lazy!

EASY A! EVERY SINGLE PERSON GETS AN A. TAKE THE ONLINE VERSION NOT THE ACTUAL CLASS.  Take every quiz and study EXACTLY by the study guide for exams nothing is on it that is not on the study guide.  You will get an A.

This class was interesting and easy. All you have to do is stay on top of things. There is no reason you shouldn't get an A in this class. I recommend it!!! The teacher is helpful and answers your questions promptly.

there is no reason anyone shouldn't take this class over the in class version. online is so easy, clear and you dont' have to sit through lectures that you would just sleep in. she is very helpful and i think she has made it idiot proof. exams are a lil hard but you have so many points for other stuff.

One of the easiest classes I have ever taken. It does have busy work though so make sure you do it all by the due date. If you do all the work and study a little bit for the exams you will get an A. Skip the orientation, it's pointless and you can see all the info from it online. Also don't bother buying the book.

Easy and enjoyable. OSU needs to offer more online classes, especially GEC'S! Was very helpful in discussion on WebCT, and exams weren't terribly difficult. Keep up with the work throughout the quarter and it's an easy A!
I got an A with barely any effort.  Take this class over the regular class!  Easy A.
This lady is a terrible teacher. No wonder why they stuck her with an online class. The class was really easy thanks to quizzes that could be taken as many times as you wanted to recieve full credit.

Would recommend over actual classes. Online is so much easier; lots of points to get with online quizzes, and assignments. Exams are a tad difficult, but follow the study guide and youll be fine. Buell is very helpful, she'll answer any/all questions!!
This online class was extremely easy to get an A in.  The prof participated actively in the message board and was really helpful!
the students in the online class might have been idiots, but the intructor was great!
No Comments

Dr. Jackson was a great professor! I really liked her and she seemed to care about the students understanding the material. I would definitely go to lecture as the slides do not contain all the material. Exams were fair but she gives out so much extra credit so it's easy to make up lost points. Office hours were helpful too.

She made me question my whole minor. Tells the class not to know things but puts them on the exams anyways. Too much work for a 3 credit class. Went to her for help one day snd she yelled at me to stop asking questions about stuff that is not going to be on the exam. She is nice outside of class and her office but not good at lecturing.

THE WORST. Likes to make life hard by forcing attendance (sparse slides, codes, refusing worksheets). Clearly doesn't understand COVID & goes out of her way to force you into a room w/ 100 people. Insanely boring, condescending & rude. Makes the exams entirely from tiny details she mentions once that aren't even on the slides. Take someone else!!!

Gives absolutely way too much work for a 3-credit hour class. Don't expect an easy elective. Made everything way more difficult than it needed to be. Test questions were based on one-line details in the textbook. Half of the class had lecture material before lab exams, but the other half did not, making it so incredibly difficult to do well.

Dr. Jackson made an interesting-sounding class one of the worst classes I've ever taken. The class is memorizing neural pathways of animals, but they are not relatable to the human brain (taking Anatomy won't help). The exams are stupidly detailed. Her communication sucks. She talks SO slow, too. Don't take! I don't know anyone who liked the class.

It shouldn't be possible to take 80 minutes to cover 10 slides, yet Dr. Jackson found a way to make it happen. The exams are straightforward and nothing in this class is too difficult, her lectures are really just so incredibly boring and impossible to pay attention to. I recommend recording the lecture and listening at 2x speed.

She is the first professor that I have had that really cares and wants you to learn. She loves helping shes chill and whatever works for you she wants you to do that. come to call or not when its lecture up to you. lessons are easy. The lab is tough a bit but she lets you know. Best take her!!!!!

I really enjoyed EEOB 4550 with Dr. Jackson. It was a true pleasure to learn from her. She had very high expectations from students and their dedication to the course content. If you study hard and frequent her office hours throughout the semester (not just before exams) to clear up any confusing concepts, you will do well.

Leslie's content was dry and boring, which was disappointing since a class about animal behavior could be very interesting. I do think I have learned a thing or two about neuroscience overall, however. Her exams were mostly very difficult short answer questions. It didn't feel worth the overall amount of work because it was so boring.

Prof. Jackson is very nice and wants to get to know everybody in her class. The exams are not difficult, but she does grade hard so you need to make sure that what you're writing is 100% correct or else you will get points off. The group project was easy and she grades that relatively easily. If you put in effort, the class will be very easy.

The tests are about half multiple choice/matching and half short answer/extended response. Start studying early because the answers are quite detailed. Its all very fair, one big group presentation but if you follow the rubric you will do very well.

She is one of my favorite professors at Ohio State. Tried to know all her students, which was impressive considering the class had 200+ people. Also would make an appearance in the weekly labs and help/talk to the students. Exams were very fair. However, it is extremely important to go to class, as much material is presented verbally in lecture.

Dr. Jackson was very fair and consistent in her teaching style. I really appreciated the fact that she learned everyone's name and made an effort to come to the labs. Book is not necessary. I would recommend recording her lectures, relistening to them as you answer the objectives to study for the exams. Exams are fair but must know specific details
Nice and caring teacher. Exams are beyond fair! There was one group project that was not hard and it was enjoyable. Take this class!

She was one of my favorite professors. She actually takes the time to make an appearance in most of the labs and also tries to know everyones name. By far they most dedicated and caring professor Ive had at OSU.

Really patient and kind professor, probably one of the best I'll ever have here! She puts in effort to know every student by name and person in her classes, and takes time to explain and elaborate on confusing concepts. Textbook isn't necessary and tests are based on her lectures. Not everything is on the slide handouts though, so come to lectures!

Dr. Jackson is an awesome professor! She really knows what she's talking about and is always willing to help students and even tries to get to know everyone personally. She has review sessions in preparation for lab exams.  You definitely need to put time into studying for exams but her assignments are very fair. I would definitely recommend her.

As long as you go to lecture and pay attention and take notes, tests are fairly easy and straight forward. There are weekly reading quizzes and occassional in-class activities so you can't skip class, but otherwise, an easy A. She drops one quiz and one activity.

Dr. Jackson is a good professor. She seems to really care about what she is teaching. Definitely record her lectures, she only uses power points for visuals such as pictures and animations. Exams are no multiple choice, but not difficult if you take good notes and study. And the labs are pretty easy .

Dr. Jackson is a great teacher! She always explains things well and is really interested in the subject material, as well as taking the time to know her students! You definitely need to go to class, as the power point slides don't have all the information you need to know.
Lecture can be dry, but material needed for the exams isn't always on the slides. The class topics are interesting, but can be delivered in a non-interesting way. She takes forever to grade. 6/10

Exams are heavily based on lecture, and she says alot of things that aren't on her slides that you have to catch. Would honestly recommend recording her lectures. Exams are NO multiple choice, take them seriously. Most questions come directly off study guides but those always have a ton of material. Lab is pretty easy and not at all time consuming.

No textbook was assigned. Class attendance was essential. Email responses takes her an extremely long time or no response at all. Grading is a big issue. She takes off points for everything. It takes her a long time to even return grades-1 paper took her 2 months to return(not a joke).Would not recommend this course to anyone under her instruction.

Unfair grading on her exams. Doesn't see if you really know the stuff but looks for really picky details, be warned. Takes back what she has to say a lot in lecture... Very unclear in her message. Just go to her help sessions before exams if she has them (randomly she does). That helped me the most.

Everything is in the Lab Manual, which she wrote. Save $$ & don't buy textbook. Lectures Follow powerpoint. Answers questions, works hard to get to know her students. Straight forward & covers material fast. Gentle grader. I bombed a lab midterm (bad day) & still got a B in the class (did OK on everything else)

Clear lectures. Exams and quizzes very straightforward. Just regurgitate lecture notes. A few exam questions are a bit unorthodox. She's very approachable and willing to help. She's also very enthusiastic. I would definitely recommend. Lecture de facto mandatory because of unannounced class participation.

I actually enjoyed EEOB 415-- which I was not expecting.  Dr. Jackon's tests are extremely fair and I appreciate how she related the material to current science/biology (i.e. cancer, stem cellresearch etc.) I def. recommend her for cell bio (as for EEOB 410.. eh) Just study the notes, and you'll be fine.

I dont really know how she taught. I was busy copying down her Library of Congress size notes during class.  Exams were quite tough but were not impossible. Reviewing notes and reading the book are your best bets. Nice lady but below average professor, doesnt know how to teach. I would not take any of her classes again.

Horrible teacher. She always went back and changed what she said and never sounded like she knew what she was talking about. We were instructed to get a new edition of the text book which was very expensive and was a total waste. She never referred to the new edition and all her notes had figures from the old text. Not a good teacher!!!

Dr. Jackson is a nice professor.  She posts an outline online so you can take notes during class.  DO NOT buy the book.  I never even looked at it and ended up with an A in the class.  Just go to lecture, take notes and know the gist.  She doesn't ask specifics on tests and exams were way easier than I expected, especially or a 400 level class!

Leslie is super sweet. She is more than willing to help you out, but you have to ask her. Go to class, take good notes, and study her notes for her exams, you don't need to buy/read/reference the book at all. Pay attention in lecture, sometimes she'll accidently say something backwards and you need to point it or be confused.

She is a very very easy teacher. This class is hard to get anything below a B. The notes are very easy and detailed,she outlines them for you, you fill in the rest in lecture. She makes this material very easy to follow and learn. Recitations help alot with things you get confused about. Overall she a great teacher to take this class with.
Good person, horrible professor

She must have changed this class.  She didn't have reveiw sessions when I took it, the notes were terrible, and we never knew what the quizzes were going to be over.  A quiz every week and a final exam that is comprehensive.  That was the most material I had ever had to study.  A ridiculous course not taught well at all.  Barely got a B.

there is no reason for anyone not to get a good grade, at least when I took it. A reveiw session every week where the TA would almost give you the answers and two reviews before the final and she would stress what you needed to know. I studied the night before each quiz and exam and got an easy A.

I thought this class was very interesting.  I thought she was a great professor! She was always willing to help you out.  If you did the review sheets and practice quiz, and attended her review sessions, you should have been able to get a decent grade in the class. Don't need the book unless you don't understand something, and won't ask for her hel

I thought she was a decent teacher- her lectures were boring for 7:18.  As far as her quizzes the material was pretty difficult with avg's in the 60's but for me i just looked over the notes 3 or 4 times before the test, did the practice quizzes, & went to 1 of 3 helpful review sessions and got all A's and B's on them (didnt look at the book once)

The worst professor i have ever had!  Her notes were extremely vauge and her review sheets were very unhelpful.  She is a very boring lecturer and most of the class did very poorly on her quizes and exams and she did not do anything to change this at all.  I studied pretty hard for all of her quizes and exams and still did poorly.  Way too in depth

Very hard professor. You would think that studying your notes every day after class, doing the study guides, doing the practice quizzes, and going to every lecture would at least earn you a decent grade. I got a 90% on the first quiz and all 65% and under after that. Class averages were in the high 60's for each quiz, and she's okay with that.

Hard class if you don't study, study, study - and do the reading.  It's all quiz grades where you are forced to fully understand the material.  Know it backwards, because it's not a simple memorization class.
Difficult class. Although there's no midterm, must study weekly for the quizzes and quizzes more difficult as time progresses.
Best teacher I encountered in the science department at Ohio State by far. Great lectures and genuinely cared about students.

A well-polished professor who consistently gives some of the best lectures I've seen. Clear, concise, and genuinely wants you to understand material. You will need to put in a lot of work to get an A, but Sovic makes the path to success in this course clear-cut.

I loved having him. Extremely caring and wants students to ask questions and engage. Lecture portion is much easier than lab portion, especially if you get a hard TA like I did. Although lab was hard, it is possible to do fairly well especially since many of the lecture points are free just for showing up. Not too much work besides lab and exams.

Sovic is great at teaching and cares about learning for his students. Lectures are fast paced but he does a good job of explaining things. His tests are difficult but possible to get a good grade, so be ready to study. He also does engagement exercises in lecture where it totals out to be a large percentage of points in his class. So do them

Sovic was really great, especially for someone who isn't big on BIO. He broke down hard concepts and was very caring and passionate - you can tell he wants everyone to do well and fully understand. Definitely one of the best profs I had this semester. The course is designed so that your grade is maximized aka you'll only fail if you don't try.

Dr. Sovic is a great lecturer and he really cares about his students. Sadly, this class was split between two professors this semester and I wish he would've just taught the whole thing. He's funny, breaks hard concepts down, and is very accessible outside of class. The tests have higher-level questions on them, but they're very doable.

Dr Sovic is an extremely caring professor. It's obvious how much he wants you to do well in the course and will offer any and all help he can to help you pass. This course is not hard and with Sovic it is even enjoyable. He gives a lot of points for simply coming to class and participating in lectures. Highly reccomend
It was his first semester teaching this class, so there were times when he was still a little unorganized. But he was very passionate about learning and was always willing to help his students.

Dr. Sovic is really a charmer. Not only is he a passionate lecturer and an obvious expert in the content he's teaching, but he lectures with such passion and concern for his students that it made me WANT to do well in his class. Biology 1113 is a pretty easy class, but it was definitely a help to have a professor as congenial as Dr Sovic.

Great professor! He really cares about his students and puts so much effort into his classes. There is a lot of interaction between your classmates and he makes a 300++ class seem small. Each exam was only about 10% of the grade and its pretty easy.

Dr. Sovic cares about his students a lot. Overall, hes a great professor. His tests are very fair. If you study his slides, youll know the material for the exams. Make sure you go to lecture, theres a lot of activities and TopHat questions for points. Theres not a lot of homework, just pre lecture assignments that are easy.

Dr. Sovic is one of the most caring professors I have ever had the pleasure of taking at Ohio State. He bases much of your grade on participation, course engagement activities, and pre-lecture quizzes (which include literally skimming the book). He even asked for our feedback halfway through the semester and CHANGED the class to help us.

He is a very good instructor. If you skip lecture, you will miss all of the course engagement activities that add up to a little over 15% of your total grade at the end so it's up to you to miss them. The exams are completely based off of lecture material. He records his lectures so re-watch them before the exams and you will pass!

Professor Sovic made taking biology as a business major almost easy. His in-class assignments really helped me understand the material, and I was happy that the emphasis was on in-class learning rather than on out of class readings. His grading scale was extremely fair, and I was really happy that he cared enough to teach us about the way we learn.

Explains well & is approachable. Provides lecture recordings. Go to class b/c Tophat, in-class activities, and course engagement points make or break your grade. If you failed this class it's because you didn't show up. Preview material with book then take notes on slides w/ laptop (adobe reader) during lecture so that you know what's going on.

David doesnt really know how to teach. We are in a 500 person lecture and he still gives out assignments to complete during class. His grading page is a mess and its so hard to tell your grade. Tests are almost impossible these questions are a way higher level of biology. I think David has wayyyy too many assignments to keep up with.

If you get this professor for Bio 1113 be grateful. While being in his class, you can tell that he truly cares about biology and helping you to learn and understand it. We were allowed to give feedback on how the class was going, and I can't believe how quickly changes were made. This is the type of professor we need in all classes.

Dr. Sovic is super nice and really cares about his students. He loves feedback and will actually listen to it! Bio is kind of hard but its not impossible to get an A. His exams are very conceptual and require application of knowledge in a higher level. Overall, great guy.
Dr. Sovic really cares about his students. His lectures really explain difficult material well. Would take again.

Nice guy, laid back class with paper presentations, submitted questions before each lecture, and participation being your only grades. You get what you put in. If you read and engage you will learn a lot and get good marks.
Yea

Dr. Gould is a solid TA. He makes you work for your grades in lab but I honestly like that because my understanding of biology is much deeper than surface level. He makes himself available during office hours and is willing to help students with concepts they don't understand. He's very knowledgeable about the concepts covered in lab

GEOFF GOULD IS THE WORST TA I have ever had and probably the worst TA to work at OSU. I received a good grade in this class, so I can assure you that is not the reason I am complaining about him. He is the harshest grader and will always refuse to give points back because it physically pains him to do so. Whatever you do, do not get him as a TA.

I took ENTMLGY1350: Biology of Hope and Belief with Dr. Fisher online over summer term. This is hands down my favorite class I have taken in my entire undergraduate career. The class isnt easy. It requires a lot of reading and a lot of thinking. The course materials are excellent. I really enjoyed this class . Very thought provoking.

It is a lot of reading! You will be very over bugs.... But I did learn a lot. Maybe more than I'd like. Professor Fisher is always quick to respond and very caring. I would recommend taking this class, but it can be a lot of work.

As a sociology and women's studies major, I loved the way Dr. Fisher dissolved the barriers between STEM and humanities disciplines and combined multiple methodologies into one consilient viewpoint. Her teaching style worked well with me too. Directions are very clear and she gives extra credit. I enjoyed both classes I took with her.

Main reason I took this class is I was struggling to pay for school and heard the book was free. Ended up dishing out almost $200 because apparently this semester she decided to stop allowing students free access. Easy enough class. Annoying 5pm due time for assignments instead of midnight. Not a bad class to take but textbook is NOT FREE anymore
Very interesting topic and easy to follow lectures. Weekly quizzes that are super easy if you watch the lectures (I never read the book chapters) and there are no midterms. Overall a great class.
Very interesting class. Easy if you read and follow lectures.

The general premise of this class is very interesting, as is the prof. However, the lectures are mostly readings from the book with a few special distinctions between the two so you can't skip either. Boring. In addition the quiz and lab questions can be confusing and result in a lower grade no matter how hard you study.

I loved taking online Entomology 2101 with Susan Fisher. She drops the two lowest quizzes and the 1 lowest activity of the semester. While you have to work hard to get good grades on the activity portion of the week, the quizzes/final/extra credit are all easy. In addition, she provides you with a free copy of the textbook, saving you money!

I loved this class, probably my favorite at OSU. I found her textbook extremely interesting and funny, and the best part is it's free! The material was very thought-provoking and I truly loved doing the homework. The quizzes were easy if you read the book, and it was definitely an easy A. Lots of extra credit too if you want it.

I took BIO1350 online with Dr. Fisher and I loved it. The textbook (written by her) is online and its free. Its readable, informative and interesting. The lectures were easy to understand, informational, and interesting. I learned a lot and the coursework wasn't bad at all. I hate biology and I liked this course, more like history of religion class

Bio of Hope and Belief was one of my easiest gen ed's. We had weekly videos/readings which were pretty much identical so you only really had to do one. Quizzes were very easy for the most part. Definitely a good online class to take if you're not good at science and need an easy A.

If you need a science GE credit TAKE THIS CLASS (online if you can). If you take good notes and have the textbook open you will do well in this class. I don't enjoy science but this class was extremely interesting and straight forward. I only spent about 4 hours a week on both the lecture and homework. Easy A as long as you do the homework.

Her online class wasn't bad at all. I had to read a lot, but she provided the textbook for free. If you don't read the book and watch her lectures, you won't pass the quizzes. However, if you do the work then the quizzes won't be a problem. Plus she drops two of them at the end of the semester!

A lot more work for an online GE than it should be. Moderately long readings and videos. The assignments have mistakes on them and the questions aren't always clear. Homeworks are pretty long. Weekly quizzes are timed but the questions are usually easy, with a few difficult ones mixed in. Not horribly hard but not  a totally easy class either.
Not a science person and this was the easiest A I've ever gotten, probably spent around 2 hours per week on it definitely take this class online if you need a super easy bio credit

Mrs. Fisher was decent at replying to emails in a timely manner - but she did not understand how to use Carmen, which resulting in some grading mishaps. I also would have liked if she had options for on-campus office hours, or digital office hours - there were times where I wished that I could have talked to her about the book (which she wrote).

There are weekly quizzes, but all of the answers are given to you in online lectures; weekly reading reviews, but they're only 5 sentences long; and a weekly exercise that is usually pretty easy or fun. Overall, the class is a breeze, but you're going to do more work than you probably would expect. Really easy though.
Lectures were well organized and given with enthusiasm.  Many extra credit opportunities and tests not too difficult.  No textbook required
This is an insect class but feels like a literature and music class. It's not easy, it sucks, and she grades very hard.

Take it online if you get the chance.  Take it with a friend. Quizzes are super easy.  Exploratory exercises aren't hard, but they're graded weird sometimes.  Only exam is a final, and it's worth only 20% of the grade.  Exam Q's are copied & pasted straight from the quizzes. IF YOU NEED A BIO CREDIT TAKE THIS CLASS.  Zero effort required for an A.

The easiestmost boring and unchallenging class I have ever taken. Teaches straight off of the power point and posts them online as well as past exams (which she pretty much borrows directly from for current exams). There is no point in even showing up to class. Easy A.

Dr. Fisher teaches this 100-level class in a very refreshing way - she realizes that none of the people in her class really know/love biology, so she makes an effort to teach usable, good-to-know biology and make the info pertinent to non-science-minded people.  She's very nice. Lectures are a little boring, but not mandatory. Book is unnecessary.

Very easy to understand and can tell she enjoys teaching the class. Lecture was not mandatory and you DO NOT use the book! She is a better lecturer than other biology 101 professors so if you had to choose, I'd go with her! Oh, and you'll probably fall asleep a few times too because the lecture is so big.
She tries hard to make the class fun but the class doesn't use a textbook which makes the class a lot tougher

Since the lecture is so big (around 500+) she can't really get to know her students. But she was clear in her lectures & overall not a bad teacher. My TA, Kate Mollohan, was actually the reason I did so well in the class! Labs are important for this class - so you can't miss them.

easiest class ever. you get extra credit just for showing up to class, plus assignments for extra credit. Some questions on tests and quizzes are confusing, but extra credit makes up for it. Lectures are all available online. If you attend all the lectures, no reason you cant get a good grade.

this class was really easy, i got over 100% but it was also one of my most hated classes i've taken. lectures were pointless but you get extra credit for going, also, the tests were over things that had almost nothing to do with bio.quizzes on carmen over lectures, which arent too bad.i just hated the class because i felt it had no bio relavance...

she was a great professor! she seemed very interested in teaching. she always tries to make lecture fun. DO NOT BUY THE BOOK. i promise you will not use it. i did not open it once and my final grade in the class was a 99%. it was very easy to get an A. go to lecture because she always gives extra credit. labs were very easy.

Dr. Fisher is an awesome professor! She loves her subject and genuinely cares about her students' success. Use the notes she provides online, as well as the quiz and test keys. Very helpful when studying for the midterm and final. GO TO CLASS! she give tons of in class extra credit that really boosts your grade. DO NOT need the text book to get an
Easiest class.  Go to lecture bc tests/quizzes are based off of what she goes over.  There were over 30 extra credit points available by going to class.  Labs are annoying but easy.
Treated like a kid.  Stupid in class activity.  Good grades are not hard to get, but pay attention to formatting of papers
I thought this was a well taught class and it was fairly easy.  I didn't have any problems with it at all.
very good teacher do not buy the book though it is never used. all of her test/quiz questions come straight from her lectures and she puts the power points online. simple class good for a basic GEC

I took her for forensic science and she was fine but the class was very hard! There was way too much info on microscopy and DNA stuff and nothing really on like the fun stuff.  The tests were hard and there was no extra credit.  You have to be someone with a lot of science background to do well.  It was not at all what I was expecting
Dr. Fisher is really interested in biology and she really does a lot of neat stuff in the lectures so it's not so boring.  I got an A and didn't really have to work that hard.
amazing, simple, easy quizzes, answers are given in powerpoint and articles...i got an 106%

Do not buy the book, you do not need it. All quiz questions come from the powerpoint slides and New York Times Articles. Must go to lecture on quiz days and that's it. Lab is necessary, it's really hard to make up a lab. Lots of extra credit, I only studied for the final and I got a B.

don't buy the book. you won't need it. you can get an A in the class without really trying. If you want to learn biology, take a different class. Her "fun" approach tends to just distract from the material, but if you don't like science, then take this class. Its random and weird but its easy and you get get a science GEC done without much work...
she definitely did try to make the class interesting, however; it was usually incredibly boring in lecture.The class is kinda crappy, but whataya gonna do? it's bio
Boring class, but she does a lot to make tolerable, like music, videos, etc. Quizzes were not too bad, but require some studying. Lots of extra credit! Don't get the textbook, it's useless.

one of my favorite professors so far. very organized. respectful. understanding. nice. would love to take another class with her. quizzes were a bit tricky at times but little effort is needed for an A. lab is long and it sucks but you will get points for it so go to it.
nice lady.  tries to make class interesting.  not a difficult class at all.  just pay attention and read through your notes.  no nead to buy book.
no need to buy book..weekly quizzes had some tricky questions on them..I got an A and I did not try very hard

You won't have to try hard to get an A.  I got mostly Bs on all the quizzes, but the other assignments acted as a huge buffer.  She's a nice lady and wants everyone to have a passion for science...obviously most people (including myself) could care less.  I got an A though so  that was enough for me!
Dr. Fisher made Biology very interesting.  She didn't try to impose any beliefs on you and was respectful of different beliefs.  If you go to class you will do well.

Super boring class but Fisher really does try to make an effort. She loves her subject but its hard to make it interesting to people who dont care. Nobody goes to monday lecture because wednesday quizzes are the only thing that matters. I would leave class early on mondays cause I couldnt stand it. But she offers extra credit and new ways to learn.

Professor Fisher is a nice teacher and she tried her best to spice up the boring curriculum, but I think it is impossible to make Bio 101 interesting.  The class is incredibly easy with the tiniest amount of time spent studying.  She does an excellent job of presenting all views of controversial topics.

BORING! don't buy the book, don't go to the lectures when there's no quiz. A- really, really easy to get...weekly quizzes are worth a lot (i got B's on most of them so that's why i didn't get an A). she's tries to make it interesting w/ discussions and media but it doesn't help with the boringness.
She really tried to make things interesting.......and shes really a great professor.....but she's very boring.....but can easily bribed with diet coke.
Super boring lecture, you'll never want to go to class.  Quizzes make up the majority of the grade...which stinks because they're not THAT easy.

Teaches Bio GEC for non-science majors. The class is dull, although Fisher does her best to make things interesting. Lots of video/multimedia stuff with people like J. Trestle starring. Easy class w/ easy weekly quizzes, but the boring factor is a killer. You can get an A in the class without buyin the textbook.
Boring class but interesting teacher. She tries to spice up the class by using different medias to teach.

Pretty boring...talks really slowly and takes her FOREVER to get through the lectures. Ok teacher, just really boring. Tries to make things interesting by using videos and music, but doesn't really help. The class is pretty easy and the quizzes were all pretty easy.

Dr. Fisher is a good lecturer for a class of 700. The editorializing expected among left-leaning profs was there, but sporadic and short in nature. The class is probably one of the easiest I have taken especially if you can find a TA who speaks English proficiently. She'll do, take the class.

She's an interesting character, I'll give her that. Her job isn't easy, making this GEC remotely interesting for about 700 people who don't care.Freakin' easy class, and her vocabulary is most impressive.
Shes a really interesting teacher the topics are interesting, and she teaches mostly current issues out of the newspaper and the labs are really easy, easier than jr high labs.
No Comments

I feel as though some are way too hard on Prof. Fisher; she does her best to make intro bio appeal to students whom it probably will not ever do so.  She was very innovative in terms of special guests, and the lectures could be worse.
No Comments

if you pay attention in class and you study your notes before quizzes, this class is pretty easy.  the weekly quizzes only cover two lectures and all the notes are online.  the only advice i would give is to work hard in your labs and you'll be fine.
I didn't care for this class much but then again I didn't want to take this class to begin with. But I though the lectures and material were silly and trivial. But its easy I guess if you go.
All but requires lecture attendance. Quizzes are stupid.
very boring lecture, but different but fun teaching style. you are bound to go to sleep on a regular day.

Not a horribly awful class. She uses a lot of words you'll have never heard in your life. Some quiz questions can be a little difficult, but overall, not too bad. But in lectures I just want to stab myself in the eye
The class is easy;however,the questions on quizes are confusing.
Lectures were not fun but quizzes were decently easy.  Labs were a guarenteed 100% so if u pay any attention at all u get at worst a B in this class.

Fisher's Bio 101 is the easiest class I've ever taken! All tests are multiple choice, and the labs are stuff you should have done in high school.  The lectures are kinda boring, but they could be worse.
Very interesting teaching style, breathes a little life into an otherwise unbearably boring class.

My biggest complaint is I found more material on the tests that we didn't really go over than I'd like.  Plus, I seem to do better sitting up front in lecture classes, but seating chart had me clear in the back, and I didn't do too hot. A few fun labs tho
Her tests were so hard! All apply what you know type of questions! AHHH! And, NO study guides or curve!
Eaaaaasy!  Labs suck, especially at 7:30 a.m., but exams were easy multiple choice that anybody with half a brain could get at least a B on.

Her lectures would lull anyone to sleep! The tests were very ambiguous and the final sucked! There were things on there that she never went over or that she told us wouldn't be on the final! Its 101 lady geez!
No Comments
