This class was awful- the tests didn't cover the lecture material, lectures were lengthy and detailed, and were never finished on time.  The subject material was too complex for a 101 course, and the test questions were impossible.
This class was cake- all the notes were online and she spoonfed us test material in lecture.Wish all 5 credit hours were this easy
exams are ridiculous , covers abstract material we haven't even learned yet. but she does try to make lecture interesting, sometimes.

I expected this to be an easy A, and it could have been, had the tests been written about the material we covered in lecture. I also didn't react well to the seating chart for a 700 person lecture. C'mon, Susan.
I never thought a teacher could actually make bio boring, but she managed to do it.  Her tests seemed like they were written while she was on a serious bender.

She's an ok lecturer, and a sub-par test writer.  She does have a knack for (occasionally) making class fun by inviting special guests, but as far as lecture goes, she really should write down what she wants to say in advance, rather than wing it.

Dr. Marschall is really nice but my god, slow down in the lecture. She refused to look at the chat on Zoom and barely gave any time on TopHat questions. When you refuse to look at the chat on an online course format, you're leaving students high and dry. It's daunting to speak in front of almost 200 people. Also, the class was just so extra.

This course was very difficult, but not to the fault of Dr. Marschall. She did everything in her power to help her students and explain things clearly. Her lectures are very clear and engaging. She gives helpful feedback on assignments and tests and will explain things to great depths if you email her questions. I really enjoyed class with her!

Lectures were very straight forward and relevant to ecology. Lectures werent exactly riveting. This class had a no computers/iPads rulebut utilized simutext homework, which I think is sorta ridiculous.

Lectures were often straightforward on topics this instructor taught; the course was split taught. Contacting this instructor for assistance was effective most, but not all the time.  One in class activity could have better covered as it had relevance later in the course. Topics covered had relevance to ecology research and historical models.
great teacher

She's super nice and really easy to talk to.  My class had 8 people in it so it was very personal.  You do have to take notes in class, but she writes on the board so it's easy to follow.  Tests are very fair and easy if you studied sufficiently.

Exams based on lectures--book unhelpful. TA's do all the grading. Posts online as much information as possible without posting class notes. Has "busywork" assignments--seminar summaries, current event articles, etc. Most will find it boring but easy if you go to class and take notes.
I agree with the poster before me. Boring, boring, boring, but a pretty easy class if you take notes. Exams were completely short answer but the material was very straightforward.
Intensely boring lectures, but a nice enough lady.  Very nit-picky when it comes to grading exams, which are almost entirely short answer.

Online, asynchronous class, so Johnston never really communicated with the class. The few times I emailed her she never answered, but the material was easy enough. There was no clear syllabus and modules were posted sporadically each week with random due dates. Definitely an easy A though, watch 2 lectures a week and do an online lab.
Dr. Johnston is one of the lab TA's for this course and she is so lovely and caring for her students. She also teaches a forensic anthropology course at OSU. She'll respect you if you respect her.

This class was WAY too hard for a GE. The lectures were boring, and we had a group project that was worth 29% of our grade. The project was anthropology oriented, which had nothing to do with what we were learning in the class. We also had 5 exams while other professors had none. If you have other options, take the class with someone else.

Dr. Singh is a better lecturer than Dr. Booton for 4606, but his tests are harder because he grades the open response questions harshly. His section of the class is a lot more memorization and less application. He also uses TopHat so you should probably show up to class to get the points. He started posting lecture recordings online too.

He teaches the second half of Molgen 4606 and I loved his explanations. He makes the difficult material much easier. I did another class that has the same material as his and I used his explanations because the other professor made it so hard to understand a thing.

He said okay almost once a minute. This made the lecture extremely boring and the material hard to understand. He is also very unclear on what to study and how much of the specifics a student will need for the exam and problem sets.

POLITSCI 4191 - Internship for credit. Great guy, very understanding of your time and if you can't do certain things. Always willing to talk and super easy to reach! The course itself is super easy and has like 4 assignments that can easily be completed.

Troy is such an awesome teacher! He was my TA for Bio 1113 and was absolutely incredible! He made the classroom a welcoming environment and made each student feel comfortable. He always went the extra mile to make the labs fun while also ensuring we were learning. I always looked forward to my labs because of him!
Easy-going nature makes class fun. Spends as much time as you need to help explain things so you understand. Goes out of his way to make you feel comfortable and want to learn about biology.

Dr. Wolfe was in her retirement during this semester, so she canceled a lot of assignments. The final paper was a lot of work, it needed to be 10-15 pages and was only allowed to have academic papers as sources. Dr. Wolfe was almost always a couple minutes late and attendance is a big part of the grade. Most days were just lectures.

Dr. Wolfe is an average professor. I had her online due to COVID and most of the time I didnt pay attention and I finished the class with an A-. We had a really big project worth a large portion of the grade. The most difficult part was a paper where it had to be 10 pages MINIMUM. In addition you had to do a presentation and a blog post.

Literally on of the worst professors I've had at OSU. She makes the work very tedious and you are expected to write A TON. She is also a very picky grader, and she isn't approachable. If I could give her a 0/5 i would have. I don't recommend having her as a professor, she is the worst.

She takes over EEOB3310.05 halfway through the semester. I have no complaints about her, she's friendly and the material is easy. I was surprised to see so many of my peers complain about her, when all that's necessary to get an A is to put in the effort to do the work.

The midterms were 30 percent of the grade, participation was the equivalent of a midterm. An easy class to get a good grade in. Dr. Wolfe is a really interesting lady and willing to help outside of class. Lectures can get a bit dull at times though.

You have to go to class, there are clicker questions almost every day and they make up a good part of your grade. The class itself isn't that hard, but you've got to go to class and go to recitation, there are worksheets every week.
Kinda boring, but the material is fairly interesting. Just be sure to keep up with the readings and go to class.
Nothing good to say...

I liked her class much better than the other raters. Her personality was not likeable. She specifically told us to not go to her office hours. In spite of this, her pop quizzes were EASY, as were the rest of her tests and labs. If you don't mind an unapproachable professor in exchange for a good grade, take her class. Book is useless, don't buy it.

aweful. kept bringing up her kids during lecture. she was extremely patronizing  referring to herself as "Mom." final exam required analysis of a research paper & raw data (unparsed) & not enough time to complete. she gets offended if evolution isn't your world. please avoid this class!

Her lectures are clear, but she makes the material needlessly complicated. Pop quizzes in lecture make attendance de facto mandatory. Tests were very difficult and too involved for the time period (must read article and interpret). She's very picky with exams and homework. My biggest gripe is that she's arrogant and unapproachable. Avoid textbook.
TA Rita is so helpful!! She really cares about her students and made practice exams to help us even when she didn't need to. I would choose her as my TA for every class if it was possible.

Rita is the BEST! She is the most fun and caring TA I have ever had. If you don't get Rita as your BIO 1101 TA you are missing out on the best experience of your life. She is so smart and pretty. Couldn't recommend her enough.
I enjoyed Professor Tucker, he's funny and has the lecture slides downloadable so it's much easier to follow along. As long as you actually pay attention and take notes the class should be fine.

I took this over the summer during COVID. He values participation, with points for attendance to the Zoom lectures. Lectures are somewhat circuitous and hard to follow, but the notes are great. Open resource exams with a lot of questions coming from the homework(which he gives you the answers for.) I wish he taught higher level bio!!

Dr. Dan is one of the best professors I've ever had. He is caring and committed to that everyone understands the material. There was not a lot of homework. Dr. Dan gives out study guides to his exams which are really helpful. He also does reviews in class before exams which are just as helpful. Dr. Dan is a great guy and his classes are great!

he is the best teacher i ever had. he gives review sheets for the exam. he takes alot of questions from the homeworkd and the quizzes. if you study the quizes and the homework you should get at least B+ on the exam. his exams are easy i think majority of the class got A. i will recommend taking him.

I think he is one of the better teacher you can have at OSU for a GEC. It doesn't get anymore straight forward than Wojta. If you want an A, know everything on the review sheet, and you will definitely ace the class. Quizzes were a little hard b/c he didn't make them, but that is the only place u will lose points if u study.

Lecture is boring and sometimes unclear but he gives you practice sheets for the tests and everything is from there. So his exams are pretty straight forward. He tries to be funny so you have to give him some credit there.

Dr. Dan is a good guy.  Sometimes he's hard to understand because he's trying to talk faster than his mouth can move, but basically he just reads straight from notes he has online.  He makes silly (stupid) jokes and brought in his guitar to sing for us.  The exams were fairly detailed and he words some his questions in a weird way.
Easy class. Not worth going to lectures, all the notes are online, just get through those stupid labs, and you're good. Book really not needed, just keep up on the notes and review sheets.

Overall a straight forward class, but a lot to learn.  He's a nice guy, but he has a speech problem so he's hard to understand sometimes.  However his notes are very helpful.  He sometimes give lame analogies and jokes to what we're learning, but he's just trying to lighten up the class.  But he's not too bad, a nice guy.

He is so nice and you can tell he works really hard to make the information presented easy to understand. There were a couple good demos that really illustrated the point and made the concept easy to remember.
Good teacher, doesn't try to trick you. More teachers should be like him. He's straight forward and you learn a lot.
Very good prof. Exams are straight from his review sheets. Final was a little harder. Very nice guy take him if you can

Very sweet man. Posts his notes online, don't waste your money on the book. Quizzes grew more difficult as the quarter progressed. Exams are straight from review sheets he posts online for you. His speech is somewhat annoying, but he's entertaining.. Labs are pointless. Not difficult if you keep up.
Easy teacher as long as you read the notes he posts, but it is a waste of time going to one of his lectures

Good luck comprehending anything this guy says.  Easy class though, the TA's were harder on us that he was.  Exams are easy, just watch the wording of the questions.  He also will review whatever you want right before the exam.  Easy Prof, worry not.

I think that Dr. Wojta is an interesting man.  Mainly he put me to sleep during his lectures.  He did do some crazy stuff throughout the quarter like ride in on his bike one day and sing to us the lecture before midterms.

Can I just say easy?  Go to class, read the book and you're set.  He's very straight forward with his exams and you don't even have to take notes, he lets you print his off for class time.  I could do without the nonsense labs though - what a joke that was!

He's *reaaallly* nervous.  On the first day of class, he was studdering and sweating profusely.  His nervousness gets in the way of his teaching, that's my only complaint.  Easy tests and detailed online notes though.
Really boring and uninteresting...
No Comments
Really nice and always willing to help.  Tests weren't tricky, but a clear reflection of what he taught.  The subject wasn't particularly easy, but if you put in the time, you did well.

Post notes online and test are relatively easy. Could probably get away with not buying the textbook if you want to save money. You don't have to attend class to get an A as long as you put enough study time in. Always willing to help students.

an incredibly sweet man.  I think he was actually more nervous than we were while we were taking the final.  He tries really hard to make lecture interesting, and put notes online.  Office hours are very helpful.

Very nice prof! very helpful and easy to understand in lecture. Notes are online, you don't need to attend lecture, but attend HIS review session (very helpful!). Exams each week are fairly simple if you goto lecture or read the notes! don't need the book

He can definitely go on long tangents during his lectures, but Jim is a genuinely nice nice guy who's let me nod off during class a couple times (while sitting right in front of him, haha). His exams are manageable as long you pay attention to his lectures and don't hesitate to ask questions about papers/figures. He really wants kids to succeed!

I have had Dr. Bauer for two EEOB courses now and thoroughly enjoy his teaching. While his tests can be somewhat challenging, they are very fair and straightforward if you've attended all of the lectures. He truly cares about his students doing well and often posts job and internship opportunities. If you like ecology, his classes are enjoyable.

Dr. Bauer taught lecture for one half of the semester and Dr. Ludsin did the other. Bauer's half was boring and the lecture slides were unorganized. He knows a lot but the class is hard work and confusing.

Bauer is the worst professor I have ever had. He is very confusing, unclear, and even wrong sometimes when answering questions in lecture. His lectures are boring and cover the most basic content from the required readings. Then, the exams cover the hardest concepts that come out of nowhere. Do not take him unless you have to.

Dr. Bauer is very dedicated to his career and is always seeking to help you get into the field yourself (he posts lots of paid internship opportunities). He gives extra credit and exams are very clear and fair, usually averages are on the higher side.  Always come to class for clicker points and sometimes extra credit!
One of the funniest, brightest, most inspirational TAs you will ever find. His labs were a fun and educational at the same time without being too stressful. Very smart and knows a lot of trivia too

Worst prof Ive had so far. Makes it seem easy by saying that specific terminology in bio wont be taught or needed. Quizzes and policy papers will destroy your grade, and he could honestly care less about his students. This is not what a gen ed course should be like, and was very difficult to keep grades up. He cant even justify the grade he gives.

Steve has structured the course more as an environmental biology course (rarely anything is taught concerning any human anatomy). He assigns many group projects concerning policy papers(?) and he is a confusing lecturer. He spends the first 20 minutes of class reviewing what he already taught and his tests are very confusing. Don't take his class.

Class is mostly based off of 3 group papers and 4 quizzes that are not always so clear on what is expected. Lectures are dry and hard to follow, he is always skipping around. The good thing is that this class has a lot of easy points that you can acquire. This is not your typical human bio class. has potential to be easy, but very confusing

Nice guy and cares about his students; however, the class has changed recently and it seems they haven't really decided on to run it correctly under the new format. Readings are easy, but lectures are dense and unclear sometimes. Quizzes are a little more confusing than necessary, but not horrible - but it is hard to know what exactly to study for.

For this class, you MUST come to the lectures, take notes, and pay attention. There are 3 group papers, 4 quizzes, and 1 final. Also some super easy New York Times summaries and recitation assignments. It feels like a lot because you pretty much have an assignment or 2 every week, but its nothing too crazy. Interesting lectures, overall fun class.

He keeps his lectures very interesting and updated with current events (politics/climate change etc.) and gives the class plenty of breaks and small group discussions. You'll be put in a group of 3-4 to do almost all your work with (so pray you get a good one). 3 exams, 1 final w/ 1 page cheat sheet allowed for each. 3 (easy) group papers.

Assigns several assignments throughout the semester and several require you to work with your groups in class. His lectures are boring and not always clear. His instructions for assignments are very wordy and can be confusing. This semester he actually gave out wrong instructions for several assignments. Recitation wasn't very helpful.

Bio 1102 is super group project heavy, with little emphasis on tests or the final. An easy A if you show up to class and try to pay attention. Lectures are awful, it's hard to pick out what he's trying to teach. Rude when you will need to miss class for a real reason, too. Don't recommend him.

Rissing is so passionate about what he teaches. He does expect you to actually think and learn. Learning? In school? Who'd have thunk! I am not a science person but he made this class so enjoyable. He uses really current material (which I think is where the disorganization comes from). But I adored this class and grading was easy too!

1911 has 3 professors and can be taken as a bio/physical science/history GE. He covers the bio portion of 1911. No tests just quizzes after every lecture (easy if you pay attention). Gets boring sometimes. Bulk of the grade comes from a group poster project and individual history essay.

This was a climate change class taught by 3 professors (each prof. taught one third of the semester) and I loved Rissing! He gave quizzes every class so you have to go, but he gave a lot of real world examples of different scientific phenomena and he was really funny. I nicknamed him Santa Claus!

Amazing instructor!  Made me appreciate science.  Before having him, I thought science was daunting and often struggled with memorizing facts for tests.  He helped me appreciate the scientific process and realize I was capable.   I suspect that negative reviews might be based on rough grades or fundamental disagreements the scientific community.

While many of the topics of the class were interesting & I did learn about basic science topics that affect Americans every day, I did not enjoy this class & would not recommend it to others. Rissing's lectures meandered around several topics, which made studying for quizzes very difficult. Due dates were very unclear & recitation was not helpful.

Dr. Rissing is a very nice man and provides a great lecture. The problem is that he is very unorganized with assignments and  grades will be affected by this poor quality. I rarely had a sure due date on major assignments.

I agree with most people here, Dr. Rissing is not a good teacher. His lectures are so scattered that no one knows what's going on, and when it comes to quizzes, none of the stuff he rambled about in class is on there. you need to go to class daily to get your 5 points, and good luck staying awake and not getting confused. TERRIBLE TEACHER

For the love of god, it is impossible to tell what this man wants out of you.  This particular class is for EEOB majors, and you think it'd be easy enough to attend the departmental seminars and write a summary of it...but he is so nitpicky that it makes writing the summaries unbearable! He gives helpful advice if you're going to grad school though

Grade really depends on your TA you learn nothing that really helps you with your papers in lecture only reason to go to lecture is to get your 5 points and pray you get a good recitation group because your grade will depend on the work of others
I dont know what you people are talking about. Dr. Rissing is very helpful and the work load is not that much. I really enjoy this class

I don't what all the negative comments are about. There is a lot of work but it's really simple and he is more than helpful if you need to miss class. Also no exams. Tests are easy if u go to lecture.

I DON'T recommend this class to anyone especially if Rissing is teaching it.  If he doesn't bore you to tears, he will confuse the hell out of you.  He preaches about clarity but he talks in circles.  He definately makes simple concepts difficult to understand.  This class should also be considered as a 3rd or even a 4th writing class!

let me break the class down so you are perfectly clear on what youre getting into. a) 4 topics: breast cancer, global warming, genetically modified foods, stem cells. b) for each topic, 1 five page paper (group), 3 two page papers, 1 additional paper c) 10 one page new york times article summaries    (one per week). 6 other assignments. 3 quizzes

The workload in this class is rather extreme. On top of either a 3 or 5 page paper due per week, we also have a New York Times article summary along with some other assignment he decides to assign..which is typically another paper. I would suggest another instructor!
Hard, boring, and useless unless you want to become a government policy maker.  I wish I never took this class.
This guy SUCKS!!!! Do not take this class i wish some one would have told me there are no midterms but a bunch of 5 page papers to the government its horrible!!! id rather take tests

DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS. YOU WILL NEVER REGRET ANYTHING MORE. I AM AN IDIOT FOR TAKING IT. I SAW WHAT EVERYONE SAID AND THOUGHT IT COULDNT BE THAT BAD. I WAS WRONG. YOU WRITE AT LEAST 5 PAGES A WEEK. THE WORK NEVER STOPS. YOU HAVE TO PRETEND YOURE A POLICY MAKER AND WRITE ABOUT GOVT. ITS RETARDED. I STRONGLYY ADVISE YOU NEVEERR TAKING IT.

Whatever you do, never, ever take a class taught by this man.  He goes on rants, and is incomprehensible.  There are no midterms, just 3 quizzes that are hard and unfair.  Ton of work, papers due every week.  Trust me, take human nutrition instead for a sequence.
fun teacher

He actually expects his students to think during lecture; may be why the 100 lvl bio classes don't like him. He obviously loves what he teaches, but understands it's not everyones passion. He does randomly call on people, but as long as you attempt to answer he's happy. Quizzes are fair, but questions can be vague. Highly reccommend him for EEOB =)

This dude is messed up. It is so easy to get an A, but he has some serious problems. First of all, he is the rudest teacher you will have at OSU. If you don't come to lecture you lose 5 points every day...maybe high class attendance him feel better about himself because I'm sure his life pretty much sucks....

Very easy class aka easy A. And no textbook is used. Lectures were unorganized and uninteresting. A lot of busy work. Hardly learned a thing. He calls on individuals to answer questions that nobody knows the answer to. If you skip class you may be sacrificing your grade because each day is woth 5 points and you don't even get a freebie.

Calling on individual people in a lecture of hundreds to answer vague/confusing questions based on what color shirt they are wearing is simply ridiculous.  The class was case study based... I learned nothing about any of the topics than I already did.   The lectures themselves were boring with most slides being reused multiple times. Don't take it!
Easy class but questions during lecture usually are not clear at all. Hope you get a good TA! Make sure you like writing before you sign up for this class. It's NOT hard though.

I really like him as a professor.  He makes it interesting for me, at least.  The questions during lecture are a bit hard to understand, but he makes you think.  Only down side is that the class is REALLY long and there are lots of papers I just hated writing... but they were simple enough
there appears to be less scientifically literate people who wear bright colored shirts.

By far the most boring professor I have EVER had. I am in a bad mood after every lecture. He just lieks to hear himself talk and likes to put people on the spot by calling on one person in a lecture full of hundreds of students. way to make someone feel stupid. bio 102 with him is more of a writing class. a paper plus a new york times due each week
Very boring teacher. Bad teaching style. Lecture is stupid you have to go because you get points for going other than that lecture is useless.

Wow,I don't understand why everyone's giving this guy such a hard time.Its not his fault we have to take bio.At least he doesn't think bio should be our passion in life;he tries to gear this class to interest people who don't like science.And his use of the NY Times encourages students to actually educate themselves on what's going on in the world.

This guy is a garbage professor.We had to do labs for the class even though the class does not include a lab portion, he just thought we had all this extra time. The labs were vague and of no point. We spent 1.5 hour classes and we go over 6 slides, 3 of which were the same. Quizzes weren't over class material. When in doubt, answer HOX genes... :(
Easiest class at OSU simple as that. He is more worried about board of education than teaching  biology and plugs his own work but for an easy A it is worth it.

don't take him for 405.01 unless you want to learn about HOX genes for an hour and a half, 2 times a week, for the 5 week animal portion of the class.  Very interesting professor, but should be teaching graduate level philosophy of biology rather than a class that is supposed to teach you anatomical structures of organisms.

Extremely unorganized, unclear as to what we're supposed to learn, and said that we were supposed to focus on the slides we went over in class rather than the book (but we only went over 10 slides in a 2 1/2 hour class, 3 of which were the same slide!!!)! He's rude and doesn't give back graded materials so we couldn't check for any mistakes.

Absolutely horrible professor. If you want to learn more about the Ohio Science curriculum at the grade school level he's your man, but don't expect to learn anything truly applicable (and related to the class). He is repetitive, but not in a helpful way, and needs to work on organizing the class better and lecture on relevant material.

This is the easiest class.. you'll for sure get an A if you do your work.. it is just painful to listen to the guy talk.. but you get points for going.. so I went and got the points did the work and got an easy A. He doesn't give midterms or a final.. just a lot of papers, but they are really easy
No Comments
Funny the first day, but after that,it is pretty much down hill.
His forced "resignation" was the best thing that happened to the department. Good Bye and don't let the door hit you in the a.. on the way out.

the lecture was one of the most boring i've ever been to. yea, we didnt have finals or midterms, but then u felt like there was no need 2 go to 2 class, but u got credit for going..and he'd randomly call out on people. he goes on THOUSANDS of rants..and you'll be lucky to NOT fall asleep. o yea, theres assigned seating. even worse. i'd never take anything by this man again.

No books, no exams, lots of group work but you don't learn anything. The guys rants on and on about how great his teaching style is but never actually teachs you anything, he is too busy kissing ass to the random guest lectures he brings in. The class relies too much on group work so if you get a bad group your screwed.
even though he rambles and lectures are boring...come on...no tests of any kind and no expensive books.  go to class and hope for a good group and it's an easy A.

No midterms. No finals. No books. No problem. Go to class everyday, and it's a guaranteed B (at least). Rants a lot during class, talks about nothing. Does chose colors. Says nothing factual, all opionated lectures. Screams like a madman. But he is a nice guy, rather helpful, and is passionate about his work. Need more teacher like him.

No exams was nice... but don't take this class if you don't like working in groups.  A good chunk of your grade is all group work and they won't let you do it on your own!!!  So basically if you get stuck with a bad group your screwed.  Students should have the option to work individually.  Also, lecture is completely pointless and sooo boring

What an eye catching, attractive man. I think his poise and occasional rants off the subject really intense his character and sultriness. I'd take him on a honeymoon to Costa Rica anytime. Oh, the class blew, but that may be due to the fact my MOUTH WAS WATERING OVER Professor Rissing the entire time..

Dick, that is the only word that comes to mind. Do not take him, hold off and find another class or prof. Always wear different color layers, he will pick colors each day for people he will call on. He rambles about teaching methods and never states nay real facts. He can't tell his students from his TAs in his class of 500. Pray you get a good TA!

He is very arrogant and thinks quite highly of himself- Talks a lot about how great the class is but never really teaches any concrete facts.  But, if you go to class, and can write at least 4th grade level BS papers you'll have an A easily

Quit complaining, atleast we didn't have to buy an outrageously expensive text book, and for that I solute the man!
I didn't learn anything!

He was horrible and rude. In a class of around 500 students, he would randomly choose someone to answer questions. If you have him, you should wear two different colors of shirts or something to quickly put on top of the other because he calls out on people who have a certain colors on that day.

This guy was awful. There's no other word to describe him than that. He was rude, arrogant, obnoxious, very misleading, and made what should've been a straightforward class (Bio 101) into an absolute abomination. Avoid this jerk at all costs.
He was the worst teacher I've ever had in my life. There really isnt anything more you can say.

This man was unreal! In class he would go off on a tangent about something totally off the subject. I learned absolutely nothing in his class. I was always good in biology, I was in advanced courses in high school and I'm a 2nd year student at OSU and this is my only B!!! if you get stuck with him--

He made an easy class harder than it was designed for.  There were over 500 people in the class, and I think maybe 20-30 people got A's according to WebCt.  His quizzes always had confusing questions.  Just hope you get an easy TA to offset this hard professor.  He was a dick to some people also.

He's evil!  Stay away from him!!  He does not care about his students.  He is just there to listen to himself talk.  He makes you want to drop after the first week of class.  Take the class with Steve Chordas.  He is SOOO much better and understanding.

Boring, no point with anything he says, obsessed with his own teaching style which is terrible.
He just keeps repeating the same things over and over...and they have nothing to do with Biology.

though he is a weird teacher and goes off into his own world once in a while, the lectures do teach something, but it is very hard to stay awake in that class, and the class is different than any other class i've taken, can be both boring and interesting

No Comments

it is extremely difficult to stay awake in class because he always just goes off on tangents. it's the third week of this class and i still have no idea what the class is about. he's horrible and is not a good teacher in any way.
Interesting teaching style, but the class was still easy.
He's terrible.

Do not think that since this class is Bio 101 you will be able to pass if you took AP Bio in highschool and did well... he will make you want to drop the class regardless of what week you are in.  GET ANOTHER TEACHER!

egomaniac! Go to class if you have him. the quizzes are a lot harder than you think. 101 should be easy, but he makes it way too complicated with his random sidenotes. He tells you that you won't have to learn terms...forget it. learn them! it's easier!

everything you hear is true.. this guy's a joke.  I often went late to lecture just to take the quiz.  He didn't teach us anything really, and constantly led us by the nose with simplistic biology material. He's smarmy and boring.

Although it seems easy at first because he hardly gives notes and tells you not to buy the book, the quizzes are amazingly hard and stumping.  Buy the book!!  It helps!!  Go to lecture, actually: don't get him!!  It's supposed to be easy, but is hard!!
you learn nothing, but get graded on it anyway... totally sucks
This class is a joke. My friend and I alternated going to lecture and taking notes (not that it mattered anyway).  Find another teacher! You'll be so sorry if you don't.
If you go to lecture, he's not so bad-actually pretty interesting. Many people are just upset that he doesn't use a book or put notes on web so you HAVE to go to lecture. Don't let that scare you.
This guy is the worst prof at Ohio State.  He does not use his book ($78).  The quizes are a 10 question crap shoot and he tries to be funny but he is not!  Find another prof for Bio 101 if you can.

Rissing is the absolute worst teacher on campus. He is the reason Ohio State has a shady academic record. His class is pointless, he teaches unimportant subject matter, he can teach as well as a mute can sing.

This guy is a complete idiot and his class is a joke.  Possibly the worst professor I've had at OSU and I'm done with undergrad.  Although, if you had a solid bio background in highschool you should take him because it's and easy A.

IDIOT.  This guy looks like the psychiatrist on office space that died.  He refuses to give any notes, the 10 point quizzes are guessing games.  Every class seems like the first day, because he starts them off by defending his putrid class structure.

The voice of David Letterman and looks of Chris Farley and the energy of a high strung coke addict (Farley?). Made class interesting with odd lectures, brought John Glenn to speak, no exams. Learn to write a 5 pg paper and you get an A. This is colleg
this guy is screwy. goes back on what he says, quizes are hard, refuses to use a textbook, and is just difficult to deal with. even his TA's don't like him.

didnt care at all but luckily the class is easy and he doesnt give tests so thats good
This guy is a screw loose. Can't teach to save his life, lazy and wont use a decent textbook, screws up his quizes, and his a liar. Don't waist your time with him, get a better prof.
Class is easy if you go. Assignments aren't hard, but they do take time.
Easy class. I actually learned some things that apply to my life.

DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS. It's easy at first, then they pile on the work at about 6th week. Rissing is really wierd too.
Interesting class concept - WORTHLESS teacher.  He is the BDIU. (South Park)
No Comments
This class is great. Not like other classes at all. Screwy, but interesting!
Very full of himself, but if you go to lecture and lab, you'll get an A no prob.
a poor excuse for a teacher. His curiculum is screwy.

Josh was my TA for Bio 1113 Lab (I had Danhart/Booton for lecture and Danhart is great!) and he is a very chill TA. You will get out of lab early, he almost always gives you full credit on the labs (if you put in a little work, you will do fine). His lab quizzes are a little tough, but they all are. Attendance is mandatory because it is lab.

Definitely a harder class than it seems. Lectures includes things not in the slides, so showing up to class is recommended. Somehow lecture is actually kind of boring even though it's about dinosaurs. His curve bumps you up a whole letter grade.

Dr. Hetherington is one of the best professors I've had at OSU. This class is MUCH harder than I thought it would be, but it was easy to study after the first exam. Lecture was interesting, and this class will help you succeed in other biology related classes as well.

Dr. Hetherington is great. He is very knowledgable and knows a lot of interesting facts. His lectures are genuinely interesting and enjoyable. His exams aren't too bad as long as you review the notes and pay attention to the questions covered in lecture.

Dr. Hetherington was a great professor, and made the class very interesting and enjoyable. The only complaint I can think of is that a few of his test questions end up being ambiguous, and he is unwilling to budge on his grading. His tests are exclusively based on his lecture and a few assigned readings - make sure you read them carefully.

Dr. Hetherington was a great professor! He is very old-school, so most of his lectures revolved around showing a powerpoint notes presentation, but he also included group discussions for different questions pertaining to the lecture material. He made the class very enjoyable, and the exams were not hard at all.

This class was a lot harder than I had anticipated but after the first exam you understand how his tests work and it's quite easy to know how you should study for the other exams. He puts up all the slides and after the first week I literally never went to lectures. I would take a class with him again!

This class was not as easy as I thought it was going to be. The entire semester I really had no idea what my grade was. Dr. Hetherington is a fairly nice guy and the lectures are ok. However, I honestly would not take this class over again.

Great teacher, very funny and was able to convey the material needed to do well on exams so reading the book was rarely needed unless there was a assignment outside of class. Reading Powerpoints and attending lectures are all you need to do well!

AWESOME professor! I don't have a lot of interest in biology, but his passion is contagious. If you have any interest in reptiles or dinosaurs or the like you'll love his class, as he tends to bring everything back to them. I learned a lot and liked this class way more than its predecessor. Take him if you can!
Not as easy as I expected for an introductory biology class. He asked oddly specific questions on the exams and there was no curve. A nice guy, though.

An A is not difficult to attain in this class if you attend class and study.  This class was extremely interesting, and you will learn a lot of things about dinosaurs that you never knew.  One of the best classes/professors at OSU.  Take this class if you can!

This guy loves what he does. He is a bit more dated, so teaching the younger generation can be a tough thing. He is great professor with much knowledge to share. If the class is cool he will let you cut early on Fridays. Also take good notes and study for exams.

I loved this class! Extremely interesting, and he knows his stuff. His passion for dinosaurs is contagious. Exams are mostly short answer but come directly from the notes.  Questions appear in the notes that are answered and discussed in class, and often those are on the exam, so it is beneficial to go. But I don't know why you wouldn't want to! :)

Dr. Hetherington is one of the best professors at OSU. The quality of his lectures are top notch and makes the subject interesting and clear. He asks thought provoking questions and really cares about the subject matter. I actually took him for Bio 114 as well. If ever in doubt of which professor to take, I guarantee you to learn a lot from him.

Such a fun class. I'm a business major and took it on a whim, but loved it. He covers a lot of material for a 3 hour class but you learn a great deal. The exams involve a lot of essay questions so be prepared to write. However they are fair and cover lecture material. Prof Hetherington knows a lot about dinosaurs, and keeps the class interesting.

Fantastic class, great professor.  I loved being in class even though it was long, and regretted every time I had to miss one (for work, etc).  Attending class is important to understand the unanswered questions in the notes (frequently on exams).  Exams were not cake, but easy enough to do well on if you study.  I learned a lot!

He is a great professor, made a potentially hard class easy and VERY interesting.  You do not need the textbook!  Just put in the time to study his notes (especially the questions he asks) and you can get an A very easily while learning a lot.  Take Dr. Hetherington for Bio 114!  p.s. Study the pig anatomy thoroughly for the lab practical.

Don't waste your money on the textbook, because you won't ever use it.  He only tests off his lecture notes, which have the questions highlighted, show up to lecture, pay attention, and write down the answers, and you'll know about 85-90% of the test questions.  He also tries to make lecture interesting through his use of dry humor and video clips.

Amazing professor.. loved the class.. book is expensive and you don't need it. Just go to lecture and pay attention to the questions he brings up for discussion, it's a lot of the questions on the exams. The exams are very reasonable!!

Lectures can get incredibly boring at times, but he's really great. You can notice his passion for the subject and shows at least one youtube clip during every lecture. Exams are pretty much the questions he asks during lecture, so don't miss out. He tends to mumble when he talks, but you can hear the most hilarious jokes if you listen carefully.

Hetherington has a geniune interest in teaching and keeps the material interesting.  His lectures are mandatory but he suppliments them with you tube clips, pictures, and stories about his experiences.  The exams are very difficult and DO NOT take a make up exam-its 10 essay responses graded by him. He says the book isn't necessary-IT IS.

This class was awesome, the material was interesting from start to finish. As for format; Dr. Hetherington posts his lectures online but leaves out answers to questions. The tests are from the questioned material. He's a great guy, I would take this class again in a heartbeat! Definitely recommend it if you are at all interested in dinosaurs.
Very good

Great professor, awesome class.  He has a real interest in the subject (dinosaurs!) and keeps his lectures clear and concise.  I love that he posts his notes online and takes out all the extraneous pictures, which means you only have to haul around the important stuff, and his tests come right from the notes.  I wish I could clone him.

I don't know what people are talking about. Dr. Hetherington's class was amazing! His tests were very fair, considering he tells you what will be tested. I never lost focus in his class because the material was so interesting. Take this class. It's seriously the best class I've taken at OSU.

He's quirky.  He generally curves to a 77%, so it's not that difficult to get an A or B.  The lectures are rather boring, but he has his good times.  You really only need to read the study guides and use Wikipedia to supplement your knowledge.  The book is basically worthless, and expensive.  If you get it, buy an old edition online.

Good teacher, a lot of dry humor that's funny if you catch it. Tests were fairly hard for a 3 credit hour, but he goes over what will be on them if you go to class. Asks for a lot of participation and waits for it, so it can get awkward, but overall a great class
Teaching style is a little dry and boring, but very clear as to what he thinks is important, and will therefore be on the tests.  Sometimes he is hilarious if you pay attention and catch the jokes.

Did a very good job of teaching a class on dinosaurs that was pretty well out of his area of expertise. Very helpful and understanding. Has a tendency to get a little monotone though, so if you're the kind who falls asleep a lot in class, bring a powerbar to munch on. I had to do that a few times.

His lectures are interesting but boring at the same time. The material is good yet doesn't go along very well with labs. The tests are terrible. They are all multiple choice with little curve. Many are A, B, C, A&B, or A,B&C. They focus on mundane details. There is barely any curve. TAs create quizzes and they are all different-some harder/easier.
Worst Biology teacher I've had.  Points do not relate to notes and test questions are unfairly asked.  Not responsive to help outside of class and very assertive in his own liberal opinions

Really great professor!  When discussing scientific controversies, he gives you both sides and then his own opinion, and will allow you to have your own opinion on a test as long as you back it up scientifically.  Going to class is probably a good idea, just to get his insights.

He is a very fair teacher.  He only tests over what he goes over in class. This class takes a lot of studying, but if you put in the time you'll get the grade. He also curves the exams to boost everyone's grades a bit. The class could be a lot harder than he made it.

you take detailed notes.. but that is all you need to study for the exams.. practicals with the cat are pretty hard but he gives big curves.. over all not a bad class.. only downfall is that it takes awhile to get your grades back from the exams and practicals.. also exams are multiple choice and some short answers..
really straight forward. doesn't use that huge bio book. tests reflect notes and are easy. nice guy too. take him if you can for bio.

Oh my god, take this class! Two hours of dinosaurs for twice a week! You don't have to buy the textbook and everything you need to know for the exams is in the notes which he posts online. You barely ever have to write anything down. He's clear, enthusiastic, and entertaining. He's easily one of my favorite professors I've had yet.
If you're planning on taking biology, do it with Hetherington-he is clear, engaging and very well-organized.
Fair grader and curved class, exams are not difficult as long as you go over all notes.  Study groups help alot.
Very clear and you do not even really need to buy the book.  All exams are over lecture notes.  If you study these notes, you will do very well.

All you need to do is study the lecture notes.  His exam questions were detailed, but all of the information was in the notes.  He is very nice and clear.  His grading is fair, the class is curved, and if you do bad on one exam and not the others he will basically disregard the bad grade. Very good.

Having her as a professor was frustrating because she often tells you to look back on your notes if asked a question on the material. The slides don't have much text so you have to take really good notes on what is said or drawn on the board. Reading the book helps a lot. On the plus side, there's bonus points given out occasionally.

Meier is really great at explaining the content in her lectures. She does not focus as much on the book as Herman does, and you can get away with skimming her sections of the book and doing well on the exam. She explains in detail a lot of experiments ans assays, and the projector notes are just as important as the PowerPoint notes.

Her material made up half of the 2nd midterm and 75% of the final. Her examples on the board go into a pretty deep level of detail so paying attention during them is key. Her exam questions were typically easier than Herman's and she asked for substantially less writing than him.

Dr. Meier is a very friendly and knowledgeable professor. It's important to attend her lectures and understand the experiments she discusses (she uses the overhead projector & chalkboard often). Her exams are based off of her in class chalkboard work far more than off lecture slides. Dr. Meier is very interested in helping her students! Great prof
I took his climate change seminar and it was a good class. I learned a lot and he's very interested in getting to know everyone. He's a great person and was very passionate about the topic.

very enthusiastic about ecosystem ecology, funny in general. no textbook for the class, but you have to buy simutext, and a lot of the test material is over simutext. exams aren't that difficult, a b average for my class

Class material is OK--delivery could be more dynamic.  Teacher lacks enthusiasm; pretentious.  Could be more interested in making material accessible to students. Acts like he's the greatest thing since sliced bread WRT Global Climate Change, but not really as involved as he says....

Seam to only care, about the students that were in or associated with his lab.   did not like answers that wouldwork  that used non ecological methods. only take this class if you have a very strong ecology background
This class is awesome!  He feeds you in class!  He is also very cool and willing to help.  Pretty clear-cut.  Take this class!
he hikes through the rainforest.  need i say more?

Bronson has weekly exams that have more questions than time and take place only between 6-9 AM (30 questions in 20 minutes + 8 extra credit q's). They include very specific questions that are all application from the lectures. She gives a lot of extra credit to make up for the fact that most of the class is failing.

BEWARE OF BRONSON. This was the worst class I've ever taken. She has weekly exams which are filled with trick questions that will cause you to fail even if you known that material. Thankfully they have party rooms everyday that offer help, which is the only thing that got me though this class. Seriously take this class somewhere else.

HATED this class. I was looking forward to this material, but when the daily question(s) are nothing but students guessing it should be obvious that there is a problem.  My advice? Exams are weekly & SPECIFIC so study, study, study! Also, don't expect to get a lot out of the 'Party Room' in a class with 500 students it only fits about 8.
You have to work hard and live in the Party Room.

Way too much information and names that we were expected to know. If you don't like memorization classes I wouldn't recommend taking this class unless you had to. We also had to do alot of inane group projects, so you have to show up to all the classes.
Dr. Alfonzo is such a nice professor. If you need help, he will always be available. Great practice reading journal articles.

Great professor. He really cares about students learning. Class forces you to become familiar with scientific literature which will be valuable in grad school. One of my favorite professors and classes at OSU.

Dr. Alfonzo is an amazing professor.  He teaches in a way that gives students an entirely different perspective about biology.  Tough class, but hes always willing to explain the material to students outside of class and he is one of the best professors I've ever had.

Great professor and is always there to help students. Participation is major to getting a good grade. The midterm and final are tough, but if you show up to every class AND pay attention, you are guaranteed to pass without studying. If you study, an A is definitely attainable. By far one of the best professors in the micro department.
No Comments

Great prof!!  I learned a lot in the class and enjoyed it.  He's easy to talk to, tells good jokes, and is really there for the benefit of his students.  Two things really make your grade in the class: 1.the midterm (which is reasonable), and 2. your class attendance and participation in discussion.

This class was fantastic, my advisor recommended I take it to have some fun in a biology course. We watch a movie every week (they're good ones too) and have discussions afterwards. There is a worksheet and a one page paper due weekly. Quizzes are a little difficult, but not terrible. The final project was really open and fun, better than an exam!
yes
Lectures were monotonous and useless.  He covered general information and then had much more specific information on exams.

Dr. Hopper was highly unorganized, rude, and monotonous. His power points were terrible  and he would often email us fixing the many many mistakes he made when making them. He teaches material in a difficult, confusing manner and even my TA said that he didn't understand Dr. Hopper. His tests are ones where you can study for hours and still fail.

Half way through the semester, you switch professors. The last professor (Bullwinkle) was great. I barely studied and got a B on her exam. Hopper came in and ruined everything. I failed both of his midterms despite studying my butt off. His exams are very confusing. Don't take him. Just don't.

Hopper was extremely unorganized. It seemed like he knew the information, he simply did not know how to explain it. He made rude comments about students and our generation in general. I have NEVER been bored to the point of  falling asleep until I sat through his lectures. Would not recommend him to anyone.

This class was extremely boring but I'd have to say he is a lot better than the other intro bio teachers. I suggest you just read the book because his lectures are extremely boring and hard to pay attention too!
If I could give him all zero's, I would. Extremely rude, and his midterms are poorly worded.
Terrible lecturer. Makes fun of students and is extremely rude. Absolutely no help when it comes to Biology.

Not clear in lecture. Spends a long time going on tangents and then skips over important stuff. Doesn't explain class clicker questions well. Exam questions are confusing and not well worded. Attendance to lectures isn't helpful, however there are clicker questions that you get points for answering correctly.

I cannot believe I got a B+ in this class;all through it felt like I was barely swinging by with a C-  Labs are tough and TA's are so picky, even with the quizzes and the tests are textbook specific Luckily enough Hopper's tests and quizzes come from the easy notecards test bank so it was easy to expect what he would ask Better than osu chem though

He will make analogies that do not have any clear meaning whatsoever. He also likes to make inappropriate comments almost every lecture. I could learn more by sitting down for the hour and a half lecture takes and reading the textbook by myself.
He was a terrible lecturer. He would make rude comments about students. I would recommend taking any other professor. He isn't clear and doesn't make any sense.
Lectures are terrible and extremely unclear. Makes rude comments and gives terrible examples.

Dr. Hopper is a very bad lecturer. He is vague and unclear, and his slides are disorganized and out of order. He also makes rude comments.  There are clicker questions for points, which are the only reason I show up to class. Lectures are comically unhelpful.  If you read the textbook and study well on your own you can get a good grade.

Comical how bad of a professor he is. His explanations are wild and unclear, and he occasionally makes borderline rude comments. Absolutely recommend someone else, but you can receive an A if you read the book.

Pretty boring in lecture, but he knows the information well. Very willing to help if you have questions, schedule office hours if you are struggling! Lecture is not necessarily mandatory but you do get points for answering the clicker questions. Overall, I enjoy him as a professor.
Dr. Hopper knows his stuff. He gives examples that really help you understand the concepts, so go to lecture. His clicker questions are tough. He is very helpful though and accessible.
The best. Big fish guy

Lectures are boring and mandatory because of tophat questions, but her exams are over the exact stuff in her slideshows. She gives you lots of tophat review questions before the exam and some are even the questions found on the exam. Overall the tests are a majority of memorization in my opinion. AP bio in highschool was harder than this.

While her reviews are low, Dr C really isn't as bad as people made her seem. Attendance is mandatory and seats are assigned. A LOT of inclass work with mandatory tophat questions and in class questions within groups so you essentially MUST be in class. Her exams are very straightforward and from her slides, nothing is ever a shock on exmas.
Dr. C is a good professor, but her tests and homework are a little bit heavy, and every week discussion questions. But you will receive a good score once you work hard in her classes.
so boring and not passionate about topics. lectures are boring and so are labs

The content of Bio 1113 is not terribly difficult, however Dr. Calhoon is a seriously boring and monotone lecturer. Her slides are filled with yap information that is not easy on the eyes, and speaks as if she needs to take a nap. You will most probably fall asleep in lecture

GO TO CLASS. No seriously, go to lecture, listen to what's going on, do her TopHat questions and you'll be fine. Her lecture slides and TopHat questions are SUPER HELPFUL for the exams. If you go to lecture and do the TopHats consistently, you can pretty much predict what's gonna be on exams. Also incredibly accessible outside class.
Attendance is mandatory, but her lecture is amazing. She encourages group works and explains everything very well.

Dr.Calhoon is an overall ok professor who mostly reads off of the slides. The lectures are pretty boring and you have to spend time outside of class to actually study to ensure you do well on the exams. Exams are pretty straight forward if you study and understand the concepts outside of class. Lab is definitely a grade booster but is also boring.

Lecture is the most boring thing in the world, I watched Netflix everyday. However, the in-lecture assignments and TopHat questions were easy points in the class, so as long as you go everyday you'll be fine. Lab is easy, and as long as you study the main points from lecture for the exams for a couple hours they're pretty straightforward and easy.
Has tophat questions during lecture, goes through content very fast and not very in depth, be prepared to study and learn outside of class to gather a clear understanding
Lectures had graded assignments so attendance is mandatory. Labs were not very hard. The tests were very hard.

This class is so impersonal, that I don't have anything to say about Dr. Calhoon because, despite being in her class for 4 months, I don't think she ever had a 1-1 convo with any student. She reads off of slides (that you have asses to), but attendance is mandatory for TopHat point. I solidly say that this class was mid at best.

Dr. Calhoon's bio class was the WORST bio class I've ever taken. She only reads off the slides, but attendance is mandatory. I don't think I ever learned anything from her. Her tests are also way too hard for someone who doesn't teach. The class averages were never great on exams. Don't take her if possible; there are better bio professors.

Most unenjoyable lectures I have ever had to sit through. Considering lecture is about comparable to and boring as sitting in your dorm or the library, reading off the slides to yourself, it is an easy classes to skip and feel comfortable with material. Too bad you are forced to go. Cares more about students talking then having engaging lectures.

This is the worst professor I've had so far. She's not at all interesting in lecture, and almost no one pays attention, but you have to attend for a grade. She has weekly homework assignments with questions about things you haven't learned yet, and then she teaches after the homework is due. I taught myself everything. Would not recommend.

Not awful just not very engaging lectures and very easy to not pay attention. However, as long as you answer all the in class questions and look over the slides before exams you should be fine. exams are fairly straightforward.
Information in lecture doesn't match recitation, none of which match the test. She teaches behind the mastering assignments and is very dry in lecture delivery. Felt like I had to teach myself.

Dr. Calhoon is the most boring lecturer ever. I think I would get the same out of sitting in my dorm reading through the main point slides. The only reason I attend lecture is because she grades TopHat and In class questions. She also reads directly off the slide. She leaves no room to write on the slides so good luck fitting any notes.

Doctor Calhoon was very well organized. Lectures can be a little boring at times but are very clear and prepare you for the exams well. Exams were easy but AP Chem (Chem 1210 equivalent) was super helpful background knowledge. Make sure to do the Pearson mastery and the Tophat extra review, questions are very similar and sometimes the exact same.

I had no issues with her! It got a little tough since I had an early morning class and you really need to attend lectures for the Tophat/ICA points, but overall it wasn't too difficult. It is very clear what content from lectures are going to be on exams which I love, I wasn't studying material I didn't need.

I loved Dr. C! She certainly wants students to succeed; she provide main point slides, records lectures, study guides, and practice questions before exams. Exams aren't hard as long as you study a bit in advance. Labs are also pretty easy. There's a discussion post every week and lots of in class points, so your grade is more than just exams!

I was initially very scared because many people said that the exams were the worst and hard to prepare for, but its not that bad. There are MANY slides for each exam, but to be honest the only ones that matter are the main point slides. She does MANY tophat questions in lecture, but they are easy points which helps a ton. Start studying early!

I found the class enjoyable and informative. Attendance for lectures is mandatory, and there are weekly homework assignments. She explains the course material and provides the slideshows used during lectures. She was also clear about what would be on the tests. However, the grading system is heavily based on exams, so it's important to study.

I was surprised by the low score for her, she wasn't the best teacher ever but she also definitely wasn't bad in my experience.  Just pay attention in lectures, take notes, and have a good study strategy and you should be okay.  
She does tophat every class, so attendance is taken through that alongside ICAs but I learned in her class.

She knows her stuff, but the organization of her modules is horrible and she gives out way too much homework for an intro course. There were times where I found myself struggling to keep up. The exams were worded in a way that can trick you if you're not careful. She puts extra credit in the class, so take advantage of that if you take this.

Lectures were very excessive and an extreme amount of Tophat questions per class. Personally, didn't like the note slides because they were filled in already. Posts study guides/main concept sheet for every exam. Lab was definitely a grade booster, lots of projects, quizzes, assignments for lab. Exams are easy and straightfoward if you go to class

Dr. Calhoon is a great professor who really knows her stuff. She is lecture heavy and a lot of points come from in-class tophat questions and lecture questions, but this provides opportunity for easy points. Textbook is not required.
I loved the way she explained content. She encouraged us to think for ourselves but guided us when we got stuck. Provided us w/ clear organized notes and there were no surprises on exams.

Lectures are somewhat excessive with a lot of in-class points. If you aren't a morning person like me, don't choose an early section that you'll sleep in past. In-class points make up more than 12% of your overall grade. Tests are lab quizzes are easy if you study, and labs are never bad. Workload is decent, but not terrible.

Dr. Calhoon reads of powerpoint slides during lectures. Tests are relatively easy as long as you study the Top Hat questions given in class. Attendance is based on Top Hat questions and in class activities as a group. Boring class but not terribly difficult.

Only thing bad is that attendance is basically mandatory. In-class activities/top-hat questions for points are given in each lecture. Other than that, the tests are straightforward and are exactly what she says during lecture. No need to read the textbook. She's a good lecturer and her slides are easy to understand and provide enough information.

She is one of the worst professors I have ever had. The information on the slides that she gives in class is different from what you would see on the exam. The lectures are very boring, she just talks and gives you questions in between. She grades her assignments to hard, she expects you to be a professional scientist. FIND A DIFFERENT BIO TEACHER!

Professor Calhoon is a great lecturer. Bio 1113 is not an easy class, but professor Calhoon made an A very possible. She gives you all the resources you need for the exams. She is incredibly organized. Attendance isn't technically mandatory, but there are top hats every class that ARE taken for a grade, so come to class!

While Professor Calhoon is a very nice and easy to access if needing help, her class is really hard you if dont watch the lectures and do the participation assignments . Her exams are super hard and worded in a way for you to fail.

Dr. Calhoon gives all the resources to pass her class. It is by no means an easy A, but she tells you exactly what you need to know for the tests and compiles it into one study guide for each test. She knows a lot about the information in this class. I loved every minute of having Dr. C!

While she is SUPER smart and knows a ton about what she's teaching, this class is way too busy work oriented, and the wording on her exams are insane. It's like trying to decipher latin without a dictionary. For being a Gen Ed class, it is far too much effort, and not worth it for how much stress it causes. Find another professor.

Dr. Calhoon is a very knowledgeable professor who provides the information and resources for you to pass her class. If you're anything like me, you HAVE TO STUDY to pass the tests. You can't pass without putting in effort, doing the homework, and studying for the tests. This class is hard, but she's a great professor with a lot to offer!

She was the lecturer for Samantha Kelly Herrmann's online Bio 1102 The Class follows a pattern of *15 Minute Video * 3-10 Question *15 Minute Video *Etc It's an excellent format. The lectures are good, and they cover literally everything you need to know, book is optional. Late Work is accepted at an extremely generous -10% per day.
Lots of work but doable, 4 exams, a quiz, a disease project, and participation graded, extra credit included. Tests are tough.

By participation I mean TopHat questions. She asks about 4-6 every single lecture so make sure to bring some device with you to class. These questions may seem annoying but they are extremely helpful to study for the tests. Theres about 4 tests including the final, but she complies all the information we need to know into main point slides.

I took this class for an admission prerequisite for my program and its just an introductory to biology. Its like high school bio just deeper information. But if you decide to have this professor, just know she includes a lot of participation off of top hat&packback which is dumb, 4 reading assignments, lab, oh & her tests are difficultly worded.
She has so many difficult exams and is a tough grader. She behaves like a PPT reader and boring lecture, I almost fall sleep. She never smiles in class and her face is like her students are robots.

Her class is obviously going be be lecture heavy because there was a lot of information that needed to be covered in a short amount of time, but Dr. Calhoon did a good job of breaking up class with different group activities and tophat questions. She also provides a decent amount of extra credit which is really nice.
Class was okay. Liz wasn't very helpful to talk to in person. Her tests often have options that read "two of the above" but never specify which two, which is pretty annoying.
Easy class with boring lectures. Show up to class and pay attention and it'll be an easy A.
Incredibly hard for just a GE. Exams are extremely difficult and unlike any material we discuss in class. Very difficult to obtain an A.
This class was fairly easy as long as you attended lecture in order to get top hat points. Labs were really long and usually boring. Lexie was my TA and she helped me out tremendously!
Crazy boring and too hard for a GE course. Don't even get me started with the useless labs. If your looking for an A, although not impossible, I would chose another class or professor.
The exams are rough and she words the questions weirdly.

Dr. Calhoon didn't have very interesting lectures and its pretty much mandatory to go because there are a lot of in-class points. However, if you review the main point slides and make flashcards for the bold terms she tells you to know-- the class is a breeze!

Exams are incredibly hard. I memorized the slides and study guide and they are almost nothing like the exams. I spent all of my time studying and could not get higher than a C on both exams. FIND ANOTHER BIO TEACHER.

Fairly easy class as long you take notes and attend class. Attendance is not mandatory but lots of tophat questions and group activities that are turned in. Exams mostly concept based, but easy as long as you study. Lectures can be long at points, but a plus is that all the slides are put on carmen. Easy GE credit class. Labs are not hard either.

This class can be fairly easy as long as you attend and take notes. Attendance isnt mandatory, but lots of tophat questions & group activities that you turn in. Lectures can be pretty long and can lose interest, a plus is that she posts all the slides on Carmen. Exams are not that bad as long as you study the material, concept based, but not hard

Lectures are incredibly monotonous. She reads straight off the powerpoint slide, and this doesn't help you at all on the exams as the questions are all applied concepts. I took this class because it was supposed to be an easy intro, but she made it pretty difficult to keep up.
Lectures are INCREDIBLY lack-luster. Good luck staying awake.

Easy. Go to class to get points from TopHat, but you don't need to pay attention. Labs are ridiculously simple, homework assignments are easy and take less than 15 minutes, exams are also easy as long as you pay some attention and study the vocab. Lots of grades so messing up a few assignments won't tank your grade. Best GE science.

Calhoon is pretty boring. Even though attendance is not mandatory, she gives you grades on top hat questions that you can only get in lecture.  She literally reads off the slides and that all so it seems pointless going to class. Lab is the biggest waste of my time; you need to go but learn nothing from it. Don't take her if you can help it.

This class was supposed to be an Introduction to Biology, instead it turned into 15 hour study days for an average grade. The material itself is interesting. However, Dr. Calhoon ruins that. She reads from the slides; this ends up hurting you on the exams, because they are application. Lectures suck. No missed lab policy. Badly structured class.
The lectures are very boring. She reads directly from the slides. You have to go to class in order to get Top Hat points. The tests are hard. Do not take this class if you are looking for an easy GE.

While the class itself was not too hard, the lectures  were dry to the point of being hard to listen to. In addition, the fact that the TopHat points are graded for credit means you're forced to attend and sit through her reading off of a slide. Pace of lectures was very inconsistent. Some days you're scrambling to take notes, others are slow.
Calhoon has a dry lecture but if you go to class and listen and take good notes, this is an easy GE class. Exams are easy if you show up to class and go to recitation for the jepordy review game.

Dr. Chiucchi is the worst round about talker. He goes on tangents every class period that are barely related to our lecture. He is very knowledgeable but not the best at teaching. He is super nice and funny but I haven't learned anything this entire semester. If you actually need to know biology then please choose someone else.

Dr. Chiucchi talks more than any professor I've ever encountered. He goes on insane tangents that are barely related to our actual content. He's extremely hard to follow but he is nice and fairly funny. I wouldn't take this class if you actually need/want to learn biology. His tests aren't too bad but it's hard to study. I would avoid.
Dr. Chiucchi was a nice guy, and he would always crack jokes. The Bio department is evil though, and the extra credit that he gave us barely affected our grades. Nice glasses though.

You watch all lecture videos before class, he does a fantastic job of giving you time to complete the videos. Lecture time is entirely tophat and review. Besides Exams, the only other graded stuff is lab, so lab projects (almost all are group work) make up most of your grade.

If you can avoid this class, please find another teacher. James Chiucchi is super laid-back but teaches in a weird, backwards style that lacks continuity and coordination, creating confusing and outright worthless lectures with tophat questions no one knows the answers to. The first exam was 65% and he blamed the students for their grades.

Dr. Chiucchi is extremely chill and sets up the class in a way where it is easy to digest a lot of concepts at a comfortable pace. Keeps the class engaged with his sense of humor and interesting discussions. Can sometimes be confusing but usually explains questions thoroughly. Highly recommend.
I would recommend a different BIO1114 professor.

Dr. Chiucchi is a funny guy and is knowledgable when it comes to biology, but his explanations can get lost in translation sometimes and he tends to go on tangents in lecture quite frequently which makes it hard to pay attention when its online. I'd recommend taking notes. Lab material didn't really line up with lecture which was confusing.

Firstly, easy class. However, lectures are extremely disorganized. Lab is horrible and worth more than 50% of your grade. Exams are fair and pretty straightforward. Beware of the Lab exam... He can explain something that takes 10 minutes in an hour.

Really bad at fully explaining concepts. He talks about concepts as if you are already familiar with the concepts being talked about. His test questions were extremely difficult, and not straight forward.

Chiucchi can go off on tangents and isn't always the most accessible but that isn't anything out of the ordinary for such a large lecture. He is really good at connecting info to outside areas which makes it way easier to learn. He always answers questions. Tests kind of such (worth a lot of the grade with typically low averages) but thats typical.

I took this course as a MWF, but it was a flipped class. During "lecture" we did tophat questions and learned were unrelated tangents. Recorded lectures were posted late the night before, bc he "lost track of time" and were confusing. Anything is better than flipped class. Sent a few emails, only 1 responded, lab doesn't match lecture and TAs eh
If you pay attention you will pass.

This class was meant to be in person, but now is online is frustrating because I wrote nearly three emails and only one of the three was answered after two weeks of emailing him. Asking questions is difficult because there is 400 other students. The exams are a large portion of your grade and is purely a guessing game. Hold off taking this class.
Great professor, explains topics thoroughly and will help students understand and connect the big ideas. Shares great experiences in his field and interacts well with students and TAs.

I don't get why his rating is so high. He comes off very chill with that said he seems pretty careless and nonchalant. He writes exams the night before, the exams are worded poorly. He does not lecture very well in my opinion. I just dreaded this class. He often went on tangents during tophat lectures which was a waste of time.

Lectures are boring and he spends large amount of time in unnecessary tophat questions. There is a group project in lab part. You have to teach the material to yourself otherwise lectures don't help. He doesn't reply to his emails.

Genuinely cared and is one of the only huge lectures I've enjoyed at osu. He had a good sense of humor and charisma and the class was pretty easy. The lab was kind of difficult depending on what TA you get.

Easily my favorite professor of my college career. If you're reading this Chiucchi, ily. Don't let the haters bring you down. - Lots of office hours/personal help - Very funny and personable - Cuffs his jeans - Drinks lots of tea - Plays soccer with colleagues - Likes dogs - Hates when people misuse the word "adaptation" - Individuals don't evolve

Dr. Chiucchi's class can at times be hard to follow, but overall is fairly easy. Everything is kind of conceptual, which is what can make it challenging, but if you memorize the stuff you can, the rest can be easily guessed. Dr. Chiucchi can sometimes get off topic and he often talks a lot about things that aren't going to be on the exam.

Here at Ohio State Professor Chiucchi is just an outstanding lecturer. Everyone here loves him So funny in class he's a real goofball Best part of my day was talking to him after lecture Afterwards he was really helpful in answering my questions Done with the class would recommend to everyone

Chiucchi was an ok professor. During his lectures, I felt like I knew what he was teaching us. Until those exams came. The questions were so finicky like whaaat? He says he gives straightforward questions but some of them weren't easy. Honestly actually go through the slides. It not an easy A like everyone says it is. Work hard and good luck!

Chiucchi was awesome. He has a really good sense of humor and finds a way to teach the dry material in an interesting way.
