If you study your notes often, you should do well on the tests because the midterms are very fair, although there are several tricky questions on each test. The lab portion of this class was much harder than the lecture part.

Chiucchi is awesome. I wish I had taken bio 1113 with him. He gives TONS of examples during lecture to help students remember concepts. He's funny and truly enjoys what he does. Would take another class with him if given the option.
Hard tests lectures kinda helped you didn't have to go but it helped with the tophat points recitation was useless but you had to go

He was a really good professor. The only complaint I have is that he wouldnt organize information as well as 1113 professors usually do. However this isnt really his fault as the class concepts are abstract and hard to understand for me. Overall fun professor and makes learning worthwhile.

Lectures are extremely pointless but GO because the tophat grade is a major grade boost. Lab TA's are hit or miss and there are a ton of points in lab. Exams are easy but somehow the final was very hard so take it seriously.

Really cool and fun guy. Keeps lecture interesting. You don't need to read the textbook or take notes, just show up to lecture and pay attention and you'll be fine. Really didn't require much work outside of class and lab. Lab practical is a bit tough but always got out of lab early. I would recommend Dr. Chiucchi to anyone.

Dr. Chiucchi was nice and he tried to make lecture interesting, sometimes he tried a little too hard to be relatable, but it was fine. I liked this class a lot more than Bio 1113, it's a lot more conceptual. Lab portion was fine too. Nothing to write home about but it was a decent class.

Dr. Chiucchi's lectures are great. He is hilarious and very personable. He does get a little off topic at times, but overall he is a fantastic professor. I think he clearly explains all of the content and his exams are pretty straight forward. If you put in the work for the class, you will do just fine.

took his class because previous ratings and other things I heard about the class were good. In the first semester of 2017, his lectures are very boring and not indicative of what is on the exam. The 2nd midterm was especially annoying. Poorly written exams and makes speaking mistakes in lecture. the lab portion with the TA is fine.

Chiucchi was a solid lecturer, he wasn't boring or anything in class, slides were plenty interesting. This class covers almost no content whatsoever. If its required for your major or you're taking it as an elective, this is an easy A.

Dr. Chiucchi was a great lecturer. He really knew his stuff. I felt like I did nothing in the class, but when looking back I learned so much! He does assign papers but they can be pretty easy. The book is not necessary!
Super fun class, makes things enjoyable. Tests are fair but you do have to study for them. He and most of the TAs are very helpful

Smock is an amazing professor. However, the head lab TA, Kara Dreher, is the most frustrating person I've ever engaged with as a student. Vague questions and hard grading. Seems unknowledgeable about biology and I'd rather pull out my teeth than listen to her attempt to teach recitation again, she is SO boring and genuinely awkward to listen to.

Super smart and passionate about teaching. She was sweet and great at helping you understand. She didnt have a final or any exams, she had 5 50 pt quizzes. Some people had a hard time with them. I just memorized all the slides a night or two before and did fine. She offered extra credit. I also got a nice TA, I have heard bad stories about others.

Dr. Smock is overall a good lecturer however the 5 lecture quizzes are a little difficult and will definitely impact your grade if you don't do good on one or two of them. The lab for this class is actually horrible though and if you don't have a good lab group good luck. My lab TA was Gordon and he's the worst grader ever.
Super chill. No real exams, just a few online proctored quizzes. Uses TopHat each class for attendance. Records lectures and uses good slides.

Professor Smock is great! There aren't any mid or final, so it wasn't painful during the final time. Instead, there are 5 quizzes and the average score is high. There are lots of bonus points, so if you put much effort you can get an A easily.

Dr. Smock was a good teacher, however her bi-weekly lecture quizzes were difficult, and affect your grade. Lecture was fine, participation points were tallied randomly, you had to get the question correct to get the point. She gives a decent amount of extra credit so do all of it!

Attending lectures is very important and is extremely helpful for the class. She gives so many extra point opportunities. The quizzes are all online and proctored by HonorLock. There is no “final”, just quiz #5 which isn't cumulative. I loved bio 1114 with her!

really lenient and gives a lot of extra credit opportunities that you should definitely take advantage of even if you don't need it at the time. class was super chill and you can easily get an A if you put effort in on quizzes. however, some content is rly boring and can be easy to skip lecture or just tune it out and get behind.

Dr.Smock was a great professor, but lectures got boring over the semester. Instead of midterms, there are biweekly proctored and timed quizzes. The guided notes are all you need to do well on the quizzes. However, it is good to start studying way before the quizzes, as they are application-based.

A good professor easy to approach but the ABP project was a waste of time. Give lots of extra credit she does biweekly quizzes that's online but proctored. You don't get to chose your bio lab group she assigns you to a group. Also there's a lab cumulative final along with three lab quiz and one gets dropped.

For future BIO 1114 students: Keep in mind that while your professor is knowledgeable and kind, TAs handle grading for homework and projects etc. The professor uses Top Hat and expects you to stay engaged in class because those are big chunk of your grade. Some assignments can be very hard so I would recommend to do it early and work with your Ta

While I do not find the content in 1114 to be an interest of mine, Dr. Smock is a great and caring professor. Great heart and wants to see her students succeed, through bonus and out of class accessibility. Exams are very clear and accurate to her lectures, you will do well if you put in the time. If you have to take 1114, take it with Dr. Smock.

Smock was great. She explained content multiple times and tied in past content/terms when applicable, which helped solidify my understanding. She gave a ton of extra credit. So reviews said her lectures were "painful." I think it depends on how much you care about the content. Smock does a great job bringing up current global issues and solutions.
Lectures are painful. Tests are fair. She is friendly overall. Work load not bad.

Lectures can be insufferable at some timesTalks like an annoying mom when a few people are talking instead of just talking louder or turning her microphone up. It's just annoying and wastes time because in a room of 450 people, some are bound to talk. Grading is harsh too, never expect 100%
I took 1114 not 1114H but there's no option for that. Great professor, interesting lectures.

She doesn't give any exams, but just biweekly quizzes. It personally isn't for me, but it makes you study more often but less intensely. She is an outstanding lecturer though, and teaches super interesting material. Attendance is mandatory though.

This class was unnecessarily difficult for an introductory biology class. Quizzes required lots of studying, labs took many hours out of weekends, and the overall nature of the course was just frustrating. Take the regular section. That being said, Dr. Smock was a great person/lecturer and was always willing to help. Ask her lots of questions.
Is very harsh on vague grading criteria. Little to no guidance in lab or how to study for lecture quizzes. Take the regular section.

Dr. Smock is an incredibly tough grader and seems indifferent to the effort students are putting in. Her lectures are boring and she often talks about the same topic over and over again. The quizzes are hard, but manageable if you study. The labs feel completely pointless and she often gives very little guidance.
Dr. Smock was an amazing teacher and lecture. Her PowerPoints are straight word for word so you can fill in but the quizzes are challenging.

Professor Smock was a great professor. Her lectures were interesting and it was easy to pay attention because of how passionate she is. When it comes to the quizzes, memorizing does not work as the questions are application/understand based. Show up to lecture to get TopHat points for extra credit. Most labs are about a bird project that is boring.

Human Bio (1102). Very knowledgeable and to-the-point in her lectures. Lecture attendance isn't mandatory, but is necessary to earn TopHat points and for learning the material. Recitation attendance is mandatory- for a grade. No exams, rather a fairly large assessment every other week. I found these to be a bit excessive- they could take hours.

Dr. Smock is a great lady. She loves talking about her time working in the great outdoors and research which I found really cool to listen to. Her class is fair as long as you put in the effort and try not to fall behind. I had to take an extra 2 hour long PLTL class alongside her class which was not very fun but Dr. Smock made the class worth it.

Dr. Smock is a good teacher; however, she is a very harsh grader. She takes off points on the littlest things or if you are not 100% correct. Expect to never get a 100 on any of the assignments she gives.

She offers top hat for attendance and gives extra credit for it. She was very easy to understand and kept lectures as engaging as possible. Biweekly quizzes arent too bad just study the notes before hand. Gives powerpoint notes w fill in blank to allow you to listen and write only key words in. Half the labs are about this group dumb bird project

Dr. Smock explains all the basic biology concepts so well & gives great anecdotes & examples to help you remember & better understand the concept. She really cared about the students & the scientific issues we are taught about. The bi-weekly quizzes are a bit hard & require more in-depth thinking than you would expect. The tophats are great EC.

Dr. Smock is an incredibly passionate and caring professor. You can tell she cares about the content, and wants her students to understand the concepts being taught. The tests are sometimes hard to follow with application questions rather than concept questions, but overall, it is a doable course if you show up and study.
The lecture's are easy to understand, however, when it comes to the quizzes, they are very difficult.
Very good professor that truly cares. Must go to lecture but her lectures are interesting. Easy to earn A in class if you just pay attention.

Cool teacher. Tells you not to memorize but more understand. Teaches relevant material to today's events. Lots of grades, bi weekly quizzes, lab grades, participation questions, and biweekly packback submissions. Should be an pretty easy A but takes a good amount of work to get it. Would recommend.

I think Dr. Smock is a very kind person but I think she should focus on redeveloping her class so that it reflects what an intro class should be. I did ALL of the work and studied quite rigorously and still barely got an A. Some of the quizzes are significant departures from what she lectures about, but overall nice lady and helpful assignments.

She did a terrible job teaching and just expects you to know everything that you are talking about prior to taking her class. grades are never clear and gives the worst feedback. "Doesn't make sense to me" was a reason I failed an assessment. terrible teacher, would never consider having her again.

One of my favorite professors Ive had. She made lecture enjoyable and even though I never have liked science, I really liked this class and learned a lot. The tests can sometimes be a little tricky but there are lots of opportunities to get points. As long as you put in a little effort youll get a good grade and learn so much.
Hands down one of my favorite professors. Very real with her students and I learned more than I ever have about science. I recommend her 10000x.

Dr. Smock is amazing. The class requires hard work to get a good grade, but she teaches the material so well that putting in the work isn't horrible. The lectures are interesting, there are NO TESTS AT ALL, and you get participation points every lecture. I hated science previously, but this class made me develop a new love for it. Take Dr. Smock!!!

Doctor Smock is passionate about the class she teaches and it shows in her lectures. She is interesting and explains things well. I went to her office hours multiple times and she does a great job of clarifying things and teaching you HOW to learn the material.

The class itself was fine, you need to go because while she posts slides on Carmen, they have blanks in them that are revealed during lecture. Recitation was usually unrelated or irrelevant to lecture material, but mandatory for attendance. Also had a pretty bad TA, so maybe that's part of it. LOTS of homework, but it's online & very easy/quick

Dr. Smock is amazing as long as you come to lectures and pay attention Her lectures are interesting and has interesting video interludes I have seen a lot of people saying that exams are difficult however most of the questions come directly from the notes and some questions require just a little bit of thinking Exams are not that hard

she was very nice, very knowledgable about what she teaches, very passionate about ecology. shows lots of videos to help understand things, but too much going on w/ group project,recitation activities, and so on, too much going on at once. lots of opportunities for work extra points that help
She seemed nice enough. If you're a hard worker you should be fine. The notes she provides during lecture aren't all that detailed so make sure to add to them.

Don't make any mistakes or be human. Pray your computer and Carmen work all the time. She refuses to help students with an issue. Pay attention to her confusing syllabus deadlines. This class would have been way better with another professor who cares.

Terrible online class. You have a group project where you have to present a disease power point or commercial which is almost impossible to do with 5 people online. I had issues with uploading an assignment and she and the TA did not help because of no "proof". Was irritating to work hard on something and get no credit due to technical difficulties

I took her basic bio online course and she tries to make it something way more than it is. She said at the beginning of the semester "just because this is an online course doesnt mean it will be easy" which really meant "Im gonna make this class really hard because i have something to prove" Do yourself a favor, dont take her class
Very knowledgeable and cares. I have much respect for her. Grading is somewhat harsh. Seems to love and cares and really know what she is teaching

Dr. Smock is not very  helpful when it comes to emailing, and exams are not easy.  Don't go into office hours and expect a lot of clarification and don't expect to be successful when challenging a grade.  There is a huge amount of work and the class has expectations of a bio major.  Good luck homies.

I took this course online and I'm horrible at science, but Dr. Smock made the lectures interesting and understandable. The online course was clear cut, but make sure you read the syllabus over and over. Easy if you keep up,  definitely need to study for exams. Lectures & homeworks/quizzes were great study tools. Group project was hard but doable.

Dr. Smock is an amazing lecturer. She was the reason why I didn't miss one class because I loved attending her lectures. The class requires a lot of work. I got an A in the class without reading the book once but I didn't skip lecture. Also, look at the rubric for the group project and you will be fine. Overall, this was an enjoyable class.

If you have to take this class, I would recommend Dr. Smock. She goes into a lot of detail in the material, and it isn't always simple, but with effort it's do-able. The group project is a large part of your grade, and design matters with extra credit. The weekly quizzes are easy, but the exams can be difficult and you need to prepare.

Dr. Smock is excellent! I am a humanities major, but this Bio class was awesome, informative, and a great addition to my schedule. Her lectures are really interesting and informative. I would definitely take one of her classes again if able.

Hey, I know, let's have a group project worth a substantial amount of your grade in an online class. Let's also have a project where you have to make an infographic, and a decent part of your grade is based on how well you can do graphic design. In a science class. In college. If you want to roll the dice with your grade have fun with this garbage.
She was a great teacher! She told you exactly what you needed to know for tests and how things would be graded. She made lecture fun and enjoyable. I would highly recommend her!!!
You will need to put in time every week, but you will learn a lot.  She gives great lectures and offers additional resources that make the tests easy to master.
Best teacher ever!!!!

Don't buy the book for this class, just go to lecture and take notes. Dr. Smock does what she can to make lecture somewhat interesting. Test questions can be worded funny, and I think that's why the test averages tend to be lower. When studying, try to think of possible situations/examples, don't just memorize vocab and expect an A+

Overall great professor, just come to class and study and you will get an A or an A- at least. All the papers and labs are easy A's. I got a 77 and an 82 and still expected to get an A.I just hate the fact that if you manage a 92.999999999 you still don't get rounded to an A. Also, I hate some questions that include lab/video questions.

Dr. Smock's lectures are by far my favorite, they are very engaging with TopHat questions and interesting videos. Always was interested in her lecture because she is extremely knowledgable. Definitely a great professor, highly recommend her. You will learn a lot.

Dr. Smock is by far my favorite professor. Her lectures are amazing and actually made me like a subject I hated in high school. There are 3 midterms and no cumulative final. You don't need a book because the midterms are based solely off of what is taught during lecture. Papers and labs are easy and straight forward.

Easy class. Must go to lectures to get 10% of your grade. Lectures fly by. She's knowledgable and interesting with the subject . Three article reflections (follow rubric  100%) One evolutionary paper (Not time consuming, again, rubric-based) And three non-cumulative midterms. NO FINAL. Easy A. Online & free textbook. No clicker required.

Class was great for a GE.  Must go to lectures to get notes and participation points.  Lectures are long but she tries to make them fun for the students.  She also has great TAs that make the lab section very easy.  Her grading is also pretty chill.

AU14: Dr. Smock was passionate about the material, so she made it seem very interesting. She has clicker questions, which you answer for points (and extra credit) There are 3 or 4 articles that you write a short essay on, which aren't too bad. The midterm and final were easy IF you read her PPT slides. No textbook. Labs easy. Lecture mandatory.

Dr. Smock is a GEM. She's really clear in lectures, and absolutely the sweetest person. Her class isn't hard at all if you read the assigned readings and pay attention to lectures. Definitely 100% recommend.

She is SO SWEET! She called her class biology for business students. She knows that a lot of people taking the course are not interested in bio but she applied it to real life. Super smart and passionate about her work!!

Evolution paper is 80% based on how much you say you think evolution and religion can be reconciled. Requires you to watch a documentary completely attacking people who don't agree with the theory, and repeats this point of view in lecture often. If you have any qualms about scientific theories, this is not the class to take.
Kristin was  a good lecturer, and interesting. I did not like the way she set up the class though and I feel like she graded too hard for a GEC. I would not recommend taking her class online.

I absolutely adored Dr. Smock. She was a wonderful biology professor. For the exams all you need to study are the objectives at the beginning of each powerpoint. Pay attention in labs because there will be questions on the exam. Attendance is mandatory because there are clicker questions in each class that actually improve your grade.

Dr. Smock's class is very organized and clear. Lectures are interesting. 2 midterms and 1 final. Don't worry too much if you get B/B+ in the midterms. Just make sure you go to class and do the clicker questions & attend every lab. There are bonus points for the clicker questions. These can improve your overall grade.

Dr.Smock is a great lecturer, you can tell she really loves the subject and loves to teach.  I did great on all the homework, papers, and labs, but always seemed to get B/B+ on the exams, which is annoying since the material was so easy. But, overall it's a great class and I would recommend it. DON'T BUY THE TEXTBOOK, you NEVER use it.

Good lecturer. She's a nice person, obviously interested in what she's teaching. The only thing I didn't like about this class was that I went to class almost every day and studied pretty hard and still just did average on the tests. Some of the labs were a little tedious and poorly set up. Other than that, it's a good intro science class.

I loved this class! I hated anything to do with science before taking this class, but now I really enjoy Biology.  Smock is super clear, pay attention in lecture and you will learn a lot.  Labs are easy too.  Take this class!!

Great Lecturer! She is always engaging and definitely is excited to teach the material. Shows great videos and lays out the lecture notes well. The power points can be printed online with fill in the blank points as she goes through them. Definitely recommend this class to anyone who likes science but isn't a science major, or just needs the GEC
She requires Chicago Style formatting but never states that on the syllabus or assignments. Get ready to answer questions for points about concepts you just went over and may not be familiar with.

Dr. Smock is a fantastic lecturer. She is so nice and makes sure you know the test material by making you answer clicker questions in class. I love her and if you took any basic bio course in high school, most of the material is just a review of information you should already know! TAKE THIS CLASS.
Easy GE class even if your major has nothing to do with science. Very nice and helpful. Textbook is not required. Would recommend class.

Lectures are organized and Dr. Smock speaks really clearly so you can understand everything. You can get extra credit if you answer more clicker questions than you need to. The class is kind of cool/challenging & you don't feel condescended to like some non-majors classes do & exams come from lecture, not extra textbook readings so they're fair.
Dr. Smock is very clear and concise with her lectures, and her exams are straight off the study guides. Easy A if you give the effort.

Super awesome lecturer. Gave us powerpoint slides during lectures. She would occasionally show really interesting videos, check participation through clicker questions, and really shares her experiences from when she studied abroad. Super nice and friendly.
Very helpful during office hours and replies promptly to emails. Showed videos during lecture and included pictures from her experience of study abroad. Material was well prepared and intriguing.

Dr. Smock is an AWESOME professor. Her lectures are straightforward, and she provides students with guided notes. She also asks "clicker questions," which help when preparing for the exams. Overall, I learned A LOT and loved the class!

A great professor! Gives clicker questions for attendance, but that doesn't mean you can't skip! Notes are helpful and very well-organized. Labs are at or below high school level. Very easy exams, if you pay any attention in class.
Dr. Smock was a great professor. She was always very clear when explaining things and made sure people understood. The lectures were very organized and she made biology somewhat interesting!

Lectures are very clear. Does give points for clicker responses in lectures, so skipping a lot does hurt your grade. Test questions are easy if you were in lecture that day, but some are specific enough to make sure you show up. Overall best prof you can have for this class, and don't skip that often.

Dr. Smock is a very clear, helpful prof. Lectures are easy to follow and assignments are not overwhelming. She really tries to get you involved in bio instead of just throwing words at you. Clicker questions are almost exactly like exam questions so attendance is important. Exams are easy and labs are helpful.
She was very clear and kept things very interesting. The tests were very easy with a medium amount of study. Overall not a lot of work.

She made Biology interesting to me, I learned a lot. Go to her office hours if you have questions, but my TA is very helpful.  If she teaches any other BIO classes, I definitely want her. Clicker questions are easy. Don't buy the book.

I was personally offended by a question that asked for an explanation of how evolution can be reconciled with religion. The question came with no explanation of which "religion", although it likely meant Christianity based on other materials we had in class... This question wasn't worth much, but it is profoundly stupid. Otherwise a great class.

Don't buy the book! In lecture you go through powerpoint slides and follow along.  You are required to have a "clicker" for participation points.  The class if filled with many opportunities to get points.  You have labs, midterm 1, evolution paper, participation points, and a final exam.

The class was okay. She gave you all of the information that you needed for the exams in the lecture notes but there was tons of material. If you want to do well in the class attend EVERY lecture and be ready to put in some time to study for exams. Harder than your typical GEC

Dr. Smock is pretty easy. She puts "learning objectives" on her slides and is very clear about what you are expected to get out of the class. I think the book is a good supplement but she doesn't require it. There are also ways to get several extra credit points; always nice. Attend all lectures and labs and keep up with text and you will do fine.

Kristen is pretty clear, she provides good slides and her class is easy to understand. If it was a more difficult subject, she would be terrible. Relatively interesting, kind of annoying but YOU MUST ATTEND her lectures and ALL LABS. As long as you show up to pay attention and study moderately you can get an A!

The notes were easy to read, no required textbook (less cost), and Dr Smock presented the class in a very interesting way. However, the attendance was kind of mandatory if you want to get points (clicker question) and the final was confusing for some questions. There was also several papers to do, evolution etc

Class is exceedingly easy is you keep up with it. The class is slightly more difficult than what you'd expect from a GEC and more time consuming because of the labs, but Dr. Smock always manages to fill the lecture time with relevant/interesting information, while the labs certainly don't.  Study hard for the tests; they're lengthy.

I really liked her and she organized her lectures in ways that made sense and were easy to follow.  However, midterm and final were much more difficult than expected for an entry level class. The labs were ridiculous and took all 3 hours. Make sure you review notes after every class and attend every lecte for easy clicker points.

You will NEED to go to every lecture and study your hardest this class is way too hard for just a 101 class, she hates any noise during class and never miss any labs or lectures or you will lose points...the exams are harder than the clicker questions

Dr. Smock had in depth material that she explained fairly well but the exams were entirely too hard for an entry level GEC science course.  The labs were designed purely to take the full amount of time whether it was necessary or not.

Do not take this class! It is the hardest GEC class I have ever taken. You can work EXTREMELY hard and still not get an A. The exams are impossible and will ruin your grade. I enrolled in this class because of the positive reviews on here; however, that was a mistake. Do not take this class if you want an A and A- in it!

Signed up with this teacher based off the ratings on here...bad decision. Her material is way too in depth for a Bio 101 class. She gets annoyed very easily if there is any noise whatsoever going on during lecture but thats neither here nor there. Overall, graded way too hard for this level of a class. Material goes WAY too far in depth

She's an amazing teacher. It's very easy to get a good grade in  the class provided that you go to class. The hardest part is lab, but that has little to do with her. Just make sure you have a clicker, and you'll do better than okay.

While Dr. Smock was entertaining, she got annoyed too easily.  She constantly repeated the same phrase "can we get a little quieter please?"...at least a dozen times a lecture. I got really irratated with her by the end of the quarter. Also, the tests are harder than she prepares you for.
Totally cool professor. The class was a lecture of over 500, so attendance was measured by clicker points. She was always prepared, decent sense of humor, definitely take her if you need BIO 101!

GREAT professor! Attendance isn't mandatory, and she puts her notes on Carmen, but it's definitely a good idea to show up for participation points. Labs are easy, tests are manageable, BUT you're allowed to bring in a cheat sheet. She makes lecture pretty interesting, and is really nice. Bio 101 students should absolutely take her lecture!

Dr. Smock was very engaging as an instructor! She was easy to listen to and learn from. I'm so glad I had her as a lecturer. It wasn't a hassle going to class because Dr. Smock was really interesting and also gave a lot of clicker points. A bonus is that she lets you use cheat sheets on exams!

Class is easy. Just show up and do the work you WILL pass. Classes are kinda boring but its not her, its the material. I highly recommend her class. Labs are easy, lots of points, and she lets you use notes on the midterms and finals!! Your crazy if you pass her up.
Go to lecture for the slides/clicker questions, exams are a little confusing, but manageable.  The labs are really pointless and lame but you get a lot of points for them.

dont buy textbook.i didnt and got a.all info is on her slides.take good notes.go to class for clicker points.labs are easy.explains info well.plays some videos that are boring.annoying about the noise level and class time.all in all  good prof and easy class

You will have to go to lectures since there are clicker questions which are 10% of the final grade. Everything is from the slides that she puts up on carmen but her exams are slightly confusing. She is very clear and helpful. So basically just attend class for the clicker questions and do the slides.

She really knows what she is talking about. That being said, her students don't. She teaches as if we know the material already super well and doesn't give people the chance to ask questions. Going through the problem sets after was really tough and the TA's are helpful. Go to class, but REALLY go to TA office hours. Tons of extra credit too.

Her lectures are extremely boring and she struggles with explaining material to the point where students can understand it. Some questions on problem sets were impossible to do based off lecture material alone, and TAs are relied on to explain the material. Exams are fair based on problem sets and the past exams she gives you.
absolute nightmare of a class avoid at all costs

She's fine. Lectures were a bit dry but material was explained well. Most of the problems went over in class as well as on weekly problem sets were in the exact format of those on the exam. A notecard was also allowed for exams. The only issue I had in this class was with the TAs. I was given incorrect solutions by them on multiple occasions.

I really enjoyed her class and I thought she was an amazing teacher. I actually preferred her lecture over the TAs lecture and she was able to answer my questions way better than the TAs. Her exams are very, VERY fair if you study. She literally gives you extra credit for doing problem sets which you need to do in order to do well. Amazing.

Went into the class reading other reviews on here thinking this would be the worst class of my life. Dr. Chamberlin actually cares about your success as long as you put in the work for her class. Attend ALL TA office hours. Problem sets offered as extra credit, DO THEM. Go to lecture and make sure you understand the participation Q of the day.
She honestly wasn't horrible. Fairly boring sometimes, but is way more interactive in office hours. I found the class to be interesting. Make sure to go to class because there is graded participation

Cant believe she is still employed. OSU needs to let her go. The toxicity level in her course are high. She does perhaps the most boring research in the history of research. NIH is wasting money on her lab. The department needs to hire a better professor. If your really need to take the class, the read the textbook or go to TA. WORST teacher ever.

I really like going to Professors office hours. But Dr Helen is something else. No wonder students are repulsed. She is emotionless to point being nonhuman. Despite that I would go to office hours regularly but I felt bad for her and myself. Because she sucks at explaining and is not lenient at all in grading especially this difficult semester.

For some one who gets paid 100k++, she surely hates her life and will make you hate your too. The recitation are awful because there are 20 HARD questions and NOT enough time for the TAs to explain. With Covid, Online classes was just BAD. I dont know how others handled it. She was not lenient during this difficult semester at all.

Problems on test are hit or miss. You have to be naturally gifted with genetic problems or really work hard. Past tests and problem sets are helpful. Lectures so boring you want to evaporate. Group project sucks-grading is unclear, forced to work with some annoying people. Take this only if you absolutely love genetics. Hardest class I've taken.

Dr. Chamberlin believes in testing your ability to interpret data. Knowledge based questions are few and far between, and the difficulty of the course is high. If you don't read the textbook, you will not pass, as she only goes over experiments and data in lecture. Her TAs were incredible, and an asset to pass the course. Good professor, not great.

Helen is clearly brilliant, but she is not great at explaining difficult concepts. Her TAs are amazing. She gives random in class assignments, so you have to go. She offers extra credit for her exams every week, and often she pulls questions directly off of the extra credit problem sets. READ!!!!

He put me to SLEEP! Let me say that you should take any course of his when you are most awake because by the end you will be on the verge of falling asleep. He was very boring, but I found him very funny, which was somewhat helpful. I did not think he was good at explaining lectures, so be prepared to do a lot of work on your own to learn content.
Slides have alot of material so he goes really fast. Super funny professor but can be easy to zone out when going over super lengthy material. Exams are difficult.
Great professor, has a good grasp on everything he taught in the class. Takes time to answer question in and outside of class. Also just a cool guy, 10/10 recommend.

Dr. Bisaro gave very engaging lectures (at least to me). His background is in epigenetics and plant pathology and you can kind of tell when he lectures what he's passionate about. Very funny. Was nice to me when I was stressed about a grading mistake.
he's a very knowledgeable guy, but he is very boring. try to pay attention because there's a lot of content
Excellent and organized, clearly cares about and respects his students. Never makes you feel stupid. Not great with technology, but great lecturer.

His lectures had a very good set up of starting broad and then adding in all of the details. The exams were fair and were derived mostly from his powerpoints. Reading the book helps because he tried to follow it closely.
Excellent lecturer, fair grader, lots of material but extremely well organized, reasonable tests.

Dr. Bisaro was a great professor! His lectures were easy to understand and he was great about answering questions that students had about the material. His exams were easy as long as you studied what was taught in lecture.

He's awesome, incredibly informative, gives easy and straightforward exams, his notesets are excellent preparation for the tests, and his name makes me think he'd fight Batman.  He was really good and I look forward to having him a few more times in the year to come!
Love his classes! He's awesome!
Very good professor! he explains things slowly and have his own noted which are exteremly helpful. His test was fair. I recommend him.
I love this guy! He is so cool, and he knows stuff and explains really well!
No textbook for the class, simply provides extensive handouts.  They are very helpful.  Very clear in class... expects you to know your stuff but doesn't trick you too badly.
Cool dude, goes nice and slow - easy to follow lectures.  Excellent Noteset, straight forward test.  Would definitely take another class with him.
Very slow and concise. He does not try to cram too much into a single class period. Pretty good teacher.
He gives notes and he's great! I love this class.

She's a pretty good professor and gives you a lot of study materials for the midterm. There's only one midterm and a non-cumulative final. She is SUPER heavy on tophat questions so you need to go to class, but otherwise the class is easy points. I will say her voice is honestly a bit irritating because she talks to us like kindergarteners.

There was one midterm and one noncumulative final. There was a weekly review due every week, along with four lecture quizzes taken throughout the semester. Dr. Calinger responds fast to her emails and is very kind. Top hat is used in class (half for participation/half for correctness), and labs were mainly about working on a semester-long project.

She really cared about making sure everyone in the lecture understood materials and was getting caught up. She was funny and easily approcable and was more then willing to help with a emphasis on being objective throughout. This class has a lot of top hat questions though but she gives you more than enough if you need to miss a few classes.
Attendance wasn't mandatory but she did tophat questions that were worth points. She also posted all lecture videos. She was great overall.

Attendance is mandatory BUT if you email her and ask for a zoom link to her lecture she will send it no questions asked and there is no limit. tophats are graded for correctness BUT incorrectness is half credit. And you can get like 40 wrong and still have a 100%. Labs are fun and engaging. Lectures are fin and engaging. My favorite professor here.
It was pretty interesting; she taught a lecture with tophats (heavily curved), and we would have weekly quizzes, then a midterm and final.

Dr Calinger Yoak is probably the best professor I ever had. Her lectures are so stimulating and she cares so much about diversity which I love. She breaks down every concept into manageable parts and is passionate about supporting her students. Take this class with her!

Take her class! An amazing professor, she is very organized and thorough with her lectures. She cares way more about her students and their understanding of the material than your knowledge about science. She uses Tophat, but allows you to collaborate with your peers and only uses some points for correction. Only one midterm and one final.

Attendance is required (tophats graded on correctness), although you can have a couple misses without any penalty. A lot of annoying (but easy) busy work. Lecture is very boring.
The lab is set up horribly you have a very drawn out and annoying group project, you only ever do like 3 actual lab activities, the rest are the group project.

Attendance is required with TopHat questions in every lecture. Dr. C is very passionate about what she's doing. Her lecture is great and interactive. However, there are hw every week which a bit time-consuming. Her midterm is not too hard but super fast-paced with lots of calculations. Make sure you really know the materials.

Dr. Calinger-Yoak is a great professor. Attendance is mandatory for lectures, but she gives a break in the middle of lecture so it isn't 80 minutes of straight yapping. TopHat is also used during class, graded on correctness, she uses it to make sure students understand the concepts & as a chance to clear things up. Very understanding professor!

Kellens teaching style would be great but it just goes super slowly and she teaches very repetitively. Attendance is important because tophat is graded for accuracy. Lab sections is mostly busy work but expect to be there most of the period as it is a lot. Includes terribly designed but fairly easy group project for lab
Good teacher and class

Dr. Calinger-Yoak was an amazing lecturer and I really enjoyed her class. Her tests aren't super difficult, consisted very much of studying what she teaches in lectures on her powerpoints and that's it. The final wasn't cumulative and there was only one midterm. Overall great class and I highly recommend her.

Dr. C is such a caring and engaging professor! I loved her lectures because she goes right to the point and will give you a reason to listen, along with the fact she's very passionate about the subject. Although the content is easy, it is very interesting and I learned a lot about our world and the current natural issues we're facing.
Very caring professor, easy class

She is an incredibly caring professor who places lots of emphasis on mental health and diversity in STEM. Very accommodating. The course content is incredibly easy (especially compared to BIO 1113) so class is a bore. Lab is a bore too. Those things can't be helped tbh.

Got a 91 on the first exam and a 92 on the second exam w/o listening much in class. Look over the lecture slides to study for the exams. She is a caring person and the amount of importance she places on mental health and diversity in STEM is great. She has questions like "two of the above", and "more than one", very often in her exams, however.

she wants you to succeed. her tests are all based on her notes which are super clear. she is very accommodating with an amazing point system. i'd want her to write my letter of recommendation. one of my favorite professors here.

Dr. C is super sweet and it's clear she cares about her students. Be prepared to be taught as if you are a newborn baby. Lecture isn't "mandatory" but there will always be TopHats or ICA's every day so if you start to skip a lot, your grade will suffer. Two weekly homework assignments and only one midterm. Final is noncumulative. Lab sucks/boring.
her class is easy and she explains everything in detail but she is really annoying

Dr.C is very sweet and is willing to help if you ask her to. However she is a very harsh grader, especially if she is your lab TA, so make sure to go to her office hours to make sure your work is to her liking. Additionally, put effort into your artwork. She will dock points if your pictures do not look like you poured your heart and soul into it.

She genuinely cares about you as a human being and understands if you are having a hard time. She puts a lot of emphasis on mental health awareness and diversity within the science community and she puts in so much effort to connect to her students. She also gives amazing book recommendations :)

One of the best professors I've had at this university. If you have the option to take the course with her, DO IT. While attendance is not mandatory, it is recommended you go to lectures, however, if you have an interference she is flexible and may provide a zoom link. Very engaging!

Super easy course but I agree with the review saying if you are impatient do not take this course. Feels like a sixth grade biology course which is fine for an easy A but professor needs to learn to talk to her students like adults not children.

Dr. Calinger-Yoak is one of the best professors I have had at OSU. She genuinely cares about her students and what she is teaching. You MUST go to lecture in order to succeed in this class. If you do all of the assignments and actually try your best, you will get a good grade.

Pay attention in lecture, make notes during case studies, and try to get all tophat Qs right and understand why and you will get an A. I never even looked at the textbook because she gives you all the info you need. Just study the learning objectives/review your notes after class (I made a summary study guide). She is super understanding!
i love her
She's a great teacher, but the material can sometimes be daunting. Labs don't correlate with the current material at all.

Learned a lot! The class is lecture heavy and she uses tophat. The course was made up of 4 real life science reading assignments, 4 lecture quizzes, a midterm, and final. This class had a lab component so there was weekly lab assignments. She offered zoom office hours twice a week and was willing to answer any questions after lecture. Loved her!

I took Dr. C's BIO1114 course in the spring of 2021 and I absolutely LOVED her course. She does everything in her power to make the course flexible and manageable - synchronous lectures not mandatory, bonus points, in lecture TopHat questions due way after lecture period, etc. Dr. C clearly cares about her students understanding the material!

I found her class very easy. She explains things extremely well, she sometimes explains things as we are in 3rd grade though. Her exams can be tricky for some due to every question being a paragraph long but just read them carefully and don't get tricked up by some of the obvious looking answers.

Dr. C explains things very clearly in lecture and you do not need to read to do well on exams. Go over key concepts and you should be fine. She creates the homework assignments which are relatively easy and tailored for what we learned in class. I got a 97 on the first exam with very little studying. I can't recommend her enough!!

She's clearly very passionate about biology and her students. Her class is set up very well, so I didn't have to study for exams much at all and still got A's on them. The exams aren't really difficult, but definitely more application than high school! Material and study resources are very accessible and helpful. Solid professor.

I took Biology 1114 during the summer and Dr. C is possibly one of the best professors I think I'll ever have at OSU. She made lectures easy to comprehend and she was very kind and understanding. 10/10 recommend taking this class with her.
Dr. C was AMAZING! She explained everything super clearly and made biology super fun! Everyone in her class (even though it was online) felt like a community and we openly joked with other students!
Super nice and knowledgable about class material, long labs with a lot of group work.

Dr. C explains concepts in very digestible ways--I often found myself putting lectures on 1.5x or 2x because she would spend so much time explaining. Dr. C also makes the criteria very clear as to what is needed to get an A. For a STEM professor, I feel that she is actually very good at teaching everything in an easy-to-understand way.

I learned a lot from the class but this did not translate to exams as exams were much harder than any in class questions. She talks to you like you are in elementary school, but I do not think she means it in a belittling manner. Also she uses proctorio for all exams while other sections of this course do not.

Prof. C made lectures very understandable with a slow teaching pace. Her tests were a little difficult, but she provides the necessary materials to be prepared for them. The assignments were fairly easy and, even as a summer course, were manageable.

a lot of people dislike dr. c, but she truly wants you to learn. none of her tests are focused on the regurgitation of material, but she prepares you well if you go to lecture & pay attention. lots of tophat & case studies shes young & clearly cares about topics at hand grade is heavily dependent on your lab TAsimple labs, but super nit-picky

Kellen is by far my favorite. She is so caring and sweet, and she does everything she can to help you succeed. Don't get me wrong, you need to know what you're doing since she's a hard grader. The tests can be tricky as well. But if you put in the work and come to class, odds are you'll be okay. Definitely recommend her!

Lectures are very interactive - make sure you go to get TopHat participation points. Labs are unnecessarily difficult for the class material. Lectures prepare you well for the exams, which require critical thinking and that you really understand material. Exams are more based on application of information rather than just memorization

Dr. C is a good professor, not a great one. I think she has a thing against giving. 100's, and loves to waste time on TopHat. Despite this, I did learn a lot and had some fun. She is also very nice as she rounded my grade up from 92.8% to an A. Oh, exams are extremely wordy as well. Make sure to understand the concept, not just the definition.

Dr. C is classic proof that you can't judge a professor by ratings. I LOVED Dr. C! Her lectures are interactive with TopHat questions just like the midterm! If you study, you will get an A, even without the book! Plus, she is available outside of class if you have questions. Her midterm averages ended up being higher than even the "easy" professors

If you are impatient, it will be hard to sit through lectures as it feels like a elementary or middle school pacing. She brings opinion into class discussion and is very open to questioning. Exam questions need to be thought through as there are a lot of all/none/two of the above and very similar wording in the same question. Know your concepts

Dr. Calinger-Yoak is amazing. You do need to attend lecture because of Top-Hat questions to get your participation points. She's very passionate about what she is teaching. The exams aren't too bad, make a quizlet with the study guide she gives you and you'll do fine. The labs are actually pretty fun and very helpful to understanding the lecture.

Really nice lecturer that cares about her students. The majority of the tests are from her lecture notes, which she posts online. As long as you pay attention, you will already have a good grasp of the material. She does in class activities and tophat during lecture, so just showing up to class gets easy points. Overall, great prof.

Makes an easy class difficult. I'm not joking, the material for BIO1114 isn't difficult at all, but for some reason this professor feels the need to overcomplicate things. Extensive amount of participation in lecture, so much HW from lab, exam questions are worded weirdly. Please do yourself a favor and take a different professor! Can be nice.

If you must take this class with her, take it seriously. Between your expectation that it will be easy, and the subjective grading present, it will rip you to shreds if you don't work hard and buddy up with your TA. For all the unnecessary difficulty, the way she teaches (and tests) is actually very applicable to MCAT passage-based questions.

Dr. Calinger-Yoak is a great professor in my opinion, even though the class is incredibly and unnecessarily difficult. She gives you a baseline of information with examples that are easy to relate to. Her exams are very difficult, but if the effort is put in it is definitely possible to do well.

Her lack of rubrics is concerning. This intro bio course essentially became a weedout class due to arbitrary grading and lack of clarity in what was expected. Avoid this class like antibiotic resistant bacteria.

Do not take this class or with she unless you 100% have to. Her grading is terrible and she expects you to have the exact answers she is looking for or its wrong. Her quizzes and tophat questions are super specific and do not actually test your knowledge. Never got out of lab early. Do not miss a lecture or you're screwed with tophat points.

The grading in this class is horrendous. The content is pretty simplistic (easier than Bio 1113) but because of how this course is arbitrarily graded, you could still do poorly. I had Calinger as my my lab TA too (which I thought would be great) but ended up screwing me over because of how harshly she grades. This was the case w/other TAs as well.

I was disappointed with Dr. Calinger. She was an incredibly nice and caring professor, however her exams are incredibly difficult, and sometimes she had difficulty clearly communicating the information. She is very smart, and speaks to us as if we are as smart as her. Prepare to read MANY graphs in this class, because she loves them.

Everyone says the exams are worded very poorly/ areconfusing, and they were right. I thought I would be fine, but I am not. The lectures are very simplified, but the exams are worded in the most confusing way possible. The lab TAs destroy you with very strict grading, so it is easy to do poorly. Take Dr. Chiucchi instead. I wish I did

This is the worst class I have ever taken. As a microbiology major this should be an easy A but this is not the case with Dr. Calinger. She grades arbitrarily and not by a rubric. When you ask for help she will help you but wont tell you if you're wrong and will give you zeros on everything. Take this class with another professor if you can.

Compared to 1113 lecture is way easier but it is dreadful and boring. I cannot stress this enough that your entire grade depends on who your TA is and how subjective they are. It is unfortunate that OSU still allows this type of unequal grading within lectures. If you get a bad read on your TA drop or transfer lab sections.

I was really disappointed by this class. Dr. Calinger's rating on this website is really high so I was expecting the class to be really interesting and for her to be a stellar teacher. You just have to memorize and understand all the lecture notes, but even with that the exam questions are VERY poorly worded. Overall disappointed by the prof.

I really liked Dr. Calinger, but this was the WORST class I've ever taken. The lab had NOTHING to do with the lecture and the TAs take off points for the stupidest stuff. Plus, Dr. Calinger was on maternity leave for 6 weeks and I wish we had her for the whole semester.

She is very passionate about ecology and know a lot about the subject so don't be afraid to ask questions in lecture! She always knows the answer. You don't need the book because she puts all of her notes online after the lecture is over. Go to class because of all the topHat, and she explains a lot of graphs from scientific articles

I loved this course! She did a great job communicating material- one of the best professors I've had. Her tests are heavily based on application of concepts, but if you understand her examples in class you should do fine on the midterms. TopHat questions in lecture are graded for correctness and completion, but aren't too hard to get correct.

Dr. Calinger does an excellent job of engaging her students during lecture. She gives many chances to earn participation points and more points if you come to lecture and participate. Her tests aren't necessarily easy, but if you come to lecture and study her lecture note thoroughly it helps with the exam. You don't need a textbook for this course.

This professor may have been great in the past but that's no longer the case here. First, her rubrics for the spice lab are inaccurate. Our entire class received half credit since we didn't apparently follow the rubric yet, everyone did and she saw nothing wrong with this. She also doesn't have a rubric for short answers and exams are way tough.

Dr. Calinger is an incredible teacher who really takes interest in her students and their success. She knew just about everyone's name in the lecture a few weeks in to classes. She makes lectures interesting with a lot of real life examples with a lot of in class activates so you need to go to class which isn't hard since she's so attractive 10/10

She is amazing, one of the best professors I've had. If you go to class and pay attention and participate she makes it seem easy. Tests are noncumulative and she really doesn't try to trick you. Don't bother buying the textbook though.
She's a great lecturer and very helpful.  Class is essentially mandatory and you're gonna have to pay attention and participate for the entire class.  Doable, but not an easy A.

You don't need the book, just go to class to learn the material and understand the concepts. Her notes are posted online as well but i would take notes in class. Tests are based off of the notes. All of her tests are fair and weren't cumulative. top hat and class activities help with understanding. Best professor ever

Her lectures are interesting in my opinion. You don't need the book at all, but with that being said you have to go to class to learn the material and understand the concepts. Tests are based off of her notes and verbal explanations. All of her tests are fair and weren't cumulative. She uses tophat & does in class activities for participation pts.

Dr. Bennett is a good person and very knowledgable, but this class was all over the place. In every lab, we would look at 20 different things, yet we had no clue what to know about them, and then it was tested over the lab practicals. There is no guide on how to study for this course. Overall very disorganized course.

Professor Weinstein's class is challenging, but with discipline and tools like Unstuck study, you can succeed. The exams are tough, but extra credit opportunities help offset the difficulty. Stay engaged in class, and you'll learn a lot.
He got fired over spring break!

This is a tough class overall. Going to lecture is important. Exams are tough, but there is a test bank for every exam. Do them multiple times and you should be okay on the exams. Cumulative final. Weinstein isn't a very good teacher in my opinion. Class is unorganized with an ungodly amount of slides per chapter. Take with someone else if you can.

Go to lecture and participate for easy extra credit. Exams are tough but you have access to the test bank before hand. Do multiple practice exams to prepare. Pay attention in lecture as some of the extended response questions will be from lectures right before the exam

Dr. Weinstein is such a fun, whimsical guy. Unfortunately, his exams are often impossibly difficult. My advice would be to take advantage of the extra credit as much as possible. Absolutely participate in class often, and prepare for exams well ahead of time.

Nice guy, wants students to do well, lots of extra credit, and he makes lecture engaging and entertaining. HOWEVER, his exams are completely impossible, his emails can be blunt and condescending, and he can cross a few lines. HOWEVER, his class is very manageable and if you participate just enough, you will surely get at least a B.

Dr. Weinstein is a nice guy and I think he means well but his class is very difficult. The material isn't the problem it's the lack of time between modules. 4 module exams and a cumulative final. He does give out a lot of extra credit but you have to participate to get it. You pretty much have to teach yourself the material.

offensive: called classmate uni-bomber
bonus points for dumb things (being a mom, being in the hospital years ago, and being a clicker/scroller on the computer so he can run around the room during in-class activities)
Talks loudly during exams
Does not let you finish your question - interrupts with an answer of what HE THINKS you are going to ask.

Dr. Weinstein's lectures are way too fast and its difficult to tell which topics are important. He provides very little study materials for his exams, just a bank of questions that don't tell you if you answered them correctly. He refuses to go over student's questions if they are too complex/time consuming. Take this class with someone else.
THE WORST EVER

He has good intentions, but he is incredibly out of touch with the students he teaches. Made several incredibly inappropriate analogies/statements during lectures that made many students uncomfortable. He had little structure to the class and apologized profusely, then proceeded to do the same things over. Lectures are useless but mandatory.

Dr. Weinstein started the semester on the right foot, communicating well, creating a positive environment. Within a few weeks he slipped, but his response was something you won't find in any other professor. He wants everyone to pass and succeed. The reviews within the last few months are not accurate. This is a doable course with a kind professor.

He is knowledgeable. But unfortunately, I could not gain anything from him because I did not have a single minute to digest what he said in his lectures. I basically had to self-study through this course. It was extremely difficult.

The reviews below are completely correct. He may have once been a great professor, but he is no longer fit for the current generation of students...for multiple reasons. The class is disorganized and difficult as a result of his disconnect, but in fairness he tries his best. Unlike evil professors, he wants everyone to pass. I can appreciate this.

He is one of the worst professors I have ever had. I feel as though I have no idea what information I need to know because he speeds through everything and then ask the most in-depth fill in the blank with no word bank on exams. I would rather drop out of school than have to take this course with him again.

The most petty professor ever. The second masks got lifted he stopped doing zooms with no warning. Was very nice at the beginning of the term, but quickly started backtracking. Exams have little to do with textbook or lecture. No word bank and only fill in the blank exams. Do not take him.

One of the worst professors I've ever had. Fails to communicate material in a proper manner. Fails to be considerate of students with extenuating circumstances. Fails to provide us with resources to do well in the course. Fails to prepare us for exams. Fails to educate as a professor. There is extra credit but it is insubstantial and uncontrollable
worst prof I have ever seen

Do not take him. For your own sanity and well being, do not take him as your professor. He knows the material and Im sure some people would thrive in this environment, but just the overall class was so unorganized and he was terrible at communicating. His exams were so hard and theres so much extra work that really isnt helpful at all.

DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS WITH THIS PROFESSOR. Doesn't actually teach a single thing, but instead just reads the slides word for word and then asks insanely specific test questions about topics not discussed.  Attending lecture was a huge waste of time but was necessary because he does tophat questions (also unnecessarily difficult) for points.

He does this thing where he gives points out on Fridays to people who do outstanding work but if youre on the zoom and not in person you dont matter. Regardless of extenuating circumstances or that were in the midst of a pandemic. But its alright when he forgets things and screws up every few minutes. Easy class but take it with someone else.

The worst professor I've taken. Ever. He made students pay for services that the university already has on Carmen even though he said how much he hated it, constantly gave wrong information in classes, and required a lockdown browser and a camera pointed at your hands/keyboard during exams to "prevent cheating" which only made it more stressful.

If you're looking for an easy biology class this isn't the teacher for you. Dr Weinstein is a tough teacher that goes very fast through lecture and usually doesn't fully explain concepts. If you read the book you'll be fine though. The only way to do well on tests is by doing the practice tests over and over and over because he uses a test bank.
Hes the type of professor that will plan a study session with his students one day before the exam and not show up. He also speeds through lectures. Had him for MOLGEN4500

One of the least understanding professors I have ever had. In response to the pandemic he decided to increase the difficulty of the class to "prevent cheating". He just reads off of the slides and does not really like questions. You have to go to class for TopHat. However, he does give out extra credit so that is helpful.

He explains difficult material very clearly and loves to be asked questions. He uses Tophat during class to make sure we are following. He wants all to succeed!! I had him in peak corona time, and he stayed resilient and upbeat about the moving-to-online process. I could tell he tried his very hardest to make a bad situation as good as possible.

The worst teacher OSU has to offer. It was during the month of April in 2020 when Dr. Weinstein decided to tell his wife to quit yacking on camera. When you approach him for help he tells you to take the practice exams. He told us that Covid-19 was not going to be a big issue and Monsanto is a trustworthy company. Very judgmental.

Dr. Weinstein's an average professor. He mainly reads off his slides but occasionally talks about stuff not on them, so it's a good idea to go to lectures. If he ever asks a question in class and you know the answer, raise your hand. He often gives extra credit for those who answer questions correctly in class and be sure to keep up on packback.

The molgen department here at OSU is absolutely abysmal. Test banks are easily over 300 questions (including tons of extended response). Lectures are mandatory for participation points but youll learn absolutely nothing. Youre better off trying to memorize the test bank for 3 weeks rather than actually learning anything. What a waste of my time.

His exams are from a question bank so the only way to pass the class is to retake practice exams over and over again. The lectures are pointless but mandatory because he looks at attendance. The exams have questions and topics he never talked about. He is also loud and intense. Packback is the only thing to help and there is a curve.

Dr. Weinstein was not the worst professor I've had, it's just this class is pretty difficult. In order to do well, you have to take the practice quizzes more than 10 times and memorize them. Do not expect to see those same questions on the exam though because there are curveballs. There is extra credit from packback and answering in class. Godspeed

Worst professor Ive had at OSU. Exams have nothing to do with material taught in class. Best way to pass is to memorize the practice questions and write good practice answers. Incredibly sarcastic and hard to respect. I wouldnt take a class with him again if they paid me. I learned nothing from this professor. Avoid at all costs.

The only way to succeed on his exams are to take practice tests on Carmen 20 times (at least). He does not teach what is on the exams in class, so it is up to you to figure out what may or may not be on the exam.

Dr. Weinstein is a great professor and really cares for his students. For his Mol Gen 4500 class, he uses powerpoint lectures which he posts online so that you can follow along and make notes, and he gives plenty of self-evaluation practice to help you with exam questions. He is really funny in class and makes the material enjoyable to learn.

For the love of all that is good, do NOT take him. He is a very unfair professor. He gave our class the option to "receive" extra credit, but for the most part, it was like getting your name picked out of a hat - you either were lucky enough or weren't. He gave around 2 students up to 22 points of extra credit in our lecture whereas most got none.

He is really funny when lecturing and some of the quiz questions are designed to be funny. He is approachable after class. Review test bank before exams. I learnt a lot from this class and still like molecular genetics.

To give you an idea of what type of professor he is, he said that late assignments will get a 0% even if it is 1 minute past the due date, but then he failed to enter my final grade in time for me to receive my diploma at graduation (by MUCH more than 1 minute). Memorize the test banks 24 hours in advance and you'll do fine, but avoid if possible.

Not a great communicator, not well organized, but nice guy. Be prepared to self-study a great deal, including the textbook. Use test banks but don't neglect understanding core concepts. Graders are typically generous if you can reason your way through an answer.

Don't take Dr. Weinstein for the love of everything that is good in this world. He is incredibly unclear, he runs through the aisles asking questions to students who don't want to answer and then laughs in their faces when they get it wrong. The final was impossible, not based on the book or lecture

One of the worst professors I've ever had to experience at Ohio State. Very difficult, instructions for just about any assignment are vague or entirely absent, seems to just not care about the students learning and doing well. Would highly suggest avoiding at all costs.

The average on our final was a 52% and there was no curve. His exams and weekly quizzes were extremely difficult, and I even read the textbook. He focuses a lot on genetics which gets confusing very quickly.  However, the lecture was in Independence so maybe he would be better in a small class.

I was not a fan at all. His tests were unnecessarily hard and he talked off topic a lot. I would definitely read the book. Try to get your grade as high as possible if you take Dr. Ball the first half of the semester.

Honestly not as bad as people say. Sure, the tests could be overly specific sometimes, but that is simply because this guy LOVES what he teaches. Any time there was a question about something that wasn't discussed in lecture it was very simple -- just read the book carefully and you'll be fine.

I had him for the second half of the semester.  Avoid at all costs unless you love genetics.  His exams were so bad, he does not ask questions based off the book, you can study all you want but the wording and the answer choices for his exams are so bad that it wont help.  Basically have to hope that you can guess the right answer.

Weinstein is amusing and enthusiastic, however his lectures have little to do with the exams.   The test banks are the best way to study for the exams, I would be so familiar with the multiple choice questions that were on the test bank that when i would take the exam, I would not even read the question because i knew the correct answers.

Take away from this guy. During class he never taught but rather just asked questions and gave out points. At first I was cool with this because he usually gave out a lot of points but then at the end of the semester they told us that the points he had given out didn't even count for anything. He is so confusing that he confuses himself too.
never take him. be prepare to listen to his life stories instead of teaching the class.

Weinstein is the eccentric stereotype of a professor that goes around telling "funny" anecdotes instead of focusing on lecture topics. The lectures were pointless, make sure to read the textbook or you'll definitely struggle on the exams.

Avoid taking him for bio 1113 at all costs.  Test questions are written poorly, confusing in lecture, stick to the text book.  I tried to keep an open mind with this professor but by the end of the course I was less than pleased or amused with his sporadic teaching style and did not appreciate how randomly extra credit was awarded.

AVOID. The molgen department at OSU is terrible in general so don't take the class if you don't have to. Exams are entirely from some random test bank online, often times not at all what you learn in class. Not that it matters. Weinstein is terribly unclear, even admitted to us he didn't know the last module well. Rude to students too. Again, avoid

A list of descriptors: His tests: unclear, poorly written, not related to material covered in lecture His teaching style: ineffective, unclear, all over the place, vague His personality: eccentric, arrogant, clueless His lectures: he goes too fast, doesn't explain content, wastes a lot of time with TopHat.  Steer clear at all costs. Curve was 1.15%

He's super enthusiastic about what he teaches, but what he teaches doesn't line  up with the exams he gives. Additionally, tests are often hard to understand and have errors in them. However, he sometimes will give out points for answering questions in lecture, which, if you manage to get his attention, will add up over time and help your grade.

RUN. Run far far away. Weinstein seems like a good guy but he is rather clueless in lectures. He runs around the room in a very disorganized and scattered way, asking questions. His exams don't make grammatical sense and the questions are either very simple or on information that has never been discussed.

Dr. Weinstein, although an enthusiastic professor, definitely lacks the ability to teach. The only reason why I did fairly well in his class was because I had taken AP Bio. His exam questions are inaccurate and require you to make false assumptions. During lectures he tries too hard to be funny... He should have gone with the job offer in Hawaii.
Exams are so hard compared to In class stuff

DON'T TAKE THIS CLASS .... it's. Learned nothing with professor weinstein. He doesn't lecture, just runs around the room asking questions. Basically have to teach yourself everything, and the exams will still be impossible.

Moves way to fast to actually understand any of the course material so don't plan on taking many notes in lecture. If it wasn't for reading the textbook and taking notes of my mastering biology homework I would have failed. Test Q's are either uber simple or something you've never seen before which makes hard to prepare and people struggle.

I would not recommend taking a class if it is only with Weinstein. He is very unclear, and does not explain himself well, even if you ask for help. I would still recommend if Ball is your second teacher because she is amazing and will boost your grade before you have Weinstein. I am sure he is a good man, he is just not meant to be a college prof.

Weinstein is a hilarious professor. Don't fall behind in the notes and reading. He is very well-versed in concepts of Bio and often gives extra info aside from the actual content, which can be fast and confusing at times. If you put in the work, read the book, and participate in his class discussions and by asking questions, you should be fine.

The molgen classes at OSU are insane, this one was just an entry level molgen and there were 4 midterms and a final, all with tons of information. Weinstein doesn't really communicate very well, his lecture slides are hundreds of slides long and don't really have clear information on them. The homework is all on quizlet and participation is easy.

Basically class is full of mistakes and confusion. Most of the lecture are students answering topics HE should be lecturing on. Then, he won't elaborate on their answers. Reading the book will be the only way to pass this class. Lecture is not helpful.

Don't take a class with him if you don't have to. His lectures are confusing and rely on answers from students which are not clarified. His tests are unnecessarily difficult and he admits that his study guides suck.  He gives quizzes over the book on info that has not been covered in class. Disrespectful to students. Worst prof I've ever had.

RUN!  Don't walk away from this disrespectful, unorganized joke of a professor.  How could The Ohio State University possibly retain this supreme example of mediocrity.  Tests have zero to do with lecture, notes and haphazardly hit the reading.   Worst of all - I am paying a fortune & learned NOTHING from WEINSTEIN.  Ball was awesome.
Pretty much same as Sarah Ball in their co-op semester class. Must understand concepts, read book, take notes, etc.
This guy is relatively funny but also confusing. Tends to get off topic, scramble to make up time and skip over important things. Liked the first half of class with prof ball better.

Class structure is appropriate but very poorly executed. Poor communication of material in class and out. Poor communication with students; cannot answer questions clearly. Inconsiderate. No flexibility. Unclear goals. Homework barely helps at all and is mostly busy work. Highly recommended to avoid this professor.
Terrible at teaching, constantly distracted, cannot seem to stay on a topic for more than 10 seconds.  You need to read the book to pass the class, otherwise you'll know nothing from the exam

Avoid at all costs. Went off on tangents resulting in rushed lectures. Material "taught" in class was often not relevant to the exams. Not helpful during office hours because he just wants to chit chat and you constantly have to steer him back to the material. If you take his class, you'll end up attempting to teach yourself.

Avoid Dr. Weinstein at all cost.  His ADHD and his enthusiastic voice will drain you in lecture. He loved talking about rats/family in lecture than what our lecture was supposed to be. His clicker questions were not helpful to study for his exams. The study guides he gives you are basically an outline of the textbook. Just read the book

Dr. Weinstein seemed a bit unaware how to teach a college class. The material he taught in class poorly reflected the material on the exams and the book did not even cover the scope of his tests. He took lectures way too fast and he was often unclear in his explanations.

Moves fast, explains things decently but not nearly well enough for how he makes tests. Class isn't that hard, just pay attention in lecture but don't expect to write down his lecture slides, he moves way to fast.

I had the Bio 1113 class that was split between Dr. Ball and Dr. Weinstein. If you see Dr. Weinstein on your schedule try as hard as possible to switch out of this class!
