Dr. Ball is a great professor, but the second half with Dr. Weinstein will ruin you. I had an A until Weinstein. Our final exam grade average was a 53% and he didn't curve.
Horrible class with a moron of a professor teaching. I do not recommend taking this course at OSU.

I could swear that since he teaches molgen 4500, he took their final exam and made it the bio 1113 final. The book inadequately covers the material and he expects you to know stuff the book didn't cover neither did he. He's a really nice guy but avoid this at all cost.
Lectures are long, filled with too many jokes for the class to be taken seriously. All the information covered in my lectures were not on the exams he gave, does not give study guides for exams.

Quite honestly the shift from Dr. Ball to Dr. Weinstein is what ruined this class for me. Had we had Dr. Weinstein from the beginning it would have been easier to adjust. His test/quizzes are ridiculously hard, he's very scatterbrained, and I'm more confused about energy transfer now  than I was to start out the semester.. Nice man, bad professor

I had Ball/Weinstein for the class, one taught half the semester and Weinstein taught the latter half.  If you constantly study the book and do well on the weekend quizzes you will be okay, but it sounds easier said than done. Going to class made me very frustrated and i was not interested overall.
He is just to essentric you never know what the heck he is saying and always makes mistakes

I found his exams much easier than the first professors. He is confusing in lecture but he is actually extremely helpful if you attend his office hours. His exams aren't unfair, you just have to put in the effort to get help from him and read the textbook

His ADHD ruins this class. I had A's on quizzes and exams with our 1st prof, then he took over and started getting C's & D's. He is unclear in lecture, constantly getting distracted and he can't stay on track... which makes all the students get off track. Does not write good quiez or exam questions; he makes LOTS of mistakes. Don't take his class

He is clearly passionate about biology but, his lectures never made sense even if I read the chapter before he lectured on it. Avoid taking his class at all costs.. He makes biology way more work than it should be.
He rambles a lot and teaches at a pace that is very hard to keep up with. His exams are very, very hard. My class final average was a 61 (D). There is no curve and not much extra credit opportunity.

Tests and quizzes are hard enough, but he makes things harder by making mistake after mistake on the questions. I don't know why he refuses to double check his own work, especially when he expects so much out of the students (tough tests, questions designed specifically to trick you). I hope to never have to take a class from him again.

Avoid him, if you can get a class with just Ball go for it, because after they switched in my class my averages went down by 10 percent. Terrible professor, his slides are useless and he goes on tangents during class. Clicker questions take up most of the class time and also not helpful. Tests are hard, quizzes are harder.
Just don't take him that's all I want to say
losses his train of thought

Dr. Weinstein taught the second half of my class.  The first day he acted like he wanted us to succeed; however, that quickly changed.  His test were impossible and did not relate to anything we went over in class (read the figures in the textbook). Our final's average was a 53% for a GENERAL EDUCATION BIO COURSE.  AVOID HIM IF POSSIBLE.

Dr. Weinstein thinks he is extremely funny, and screams his jokes into the microphone. He spends so much time goofing around (which is extremely hard to sit through) that he needs to fly through the actual material to finish on time. He is not completely useless, but he is the most annoying professor I have had at OSU.

Dr. W is very enthusiastic and goes through slides quickly. He does not explain things at all. He likes to ramble about nonsense. His clicker questions are not helpful and out of no where. I wanted to skip his lectures where I did not with Dr.D. His study guides are basically the book. His tests are very detailed and quizzes are hard. Good Luck.

Dr. Weinstein is a tough prof. I would not recommend taking a class with him especially paired with Dr. D'Orazio. The class is curved, and has extra credit. The post lecture quizzes are very difficult, I recommend doing it with other people. READ the book and take notes from your reading. He is also not a friendly guy and is very anti-smoking.

Dr. Weinstein expects a lot out of his students.  Although his class is very challenging, it is not impossible.  The key to passing is reading the book and paying attention in lecture.  I did above the average on every test because of this.  I would take him again.

He's a relatively clear lecturer although his slideshows can be a bit confusing. His quizzes are hard. His exams are INSANE. Be ready to study study study because his exams are all over the place. Our final average was a 50% with little to no curve. Recommend running for the hills although he is nice enough.

Dr. Weinstein is incredibly knowledgeable and extremely willing to help his students, but his tests are EXTREMELY hard and in my opinion, unfair. He would put multiple right answers, but students had to choose the one that was the "most correct". Reading the book is ESSENTIAL to passing this class. Avoid him  if possible. If not.. good luck

He may know a lot about genetics but is absolutely horrible at conveying that info to students. Multiple instances when he asked questions that he admitted made no sense or he got wrong. Go to lectures for the easy participation grade. The exams can feature questions on material barely covered. Only way to do well is to do A LOT of self evaluations

Dr. Weinstein isn't nearly as bad as the other commenters are saying. His class is tough, but nothing over the top. If you go to lecture, read the book and pay attention like you should, then you'll do fine. I've never had a problem which the tests being any harder than I expected.

Terrible lecturer and unclear about what information is on the test. Goes on tangents such as a specific disorder and might ask 540 test questions on something only covered in brief. Tests are awfully made. Multiple choices can be correct. He took over my bio class and my grade dropped 20%. Does curve class. Do not take Bio with this man!!!

Enthusiastic but drifts off topic frequently. Words quizzes in a way that everyone answers incorrectly, but will give the points back if enough complain. VERY willing to spend as much time (1 hr/appt) as needed during office hours to help you with any questions you have or to go over questions. I've gone multiple times in a week without judgement

Great professor. Class requires effort to do well, but not that hard overall. Go to class, read the book, and do well in lab. He is extremely funny and knows his stuff. Sometimes gets off subject. Cares a lot about his students, talked with me 30 minutes after class once to talk about my future.  However, you need to make the effort to talk.
Dr. Weinstein is not a good professor. He is not clear and he does not teach you all the information you need to know. But if the whole class does bad on a quiz he will give you the points back.

One of the worst professors I've ever had! Unclear and terrible lecturer. His test questions have multiple correct answers, but you have to pick the answer that he wants. Sarah Ball is literally a goddess compared to this guy. I don't know how he has the title doctor, very unintelligent teacher.

Either avoid this class or take it somewhere else. The material is interesting, but the exams will drive you crazy. They are difficult mostly because not much time is given and you need to read the book in detail to do well. His post lecture quizzes are impossible to answer do to the questions being poorly worded. Save yourself the headache.
Class was a piece of cake. Slept through half of it, and still passed the class. Just read the ppt notes he posts, and the study guide. Tests were alot easier than what he said.

Very tough class. YOU NEED TO READ THE BOOK. It may not seem like it but he rarely tests you on what he puts on the power points, just little tidbits that he likes from the book. So pay attention to what he emphasizes and likes to talk about in class because those are huge subtle hints. Make sure you do well in lab because that saved my grade.

Ridiculous. Absolutely ridiculous. I'm consistently over a 3.0 student and this man would bring the best of students down. He's hyperactive, unclear, and difficult to talk to. When asking questions after class, he doesn't give you eye contact and makes you feel small. Quizzes were unreasonable. Tests were worded terribly. Just... don't.

This class is hard, but that is expected.  If you fall, behind it is hard to catch up. I would suggest studying/completing the quizzes with a group because once the professors change the quizzes in my opinion got harder.  It is not impossible to do well just takes a lot of work.
Worst professor I have had thus far at OSU. Extremely unclear, ridiculously unrelated exam questions and pointless lectures. Seems like a nice guy, but avoid taking a course with him at all costs.

Very hard quizzes (I suggest working in groups) and exams. Doesn't teach the information very well, but he's a very likable guy. If you put the work in (read the book, understand lecture slides), you can do well in this class, and there's points from lab and clicker questions. He's not as bad as everyone makes him seem.
Dr. Weinstein is the worst teacher I have ever had! He does not know how to teach, and is very confusing when he tries to. Seriously do not take this guy's class!!

This is the first professor at OSU that I've gone out of my way to warn students about. For most professors, putting in effort yields results.  Not with Weinstein. No matter how much effort you put into the class, you won't succeed and more importantly, you won't learn a thing. He shouldn't be allowed to teach. Do whatever it takes to avoid him.

Don't suggest his class.Don't have much of a choice. He switches half way through. Quizzes aren't fair b/c he doesn't teach you the material you need to know before  hand. Wording also causes great disagreements when detail is imperative between right and wrong answers.Gets upset if his mistakes punish the our score but doesn't fix it. U R Warned!!

Hyper professor who is not very helpful. After class I came to ask a question and he just told me not to worry about it and for get about it. Quizzes are super hard, and expects you to know the information a graduate student would know

As many have said, he is very eccentric. I took him Spring of 2013, go to his lectures as there will be questions on the quizzes and midterms based on info he taught there that is not in the book..but READ THE BOOK! It is the only way you'll survive the second half of 1113. There's no test bank anymore. His 1st midterm was easy, 2nd was very hard.

This dude is crazy energetic. Go to class or the clicker points you miss will add up. He switched in halfway through the semester, and his quizzes/exams were SIGNIFICANTLY harder than the previous professor (Sarah Ball-- she's awesome). you will need your book to study because his lecture slides aren't helpful.

Dr. Weinstein is constantly messing up misinforming during lecture. Then turns around & points fingers at you if you ask him questions about it. He is a dreadful professor. I study 20+ hours for each of his exams and the highest I got was a 75% on a midterm and an 85% on the final. Please protect yourself and don't sign up for this guy's class.

Weinstein team taught the class. Connected well with students but the promised easier exams were far from. Going to class is far from enough to learn material. Posts slides online beforehand. Forgot to give scheduled quizzes throughout the term, which made exam grades more influential to overall grade. VERY energetic (be warned)
He was the professor for the second part of my class and he promised for easier exams but, they weren't much easier. He is also pretty hyper and I was too tired for that in the mornings.

Overall not a bad professor, he truly does want everyone to do well in the class, although sometimes he is unclear. There is no longer a test bank so future students disregard earlier comments! It's a hard class and you have to read the book and work hard on labs but if you're not willing to do that you shouldn't be really be at OSU.

Weinstein's setup was a little unfair at times, but you learn A LOT of info. Test bank was manageable if you made it a team effort. I really enjoyed the fact that he would explain problems until the class understood it before moving on. Sometimes  the level of work was way over my head, but when falling back to regular bio it was cake.

HORRIBLE! If you have all your clicker points don't even go to lecture. Seriously. I just had him for Bio 113 and didn't learn anything. As long as you know the test bank you don't have to do a thing.

He gives really hard quizzes and tests, but he gives you a test bank with 420 questions and he picks 50 of them for the final exam. Try to make it to his office hours or schedule an appointment. He will gladly answer most of the questions you may have on the test bank.

guys great.. only came for the second half of the quarter try interested in teaching, doesn't help you much though if you have a question. his final is 50 questions from the 550 he posts online.. use the internet to get the answers

Lovesss showing youtube videos to keep class interesting.  He is very clear in teaching but sometimes his lecture gets boring and he expects you to know terms prior to his lectures.  His midterm all comes from a test bank of like 300+ questions that he gives you at the beginning.  Focus solely on that and get all the right answer.  Study that only
I never opened the textbook.  Save your money.  He was funny and upbeat during lecture, but the subject matter is just dreadful.  The class is not curved, so the highest grades in the class are B+.
Fun, upbeat professor- during lecture.  One on one he is rude and arrogant, and he actually is kind of degrading.  I would try to avoid him.

Worst professor I have had at OSU. The final for the class is split between him and Dr. Seeger. On Dr. Seeger's section I got an A, on Weinstein's I got a low F. Final wasn't supposed to be cumulative but his section was. He is arrogant and is not afraid to tell you how smart he thinks he is and how dumb he thinks you are. Absolutely TERRIBLE.

Weinstein is...different. He is hilarious and interesting, but he's also arrogant and showy. He is a good lecturer, but 1-on-1 he can be a bit of a jerk. Obviously an expert in his field though, and I would probably take him again.

He was one of the worst teachers I've ever had in my life. He gave us over 650 multiple choice questions the first day of class and told us our Final exam would be 40-50 of those questions. Only problem is he didn't give an answer key and was an arrogant jerk about helping you, oh and didnt teach the material on 50-60% of the questions. Avoid him.

Weinstein is okay... he is really fun and entertaining, so he keeps your attention.  However, he is really unorganized and the lectures often bounce around and are hard to follow.  Sometimes he goes off on a tangent trying to explain something and it makes no sense at all.  Don't get me wrong, he knows his stuff, but his teaching is mediocre

He was an interesting lecturer to listen to, but his lectures were all over the place and sometimes did not follow the notes, so it's easy to get confused. He seemed funny in the beginning, but as time went on, his jokes got old, and he came off more as a smart ass. Make sure to read the book or you will do terrible on the final.

i thought he'd be a funny professor, but he turned out to be a wise ass.  during class or review sessions, if you'd ask a question that he didn't know the answer to, he'd say "see me during office hours"... he reiterated everything strait the book. negative part of this: lectures are boring. positive part of this: you dont have to go to lecture.
Michael has very hard test but he luckly gave us a test bank so we knew what to expect. He has a very wise ass attitude toward students which makes him a devious. Office hours are useless too.

Very hard teacher. Very smart proff but has a hard time teaching material to students. His lecture and lecture notes wont teach you a thing. If you can deal with his wise-ass attitude he is actually pretty cool.

The class is tough and if you are looking to get an A you MUST read the book, takes notes and attend lecture.  It is not impossible but requires a tremendous effort.  If I got an A, you can get an A..put in the time and effort and you should do fine.

Read the book and pay attention to the slides. Shows some cool movies and adds extra stuff into the midterms/final. Also, adds funny questions to the final as a joke. He makes tons of jokes and is excited to teach.
His final was a joke! Really hard questions.

This guy is awesome. He's SO entertaining. His tests are a riot. (Lots of jokes and funny answers.) I highly recommend him. As far as his tests go, I did really well and had a great time taking them. So! Shouldn't be too hard for others to do the same thing. :)

He is an awesome prof.  He is interesting and keeps the class awake and thinking.  Someone on here said he isn't funny.  I think he is hilarious! seriously I laughed at least 10 times every lecture.  He does go very fast, and he writes a HARD test, but overall I would recommend him - just don't expect a free ride... and prepare to be amused!

Weinstein knew the material very well and conveyed it clearly. The exams were a little rough but pretty much covered the topics he lectured over. I would recommend him if you want to gain a firm understanding of biological concepts.

Weinstein is a nerd... He should not be teaching this class... he sucks... I went to 2 of his lectures and passed out so i stopped going! He lectures way too fast... tests are really hard, and he thinks he is funny...but hes not! DO NOT TAKE HIS CLASSES!

Lectured way too fast. I eventually stopped going to them because they were no help at all.  Unfortuantely his notes weren't even helpful. Way too much information, way too fast. Would NOT suggest this professor.

Really tough! I found the material interesting and understood it well.. or atleast I thought.. His exam was rediculously difficult! he is very very nitpicky and sometimes has more than one correct answer but will only accept the answer he had in the beginning. He's very knowledgeable and enthusiastic but very close minded.

Not a good prof.  Unfortauntely, I had to take him for a class and had to collaborate with a research project.  In both realms he is terrible person to work with.  He is more interested in demeaning people than helping them.

Extremely knowledgeable, but talks over your head at amazingly fast pace. Must read book to fully understand and fill in the gaps - had many "Oh, now I get it!" moments after reading. He tried to engage students, but often failed because we weren't following. Did well in class because I read the book, took my own notes and studied A LOT.
His energy for teaching is great but as a result of that he sometimes talks too fast to understand

his tests are so hard!!! he focuses much more on minute details instead of making sure that the overall concepts are understood. lectures are really fast and really boring too. even the ta's hated him.
No Comments
No Comments
No Comments

always cracks funnies which is really annoying when you're trying to understand the material and he blazes through the lecture telling pointless jokes... too many specifics on the exam for a 100 level class... go to the reviews- he gives good advice... and youll spend lots of money because his power points are like 29 pages each & loaded w pics

He's really high energy so it's easy to stay focused during the lectures. He occasionally hits some pretty funny jokes but misses quite a bit too. He's good at explaining things like genetics and that's what matters. Tests are hard but not any harder than other bio profs. Midterm average was a 66.

He's a nice and pretty funny guy so the lectures aren't too too bad.  But there is just so much material and the pace is pretty quick.  I would go to the lectures on top of reading the chapters and studying for a long time just to get hopefully a C....it's not impossible though.
He moves really fast, but he's at least really charismatic about what he does. He cracks a lot of jokes and makes lecture more interesting. He taught with Swenson, who was horrible.
BORING

Went way too fast. He could have slowed down and still stayed on schedule. He is arrogant and very stubborn. He taught the same class with Chang, and I thought that this class would have been fine if Weinstein was not teaching with him. Would not recommend unless you plan on reading the book and teaching yourself.
This class is ridiculously hard. The tests are very specific. His lectures don't make sense at all. You can skip the lecture and just read the book. I worked really hard and ended up with a C+.

Avoid this teacher, I don't think he understands what a teacher is supposed to do! (here's a hint: TEACH) His lectures are extraordinarily fast, and he ended up so far ahead of schedule lecture didn't happen for a week.  He does not really examine you on many main concepts ideas etc.  he's gonna ask you the most rediculuous and specific questions!
I found his tests very hard and tricky. Expect to spend a large amount of time studying and ending up with a C anyway.

I thought he actually went the right pace.  U see, it's not his fault that he HAS to teach us soo much in such a liitle time period.  Its because the bio series is only 2 courses that make it hard, not the teachers.  He was an ok lecturer, but I am somewhat indifferent about his teaching style.  I think he is here mainly for research.

Unlike many of these other raters, I liked Professor Weinstein pretty well.  Although he sped through lectures, his instruction was clear and concise.  He also had a good sense of humor, which helped keep me engaged in an early morning class.

Horrible! Very hard teacher! Covers material way too fast and the tests are impossible. His attention to detail is to fine for a 113 level course. I would never take another class with him, he should not be teaching undergraduates.
This proffesor is difficult..he goes way too fast, doesnt take time in his exams..his exams ARE TOUGH..you need to know way more then just what is in the book. Avoid this prof
Tests irrelevant to what learned in class.  Moves way too fast, if at all possible avoid this teacher

He moves waaay too fast when he's lecturing. Apparently doesn't think tests should reflect what we talk about in lecture and read in the book.  Tests very unreasonably hard and questions unclear.  Tests for nit-picky details instead of important concepts. Gives very minimal help on study guides, and then test was nothing like study guide. Avoid!
not a good pick for bio 113. he is too caught up in his research to teach.
Tests completely irrelevant to class.  Won't answer questions when you ask clearly.  Painful to sit through lecture.  Glad its a team teach.

Energetic! Off the wall! Passionate about his field! Covers a lot of material & FLIES through slides, but stops constantly to make sure you're following. If you're lost-ASK QUES!! He is actually really nice & willing to help. Tests hard, but fair enough. Do your reading, go to class, and study!!

His part of MolGen 700 is the most difficult part. He gives takehome midterm you still manage to fail. Very energetic and skillful. Challenges student to think/learn like a real scientist. Memorization you will fail. Hava to truly understand inside out.

Very passionate in teaching. Energetic. Loud. Unique in his style. Good researcher, airplane pilot, best embryologist in OSU, hardest prof in MG Dept. Extremely rude to students. Arragont and extremely eccentric. Cursing to students often.

He's good, definitely passionate about his material. He tries to make lectures engaging and really tries to ensure you understand the material. For the exams, use his practice exams and mastering assignments and you should be good. Also, if he talks about it for a good amount of time, it's pretty much guaranteed to be on the exam.

I really don't like him or this class. Your grade is determined by 4 difficult exams, each worth 25% of your final grade. I truly have no idea what he's looking for in his extended response questions because he almost always takes off points even if you answered the question correctly. Unaccommodating and rude. Good luck!

Dr. Herman is just OK. He often doesn't understand student questions, and so he won't answer them properly. The pre-lecture homework helps me learn most of the material. He teaches well and you will learn by going to lecture, just not the best. You can tell he really likes bio and genetics though, and is passionate. Easy tests.

I had Dr. Herman for 5607. Hes good at teaching, however, he expects you to take what you know and apply it at a level beyond what is fair for that level of knowledge. His quizzes were heavily based on critical thinking, and simply looking over the notes does not help. He also had required prelectures that were typically over 50 minutes.

Dr. Herman is a really nice guy and good professor. He made sure to go slow enough to explain concepts well, but not too slow to make the class drag. His exams were much easier than the professor that taught the class for the first half of the semester.

Paul Herman was a breath of fresh air after Alonso. He knew what he was doing and made hard subjects like mitosis and meiosis a breeze. He even gave us ten minute breaks to relax. Top hat questions were pretty easy with him. You could always go to him if you had an issue. Very friendly and had his students in mind. No curve in the class though.

I loved Dr. Herman. His exams were extremely easy, and they were all questions I had seen before. He explains material extremely well, and is willing to reiterate anything that may be confusing. Really cares about his students and loves biology (especially genetics). There are TopHat questions every class that are for credit.
He's a real gem and he truly cares about his students and is really passionate about biology. He explains things more than once so the material is well understood.

Dr. Herman is hands down one of my favorite and best professors I've had. He is extremely knowledgable, and his lectures are interesting, relevant, and relatively easy to follow if you are giving an honest effort. Going to class is necessary for TOPHAT and in-class worksheets. Reading the book is a good idea for studying even if you take good notes

The material itself isn't hard, but reading the book and attending class is necessary because he is a very particular and tough grader. Points only come from 2 midterms + a final. Studying every day and attending office hours is a must for doing well. He's good about answering questions both in and out of class. Easy to ask questions in class.

The worst class I've ever taken! Dr. Herman teaches it with Harold Fisk. The only points you can get is through exams, and there are only two midterms. Professors basically make you CRAM! You absolutely have to read a book, and it will seem like easy. The horrible part is by the time you will take exam you will probably forget half. CRAM CRAM!

Lectures are okay, not exciting, not too boring. The annoying part is he always adds some extra slides which are never posted. Exams are little bit tough but not horribly difficult. But his grading is a disaster! He expects you to explain everything in details. Getting correct on the major concepts only gives you half credits of the exam question.

Herman is excellent at explaining the content of the course, and he is always willing to ask questions. You have to ask the right questions though during office hours (not just ones you can find in your notes). His exams are difficult, but you can succeed by working hard and studying the material he tells you to read in the book.

The class was DIFFICULT. I ended up with an A- but it was definetly the most work I've put into a course in my time at OSU. At least for me it required >50 hours of meticulously combing over the littlest details of the book and the notes for each midterm. Herman wants you to write treatises wheras Meier's exam questions aren't nearly as difficult.

Dr. Herman is super interested in his research and it shows through in lecture. If you're an interested, engaged, and inquisitive student you'll find that he's very friendly and helpful. He really wants his students to succeed. His tests were not difficult; they provoked logical thought and required an understanding of the material. They were fair.

He does come off as arrogant and full of pride for his work during the lectures, but is just a moody person. If you take the time to take interest in his subject and show some effort, he's really helpful and open to all kinds of discussions. I would rate him hard but a sincere professor.

Details! Memorize the book. He teaches out of it but tends to nitpick details for tests. He may come off as arrogant or high-minded, but I found that if one took the time to engage with him by asking questions after class or office hours, he was very helpful and a good guy to have an extended scientific discussion with. Hard class, though.

Lectures weren't bad, and the subject matter isn't that difficult. The test was brutal though. The content wasn't bad, but he expects a lot of background information in your answers that isn't explicitly asked for on the test.

He's very arrogant and gives the impression that he is annoyed by questions from the class. In fact, he rarely answer questions and usually responds with, "You can buy the book or figure that out on your own if you want to know." Oh wait, he's tenured! Of course he has little concern of his teaching quality. Lame.

Herman is a decent teacher, his lectures aren't boring and I like his very visual style of teaching.  The only complaint I have is the way we were tested.  The test was relatively easy, but was graded extremely harshly.  I was expecting a high A on the test and got a C, basically everyone else felt the same way.  50% of the  class failed the test.
This class has 3 professor and she was the best one by far. The other two were very disorganized so keep that in mind when you take the course.

This class was very..interesting. To be honest, Pradhan is very kind and understanding, an amazing person! Still, this course was difficult as there were three professors, thus three teaching styles, which was hard as immunology is intricate and very lecture-heavy. Plus, almost all of the points in the class came from exams, so keep that in mind!

Dr. Pradhan really shows that she cares about her students. She is so sweet and is dedicated to helping students succeed. 200 out of the 250 points in the course were from exams, so hopefully, you're a good test taker! I would definitely say she is one of the kindest professors I have had.

One of my favorite professors that I have had. She truly cares for her students and wants them to succeed. Her lectures are clear and concise. There are no midterms and finals, only 4 exams because she doesn't believe in cramming. I have never felt unprepared, if you simply pay attention in class and study the notes you will do well.

Dr. Pradhan really cares about her students and their success. This class is very memorization heavy, so the exams can be difficult. Lots of quizzes and exams, few assignments. She goes above and beyond to help you understand the material and is very accessible outside of class.

Dr. Pradhan is the best microbio professor I've had at OSU. You can tell she genuinely cares about her students and their understanding. She is quite flexible with deadlines and content on exams. The class itself is not as easy as it seems at first glance, but that is simply due to the amount of content. Can't recommend Dr. Pradhan enough!

I took this class in a hybrid format, and watching her lecture videos was a nice experience. She's a really sweet teacher, came into our in-person lab one day to wish us luck on the exam. However this review is more towards TA Liselotte Peeters. If you have her as a TA, just know you're in for a tough semester in lab with her. She grades terribly.

Dr. Pradhan is one of my favorite professors at OSU. She is very supportive and wants her students to succeed, and is very helpful with disabilities and illness. She emphasizes that your work ethic and passion matters more than your grade, and will help a lot with getting students in the positions they need to be in for their future.

One of my favorite professors at OSU. Her lectures were great and covered all the topics on the exam well. There was a bit of homework, but nothing too bad. The labs were very annoying weekly. She drops a lot of low grades. Very few office hours
nice professor but so many papers

I love Dr. Pradhan. She's everything one could ask for in a professor. She teaches my favorite class this semester because she not only truly knows her stuff (and enjoys talking about immunology) but also because she genuinely cares about being a great professor. I can't say the same for all the micro professors.

I took the hybrid Microbiology, so my lectures were online and went in for lab. Pradhan's online lectures were super straightforward. The exams were based directly on the slides. Other assignments included Mastering, easy online discussion posts, and a few projects. Overall, this class was easier than I expected.

Dr. Pradhan is an amazing lecturer, she really explains the material in the capacity you need to know it. Re write your notes, and remember the quizzes are usually harder than the exams. the final was a bit tricky because it was from guest lecturers, but if you work for it, a good grade is far within the realm of possibility.

In short, Dr. Pradhan is world-class. Absolutely loved her lecture style, approachable and helpful attitude, and clear expectations. Exams were straightforward. This particular course was newly-designed and fascinating, one of my all-time favorites. I would take another class with her in a heartbeat
She is an amazing lecturer. Her exams are straight forward, and the topics she teaches are very interesting. She really knows her stuff.

taught the 1st half of 5122 very very well and clearly. Wish she taught the entire course, but I only missed one question on the first midterm and 1 question on the 2nd. The material in the first half of the class is much easier than the 2nd half, so you always have to read. Otherwise very clear and open to helping students!! :D
Great lectures but topics can get boring. Memorize what she says and learn how to apply it using the hw. Easy class if you put in a little bit of time each week.

Absolutely love her and this class. She is a great lecturer and really wants her students to understand the material. Exams are totally based off her powerpoints which makes it really easy to study. Lab is actually fun, just be sure to study for the practical. Not sure if she's teaching 4000 next semester but if so, take her for sure!!

I cannot say enough great things about her. Do not skip the lectures because she will tell you exactly what you need to know for the exams. Very clear expectations and tests were very easy. The course is designed so you can slip up a few times and still come out with an A. As long as you study the powerpoints you are good to go!

I had Bullwinkle for the first half of the course and Pradhan for the 2nd half. Pradhan was definitely the better lecturer of the two. The problem was, her powerpoint slides ,which are on Carmen, were not as helpful for studying so take notes in lecture. Pradhan knows her stuff about microbio though, she is pretty interesting to learn from.

SHE IS AWESOME! Her accent is the cutest thing and you can tell she really wants to help her students succeed in her class. She posts all of her lectures so as long as you memorize all the details on the powerpoints, you should do fine in the class. The lab section took up a lot of time but wasn't difficult, except for the lab practical

Great Class! She adds humor to her lectures so you don't fall asleep and repeats things over and over again. I would suggest going to lectures as she gives hints about things that will appear on the exam, as well as gives you info that is not on the slides. You don't need the textbook. All the test questions come straight from the slides and hw.

She is good at organizing class content to better understand it and explain it clearly. I loved how she would emphasize things that were really important and made sure we understood before moving onto the next thing. I probably went to half of the lectures. You can skip, but its way easier to study if you go to class and actually pay attention

Awesome Professor! Clear and direct on what you need to know in lecture. Office hours are amazing, she wants you to learn the material. Kinda tough tests, but take this class seriously and you should do fine. Textbook not required. Highly recommend, the content is difficult, but she makes it as clear as possible.
Very knowledgeable and pleasantly sassy. Explains the material very well and makes microbiology an interesting class.

Dr. Pradhan is a dynamic lecturer.  She also explains the same idea to you in several different ways and gives lots of examples.  She has high expectations, but not unreasonable.  She's clearly dedicated to finding methods that allow students to be successful. Reasonable students who are willing to participate and to actively learn will do well.

Dr. Pradhan is one of the few professors in academia who has no tricks up her sleeve. Her tests are designed so that if you study seriously, you will not only pass, but perform in an A-B range. I wish all professors were like her. She understands the students and is more than willing to help you in office hours as well.

Tests were terrible. MUST SHOW UP TO CLASS, not only for attendence points but for extra information on tests that will not be in the slides or book. Hard to understand at some points during lecture and some of her information on slides conflicted with the book and other classes.

One of the most nicest profs I've ever had. I came to her a few times bc I wasn't doing as well on the exams. she gave good tips on how to study. asked lab TA how to do well & got good tips. did a bit below avg on 3 exams but near perfect on everything else (lab, hmwk) and almost perfect on final. was happy in the end but had to work extra hard

Pradhan knows her stuff and the lectures are extremely straightforward. If you study even moderately you'll do well on the exams. Attendance isn't mandatory but it's a grade boost and you might see the poll questions later on an exam. She truly wants you to learn and will go over material multiple times if she has to, definitely recommend her.

I did not enjoy the lecture portion of this course. I would rather get an ice pick lobotomy in Siberia than sit through this course, or any like it, again. I find microbes fascinating and fun to learn about, but I found this lecture more dull than the scissors given to a three year old whose parents graduated from the University of Michigan

She is absolutely great. Probably my favorite professor that I've had in my college career. Always available to answer questions, office hours were very helpful. There are online homework assignments but they were fair with enough time to complete them. Going to actual lecture helped a lot because of the "Poll Questions" and exams were not TOO hard

Pradhan was awesome at explaining things in a way we could understand. Her examples in lecture were very clear. I loved having her-never thought about skipping class (even though I probably could have) because she was just that great. I never attended her office hrs (didn't really need to) but she was very prompt about answering emails. Great prof!

Absolutely great professor. She is fantastic at taking difficult concepts and translating it into layman's terms, or drawing out diagrams to help get the point across. I loved that she was very approachable, and taught the class with different types of media to make the material approachable to all kinds of learning styles. Great class for anyone!
One of the best profs at OSU. Clear and helpful. Open to questions. Online hw is more helpful than the book (which I didn't open). 10/10 would take again.

Dr. Pradhan is easily the best science professor I have had at Ohio State.  She is a very nice woman and is genuinely interested in her students learning and performing well in her class. Her exams are very reasonable and based entirely on material covered in lecture.  This was my favorite class I have taken at OSU, I would recommend her to anyone

She is the best professor I've had. Not only does she teach you new stuff, but actually applies it to the real world, which is really interesting. She will tell you if she doesn't have clicker questions so that you can 'enjoy the weather.' Tests are really easy and she tells you what you need to know for them- no surprises. Lab is fun/relaxed.
Great lecturer, she has good delivery when speaking. When it comes to course material she is completely clear about what information you need to focus on.
Reccommend her! She is clear and helpful.

Dr. Pradhan was very enthusiastic about Microbiology 509 and helped me to be able to focus on what she was saying during the lecture. All lecture exam questions come from the lecture and you have to go because she tells you what to focus on and deletes a lot of slides too.

She is one of the best professors at Ohio State. I highly recommend taking microbio with her. she's very helpful, very clear, and jokes around in lecture. It was because of her that I am taking more micobio classes
extremely easy. no need to study much for exams because questions are basic, straightforward, common sense
Very easy!

Great Class! Dr. Pradhan is an excellent teacher. Very, very clear. She is always willing to help her students. Will highly recommend the class. Like others mentioned, not an easy A, but definitely attainable...don't be lazy, bottom line--you get what you work for. If you are expecting to go into the medical field, then work! Used textbook for clar
Loved the class, very easy and lab was a dream (no reports!). She makes everything easy to understand and you don't need the textbook at all. Would definitely recommend!

Oh my Gosh I never liked any of the bio related classes in my entire life. But because of Dr. Pradhan I really enjoyed micro bio...She is very clear, and always there to help. Don't buy the book but u need to show up to lecture even if it's not mandatory. She is the best professor I have ever had in biological sciences.

Dr. Pradhan is most likely the most fair prof. I've had at OSU. She gives lecture slides and then adds depth in lecture, and if you pay attention, you'll do fine. Got an A, no problem. She's straightforward (no trick questions!).
Amazing professor! Take this class!

Amazing prof, makes concepts very clear and easy to understand. Exams are all mult choice and questions are fairly easy. don't buy the textbook unless you have no bio knowledge at all. lab is a breeze especially compared to other labs (e.g. ochem) at osu. final is not cumulative. easy A.

Amazing teacher who is always willing to help her students! A lot of memorizing details for only 40 questions per exam. (3 exams total: 2 midterms and a non-comprehensive final). Would highly recommend Dr. Pradhan for any class! It was very interesting and good for anyone going into the medical field.

Professor Pradhan was an excellent teacher. Very clear and concise and was very open and wiling to help students on the discussion section. Someone earlier said the exams were really difficult.. I dno what to tell that person. I studied for the first exam for 5 hours, got a 100. 2nd exam 0 hours, got an 80. final 6 hours, got a 100. Very easy class

AWESOME professor. Very clear, knows her stuff. Very interesting material when you go to lecture. She may say you don't need to go, but honestly, even though lecture is not mandatory, there is quite a bit that you need to know that is only said in class. Otherwise, she made the class very interesting and was a very fair grader.
Amiable. Professional. Very good coverage of information. Lectures can be a bit dry. Not at all difficult if you have had a little biology prior to this class.
Don't let everyone fool you - exams were difficult. I spent 20+ hours studying for the first exam and failed it with a 57.5%. EXAMS WERE WORDED BADLY. She is very nice but the class was unfair.

She is the reason I switched to a microbiology major! Great professor, very clear about what you will see on tests. Her powerpoint slides have all the info you need for exams, so don't buy the book.  Easy class and great professor!

I took this class with a strong interest in science previously and I learned a lot, but the class is difficult if you don't put much time and effort into lab and lecture. Her lectures are interesting, but it's easy to get distracted. If you take her class, you will work hard.

Like everyone else said...uber easy. Very clear...go to class cause she gives direct hints to questions. She jokes about herself too, which is fun. Don't need the book. I wish she taught other classes for Micro majors, because after her class, I switched to it :) She is one of the best science prof's at OSU

Definitely one of the more interesting classes at OSU.  Don't waste your money on the textbook, she only tests you over her notes.  Just show up to lecture and take really good notes and you'll do well in this class.
By far my most favorite class I have taken at OSU.  Great teacher, interesting material, and labs that actually serve a purpose.  Take this class!  Matt Swearington is a great TA to have in the lab.

She is a great professor. I love going to her lectures, and because of her I have decided to make Microbiology my minor. She makes everything really clear, and her lectures don't put you to sleep. I actually WANTED to go to class and listen to her.

She explains everything really well and makes her tests directly from the notes in class. You don't even need to buy the book and she knows some students are just there because they have to and not because they're interested. Take her class!

Dr. Pradhan is an awesome professor.  She explains the material extremely well while explicitly indicating what you do and do not need to know for exams.  Go to class - she adds material to the notes which are found online everyday.
Madura is the best lecturer I have ever had. She keeps things simple and clear and her test solely reflect her lectures, which means they are very straightforward. Take her shes sweet

Great professor. Her accent isn't that bad. GO TO LECTURE!!! Don't even bother with the book. Take really detailed notes and even record lectures if you have to. It's VERY managaeable to get an A. Just study her notes REALLY WELL. She's really nice and approachable.  Applies subject to life often. Really enjoyed the class.
Best prof ever!!!!  I wish she would teacher all the other classes I have to take.  Easy tests (two midterms and a final) as long as you study a little.  Very fair and helpful.  Highly recommend!

Easy class. Easy prof. Just go, take notes, study a little bit and you'll do well on the exams. Nothing tricky about them. Labs are fun and interesting and actually follow lecture material. Best lecture-lab combo I've taken at OSU.

She is a good teacher, keep material simple and easy to understand. The exams are not easy but arent hard. you just need to review her lecture notes. The labs are stupid and the teachers for the lab could care less about the students in it. The professor though is great

An amazing teacher. She made things very clear and was very helpful when asked any question. She seemed very interested in the subject and provided examples to make things clear. You will only do well if you go to lecture, and don't buy the book

Great prof. Willing to help. Definately recommend taking her. Don't buy the book, all material on tests & quizzes given in lecture-GO TO CLASS!! Notes posted online, be sure to print them off before hand b/c she goes FAST! Lab instructor (LSR) is wonderful also!!

Very well-intentioned,wanted students to understand the material. Midterms were straightforward with two or three tricky questions. Lab is easy and the biggest worry is the quizzes and practical. Great class.
Her lectures were ridiculous, she was hard to understand, and the class itself is pointless.  In lab, the professor treats you like a five-year old
Never used the book, lab is twice a week, exams are tough so don't expect an easy A...but I'll admit that I skipped majority of lectures and still got a B
Good teacher . . . attendance not required but very helpful!  just go to class and you'll be ok.
Nice lady :)
Very good teacher. She explains the concepts very well in the lectures and exams are fairly easy. Not a guaranteed A though like someone else said. Maybe guaranteed to get at least a B.
absolutle loved her! and dont buy your book because you dont need it. she gives you everything you need to know in the notes. HIGHLY reccomend!!!
this class was really easy even if you are comming out of bio 101, the only thing is her accent is a lil distracting but its fun! she is really helpful.
Excellent teacher, it doesn't get any better than this when dealing with biology.

I really enjoyed this class. She is really into helping students and likes when people ask questions. Her accent isn't too bad only a few words are a bit hard to hear.  Tests are based on notes only and in my opinion weren't terribly hard.

The people that gave her a mediocre review do not know what they're talking about.  As long as you go to class, memorize what she tells you to memorize, you are almost guarenteed an A in the course.  Her accent is not bad AT ALL, and if you cant understand, just ask her, she's very approachable.  The lab is hard, but she's so sweet!

This class is hard if you are coming straight out of Bio 101.  Not only is the material hard but her accent definitely gets in the way.  Print-out the notes and be ready to write very fast!  Don't bother with the book (biggest waste of $100).  Be ready for her to be late everyday and lecture over the class time (even if its Friday).

Very easy class if you print off online notes and take good notes in lecture. She gives information in class specific to what will be on the exam to increase lecture turnout. Don't bother buying the book...

Moves fast in lecture. Notes online- print and bring them! Do not have to read book.  Exams from notes and lecture only.  Accent not bad- she knows what words she has trouble with and makes things clear.

She is really nice and makes the lecture somewhat interesting.  She repeats herself to help you understand what she is saying because she has an accent.  You don't need to buy the book to get a good grade.
She's very hard to understand sometimes, but she's fun and willing to help whenever needed

Her exam questions come directly from notes online, maybe one or two questions total coming from stuff she mentioned only in class and you had to be there to hear it.  Her accent isn't that terrible, but there are a few select words that you really have to guess what she meant.  She says "however" a lot, that just annoyed me for some reason.
material is fairly easy.  notes are posted online.  kind of hard to understand.  no curve!
Notes are posted online. She moves fast in lecture.  Take good notes and study them hard for tests.
its not that bad...shes dec
Her notes and concepts were very easy to understand and her tests were based straight from them.  The material for the class was really interesting!!

She is okay... Tests are very easy, but she is boring to listen to. She constantly repeats herself four or five times in a row by rearranging the words in her sentences. It is the most annoying thing to listen to.

Her accent is very hard to decipher.  I had this class in the afternoon and it was very hard to stay awake.  The book is NOT necessary...multiple choice exam questions are taken straight from lecture notes.

Amazing Professor and gives you tons of practice and guides before exams. Lots of content so the exams are kind of hard but as long as you study days before, you should be fine! Also willing to help outside of class times and responds to emails fairly quickly.
This professor taught the lectures well. The exams are average but as long as you study you should be fine.

PPX are extremely long, he does not elaborate on them at all. Reads directly from PPX, blanks in PPX to ensure attendance. He does not care that the average grade for exams are failing, he says we should study harder. Gives a research project, but we cannot conduct any research, just read articles. If it's not to his liking, it isn't good enough.

Dr. Beres truly cares about his students and is willing to help if you ask him. If you work hard and get good grades on in-class assignments and labs. Then they will balance out failing the tests, which most people do. It is not impossible to pass, but extra time and effort is required.

This professor does not keep his word when talking about what is on an exam, it is very specific as to what he wants and nothing else. In lab with him he is very nit picky when grading and will comment about a lot of things that you did wrong. Questions on the exams are not in his lecture or labs and he just randomly expects us to know it. AVOID

Grades way too harshly as the class average on midterms is a failing grade. The class is blamed for poor study habits when more than half of the class fails a test, rather than considering his own participation in the matter. Tests are worded poorly causing confusion. Students study more and do worse on exams. 0/10, would not willingly have again.

His lectures are designed and performed well but everything else about this class is horrendous. Average class grade is a C I believe and he doesn't care how you do on exams even though it is obvious multiple kids are struggling. Avoid

Terrible professor. Kids who study 20+ hours for exams still fail and instead of taking responsibility and realizing he makes the exams too difficult, he blames his students for not having proper study habits. Yes, college is designed to be difficult but not to the extent where the average on exams is ALWAYS an F.

Among the worst professors I have ever had. Does not prepare students for exams. Expects students to remember information from 6+ weeks of lecture with very little review and blames his students for not preparing enough. Avoid if possible.

He is by far the worst teacher Ive ever had in my whole life. Im a freshman and I have never experienced such a worse professor. The first 2 exams the class average was a 55% and 51%. He is the worst grader in the world, for labs he will take points off for anything and everything. I once put a arrow on a graph and received a -1.5 PLEASE AVOID

This professor is by far my least favorite. He grades extremely tough and will not be very helpful when reviewing for exams what so ever. This professor will make the exam over material not covered in lecture and make it extremely hard to pass every exam he gives. Lab groups are also random and permanent. AVOID!

The toughest grader as far as BIO1114 TAs go. The assignments are difficult as they are but he takes points off for the smallest things. Compared to other BIO1114 TAs he is a much hard grader which I find unfair. Try to avoid or switch sections.

The most I can say is that he is good at teaching concepts that have been covered in class. Other than that, avoid him. He will say that your work looks fine just to take off points when he goes on to grading the papers. He is super nitpicky about what you wrote down as well. Any small deviations result in points lost. AVOID.

Very genuine dude, clearly loves the material but doesn't explain concepts well. Talks as if everyone else is an expert and not learning the material, unclear explanations. Lots of outside videos to watch that aren't even his lectures. Class time was supplemental and final focused on the novel required for class and outside videos. Exam was easy.

I had Professor Seeger for the first half of Bio 3401 and I struggled. He obviously cares about the material and the material isn't hard but he lectures in a way that doesn't highlight key concepts, the quizzes are indecipherable, and he is obsessed with fruit flies. It isn't as hard as chem but it is so boring. The other professor is great tho!

He put zero effort to make the material more comprehensive or interestin. Also when approached with questions he would always say things that never really answered the question. DROP THE CLASS IT ISNT WORTH IT.

I had Dr. Seeger for the second half of the semester. While definitely an adjustment from the easy first half of the semester with a different professor, I don't necessarily think all the negative reviews of Dr. Seeger are fair. His exams are based on lectures and assignments, so they are definitely manageable if you pay attention! Content is easy.

I had Dr. Seeger for the second half of the semester. It was definitely a huge adjustment to make as his content was more intense and you had to really know the concept in order to get a good grade. His quizzes and exams were very detailed with very little multiple choice questions. Pay attention to recitation activities and go to office hours!

Take him at your own risk. This class had 2 modules meaning it was broken into 2 different sections and he taught the 2 part of the module. His way if teaching is old school and his exams are really difficult for no reason. It is open book but trust me it is EXTREMELY HARD. Buuuut if you're up for the challenge then take him lol. Thats all I'll say

Never rated a professor before but DO NOT take his class!! His exams and quiz questions are very difficult to do because his style of questions are very extremely difficult to understand. He said in his own email that " I think it is a fair yet rigorous exam appropriate for the online/open book". Do not fall for this Open notes scam-ONLINE

Dr Seeger is the harder of the 2 professors. Although his module may be tougher, it is not too difficult. I think that people get used to the first module and when they switch to this one, it seems leagues harder but it is not. If you pay attention and take some time to understand, then it's like other Bio classes. Only annoying thing was iBiology.

I honestly could not tell you anything that I've learned during his module. Our semester was switched online because of COVID and he gave us so much work to complete. It was impossible to keep us. His lecture style is very boring and impossible to listen to. The only perk was that he gave us over 24 hours to complete our final and it was open book.

Although he can seem to talk about drosophila forever it is a great genetics class. He is super accommodating and enthusiastic, he brings humor to the class which is especially appreciated due to the statistics base. If you do the assigned homework you will not have a problem passing the class. He is truly a great professor.
I suppose a good teacher, but his tests were pretty difficult.

So ungodly boring. Dr. Seeger is nice and clearly brilliant, yet he constantly makes basic math mistakes and all of his equations are wrong in his notes. Exams are reasonable and assignments are long, but straightforward. Be sure to read outside of class though!
Incredibly nice and helpful prof. Just make sure to work your butt off and study well in advance for exams, not just several days prior. Exam averages were consistently in the ~60s.

Seeger team taught the class. Lots of small details to remember, and he teaches like a stereotypical research prof. Cares about his students but presentation of material was rough to say the least. Class exam averages were low (50s-70s) and only going to class is not enough to learn material. Does post slides beforehand.

He has no textbook, useful syllabus or general direction for the class.  His lecture slides are just pictures and give no useful information- meaning you have to write down every word he says in lecture to learn anything.  However, this is impossible because he's so boring.  I've learned nothing in 7 weeks.

I'm generally opened minded when it comes to  classes, but this professor is the worst I ever had. Monotone voice that bores the hell out of you. Late postings of tests and homework (didn't post the grades for the midterms till week9) If I ever have another class with this prof. I would drop that class right away.

I have no doubt this guy knows what he's talking about. He kinda looks like professor flitwick. But he is the classic research teacher. He's only teaching so he can get his funding and lectures are often just him reading off slides which are just research papers.
Class did tend to get boring at times, but he's a nice guy and by no means a bad prof.

super easy class. i had him for the latter half of the quarter. he's really boring but he likes to sneak x-files into his slides which i found really charming. he's more than happy to explain stuff after class. if you're not satisfied, talk to a TA or watch the cd in your textbook.

Seeger is a nice person.  He is willing to meet with you if you need help.  However, I won't gurantee it will do any good.  Lectures are long and BORING.  Tests are hard and ask for detailed answers.  They are entirely problem based and we didn't do any problems in class.  Assigned a bunch of work in the last week of the quarter.

He has horrible communication skills and is all together an awful teacher I came in loving Genetics and left hating it. He can't explain anything and has incredibly boring lectures. The course is unorganized and piles up exponentially at the end. Hard tests with no practice other than the book to help. In his class, you learn entirely from the book

He was obviously interested in teaching the subject to his students. His close interaction in labs was very welcome. My only complaint is that lectures got a bit boring, but that could have had more to do with the classroom or the subject matter.  If you have to take this class, I would definitely recommend this teacher.
He assigned too much work the last week or so of class, but it could have been worse. Nice guy.

His lectures get a bit long, and his midterms are very hard with detailed questions, but he does have great hair.  He did, however assign two lab reports, and 4 chapters of work during the last week of class.

Professor Lanno has long lectures, and the beginning of the course was difficult. The labs are almost all dissection, so if you have a weak stomach, I do not recommend this course. There was a lot of group projects at the end of the semester that can make or break your grade, choose your lab partners wisely.

Dr. Lanno was passionate about what he was teaching, but the course structure could use a little work. The lecture material was a lot to learn at once. Some of the exams (practicals) were a month apart, some were barely over a week apart, which sometimes left us not much time to study. The class just felt a little all over the place.

Dr. Lanno makes this class harder than it should be. He gave us 50-page slides a few days before our final without a lecture and half of the final was over that. He could've planned ahead but did not, causing students to cram and fall behind on learning content. His explanations drag on and are confusing, even when a student has a simple question.

Dr. Lanno was an awesome professor. The structure of the class was difficult at the beginning with few assignments and long lectures, but Dr. Lanno is very open to feedback and changed his class delivery to accommodate us. Study for the tests because they make up most of your grade. Labs depend on the TA, but the endophytes project was interesting.

Dr. Lanno is an amazing professor who will do his best to prepare you (though a bit fast ) That said the lab and the semester project are hard and the course content is over whelming. I love bio and I found myself hating this class. If you like bio and want to preserve your sanity dont take this class at 8am! The course is fast and content heavy!

Pretty good professor, kept lectures fairly interesting at 8 am. Good at explaining concepts, and breaks up the lectures with readings and discussion. Study for the second exam early, lots of memorizing. Endophyte project is tough, but doable. Not the best with technology, but tries his best.

Super nice guy and very good teacher! I was always interested in his lectures & they were 80 minutes at 8a.m! He breaks up the class time with discussion and 2-6 page readings that tie the material into current issues. The endophyte project is a lot of work but it's split up over the semester. As others said, start studying for the 2nd test early!
Dr. Lanno was a good professor, but he wasn't the best at emailing back. He was easy to understand, and although some test questions were poorly written, it was fairly easy to do well.

Wasn't a fan of his module-- because I didn't find toxicology interesting + he used unfamiliar words and it was really hard to pay attention in lecture. He focuses on the oil spill a lot- pretty boring. His exam is fairly easy if you study what he tells you is important (red + blue stuff on slides -- beware he changed this on the slides midway).

He's an okay professor overall. His part of the class consists of listening to lectures and answering graded LGS questions. The lectures were straightforward, and he will highlight important parts before the exam. In my opinion, recitation was a waste of time.
Get points for going to lecture. Exam is poorly written but is manageable to do well on. Lots of points come from showing up to lecture. Lecture is interesting but sometimes gets pretty boring.
Show up for in class assignments. He usually walks you through them for easy points

Dr. Lanno is a nice guy but I wasn't particularly found of his module. I thought that the oil spillHiroshima& Nagasaki stuff was interesting but the rest was really dry because it was mostly bio stats. I felt that hardly any bluered info was on the exam even though he said it would be. The exam wasn't terrible if you study just really random
Very thorough and makes summary slides so you know what to study. Really good at explaining applicable uses for information in field. Overall, I recommend this professor
Dr. Lanno was seriously awesome. He legitimately cares about students. He offered plenty of extra credit opportunities. He is an excellent lecturer.

The class seemed easy... until the second exam killed everyone. The first exam was really easy, but he threw us a curveball and made the second exam extremely difficult. Also, like others have said the grading on the small assignments is very  nitpicky which hurts grades in the long run. That being said, Lanno is an overall great professor.

Dr Lanno is a good professor, the material isnt too hard but the way the class is set up makes it nearly impossible to get an A . Get used to a lot of 3 out of 5s on small assignments which add up to kill grades

The lecturer is extremely good and understandable. However the TA Jessie Wallace is so critical, I think it's absurd that the majority of the class is getting close to no points on drafts of papers which is bringing down grades tremendously.

Lecturer is fine, and worth taking.  Watch out for TA Jessie Wallace - grading is extremely inconsistent and you will get nickel and dimed on everything.  Getting absurdly low grades on DRAFTs of your paper sections based on trivial things is absolutely ridiculous.  This ruins ths class.

Really liked him even though i absolutely despise science.  Really wanted students to do well.  We were in 4-person lab groups and I was pulling all the weight in my group so he noticed that and pulled me aside and asked me if i'd like to be put into another group. i said yes and he changed everyones group around...i really appreciated this!!

Like everyone said, you can go once a week and go to lab and get a good grade. However, make sure to study for the quizzes, bc a lot of the questions come from newspaper articles and you will not otherwise no the answer no matter how well-read you are in biology.

Easiest class I have taken at OSU. There are no midterms and no final. DO NOT BUY THE BOOK. I don't even know what the cover looks like. I went to class once a week and when I did go I either slept or studied my notes. I got an A. He puts all the notes on Carmen so as long as you at least glance at them you will do well on the quizzes.

Good teacher...makes a boring subject pretty interesting.  Class is easy IF IF IF you study the notes before hand.  You will for sure fail every quiz if you don't study for them.  All the questions come right from the lectures notes(online) and the readings(online).  Don't waste your money buying anything for this class.

He is nice professor, interested in getting you in and out of biology with a decent grade. But your TA may be a different story. No final, weekly quizzes (find someone who has recently taken the class, they can help you alot), and the labs are easy but you have to go to them. Also REMEMBER to do the weekly blogs, an easy  5 points.
fairly easy class. dr lanno is a nice guy no exams it is all based on weekly quizes and labs. go to lab and make sure you keep up with your deadlines and you will be fine.

This class was really easy. There were 8 quizes(one each week) instead of a midterm and final. You do not ahve to go to lecture (except on quiz dates) because the notes were on carmen. I would reccommend this class to anyone!
Don't buy the textbook, it's never used at all!!  The class is very easy, just review the notes given on the website before quizzes.  Lanno is a nice guy too who explains everything clearly.

VERY EASY CLASS!!!! I only went to lecture when there was a quiz and passed all of them.  I ended up with a B in the class and thats with no effort.  The no midterm/final is AWESOME.  DO NOT BUY THE BOOK. Total waist of money and they do not buy them back. Overall very eas class, High School Biology was harder.

I loved his lectures they were very interesting. Pay no attention to the other dorks on here. The only reason they think it was a joke, is because he does make great notes to where you dont have to use the book,and then he post everything.If he didnt the slackers in the class would prob flunk! I learned a lot in his class,and thats most important.
Don't bother buying the book, you will never need it. Just download the notes off the web. SUPER easy, the labs are identicle to ones I did in 7th grade.

sooo easy. stupid lectures, but easy to skip and do well in. he reminds me of tobias from arrested development. my TA doesnt speak english very well, but its still really easy..like first grade stuff.

He's super boring, but he tries to be funny and make class interesting.  Maybe it's not so bad if you don't take it in the morning...  The quizzes are super easy and right off the notes which you can get online, so you don't really have to go to lecture except to take the quizzes.  Make-ups are SUPER hard so don't miss.

he was pretty easy, just be careful on the quizzes, theres only like 10 questions on each so you miss 2 and your down to an 80%.  labs are easy just make sure you go.  i didnt even really try hard and i got a B+.
Easiest class ever at OSU.  Easiest professor ever, never have to go to lecture except for quizes, no midterm or final, and all notes are online.  Highly recommended
Very easy class, I highly recommend it!

This class is such a joke! I never went to lecture except for quiz days because everything was online. Common sense is all you to get an A! Plus the labs are ridiculously easy and you always get out early. I recommend Joe Beuchel for your TA- EASY grader! =)
Excellent lecturer! Highly recommended!

If you can stomach Lanno bashing the Bush Administration and pushing his environmental agenda on you, then go ahead and take this class. The good thing is that there are no midterms/final, and I studied for the quizzes in lecture and got an A on every one.  Labs are a joke.  If you passed 5th grade then you should be able to get an A in this class.

Easiest class in the world. Lecture notes are posted ahead of time, so you don't even need to bother going to lecture. Quizzes are a piece of cake. No midterm, no final, how much better can it get? However, don't get Mike Nelson as your TA. He grades the labs ridiculously hard considering that this is a class for ppl w/ no bio experience.

Yeah, this class is pretty easy, and the professor is pretty cool, just make sure you do NOT get Mike Nelson as your T.A. He grades the labs extremely hard (they've had to raise all his classes' grades to meet the average of everyone else in bio) and alomost always uses up the entire 3 hours (most T.A.s don't)
extremely easy
GREAT class set-up -- weekly quizzes instead of finals and midterms.  Also, he wears really tight pants.  It's great.

This class has been the easiest of my college career, I slept through all of the lectures and still came out with an A. Just agree with his propaganda and use common sense and you'll been fine. Doesn't do much to prepare you for 102 but nothing can prepare you for the NYT disaster.

Piece of cake class. If you don't mind agreeing with his environmentalist propaganda on every quiz, this is the prof for you. If you want a bio class that will prepare you for the second half of your biological science sequence..... Lanno and the New York Times will not help much. Clarity and easiness don't always equal preparation.

Easiest professor yet.  He's funny and keeps the class simple.  No midterm or final, quizzes are a breeze if you study your notes-- questions mostly over definitions.  If you can find someone who kept their old quizzes, they're 95% identical each quarter.

If you're gonna take bio 101 get this guy.  Class is easy (no final or midterm).  Just short weekly quizzes that you can study for while he lectures.  Don't bother buying the book if you're going to take his class as I didn't open it once and as a result lost $60.  I got an A with no effort.

The class was easy..quizzes were short, sweet and to the point--sometimes a little tricky though....all notes are on webct ahead of each class, no midterm or final :)  really easy to understand prof.  made the concepts VERY simple!

Definately worth taking. You hardly even need to read the book to do well. Im sure if I spent more than 30 minutes a week studying i would have an A. Think im at an A- or B+ with close to 0 effort. Lectures are interesting, but dont fall asleep or he'll come after you asking questions. NO EXAMS!
Not as boring as some proffesors, but he presents the material pretty well
the course material isn't very exciting, but i wouldn't say professor lanno is boring. he's a great lecturer and very clear.

This is probably the easiest class I've ever taken.  No final or midterm, just multiple-choice quizzes every week.  Notes are online, so you don't even have to write anything down or buy the book.  INCREDIBLY boring, but hey, it requires no effort whatsoever.

I am ashamed that I have to pay money to take this class but I'm taking it because it is a requirement...  If you've taken high school biology - this class will merely be an inconvienience.  Good thing it's really easy because the class is really boring.

Talk about easy! Just like everyone else says, no midterms or finals which are a huge +. Quizzes are over notes, NYT, & any movies shown so make sure you go to those lectures when a movie is suppost to be shown. Lecture is kinda boring unless your into this kind of stuff and notes are online.

This guy is very understanding about situatuions that prevent you from making it to class. But his lecture is hella boring, but i mean it's basic biology it would be very hard to make it interesting. Pretty cool guy overall.

Lecture was pretty boring, but he keeps you updated with New York time articles. He's very knowledgeable, nice, and he wants to teach. There is no final or midterm, just quizzes every Friday--which are directly from the notes. Only lab sucks!!!
Lanno wasn't an exciting professor but he always referred to current events to keep things interesting.  No midterm or final was awesome,  Made things less stressful!

Lectures weren't the most exciting things ever, but definitely go. Notes are online but he blacks some slides out so in order to get all the info you have to be there. The no midterm or final rule was incredible. I'd recommend him.

For a professor, he was not bad. The problem comes with the TA's. If you get a crappy one, even if you go to class and take notes, if your TA is bad, you will still get a B+, which is what I received.
Very good bio professor, puts all notes on the internet and makes quizzes (NO FINALS OR MIDTERMS) very fair. Best bio 101 teacher
Prof. Lanno is a very even-handed and fair to students.
We didn't have any midterms or finals only quizzes and labs! How nice is that? He wasn't the most exciting lecturer but it was fairly easy stuff. Definately recommend him if you have to take bio 101.
No Comments
No Comments

Other than the class content being completely mindless, and hating every single passing second I was present in this class. She was a great professor, she came in with a positive attitude everyday, the class was an easy A. If you can handle attendance, which is only 2 days a week ( I hate going to class lol) then TAKE HER.
Rocky start trying to learn her expectations, but she mostly makes her grading seem worse than it actually is. A wonderful professor by the end of the term, very comfortable joking with her students.

Dr. Z is awesome and hilarious!!! She truly cares about her students and wants them to do well. If she notices the class is getting something, shell stop, take input, and fix her lectures to make sure everyone understands. Totally recommend
I LOVE DR Z. SHE IS FANTASTIC AT EXPLAINING, COMES IN EVERYDAY WITH A POSITIVE ATTITUDE, AND REALLY CARES ABOUT HER STUDENTS.

Dr. Z is great, I took her for an Introduction to Undergraduate Research class, and if you do your work and actually try, then this class will be easy. She has helped me enormously in getting involved in research at Ohio State, and will help anyone who gives effort!
Robert is the best TA EVER. He will help you prepare for exams, shows he cares about you, and prioritizes your understanding of the contest and your overall well being. 10/10 highly recommend !!

Robert was the best TA I have had at Ohio State so far. He was always prepared for class and did good recitations. He was helpful while also allowing students to think for themselves. He connected well with us and I would recommend him as a TA to anyone!
