Robert was very helpful in bio 1113 lab. Whenever the class, or just I, was confused, he had no problem taking the time to give a thorough explanation and resolve any misunderstandings. I enjoyed having Robert as my TA this semester, he is one of the best TAs I've had so far.
pretty cool teach
AVOID THE BIG BURHAN AT ALL COST! HIS SKIBIDI ARKAN DOES NOT KNOW HOW TO TEACH THE CLASS!
Horrible
He was a very genuine and nice professor. Probably one of the top three professors I have had. He was always helpful and cared about his students.
He is a very tough grader and challenges his students, but he is a good TA and professor. He always made time for students to make sure they understood the material.

Dr Bell was an amazing TA. Yes our lab sections tended to run long due to his heavy explaining of material, but he genuinely wants students to succeed. Just do the work and put in decent effort and you will be fine.

STEER CLEAR! We would go to his office hours, and he would say our answers were good. But then, when we got graded, would we get points taken off for incorrect answers? Also, he graded really tough and wasn't accommodating when my group had fewer people. We watched unrelated videos about spiders, which didn't make sense. The weed-out of 1114!

Dr. Bell was difficult, but I learned more in his lab recitation than I did lecture. His labs go longer than other sections, but it was worth it for the better understanding I got. Truly wants his students to succeed and will always help. Lab quizzes were hard, but they were good prep for the lab final (got an A). Participate and you'll do well.
Bell is a tough grader, but fair. He expects students to pay attention to his lectures and will quiz you on that material.

Don't pick him as lab TA. Our labs were longer than others bc he lectures forever and then most of the time you won't have enough time to complete the lab wksht in class (he's trying to help but takes all your time). Super picky grader and our lab quizzes were also harder than other lab sections. You can do well but life is easier w/a diff TA

Bio 1114 labs were poorly organized and planned and needed to be online. He is extremely difficult professor to understand what he wants during lecture. Difficult and slow grader, asks questions within a question after you turn in response. It's very annoying. You have very difficult quizzes you haven't any idea what you will be tested on.

Nice guy, very smart and passionate about biology, but a very tough grader. Labs are somewhat difficult. Dont think about skipping class, attendance is mandatory. You will definitely have to work for your grade.

I had Bell as my TA and he was really nice and seemed passionate about biology, more specifically his research on spiders. He's a very tough grader as I've never gotten full credit on any of the lab assignments we've did. The lab quizzes are difficult and he'd barely talk about them during recitation. Very hard to get an A. :(

Bell was my TA for the summer course for 1114 (Summer). He was a SUPER tough grader and went off on tangents... could never get an A! Even the most intelligent classmate in the class was complaining... :( would NOT reccommend
Extremely harsh grader, very difficult to get an A, labs reliably run an hour over at minimum. AVOID.

Dr. Bell was my lab instructor. He provided very good feedback on each lab and was not overly harsh when grading - averages were usually 13/15. Was helpful both in lab and in office hours. Was very good at addressing common mistakes and making sure we understood what was important. Very quick to respond to email, even outside of work hours.

Do not take his labs. This prof was extremely petty and unwilling to answer questions during labs. If you had a question, he would answer everything back with vague answers/more questions. This leaves you more confused than you started out. He marked off points for someone's prediction on a pre-lab. How can a prediction be wrong? Just awful prof.

I had Dr. Bell as my TA for Bio 1113 and he was the worst TA I have ever had. Incredibly rude and was never willing to help, all questions were answered with maybe. He often had an attitude and was very picky when it came to grading. The points he took off lab reports were inconsistent and for extremely small errors.

He was the TA for BIO1113 this year with Sarah Ball. This man is extremely petty. One of my classmates left her lab manual at home, so to write an IOU he dismantled a glove box and scribbled his IOU all over it. For me, he took a sheet of aluminum, wrote all over it, then crumpled it in a ball. He answers questions with "Google it" and "Maybe".

Worst professor that I've had at OSU, by far. Dr. Bell had no interest in helping students prepare for tests. Lecture was terrible because he would try to make 300+ people participate in group activities. His powerpoints weren't very useful. If you're willing to put in the work, you'll do well, just don't expect Dr. Bell to help in any way.

Dr. Bell's lectures were long and dry, but I did find going to lecture and actively taking notes helpful. Complete his reading guides and read the book to do well in this class. His tests are very fair and he is extremely helpful in his office hours.
The class is not hard to pass but you must read the book and attend lectures to receive a good grade. He gives extra credit surveys and his exams cover a lot of material but are doable.

Bell has an unusual approach to lectures.  He try's to engage the class through open discussions and group activities but fails to get the feedback and attention he is looking for.  Honestly if you have taken any honors/AP Bio in high school and did well this class shouldn't be too bad for you.  Tests are odd in that they are very generalized.
No Curve? Dr. Bell, seriously didn't give a curve, after the exam averages were in the 60's every time. Absolutely ridiculous.

It's extremely difficult to follow Dr. Bell's lectures. They're all over the place, with no clear topic for the lecture. Tests weren't hard, but expectations weren't clear. Test averages were pretty low with no curve given. Lab grades were generally decent. Attendance mandatory for Top Hat points and in-class activity points.

I was lucky to have a great lab group which  lifted my grade ( lab is 50% of the class basically). I received a 64, 62, and 72 on the exams and finished with a 84 %. The lectures are not helpful as he skips some of topics because you are expected to remember high school bio very well. Does not given exam help. Homework is always due 9 am Saturday.

DO NOT TAKE. You basically have to teach yourself everything. He is a nice guy, but don't let it fool you. His exams are not easy, and he wont even listen to your grade disputes. He is also terrible at getting grades back to you, he put in the majority of our grades days before the semester is over. He doesn't care about how you do.

If you go to lecture he has in-class activities and questions that are easy points. The exams are HARD, our class avgs on exams were D's. He is SO boring. people skip or fall asleep in his class ALL the time. His pace of speaking is slow and he goes on tangents that aren't relevant. I learned more through the online book and mastering program.

Honestly the worst professor I've EVER had. When the class averages are Ds on exams, you would think that maybe he would get that HE is the problem, and not the students. Going to lecture is a waste of time, and his entire class is a waste of time that will just destroy your GPA. The only reason to go to lecture is for TopHat credit.

Bell is the worst lecturer I've had at OSU. He is unorganized and does not teach what so ever. Tries to teach through asking the class questions and through top hat which does not work. Began semester saying he would post homework 2 days before due but most times would post hmwk with less than 24hrs to do. Nothing he teaches helps for tests

DO NOT TAKEE!!! If you want to learn anything, I would not recommend taking him. Class is mandatory but you don't learn anything. He doesn't put hardly anything on his power points. He gives you reading guides, but they are pretty pointless. They don't help for his exam. He is a nice guy, but sucks as a professor. (also lab TA)

He is an awful professor. He cannot convey the material necessary in the class in any meaningful way. His slides contain less than the minimal information to lecture about. When he lectures material he is very unclear and hard to follow. He asks the class questions we don't know that answers to. If you don't read, won't pass! Avoid if possible!
Every exam has short answer question, which really kills me.

He is terrible. Not only is lecture pointless in learning anything, he makes it mandatory due to TopHat questions. He is also a Michigan fan which should be enough of a reason to NOT TAKE THIS PROFESSOR.

Not the hardest class, because the guy will give some extra credit on midterms. He is my least favorite professor here at OSU thus far. He is a great guy to talk to, and is a very kind/willing to help. Lectures,  however, are mandatory (TH) but extremely drab and uninformative. Read and understand the book, and you will be alright.

This class is completely unorganized, and painful to attend.  The only reason people go to lecture is because of TopHat because none of what he talks about makes sense, or is easy to follow.  He talks very broadly in class, and the exams are very specific so they don't correlate. I would absolutely not recommend, pls help yourself while you can!!!

WORST professor Ive ever had. Cant take notes from the lecture slides, and the book is horribly organized. He expects you to remember everything from high school bio (which I havent taken in five years). If you want to learn Bio, I would take someone else or take it elsewhere as it will not be learned here. The exams are also not curved ever.

Help. I am dying. Class is irrelevant and yet mandatory due to tophat. He can't often answer questions students have so we have stopped asking. He stands there awkwardly waiting for us to respond to questions we do not know anything about (there's one happening right now). He is the single worst teacher I have ever experienced. RIP my love of bio:(
don't actually teach and is all over the place during lecture. He jumps around making easy concepts tougher to understand.

Bell is the absolute worst professor I have ever had. Lectures are boring and unorganized. TopHat questions daily which usually don't have a correct answer because of his typos. Literally did not go to a single lecture after midterm 1, did TopHat from home, and read the book to teach myself and my exam grade went up 20% on the second exam. AVOID!

Worst Bio class and Professor. Bell is horribly unorganized and teaches the class through top hat questions and asking the class questions that few understand or participate in. Teaches practically nothing and does not prepare students for tests, he wont even mention them the lecture before. Do not take the class with Ryan Bell, you will regret it

Lectures are confusing and do not relate to exam material. The things talked about in lecture do not go in-depth and you are often left teaching yourself by reading the textbook. Top-Hat is used so lecture is mandatory (even though it is useless) if you want credit for this part of the grade.  Exam material is not specifically defined.

He is the worst biology teacher I have ever had. He doesn't understand the material himself, and his lectures are all over the place. He uses TopHat, but never explains the correct answers correctly. The exams are the same across the biology teachers, so he does not prepare you well enough at all. I do not recommend him at all.

Dr. Bell is very unorganized and hard to follow. He gives your reading guides to prepare yourself before learning about the chapter, however he often forgets to post them until after the lecture. His lectures are very dull, and he teaches material as if you already know it. If I could do it again, I would not take his class.

Dr. Bell is hard to follow.  Attendance is mandatory for Tophat points and you won't get the points if you get the question wrong. Exams had trick questions. He provided "reading guides" to help study which were weirdly worded and hard to learn from. I didn't hate him, just would have preferred a different professor for the class

Dr. Bell's lectures are incredibly boring and hard to follow. He goes off on a lot of tangents. He uses tophat for points every class.  He's questions are often poorly worded and most of the time you will never find out what the right answer is. He is incredibly unorganized. If I could do it again there is no way I would take this class.

Very poor lecturer, some of the information he gives is incorrect. Frequently asks TopHat questions, which more often then not, do not have the correct answer because of his typos. Often rambles about something and does a poor job explaining both concepts and relevant information.
He's terrible. Boring lectures and goes through notes as if you already know the material. Don't take his class.

Ryan is nice and laid back but he is also quite stubborn and unwilling to listen to any concerns raised about grades. The bio dept. has a system for lodging complaints but he is resistant to any kind of discussion about grades;as if he is taking it personally.Very disappointing coming from a dept. that prides itself in being systematic and logical.
Good TA.  Laid back and casual which is good when your lab is nearly 4 hours long.  Very willing to help out if you need it.  Ask him about spiders :)
Dr. F was very passionate about the knowledge in this class, but lectures could get boring at times. Almost half of the points came from in-class activities so be wary of that.

The materials in this class are easy. Dr. F is a decent lecturer but he is willing to go above and beyond to help students.  There are many assignments that can easy boost your grade. I got around B- on his first exam but still ended up with an A in the class. Must go to lecture! Assignments are done in lecture.
The class is not to difficult but he is not very clear what was going to be on exams.

Dr. Freudenstein is a pretty good professor. He loves orchids and always makes a mention of them, it's pretty cute how much he adores them. Very knowledgeable and approachable, fair exam questions, if somewhat picky. Being in class was absolutely essential, stay engaged and it's easy to do well. No textbook but readings are required.
I LOVE HIM HE IS THE CUTEST BOTANIST IN THE WORLD. LIKE, I CAN'T EVEN
The class is split between him and mark seeger. Seeger is terrible. Freudenstein was pretty good. Class was mandatory because there was a lgs form due pretty much every class. Good not great.
Very nice and friendly however she was a very tough grader on everything. We rarely ever did recitation and instead she would lecture about the lab for nearly an hour each time.

Dr. Hood is a nice person, but okay professor. There were tons of technical issues and syllabus changes throughout the whole semester. Also, he claimed to be open to receiving challenges for exam regrades, but failed to actually accept them. Also, his exam format is very strange and he himself even seems to be confused about the material on it!

Dr. Hood has a wonderful personality and he keeps his lectures engaging. This class was out of 1000 points and his midterm and final exam were very straight forward. He is very easy to get in contact with if you need him outside of class. He cares about his students and the content of this course. I would 100% take another class with Dr. Hood.
Lectures are long but not heavy. Things are explained pretty well.
Dr. Hood is a genuinely nice guy. He is pretty straight forward on what he expects from you which is nice. Overall, I enjoyed the class.

I really hope this was his first time teaching this class, because it really seemed like he didn't know what he was doing. Unorganized and unnecessarily hard and a large amount of work for 2 credits. The homeworks are super long and take forever. There is one partner presentation which isn't so bad, but attendance is mandatory for each presentation

I don't know why this guy even bothers recording lectures and posting them or holding class if hes just going to either use other peoples powerpoints or copy and paste google searches right onto a presentation. So dry and extremely uninformative. His exams are so unfair compared to his awful lectures.

If you don't review the slides and participate in discussions, the material won't make sense. The quizzes through the semester weren't very difficult and related to the material discussed for that week, however they don't prepare you much for the final. The recitation with this class was the worst I've ever had and had unrealistic expectations.

In his video lectures, he talked too much about his research. His slides had good information however. His questions on exams were horrible and he wanted very odd details in his answers. He was also an anti-religious elitist. He also claimed to be a much better person to the students when he substituted my recitation section.

Dr. Carstens is a nice guy and throughly explains his teachings but over all this class was awful. lecture slides and carmen content always had technical issues, labs were unorganized and pointless, and plenty of busy work on top of their text heavy lecture videos. Exams were near impossible that were too specific and had lots of grammar mistakes.

Dr. Carstens is a nice guy but I did not like him as a professor. His slides are text heavy and hard to decipher. He flies by his slides during lectures so you can hardly make sense of the material. The exams test only memory of very minute details from various case studies from his messy slides. Luckily, he only teaches this class for a semester

I really enjoyed his class, I found the lectures interesting and the midterms were fair. The lab practicals were difficult due to the sheer amount of information, but I found flashcards helped with that.

It's really interesting and he clearly cares about teaching. In class there are just activities based on the online lectures he posts to youtube. The labs aren't hard, but the lab practicals are somewhat difficult just because of all the animals you have to memorize. This class should be 3 credit hours instead of 2, there is so much information.

For 3310H.  It was hands down my favorite class at OSU. Concepts were taught through pertinent, recent research papers and were discussed daily.  The class hard but was manageable if you actually put an effort into reading papers.  Carstens was eager to help and made the class awesome.  I left the class with a new lens to learn through.

Pretty clear in lectures, taught well & covered material at the right pace. However, his tests were impossible, the first midterm was so poorly formatted it was a disaster, bad enough he offered a retake (there's no curve).

One of the worst lecturers I've had throughout my four years at OSU. Teaches purely at a graduate student level, which is rough for undergrads, especially those with a major outside the college that are required to take the course. He also does not know how to write exams. Questions don't test knowledge, they test memorization of details.

Dr. Johnson was very passionate about what he was teaching. He did not expect you to become an expert in the field and just wants his students to take home information they did not know before. There are in class quizzes occasionally but if you attend lecture you will do well on those and the final.

Dr. Johnson is very passionate about what he teaches and doesn't expect you to be an expert when you finish the course. As long as you pay somewhat attention in lectures you will do fine on the in class assignments. The textbook for the course is written by him and kind of expensive but it is very informative and covers the lectures in extra detail

Dr. Johnson! I love this guy. He is such a sweetheart. I can confirm all the better reviews this man got and deserved on this site. He wrote his own book for the class, and while expensive, it is full of information that he covers in class. Really wants people to learn and is extremely passionate about the poor babies affected by malaria. Love him

Dr. Johnson was a caring professor. But, 1) The course structure is confusing. 2) Lectures are boring, and go into too much detail. I think the course needs to be modified to not be specific. Dr. Johnson/Dr. Chordas only focused on microbio of disease/insects, and I wish the class went into topics that majors other than pre-med can have interest in

Norman teaches alongside Roman Lanno and they are both great professors. Very positive and calm atmosphere in the classroom. Willing to answer questions but also pushes you to think. Super refreshing to have a class like this especially since we are still in a pandemic.

The worst professor I have ever had. In addition to the test, students were assigned to write two essay questions. The instructions were not clear, and the rubric was vague. All students got a low grade. They refused to curve and regrade. The class was waste of money and time. The grading system was unfair.
Amazing and passionate professor he taught the Malaria module, and the end of his last lecture he donated $250 to Against Malaria Foundation on behalf of the class. Class act

Prof Fisk is one of the most passionate and interesting professors I have ever taken a course from at OSU. He TRULY cares about the things that he is teaching and just wants to share his passion with you. At times the lectures are a little boring, as they are in all classes but his love for the course is what makes it enjoyable. I enjoyed the class

Amazing professor!! He's the most passionate and caring professor I've ever had! He really cares about his students and his lectures are very interesting and make you look at biology from a whole new perspective! He is endlessly knowledgeable and is very reasonable with assignments and exams!! Outstanding!!!

Liked his module more--very kind guy. Gives final essay questions ahead of time; for the short answer part you just have to pay attention in lecture. Wants people to do well. Engages students in discussion more than Module I.

Lectures are boring but points are easy to get. Clearly lays out what you need to do for his half of the class. Gives the exam essays ahead of time, short answer is easy if you were in class with a pulse.
Very interesting class. Dr. Johnson is a great guy and an interactive lecturer.
Awesome guy, and clear cut lecturer.

Dr. Johnson was awesome for the Malaria module in Bio 3401. His test was clear cut and to the point. If you go to lecture, do the reading, and review his powerpoints... you should be able to get an A. Plus, he's a nice guy and more than willing to meet outside of class for any questions.
Dr. Johnson taught our first Module on malaria. He was an excellent lecturer and an overall awesome guy!
Great guy, good lecturer

I think that the way Dr. Hamilton has set up this course needs to be changed. The grading system is extremely confusing and is nothing like how a typical class would get graded. Also, his quizzes and exams feature too many "one or more of the following may be true" options and extremely wordy questions.

Dr. Hamilton is very passionate about what he teaches. The way he teaches the material is sometimes vague and unclear, and this can bleed into his tests as well. However he's very open to feedback and is very willing to help his students. Overall great guy. While the lecture material may have been a lot, the course was interesting enough to suffice

Dr. Hamilton is definitely passionate and well-versed in the subject matter. The lectures could sometimes get quite boring, but he is excellent at answering questions if you are ever lost. Wouldn't call this class an easy A, a lot of people seemed to struggle with his exams & quizzes and there is a semester-long project to watch out for.

Dr. Hamilton was clearly passionate about the field. His exams were fair. Paying attention in class was important as much of the material was examples. His lectures and material are clear to understand.

Dr. Hamilton was extremely knowledgeable, but the course got boring at times if you are not overly interested in the material. Attending lecture is a must due to the detailed examples and attendance points. Exams and quizzes were fair, but definitely stay on top of the semester-long observation project! I wouldnt call this class an easy A.

Dr. Hamilton was very kind and really seemed interested in his subject and our learning. I enjoyed the lectures, but I know a few students who have taken other EEOB courses (evolution, ecology) that were bored by them. Exams were not too difficult, as long as you gave at least a glance at the notes, but watch out for the semester-long project.

Hamilton taught the 1st half of the course. His exam was very fair (cheat sheet provided). Not much need for book for his exam. He even posted many practice problems beforehand. Show up to recitation and you will be fine. Lectures posted on Carmen. He is not the least bit entertaining though.

His midterm was very tough got a 65% on it but with all the other homework (easy) and recitation and clicker points still ending with a solid grade. He was a great professor though, very knowledgeable.

Nice Guy. I don't know why so many people are complaining about him. Yes his exams are challenging even with a cheat sheet but he's making sure you understand concepts thoroughly and can apply them. Also, USE YOUR TA's. If you put in the effort, you'll be fine.
The most boring professor I've ever had.. Homework is useless. The class was way harder than it should have beem

Dr. Hamilton is a very knowledgeable professor. He should NOT be teaching at the undergraduate level. He has a very hard time explaining concepts to an undergraduate audience. His tests are very difficult and purposefully worded to trip-up students. He's persnickety to the nth degree.  AVOID HIM if you can.

Dr. Hamilton is a solid professor that gets a bad rap. He is a genius and sometimes has a hard time figuring out how to get his thoughts out in an under stable manner for the class. He is a very nice guy that tries hard to make changes based on student's opinions.
He was honestly one of the worst professors I've ever had, and I'm usually easy on reviewing professors. He was terribly boring and lectures were useless, but required because of clicker questions.

I learned alot in this class... Lectures were long but he made good use of clickers to break it up and make you apply what you were learning. Clickers also counted as attendance. I found this class very interesting though i am a zoology major... Tests were difficult and had 3 hw assignments and 2 papers

Honestly why is everyone hating on this guy?  I have found this class to be pretty easy and I am by no means a good student.  Fair grading, and use of clicker questions requires to go to class but all of the questions for the midterm come from lecture.  Tons of easy points such as clicker points, recitation etc.  Can be boring but overall good.

Honestly, the class could have been a lot easier than he made it. The midterm was unnecessarily diffucult, not because of the content, but because of the ways he worded the question. He's not as enthusiastic as he could be, which could make the class more interesting. I really hope he looks on this website so he can change his teaching style!
AVOID HIM at all costs. He speaks so slowly it is impossible to stay awake.  This class is a TON of work. He constantly contradicts himself and instructions are very unclear. Grading is harsh.

Very very boring professor. He speaks in monotone and you will fall asleep at some point during the course. He has pop quizzes once a week in lecture making it mandatory to go. He does give a break at the half way point, but most people end up leaving. You don't need to buy the text book at all. Do not take this class with him.
Very well organized, but the exams were the hardest I've ever taken for a biological science course. I felt like I was simply memorizing information rather than gaining anything useful.

The class isn't hard, but he insists on mandatory attendance for everything.  You miss one recitation, you lose points.  He has quizzes on unannounced days (though you know there is one every week) so you can't just skip class.  Tons of people leave as soon as they take the quiz.  You will definitely hate this class.

Hamilton is the worst prof. I have had at OSU. He is boring and monotonous and he never shows any emotion. His posts very basic notes online, and then shows them while he talks in lecture. There are "pop" quizzes in lecture, so that you have to go, and there are to many homework assignments. Take the class with Meg Daly if you can, avoid Hamilton.

It was a pretty easy class, BUT... Hamilton is THE most BORING lecturer on the face of the earth.  Caution: You WILL fall asleep. You WILL leave class early when possible and you WILL hate this class if you take Hamilton.  If anyone else is available, take them. He has pop quizzes in lecture, which sucks because it makes yohave to attend sometimes.

This class is poorly designed but easily passed. The lecture videos must be watched before class, but none of the videos were recorded by the professors. Extra credit was offered for lecture participation but imo it wasn't worth it. The weekly exams are open note but covered material that we didn't go over. The lab section is entirely useless.

disorganized lecture 
never reply email 
lecture = read ppt
ask question = I'm not sure
last EEOB grade depends on SELF STUDY & TA
Absolutely ridiculous... be prepared to teach yourself

Dr. Sabree was a very nice person who cared a lot about us as students but not the greatest professor. Content was communicated through long, disorganized lecture videos from other professors; weekly online exams often had material not covered in lecture videos. Definitely shows passion for the course material, but does so in a disorganized course.

Professor Sabree's lectures were just a summary of lecture videos we were required to watch before class. He didn't put effort into teaching the class material & instead chose to use recorded lectures of other professors instead. They were long and too many. It was ridiculous how much he expected us to do outside of lecture.

NEVER ANSWERS EMAILS! No one in class seem to be able to get hold of him! if you have questions after assigned lecture time it will never be answered! Structure of the course is so confusing. you have to watch videos by other professors that are boring, and the actual tests has nothing to do with lectures you watch! Material itself is not hard.

The class was setup in a weird way where the actual lecturers only give the lecture once a week you need to watch several videos from other professors every week. I just didn't like this setup at all and it did not interest me since a lot of the videos were boring. The professor himself was completely fine. Some of the exams had strange questions.

The class itself wasn't bad but the lecturing was mediocre. Lecture notes aren't made to be studied & things were often disorganized. I feel like your experience is entirely dependent on having a good TA (Which I luckily did!). That being said, the content is easy to grasp and it's very possible to get an A! TA's will be your lifeline!

Dr. Sabree is hilarious. The lectures were very entertaining. My only problem was with the structure of the course which caused a lot of unnecessary confusion and stress. Very TA dependent, so having a good TA is super important. Weekly exams were a little unpredictable, but overall pretty easy and 2 got dropped. Pretty easy course.

Honestly the class was just absolutely stupid. I learned nothing new from Bio1114 and the innovation project in the class was the first time they have done it. They had high expectation for the first time doing it and it stressed a lot of people out. Not very organized or good at communicating. Not a bad dude, just a bad prof. Would not take again.

The tests are very difficult. All lectures are online but through some Carmen based site so they rarely worked for me. Recitation helps a lot and he often gave graded in class assignments which could be done at home most of the time. Its better not to skip, but most can be done if you do.

This class is not bad at all. It is disorganized, but once you get used to the flow its easy. I stopped going to class until there started in class assignments (with easy extra credit!) which wasn't bad and a grade booster. i did not watch a single lecture video, and studied minimally and got a B+. Exam averages are 75%-80% and you get to drop one!

Zakee is not a bad guy but he is an absolute mess of a professor. The format of the lectures changed with each midterm, and he refused to take student feedback on the format of the class. Would not take again.

The class itself (Evolution) is HORRIBLE. Do not take this class. Dr. Sabree is one of like 6 professors so it doesn't matter how good he is individually. He is an easy grader for module responses. However, tests are unnecessarily specific and lectures take FOREVER because this is a flipped classroom. I would not recommend this class to anyone.

Dr. Sabree is a very charming professor. His jokes are probably the best out of the other professors I've had. His lectures are great, and he explains things very thoroughly. His exams are a little on the unpredictable side, and some questions can be confusing, but they're very doable. He's the most millennial middle-aged man I've ever met

Dr sabree is a cool guy. He has lots of extra credits in his class, but his teaching method is not great. Reads off from slides. If you miss class it doesn't really affect you much but has 14 pop quizzes which are online so if you miss you can do it at home but it has to be done during class tIme. EXAMS ARE HARD. Be ready to learn by or avoid him.

BUGS AND MICROORGANISMS GALORE. Dr. Sabree is (a cool dude in a loose mood) very intelligent but his teaching style is lacking. He'll teach his own material and expects you to read from the book separately. Exams are very difficult and don't always make sense and there are 14 "pop quizzes." You definitely need to do a lot of studying on your own.

Dr. Sabree is a super cool dude. He is very open about what is going to be on the exams and he even lets the students submit questions that he will then put a percentage of those questions on the exam. He doesn't try to trick you, and is straight forward in his teaching. His classes are very interesting and I would definitely take him again.

Worst class taken at OSU.  Pop quizzes randomly throughout semester, and they are really tough.  You will have no idea what will be on exams.  Exam questions are so unclear it is unreal.  Recitations are an enormous waste of time, but they are mandatory.  Avoid this professor AT ALL COSTS.

He goes up to 2 chapters/week. You have to know *everything* in the chapter readings (basically the entire book),  material from lecture (a lot of it is independent from book material), and material in recitation (scientific papers you need to study). He doesn't explain what you should be studying. Smart but not good at teaching, unfortunately.

Sabree is one cool professor. He is truly interested in the students success, took me to grab coffee to discuss the class lecturesmy future professional plans. The lectures are straight forward, just ask if you're confused about something.

Teaches the second half of the class, exam 3 and the final (not cumulative).  We could drop 1 of the 4 exams, I dropped the final even with failing exam 1.  So many points, just do the work and you'll be fine.  He takes his notes right from the book, and it explains it a lot more clearly.  His exam 3 was straightforward, a few tricks but not bad

Don't be fooled by his outgoing personality and comedic skill. Dr. Sabree gave very little direction on what to expect for his final. He told us 65% of the questions would be from the text and only 35% from the lecture. Good luck trying to figure out what to memorize. His questions came from a test bank. His slides were also not very clear.
Great professor, he was funny, and really knowledgeable on the subject. Had a great fashion sense.

Professor good is like 70 or so years old but he still is active. I had his intro to biology over the summer and for my first ever college class (as a sophomore in high school) it was not hard at all. Very fun to learn and he was very passionate, not too much studying and he hands out bolded notes what you need to know. Good prof talk to him

yes the class is difficult but if you show up, pay attention, and put in the work during lab time then you will succeed. the "text book" is a novel and the discussions are easy points. open note exams. recommend recording lectures. Slides are bare but the lecture is very informational. clear grading criteria and gives all the info needed for exams

The lectures are pretty interesting and Kevin is a great professor who truly cares about his students. Make sure you write down everything he says in class and take very very detailed notes. All of the questions on exams are straight from things he discusses in class. As well, draw detailed images in your notebook from various perspectives.

Kevin is a great professor and cares about each student's success in the course. The one thing I would say is to make sure to record every lecture. The take-home exams have a lot of questions that I would not have known without listening back to the recording. Take good notes and ask a ton of questions and you will be fine.

Really nice, reasonable guy, just make sure to write notes on anything and everything he says. Every quiz and assessment is open note, and there is no textbook, so if you miss something it's because you didn't write it down. He is more than willing to clarify and answer questions!
Took his course in part during the pandemic. Very caring and sweet person. Would absolutely love to learn from him again.

Kevin was a good professor and was very helpful in the specimen work. A lot of his test material was either briefly mentioned or not at all mentioned during lecture. However the last exam and final were much easier than the other exams.

Avoiding the fact that the class was online and the labs were in person this professor made his exams very inconsistent and he made Jeopardy and notebook checks for a grade rather than bonus. But dissecting animals was very interesting. Listen to professor's lectures, his lectures help out a lot.

He is a great guy, very kind, but he is not a great lecturer. The quizzes sometimes have questions that are based on random things that he does not mention in class, but he thinks you should just know them. Maybe a textbook would help. Practicals are fine for most part. I feel like the work I put in should receive an A. Quizzes weekly!

Dr. Lumney is extremely caring and EEOB 4510 is an amazing class. This was debatably my favorite science class at OSU. Make sure you enjoy taking notes and drawing. If you pay attention in class and take wonderful notes youll have minimal work outside of class.

Kevin is one of the best lecturers I've had at Ohio State. Exam questions can be specific but Kevin addresses them all directly in class. In opposition to what others have said, his questions DO NOT come out of the blue! Exams are open note- so take decent notes and draw good images for the practicals. This class should be a piece of cake!

Kevins class was great! I learned a TON and enjoyed the material. The exams are pretty tough; some questions come out of nowhere and the exams take about 2.5 hours to complete. You NEED to come to class in order to pass and you must take notes on literally every little thing he says in lecture. Overall, his class is tough but I learned SO much!

Kevin is a really nice and funny guy. His classes are cool- you get to dissect things, but the exams are extremely difficult. Timed practicals and extremely specific. If you SPELL something wrong you get the ENTIRE question wrong. No curve, and attendance is mandatory- you definitely can't miss more than the number allowed.

To get an A in this course, you have to write down everything he says in lecture. I mean absolutely everything. If you do and you have good organization skills and handwriting, the class should be a piece of cake. Format is open note, but questions can seem to come out of nowhere because it's difficult to anticipate what is important in lecture.

Kevin is great, he communicates everything super clearly and lets you use your notebook on the lab practical and written exams. As long as you go to class, listen to lectures, and draw really clear diagrams you should be good. He tells you to get 2 books but you really only need the lab manual for dissections, he goes over the content in lecture.

As people have said, the questions on his exam come out of nowhere! Even if you write down every single thing he says during lecture, you can still do bad on the exam. So to ace this class, get the old exams from the previous semesters! He reuses most of the old questions and that's the only way it's possible to get an A in this class.

I found this class challenging. Lecture exams counted for the majority of the overall grade so make sure you do the best you can. I made sure I had quality notes and I studied really hard for every exam but was still only getting C's on them. Pay attention & ask questions when you don't understand something right away. Doesn't curve the class.

I hesitated with tests are tough and tough grader. Tough grading could be my TA, but written portion of exams depends heavily on what he says during lectures and his slides are bare. Since the class is combined lec & lab, you have to show up anyway for dissections. Kevin is super nice and class is relaxed.

I LOVED the class. There is a lot of hands-on work that is very helpful. However, the exams were so out of nowhere. Even when I took really good notes during lecture & studied a good amount of time, I always ended up getting C's in the exams (which are about 3 hrs long). The way the exams are designed, it was nearly impossible to do excellent.

Kevin is a great teacher and a great guy. There is a quiz each week, which can be kinda tough because they're based both on lecture(which can be long, boring and hard to pay attention to) and readings (also long and boring). Lab is fun and lab practicals are open note. Overall a pretty interesting class if you are interested in this kind of stuff.

Really nice guy. Pay attention in lecture and write good notes because exams will ask about the smallest detail he mentioned once. He does take attendance, in both lab and lecture and grades you on it. Be sure to check out his youtube videos of his tin flute performances.
I absolutely loved this class and Dr. Lumney. He cracks not so funny jokes but he's too adorable not to laugh at him. Probably my favorite teacher I have had while at Ohio State.

Very helpful, wants you to do well. He is very good at explaining things in lab. You get to dissect so cool stuff. Let's you use your lab journal for the practicals so you can write everything you will need. In-class tests are somewhat challenging but you can use a cheat sheet. Takes attendance for lab & lecture but we usually got out early.

Very nice guy. Explains things clearly once you are actually dissecting. Tests only things you have seen or things you have read from lab book. Practicals are hard, but a dichotomous key was allowed on the second, which made it a breeze. Not a lot of effort required, and I would def recommend him for this class!

Great teacher, very helpful. He is very knowledgeable on the subject and is willing to give any help you need. The exams make up 75% of your grade. They are not necessarily hard, but require a fair amount of studying.
Kevin is a nice guy and is willing to help during class. However, his tests are pretty hard. For the first practical, the average was in the 60s, but he still refused to curve or normalize it at all.
great

This is not that difficult of a class. Seriously, I went to only half of the classes (attendance is not required) and I achieved a B. The class has is digitally recorded and is uploaded to iTunes. Don't get me wrong this class is hands on and a couple of open labs will help on exams. 2 Exams and 1 quiz total 240 pts and is your grade. No curve!

interesting. didactic portion really clear, but kevin has a hard time teaching the dissections. his instructions were pretty confusing that even the ta was clueless. his expectations are pretty clear. not enough time in class if you want an A so come in during open lab hours. i should've done that.
I loved Kevin! He was really clear and helpful, but the class requires a lot of studying. It should be worth more than 2 credit hours!
Very good teacher.  He should be teaching the lectures because he is quite knowledgeable and effective.  The department should make it a 3 credit hour class though.
I agree! I had him and he very nice and helpfull. However, the course is way way way to diffucult for a 2 credit hour.
Tried to make this class as interesting as possible. Willing to help students out. Takes attendance in class. Very straight forward. He is a nice guy.

This class was so intense for just 2 credit hours.  I found myself studying more for it than my other three 5 hour credit courses!  However it's not Kevin's fault, he's a great instructor.  He's very clear and extremely knowledgeable.  I would take a class from him again if I could.
This class was waaaay to intense for a class that meets once a week for ten weeks. The amount of material for this 2 credit hour class was insane, as was what we were expected to know.

My experience was pleasant. This course set up like a university writing class. The entire semester is writing assignments about drugs. The final project is a 5-8 double-spaced argumentative paper. Grading isn't strict. Write an even half-way competent homework that covers the rubric and turn it in on time and you will get a 100% on the assignment.

Literally the worst professor I have ever had. My full review is too long to post so i'll save you time and tell you to just avoid her at all costs. I thought the reviews would be dramatic and it'd be fine, IT'S NOT FINE. Save urself and don't take it with her.

Lots of busy work. Flipped classroom style of teaching. Midterm is one of those “choose the best answer” types and you're not allowed to go back and change your answer once you've passed a question. Grades harsh and takes off points for a lot of things it's as if the goal was to make sure you don't get 100%.

Her module is a flipped classroom, basically a hybrid format. However, be prepared to learn the lecture videos on your own bc she won't go over them in class. She likes to spend the whole class period explaining the HW assignment instead of going over the lectures. A LOT of papers that irrelevant to the exam. Take it with another prof if you can.

Gives hours worth of work outside of class and then ramble in lecture about nothing related to material. Spends 20min going over material and 60 min rambling about "explaining" the concepts. We are in college and are able to read and follow directions. Only cares about her ants. EX: had no idea we were in the National Championship this past week.
She is the worst. So annoying. A million assignments a week. Thinks her class is the only class anyone could possibly be taking during the semester.

This professor is amazing. She is super nice and understanding. There was a lot of work to be completed in this professors class, but it is not for a lot of points and if you finish the assignments assigned through out the course, you are likely to get a good grade.

Dr. Adams is very passionate about ants. The class itself seemed disorganized at times and this was especially true for the carmen canvas page. It was sometimes hard to find assignments or see when things were due.This class wasn't so difficult, but more just a lot of work and preparation. It would definitely be more appealing to entomology majors.

This was the worst GE I have ever taken. I signed up because of the name, but I don't think anyone knew that this class was about ants. Unless you are an entomology major or have an interest in insects/ants, you won't enjoy this class. She wasn't helpful at all, her instructions were never clear and she was super condescending. Avoid this class!!

In the most respectful way, I would never take this Professor again. For a GE this class was extremely strenuous and demanding. I feel as though there were a few moment of unfairness most of them being the instructor saying one thing then doing another. Save your time and energy, pick a different GE that meets the requirement.

Class was advertised as biodiversity but was entirely about ants. The professor was disorganized and condescending, often patronizing students about tech she couldn't even use herself. Deserted projects were due abruptly during finals week. As a pre-med, time wasted. By mid-semester, students were disengaged. Avoid if you value your sanity.
So disorganized, gives 8 credit hours worth of work for a 4 credit hour class. Do not take EEOB 2260
Worst and most unorganized class I've ever taken.
Terribly unorganized, expects you to an ungodly amount of work for a GE. Do not take EEOB2260 is it the worst class I've ever taken.

Makes a GE class, then proceeds to grade projects expecting high level work. Grades very strictly, class is unengaging and mundane. Most unorganized professor I've ever had the displeasure of taken the class of.

Do not take EEOB2260 unless you are an entomology major with previous experience.

Dr. Adams seemed disorganized and this class made me question the relevance to my major (Biology). She lectures on ants for 8 weeks but it is a flipped classroom so you don't really learn anything and lectures were hard to bear. Midterm was extremely hard and you couldn't check your answers.

Bio3401 made me wish I dropped my bio major and ran for the hills to any other major. The class has almost nothing to do with biology and is just a series of writing assignments that take a lot of work and have unclear expectations. Dr. Adam's exam was super confusing and the TA's grade so hard you'd think they got fired for handing out 100s.

If you have the option, avoid taking her. Not organized & you have some sort of writing assignment due every week. Flipped classroom for lectures. She BARELY goes over lecture material in class,so you are not getting set up for the exam, it's awful. "Best answer" and you can't go back to change your answer after you submit next on a question.

Great professor, excited to engage with students and participation. Material isn't too hard, flipped classroom but only attend one day a week. Recorded lectures were very precise with information you needed.

She's a very nice person but the way the class was set up was so overwhelming. Too much busy work and TA's and graders were really tough on assignments that really should have been easy points. Expectations for assignments aren't spelled out clearly too. Lectures are hard to pay attention to, partially due to them being an hour and 20 minutes.

This class is very boring and, for the most part, useless. However, Dr. Adams did a good job at making the material somewhat interesting. I am giving her such a high rating because her section of the class was extremely easy. You don't even have to show up to lecture (just watch the videos she posts online) and keep up with the busywork assignments

Dr. Adams is an amazing and well-respected researcher who really cares about her students in Biology 3401. She was in tune with students and adapted where necessary. There was a lot of material communicated in confusing ways in long out-of-class lecture videos and her exam is very tough. Understand everything thoroughly. Lots of small assignments.

This course was easily one of the worst courses I have taken as a graduating senior. The layout of her module was unorganized and there were too many unrelated assignments to focus on actual class material. The flipped class format does not work. The exam was all "what is the MOST correct" questions. I would literally take anyone else.

If you can avoid having Dr. Adams do it. Her lectures were all over the place and the organization was all over the place. We had too many pointless group assignments and papers that didn't really pertain to the class. While I think Dr. Adams is a really nice person, the structure of her class was god awful. Stressful for no reason.

Dr. Adams' lectures were some of the most disorganized I've ever seen. Her slides followed no logical order and she basically read directly off of them. There are also multiple papers that do not have anything to do with "integrated biology," which is what the class is supposed to be about. If you can avoid it, do NOT take this class with her.

The professor is nice but her slides are disorganized. Lots of slides are posted per lecture (upto 90) and are difficult to navigate through as the topics are not organized properly. The class also has a lot of papers to do & presentations. The paper topics are often irrelevant to the real world application. Be prepared to get bored & frustated.

Only taught half of the semester, so having her wasn't terrible. Lecture slides are terribly unorganized and confusing, so it's your job to sort through the info. Despite that, her test wasn't too hard. Fair warning, this class has a lot of recitation/in-class assignments, which you don't want to slack off on!

She's nice but her lecture slides are awful and very unorganized. She'll post 100+ slides but only go through 40-50 of them. Her in class assignments are pretty easy but her exam was pretty confusing and it dropped my grade by a lot. Not the worst, but definitely not the best.

Dr. Sarah Rose is the worst TA I've ever had. These other reviews are completely spot on. She is the toughest grader I have ever seen, and it seems like she takes off points for no reason. She is the toughest grader I have ever had, and she also takes weeks to grade assignments. Take anyone else.
Worst TA ever had, find someone else in SchedulePlanner

I took her at CSCC, not OSU, but I can't find her for CSCC.

I wanted to be charitable to her because I did like her, but she sent a dispute over me having a meltdown after intentionally antagonizing me (I'm autistic, FYI) and now I can't start my classes on time. She had ample time to tell me this but she didn't. She wasn't even mad at me. Insane.
Actually the worst TA I've ever had in my life

The other ratings here are not dramatic or exaggerated whatsoever. She is very condescending and rude towards her students to the point that it is cruel. The lecture portion of this class is incredible but the recitation… specifically HER recitation sections… worst experience I've ever had. She is the SOLE reason I do not have an A in this class.
She was the harshest grader the first half of semester. Once Donald Trump was elected she became much more enjoyable. It seems there is a positive correlation between his election and her happiness.

Avoid any class with this teacher, the work that she makes you do in recitation is tougher than the course itself. It's tougher than an ochem lab. Any example that you will try to use she turns down immediately.
She is the only thing wrong with this integrated biology class. Grades harder than anyone I ever met.

I haven't met a single person who had anything good to say about this TA. I hope she sees all these bad reviews and decides to change herself, because never in my life have I had a "teacher" (I put teacher in quotes bc she doesn't teach) this bad. I genuinely think she's heartless the way she's tanking everyone's grades...

She is exactly who Steve Chordas talked down upon. He said he hated how scientists are so brutal when peer reviewing articles and she grades every assignment like you are submitting a paper to the world. Girl we are not scientists nor are we actually that interested in what you have to say because this is just a biology class we are forced to take.

I would rather take 10 Baldwin classes than have this TA. She takes points off just so you do not get a 100, and her comments are harsh. "Go to the writing center" even when your writing is eloquent. I got over a 100 on the exam and yet the rec weighs my grade down so much.
She grades extremely hard.

Takes points off like her life depends on it. No matter how much effort you put into something, it won't be enough for her standards, which I'm pretty sure she makes up as she grades. I've lost all hope in this class and it is 100% because of her.

Easily the worst TA I have ever had. It does not matter how hard you work on your projects and papers, you're getting a B at the absolute best. You can follow the rubric to a T and she will find ways to take points off for the most random thing. It does not matter how many times you ask for help, you will lose points, always.

Do not take this professor ever. The worst recitation instructor I've ever had. I can't believe how awful she is at grading. She will just take points off for fun. Doesn't care about how much effort and time you put into assignments. No constructive feedback. She just wants you to fail. I'm not sure how she still has this job.

This has got to be the worst TA I've ever had. I wanted to give her the benefit of the doubt for a long time, assuming that the profs want the recitation to be hard but this girl is just actually insane. she wants you to fail, and she would give you a zero if she could.

Sarah Rose is the worst TA I've had in my life. She's extremely nit-picky and makes up nonsense reasons to take points away on assignments. Sometimes it seems like she takes away points just because she can. Nothing is ever good enough for her and she turns a very easy class into an impossible one. Avoid at all costs.

She grades harder than any other professor/TA I have ever met. Even Dr. Chordas was trying to get her out of this position because of how many complaints he's been getting about her. Some of these ratings about her are extremely mean, but couldn't be more true. Don't take her. Just don't.

doesn't help or care no matter the situation. It might be a power trip or something, but I've never seen a worse grader in my life. She'll take off points if you breathe too hard lol. I hope she reads this and considers a different career so she doesn't make any more people suicidal.

You have to give her credit. You have to be pretty creative to come up with the things she takes off points for. Some of the stuff is just unheard of. She also has some thick skin too to be able to deny helping people constantly. Even the professors don't know what to do with her with the amount of complaints they have been getting about her.

If I could go back in time and change one thing in my life, it would be picking a different major than bio so that I wouldn't risk having to be in the same recitation section as her. The lecture was great by the way. But I seriously do not know how she is leading a recitation and whoever qualified her to do so needs to be investigated IMMEDIATELY.

Where do I even start... I don't know what's worse, her lack of clear instructions, or the fact that she never helps. Just do yourself a favor and get as far away as possible from her as possible. Terrible. Just terrible. My recitation group took a poll on if anyone had anything good to say about her, and not a single one of us did lol. anyway...
extremely rude and degrading in the way she speaks to her students. has grades set up so you can loose more points than you can earn.

Sarah Rose is the worst TA I have ever had in my life. She prides herself on grading harshly, so much so that she even told us that "higher ups" told her to loosen up. She is not approachable and is often rude to students asking for clarification on assignments. Assignments seemed to be graded on opinion rather than by the actual rubric.
She was passionate about the material. The exams were very application-based, making studying for exams much more challenging. Top hat was a pretty big chunk of the final grade.

Sarah Ball does not set her students up for success. Like many others have stated, there is absolutely nothing wrong with hard exams but many questions have no correlation to what she teaches in class. On top of that she will not provide practice exams that will somewhat prepare you for the actual thing. There needs to be a change on her end.

She is the WORST! I have emailed her numerous times asking what I can do to receive a good grade on an exam, she told me that it was my studying habits that were the problem, not her teaching. She will never release practice tests or the previous exams. If I could give her a zero I would. Whatever you do, do NOT take her class!!

Bad professor. The first exam average was a low D for my class. She has practice exams, but even after that bad exam, she won't give us those practice exams because "we aren't studying hard enough." However, the book and study material she gave us were nowhere near the difficulty of the exam, and we don't know what to study.

Overall, she is a good lecturer, but she is very inconsiderate of her students schedules. She will not allow you to receive extra time on her assignments, if they are due on the date of your exam. Even if asked for an extension at 11:59, she will decline your offer and you will still have to submit your assignment at the start of your Biology Lab.

worst professor I have had in my three years. lectures BARELY relate to the exams. exams themselves were AWFUL. nothing wrong with difficult exams, but hers were confusing and abnormal for a basic biology course.not inspirational whatsoever. lectures are awful, she is a bit unbearable. If you could have ANY other professor....CHOOSE THEM!!!

She has a passion for the subject but the exams were extremely difficult. I studied the slides and dynamic study modules but most of the material that was on exams aren't discussed in class so the exam are a hit or miss. I highly recommend you take a different Bio lecturer if you have the chance.

Dr. Ball is a good professor. She really knows what she is talking about. She explains topics clearly, manages her time well. However, she can make you feel a bit dumb when asking questions. The three exams are a bit difficult so you really have to know the topics. Lab final is cumulative, but lecture final is not.

She is a great professor. Had her for BIO1113 and if you attend lectures and do the Mastering, there is no reason you shouldn't do well in the class because a lot of concepts and questions come directly from those on exams. She is very receptive to feedback and very good lecturer. Her exams are only "hard" because they are very application based.

Even though the exams were very tough, the overall grade is points and not percentage so it's easy to recover. TopHat questions in lecture for attendance, but graded on participation and not correctness. Lab is a lot of group work and on large project. Dr. Ball is nice and is clear when explaining things in lecture.

Take this class if you want to crash out over a course! I spent all of my time taking this class just to score a 50% on every exam. As someone who spent lots of times studying her class was extremely difficult. I would never take her class or her exam.

If you took AP Bio in high school you will be more than fine with Ball. My lab really screwed me over. DO NOT TAKE SEA PHAGES LAB. It isn't necessarily hard but it is EXTREMELY TIME CONSUMING OUTSIDE OF CLASS. The real class itself was very straight forward and fine though. I started studying the day before every midterm and did fine.

Take this class if you hate yourself! This was easily one of the hardest classes i've taken. She often times goes too fast. Only thing that was good was she was passionate and loved talking about biology. Despite that, her exams were super duper difficult for an intro biology class. If you can take any other professor under biology 1113, do it.

Lecture pros/cons
-straight forward
-easy to understand :
-very dense
-speaks very slow (ended up watching lectures 2x speed)
-tophat attendance 

Exams are probably more difficult than other bio professors but despite what everyone says, they are not impossible to study for.Guarantee most complaints are from first year students w/ HS study habits

Exams aren't going to be simple multiple choice/memorization - neither are most  college STEM classes. Use Mastering as a main study tool - she pulls some questions word for word from them on exam. Put the work in as you would for a college class and you'll be good. SEA PHAGE lab is tough but just stay on top of it and ask for help if you need it.

She really does enjoy teaching, I do have to give her that, but this class was so incredibley challenging. For lectures she pretty much just read off slides and made tophat questions to go along. AVOID SEAPHAGES LAB AT ALL COSTS!! The lab work was so precise and graded SO strictly. Exams were so so so difficult. Don't take if possible!

Dr. Ball is very passionate about what she teaches and is obviously very knowledgable in the subject area.  She places a special emphasis on asking analytical and application-based questions on the exams.  Use the Mastering hw and the TopHat questions to review; these are often reflective of actual exam questions and prepare you to score well.

Like most, I struggled with her exams. I did everything she recommended and averaged terribly on them! I would avoid this course if you had the SEA Phages lab. It absolutely had nothing to do with lectures and the TA grading was harsh but Sarah Ball is very nice and passionate. I just wish with the work I put in there was something to show for it.

A lot of people say this professor is bad I would have to disagree. Exams can be tricky but if you go to lecture, study, and really put in the effort you'll do well. I honestly found the lab to be harder than the actual lecture for this class.

Sarah Ball makes exams WAYYYY too hard. as long as you do fine in everything else you will end the class with at least a B-. I got a 66%, 54%, and 51% on the three exams we took and ended the class with a B- just because I locked in for everything else. The exams are made very applicational and you don't learn half of it in lecture. Good luck.

A difficult course, but I feel that Dr. Ball does a good job at making lectures interesting and explains things well. I would try to avoid the SEA PHAGES lab if you do not want to be doing a lot of time-consuming things for lab, but the skills learned in this are beneficial. Ex) My friend had Dr. Ball and no SEA lab and had way less work.

Where do we begin. This class has been my most difficult experience at OSU. Small assignments are worth too much of your grade with homework graded for every question without room to learn, TopHat questions and NO study resources given. Very unhelpful and ambiguous teaching style, with impossible exams even if you study!! Do NOT take her class!!!!!
Tests were harder than they needed to be. If you have option to take a different professor, do it.

Exams are awful. Gives no study resources and even though she says "there are resources online" they are extremely unhelpful and time wasting and nothing like exams. Midway through the year she did give us a study guide, but it was not representative of the exam at all. She also has a terrible attitude and gives u sass when answering questions.

The exams are barely anything like what is taught in lecture and the questions on exams are way harder than the TopHat questions. Homework is graded by each attempt per question which makes it harder to use as a study tool especially when she doesn't really provide any other study materials.

Professor Ball is quite passionate about the subject, but her class can be a real challenge. Exams are notoriously difficult, so be sure to stay on top of the material and consider using resources like Unstuckstudy to help with study prep. Overall, a tough course, but manageable with dedication.

I loved Dr. Ball's class! Her lectures connect real-world applications to the material. Starts each day with a curiosity question and uses mini breaks to help us digest the content. Tests are tough, but with consistent study and office hours, you'll succeed. The lab, focused on phage therapy, builds valuable research skills. Highly recommend!

I really don't like the way Dr. Ball teaches. Her lectures consist of things that are not necessarily on the exam and her slides are pretty vague. She doesn't give you many study materials and when students asked for more she just made up excuses to not provide us with more resources. The tests are extremely detailed and difficult even w/ studying.

Take the bio with Dr. Ball if you can! She's very nice and take the phage lab if you can the trad lab is boring and lots of busy work. I had lots of fun taking phage lab with her the workload is okay plus the TA were very accessible outside of class. She also does extra credit!!
her lectures don't include 35% of the material that's on the exams

TopHat points in every class. The exams are way too hard for the level of class and the exam is designed to trick you. The lectures are mostly her rambling about things that are not included in any of our actual coursework.

Dr. Ball's lectures don't cover a lot of the material on exams. She posts slides with missing words which is annoying and doesn't post mastering homework on Carmen. Her exams are fair and not too hard but she literally gives you almost no resources to study. Lab is pretty annoying. Overall the class is pretty disorganized but it's not too hard.

Dr. Ball was very difficult and I did not like her. She used TopHat for attendance so you could have done it from home but you can't tell when she posts questions (these were graded for correctness). Hw was hard and confusing. She talks super fast and doesn't post filled in slideshows. Overall she was not good and if you can avoid her, do.

Dr. Ball is super nice and passionate about what she teaches but the exams and HW are so hard and she tests on the tiniest of details. Study EVERYTHING. SEA lab isn't as annoying or hard as people say and it's honestly SO helpful if you go on to take Microbiology. I liked her teaching style and her as a person, I just hated her exams.
Complex tests and heavy lab. Don't suggest anyone to take it.

Love this lady. Super passionate about what she teaches you can tell she thinks its the coolest thing in the world. Exams not too hard like people say. If you know the information, you can easily apply it. you just have to put time into knowing the information.
By far the worst professor I've ever had. She will say something 1 time and then have half an exam over that topic. She is very inconsistent with her material.

I recommend watching Lectures back again and take notes on the tiny things. those are what the exams mostly are about. Exams are VERY hard. Lecture is not mandatory, but top hat questions are used as participation points and only given in lecture. 20 points are dropped. She gives some extra credit, but don't rely on that. She's nice and passionate.

Try and take a different prof if you can. Lectures are kinda boring and masteringbio HW is annoyingly hard. The exams are so difficult and seem like they are designed to make you fail. Worse if you're in SEA-phages lab bc it has nothing to with the material taught in lecture.

She makes the test so unbelievable hard and basically impossible to do well in her course, she's rude and not helpful whatsoever. Absolutely take the other professor in Bio 1113 if possible to actually learn something. I've never heard anything good from even the TA's about her who have taken her class.

This class is almost 100% participation based. There is only 1 midterm and it is online and open note (and very easy). Dr. Ball explained how to use the DNA master application for the lab well, and made it very easy to succeed in the class. This class also includes a poster presentation at a real event, meaning it can be put on your resume.

I recommend opting different instructor for Bio 1113, mainly due to seaphages lab. This lab didn't align well with lecture, had a negative impact on my grade, a lot of work. While she delivered strong lectures, the application of knowledge to real-world scenarios were lacking, a concern given the exams focus on such issues. Exam class av.: 60-70s

She is not a respectful professor. She assigns 28 pages plus to read through over the weekend, grades everything for correctness, and doesn't take into account that you have other classes you have to also worry about.

DO NOT TAKE SEA-PHAGES LAB. WHATEVER YOU DO, DO NOT TAKE SEA-PHAGES LAB. YOU WILL ACTUALLY LOSE YOUR MIND FROM THE AMOUNT OF WORK YOU HAVE TO DO. PLEASE DONT MAKE THE MISTAKE I MADE. DO NOT TAKE SEA-PHAGES. 

In terms of lecture, meh its not that bad but lab is actually awful.

We only had her for half the semester. She was engaging and answered random curiosity questions at the beginning of each lecture. But it was definitely a class where you have to teach yourself a lot of the material on your own. Tophat questions during class.

Dr. Ball is unique in how she comes across as a genuinely kind and caring person who would rather teach to see the success of her students rather than boost her resume. Despite the content of the class being somewhat boring to me, Dr. Ball was able to use her good personality to engage students throughout her time teaching.

Pretty average teacher. Lectures are very boring as she talks pretty slow and was a struggle to pay attention through a 90 minute lecture. Her lab is different than the normal one and it is a lot more work. Exams are also pretty difficult averages were in the low 70s and 60s. Take the time to work and get all your homework done, you'll be fine.

Overall, Dr. Ball was a good teacher. Her lectures could be a bit boring, but it seemed she did care about the subject/her students. The exams weren't hard, just super content heavy. However, the SEA-PHAGES lab was so much unnecessary work. Discovering new phages was kinda cool, but the workload outside of class was a lot.

Dr. Ball's lectures were really interesting, and often tied in real life illnesses/events which helped me a lot. Her slides were also very useful and clearly outlined what she wanted us to know. However, the exams were very detailed oriented so make sure to study the slides well. She was also really helpful during office hours with any questions.

She lectures very well and is engaging with the audience, but her exams are over the smallest things she mentions so you need to pay attention. Not as bad as other bio profs, but lab is kinda stressful.

Would strongly recommend not to take solely because of her SEA-PHAGES lab. Much harder than the regular 1113.01 labs and completely unrelated to the class. It's honestly just a headache. Just take another professor and enjoy a better grade given much less work.
I enjoyed her lectures, for success in this class do the Pearson Concept Check questions because they appear on the exams always! Lab is sometimes a pain, but overall not bad would take again.

Do not take the Sea-Phages lab -- literally the worst lab you could take. She grades so harshly on small assignments worth like 3 points and treats this class like its worth more than 4 credits. Her tests are on the smallest things she mentions in the lecture so prepare for that. She also giggles when people get the top-hat questions wrong red flag

Dr. Ball always had clear and concise slides and I rewatched her lecture videos at a fast speed to study for tests. I never used the textbook and the class overall was not bad, definitely recommend her.
Not a very good professor. Compared to other professors, she makes her class unnecessarily difficult. Avoid.

Not as bad as people make it seem. Many people don't know how to study for her class but the best way I've found is to WATCH her lecture videos (Put it in 1.6x speed cuz she talks slowly) and take notes on all she says.  I never used the book, it was time waster and made things confusing but it could be helpful to some. Lab was a headache though.

Good professor, attendance is not mandatory but topHat questions in class are a part of your grade. Tests are pretty easy, lab requires a semester long group project but it id pretty easy and doesn't require much work. She posts lectures after class but no live zoom sessions.

I felt like she did a good job teaching honestly, her slides were always clear. BUT her tests are much more difficult than what she teaches. Also, the lecture isn't mandatory, but she does TopHat questions for participation in every single class and drops 20 questions at the end. The lab part of this class really was terrible too.

Dr. Ball's lectures were honestly a waste of my time. She reads directly off her slides, and when she isn't doing that, she is teaching her students irrelevant information that doesn't apply to the topics being learned.

While I liked this professor, her lectures were lengthy and sometimes unhelpful. Much of what she discusses is basic while the exams she gives are not. She doesn't put certain assignments in Carmen, which makes it extremely easy to miss them, while only offering up to 50% late credit. You will need to teach yourself a lot on your own time.

Going into the first test I was confident because I memorized the lecture slides. When the test came, a lot of the questions were on small details she would mention in class that were not on her lecture slides. I would make sure to pay attention to the small details she says and maybe rewatch her lecture videos in preparation for her exams.

Professor Ball cares about her students and wants everyone to get a good grade. She responds quickly to emails and is flexible with office hours to help her students. Tests are not too difficult as long as you pay attention during lecture and not many assignments outside of class besides lab assignments. Definteily recommend!!

If you get put in sea phages switch into regular lab ASAP. That is the only hard part about this class because it is unnecessarily difficult and doesn't relate to lecture at all and isnt on exam. Dr Ball is knowledgeable but does not have a lot of resources studying on your own off the notes is it (take good notes in class) - tophats every class

Dr. Ball was good, but not anything special. Her lectures could get very boring at times and became hard to pay attention. She has a ton of lab assignments that are graded very harshly and it felt nearly impossible to get a 100% on one of the assignments.
Nice but boring.

Lectures go slow and get pretty boring although she does try to make it interesting sometimes. Exams are relatively easy questions are very similar to tophat and mastering. If you have her as a lab instructor and/or are in the sea-phages lab good luck. She grades very strict and the lab has nothing to do with the lecture.
