An amazing lecturer who was very clear in what you needed to know. Tests are multiple choice but at the application level so some can be tricky. I felt like questions were always valued and she's a very approachable teacher. Highly recommend for biology 1113.

Overall professor Ball does a good job of lecturing and explaining material, but she gives way too many lab assignments and grades them very harshly. The mastering will really boost your grade so make sure to do that and the exams aren't bad if you understand the lectures. A lot of the exam. questions are straight off of mastering.

Professor Ball's lectures were overall good, however the lectures get extremely boring really fast. It is hard to sit through her lectures without falling asleep. The class grades are mostly based on mastering biology and midterms.

Dr. Ball is easily one of the worst professors I have had at Ohio State. Her lectures have absolutely nothing to do with exams, if you go to her for advice she will give you an unclear run-around answer, and is a terrible grader. SEA-Phages lab is a huge time commitment and doesn't relate to exams. She's a terrible professor and super confusing.

Please do not take bio 1113 with her. The lecture slides are too easy but the exam questions are extremely difficult. The SEA-PHAGES lab comes with a lot of assignments and it has nothing to do with the lecture. Sometimes she makes a bunch of assignments due in same week as the midterm so you do not even have enough time to review for the exam.

Do not take bio with her if you plan on doing extra work that goes beyond of the actual credit hours rewarded for completing this class. Her SEA PHAGES lab add on a lot of extra work for the same credit you'll receive by doing any basic bio lab. She grades ridiculously hard and will literally take off 0.25 for the worst things ever.

Ball is a good professor. Her class is structured very clearly, and if you do the practice problems, the exams are not too difficult. For my lab section, we had a virus group project that accounted for a fair bit of the lab grade. I enjoyed the questions she answered at the beginning of class, although her lectures can get dry at times.

she makes the subject sound so simple and attacks with HARD EXAMS that basically just pray for. UNLIKE CHEM, the exams were hard but if you study study you will do fine. However for bio- recipe to success: study. LUCK, PRAY, PRAY 

goes on and on and will add extra chapters and squeeze into exams if time left; teaches till even day before exam

If I didn't rewatch lectures, I would be completely lost in this class. Dr. Ball talks at a snail's speed to try to pay attention. Textbook can be useful but not necessary. Become friends with your TA and work hard in labs because they're most of your grade. Tests are similar to tophat application questions and if you are confused it will be hard.
Material taught in class is not what shows up on exams

There's not enough characters to explain how bad Dr. Ball is at teaching. Her slides are way too simple for how complex the material and exam questions are structured. If you struggle interpreting questions DO NOT TAKE THIS COURSE. Instead of testing you on the concepts all the exam questions are practically how you interpret the questions

Don't take 1113 with SEA-PHAGES lab. Adds a lot of unnecessary work, and essentially tacks on an additional 1/2 course of work for no benefit. Ball uses Top Hat which essentially mandates attendance, which is annoying if you plan on only using lecture recordings. Mastering is decent, not too much work but definitely a little bit. Exams are tough.

Sarah hall is definitely one of the worst professors I’ve ever had. She talks so much and so fast in class but the exams, most of the time have nothing to do with what she’s talking about. The exams had questions on there we had never talked about in class nor were they mentioned in the book.

Dr. Ball is a HORRIBLE professor, her slides are like 10 years old and all she does is read off of them. No engagement, she doesn't make her own questions they are all of the internet because she is stupid. I do not know how she is still a professor.

I didn't think Dr. Ball was helpful out of class. But paying attention in lecture was pretty much all I did and I got an A. Search mastering Qs because those homework points give a little boost at the end, and review them before the exams too. I didn't read the book bc its more about understanding so pay attention to what she says in lecture.

She makes everything sound easy in class but in reality her exams get into so much depth that she doesn't cover. Also her lab quizzes were so hard for no reason. Whenever I spoke to her about my grade she said that I would be fine but in reality I wasn't. The class is very slow and she talks very slowly.

Dr. Ball's notes were thorough and her exams were very straightforward. As long as you study and actually do the homework instead of looking up the answers, you will be prepared for the exams. In lecture, she moves at a slow pace which was frustrating because it is a lot easier to get distracted.

She is a very nice person but found her lectures to be boring and extended for no reason. Do NOT take SEA-Phages as it is difficult and has nothing to do with what is being taught in lecture (this lab section made this class difficult to enjoy at all(from a non bio major).

Dr. Ball was actually very considerate to me during this pandemic but I would highly discourage you from taking her lecture with the SEA-PHAGE lab. That lab did not match up to lecture at all and felt like an additional class I was taking. Dr. Ball's lectures are pretty boring and the tests are difficult so make sure to read the book.

I hated attending lectures. She speaks SO slowly and assumes students know all terminology. In the SEA-PHAGES lab section, the lab rubrics were simple/vague, unclear on all requirements, but TAs went heavy on the grading. By the end of the semester, I'd leave the lecture running and tune in only to answer TopHat questions. Would not recommend.

Dr. Ball is an intelligent, earnest, and articulate professor. The lectures are easiest learned, however, through carefully reading the textbook and rewatching lecture videos. Attend class for TopHat points. In a class this big, there is little room for grade leniency and flexibility. Develop a relationship with your TA, and know the material.
She did not care about her students in any means. Office hours do not help at all, the way she talks makes it seem like you should already know the information and would not offer any extra help.

She does not care for her students at all. During the COVID era, she didnt give any extra help with almost no communication, and no one ever knew when anything was due. Her lectures are so boring and not sufficient to do well on the exams. We didnt cover as much as the other classes , so if you are pre-med take another professor!

Dr. Ball's lectures were mind boggling boring. She sounds normal on 2x speed. When Covid-19 hit she just uploaded lecture recordings from previous semesters and peaced out. Ta's carried the course. Test questions are worded weird and only try to trick you, not test knowledge.

Dr. Balls lectures are confusing and badly worded, and she often uses terms in lecture that arent always understood by the students. Make sure to attend lecture to try and get as many TopHat points as you can. DONT take one of the SEA lab sections because theyre highly disorganized and much more work.

Dr. Ball does not care about her students. Amid the COVID-19 pandemic, she took the opportunity to make lectures longer and assign even more homework than usual. Also when I asked her about an inconsistency in her lecture, she got defensive and rude.

Lots of blanks on ppt, missing one sentence you'll be lost in the following hour. Mastering due once a week routinely, not helpful. No feedback or explanation. Top-Hat questions pop up every 5 minutes, graded for correctness. Lab TA judgy and mean. Why would I waste that time and money, and end up learn everything from Khan academy?

Attend the lecture for TopHat. Exams were very hard and worded weirdly. Her lectures were boring. Spent 15-20 minutes in each lecture explaining curiosity questions which had nothing to do with class. Hw takes lots of time. Try to get a good TA as they grade your lab. Didn't go in depth in concepts so DEFINITELY read the book or you won't pass.

Dr. Ball is clearly passionate. She is fair with grading, especially since Top Hat isnt graded for accuracy. I had a tough time at the beginning of the class - my TA was a tough grader, I was getting 80s on the midterms. Going through mastering / top hat questions during finals studying helped me a lot, I ended with a 92.57, which she rounded up.

Sarah Ball was not that bad in my opinion. I actually thought her teaching style was okay, however, I would zone out. But, this did not hurt my grade as she posts both her notes and lectures online. BUT, my BIGGEST recommendation is to READ THE TEXTBOOK, yes it is dry but it prepares you so well for the exam and is the only reason I got an A.

Dr. Ball is a great professor! Her exams are kind of difficult, however. I thought I understood the content to my best ability, but her questions are highly conceptual. I think it just really depends on your lab section.

Sarah Ball explained concepts well, however, she did not go into much detail. Her exams were much harder than any practice problems given or homework assignments. Would recommend reading the book. Lectures were interesting content wise if you enjoy biology. Lots of tophat questions for participation points, so definitely go to lecture.

It is very obvious that Dr. Ball knows a lot about biology. She has very good notes, however they are not very detailed. She gives some opportunities for extra credit and the labs are fairly easy. Be sure to attend class because she relies heavily on TopHat questions.

Her lectures were boring and miserable. Would have done better watching Khan Academy. Tests and homework were very difficult. In class activities and Tophat were not helpful and wasted a lot of class time. Do not take this professor if you can avoid it.

Dr. Ball is fantastic! She is great at breaking down difficult concepts, is willing to answer questions, and provides lots of opportunities to earn points outside of (her very fair, if you study) exams. She is very kind, and extremely passionate about Biology, which makes her already interesting lectures even better. Take Bio with her if you can!

Despite getting a good grade in this class, I really didn't enjoy it. Her exams are worded in the strangest way, making them much more confusing than they should be. I would only take her if there was no other professor available honestly. One good thing is that she posts her lectures and videos online, so if you miss class, they're available.

Dr. Ball is a very, very genuine professor, and one of the best at OSU Main. She always begins her class answering questions that students may have about almost anything -- doesn't have to be bio related. She is also a very helpful person, taking her time to answer your question and making you understand the concepts behind them. Take her class!!

Dr. Ball cares a lot about what she teaches and is always there to help. The real thing that will decide your grade is who you get as a lab TA. Some are really cool and helpful while others take off points for no reason and refuse to help you out. The tests are difficult but fair. Just stay on top of things and you will have no issue passing

Dr. Ball is passionate about biology. Overall she does a good job teaching the material, however there were some topics that she could have made easier to understand. It's important to study your notes well for the tests. Midterms are fairly difficult but manageable if you study well. Attend lecture and lab; top hat and lab should boost the grade.
pop quizzes  top hat. Fill in the blank slides. Lectures are honestly helpful so highly suggest going to class and paying attention or a lot of studying by yourself later

Professor Ball was mediocre at best. She left out a lot of concepts introduced in the textbook that are actually found on exams, so get ready to read. Her exams were tough and more in-depth than your basic definition questions. She wasn't very approachable when you had a question and didn't seem willing to help. TA's were ok, but helpful.

I think professor Ball made the lectures as interesting as possible. Her voice was not boring or dry, and she explained concepts with fun facts thrown in there. she made her tests very relevant to lecture material. My advice: do not ever skip reading the textbook. I don't know how you would pass the class without it.

Definitely not one of my favorite classes because the lectures were not stimulating and the material was explained at its most difficult level. She is seriously intelligent, but does not always explain the information well or in more than one way. Your TA will be your best pal in this class. Make friends and study with them.

Ball was definitely a great professor, but just a forewarning the subject matter and the lecturing can be very dry if you take the long tuesday/thursday class. Her lectures are definitely the most useful thing to understand basic biology, but it is necessary to do work outside of class. Her exams were difficult, but study top hat and mastering.

The exams were very hard and Ball didn't care about the averages being so low either. TAs take off points for no reason but doing well in lab is just as important as the exams because there are a lot of points for it. TopHat questions every day so that's kind of your attendance, mastering homework questions were always online. Ball was no help.

Dr. Ball was a pretty good professor. Her lectures could be long and boring at times but she tries to spice it up with in-class activities and TopHat. The homework and exams were pretty easy so long as you read the textbook and pay attention in lecture. Do not take the SEA-Phages lab!

Youll take 4 tests, the final is not comprehensive. Attendance is not taken but you do tophat in class to track it. TAs will take the smallest points off for little errors. Prof. Ball doesnt seem to care what the average for tests are, test 2 and the final were difficult. I got a B+ in the class. Do the homework because it is graded. No curve.

Lectures are a must because of top hat and graded in class activities, however other than that don't expect them to help you much. If you want to learn the material you have to read the book several times over. Exams are not weighted and tricky. Mastering homework is tedious but put in the time on it as it can really affect your grade.

Don't take the sea-phages lab. You can do her top hat questions outside class if you skip. You have to buy the book for the homework code, but I never actually read her books. Her tests are off her fill in the blank class notes. Tests aren't worth much because she has so many assignments. Overall good experience

In Dr. Ball's offense, I've always hated biology, however, she made me hate it more. Her powerpoints and notes are over topics equivalent to addition, and her tests are derivatives. Lectures are incredibly boring. I would never recommend her to anyone ever. Also not very nice or willing to help. Disappointed.

I wasn't the biggest fan of Dr. Ball's tests. The information covered in lecture seemed elementary compared to the topics tested. Tophat will boost your grade, so go to class. Her lectures are mildly entertaining. Read the book and don't cram for her exams and you'll be fine.
Dr. Ball is a decent professor. Her exams are slightly difficult but other than that she is very cool. Would recommend

The lectures can be very boring. A lot of important material is not on the power points. Overall material is not hard but very detail oriented so you must know all the material very well. Do not take the sea phages lab unless you have an interest in research, it is much more work including a research paper.
Dr. ball is a great professor; however, lectures can be dull and very broad. Overall good, but could perhaps be a bit more animated about the wonderful yet mysterious science that is biology

Dr. Ball was a pretty good teacher overall. Tests were not too bad as long as you had a really good grasp on all the material. Most test questions were application ?'s. You'll definitely need to read the book!!! Also, google Easy Notecards, click on Campbell Biology and do the notecards for the chapters covered on the test(s)- they help so so much

I really liked Dr. Ball, she was funny and friendly and made class interesting. She uses TopHat for attendance and it's graded on participation, not correctness, so go to class! Wasn't a huge fan of the types of questions that make up her test, but that's a personal thing. Good choice of professor.

Ball is okay, her class isn't exactly mandatory but her notes are fill in the blank so it would be a good idea to go.  She also does tophat questions for attendance.  Homework is through mastering so you can find it all online.  If you can do NOT take the sea phages lab, do the normal one because sea phages is way more work.

Dr. Ball was a very good professor. Explained everything in class very clearly, and all assignments supplemented the class very well. Exams and homework were very fair. She kept the material very interesting.
Amazing Professor. Speaks clearly and teaches effectively in lecture. Exams are nothing tricky.

Unless you're already a whiz in biology, you'll want to read the book and review your lecture notes. She was a great teacher, and you'll see repeated questions from the Study Area on MasteringBio on exams. She definitely makes her half of the semester doable and fair, but Dr. Weinstein might make you rethink who you want to take for Bio.

Her tests were a little difficult (you have to really understand the material in order to do well), but not impossible. Just make sure you read the corresponding textbook sections BEFORE lecture- it's the only way you'll be able to understand the material. Tophat questions each day counted for attendance.
Goes really fast stay ahead and read the textbook

She knows a lot about the subject, for sure. The lab is the worst part- seaphages-  and where most the grades for the class come from- prelabs, quizzes, papers. Exams are more application-based than normal classes and will take the full time. Extra credit chances given. Attendance taken through top hat every class.
Must come in with an understanding of biology. I came in struggling because I haven't had bio in four years. Reading the book and going through lecture notes is key.

Ball's tests were the easiest things in existence. Make sure you read the book though because she isn't the best at explaining things. All her questions come from an online test bank too. For sure one of the easiest biology professors.
Pretty good prof. Decent slides really just not a hard class if you pay attention to lectures and learn whats presented. hot.

Dr. Ball was a good professor, but the lecture itself didn't allow for much interaction with her (there were 600+ students). She puts guided notes on Carmen before lectures, and her exams are based solely on lectures. Honestly, the textbook isn't needed if you go to class.
Not too hard

Dr. Ball was very good at teaching. She took things at a nice pace and assigned work relevant to the tests. Reading the book is essential to getting a good grade. She uses clickers for class, so skipping class can loose you points.

Dr. Ball was a great professor. She was very insightful with her lectures and very detailed oriented. She does go off of the book. Be prepared to look at it to study. Also use the website EasyNotecards. They have test questions related to the book chapters. Overall, she does a nice job. The SEAPHAGES lab wasnt great but it was somewhat interesting.

Professor Ball was very nice and comprehensive. Her test were pretty tough and she liked to put on tricky question on exams. She highly recommends you to read the book and take notes individually. Honestly, this will help you pass the class.

Dr. Ball is extremely helpful if you ask for help. Some students may think she's unapproachable, but she is very specific and helpful if you come to office hours with questions. Very concise in her explanations; she really knows the ins and outs of the information presented in lecture and is always willing to answer questions. Great overall.

Lecture was super boring. Basically explains bare bones of what you'll actually have to know for the tests. Not very helpful. Lab has nothing to do with lecture. Test questions are straight from online and the test bank.

Really knows her stuff, and is a good teacher. Her lectures were  interesting, but long and took the entire time. Tests were tough, but the test questions are all online on flashcards. If you studied those and the lecture slides the class is very manageable.
Didn't enjoy the class at all. Tests are very tough and made so you fail them. I studied so much and it never showed. But the issue is that there are no good 1113 professors.

It was with the SEAphages late. The lab and lecture do not over lap. It is like taking two different course. Lectures are not that helpful. I can read the book and have a better understanding. You have to go to class to get the clicker question points.
Dr. Ball is very knowledgable about Biology, but not exactly approachable. Her notes are not very helpful for the test. YOU MUST READ THE BOOK!!!

Dr. Ball is an good teacher.  Her curiosity questions keep lecture a little interesting.  I hated this class. There is a reason they call it a weed out class. Reading will help you and make sure you review the notes.  She leaves blanks in the notes, so attendance is important and there is clicker questions that are basically attendance points.

Lecture is very broad  Need to know topics inside and out.  She tries to trick students. YOU NEED TO READ. She ask questions directly from the book material . Attendance taken with clickers. Sea Phages lab is awful has nothing to do with class. I'm a B student really did not enjoy class. In class activities are easy points but waste of class time.

This class was awful. The SEAPHAGES lab has nothing to do with the lectures at all. I was super excited for bio and she made me hate it. The fill in notes are no help because the exam is way more indepth then the notes. If you don't read you're pretty much screwed. and there was a lot of pointless work for lab in which they graded super hard.
She was just really interesting and her expectations were clear cut

Sarah Ball was a great professor. Her lectures were clear and she gave out PowerPoints with blanks in them to fill in as she covered the material in class.  She gave out plenty of practice questions, which came from a test bank for the textbook.  If possible, get the test bank as a study tool because it really helps.  Would definitely recommend.

She's very clear and provides detailed lectures that you must fill in blanks. She also uses clickers. Most quiz and exam questions can be found in book and online. Very smart and tries to keep lectures interesting. Highly recommend

Biology is a hard subject but Dr Ball presents the material in a way that makes it incredibly easy to understand. If you pay attention in lecture and also STUDY (like I said biology is hard) you will have no problem with this class. She put powerpoint of her lectures online and her lectures are very organized. Highly recommend.

She pulls her tests from all of the questions found in the book, so preparing yourself for them isn't too difficult. I didn't think to study them until the final exam (which was a little too late) but wound up getting a B in the class despite the terrible lab (just wasn't for me). She's super nice and likes to keep things interesting.

Her tests have a lot of tough questions so it's important to really know the material. You need to read the book. There's clicker questions and group work during lectures to encourage attendance. Other than that, she is very organized and explains the material well. The lab is confusing at first, but after a while it feels like easy points.

Dr. Ball was very passionate about what she was teaching. There were many assignments for this class, and the lab was the SEAPHAGES lab, which required a giant paper and focus on one topic the entire semester. The quizzes and tests were difficult. I spent most of lab not knowing what was going on, but still ended up with an A-

Lecture was interesting. Can get away without the book but you'll do a lot better if you use it.  Tests were very hard and extremely confusing wording. SEAPHAGES lab was confusing & difficult but GREAT experience if you are microbioMolGen. Just read. Everything. It's manageable but not easy.
Very tough class. Was in the SEA PHAGES lab so nothing in lecture and lab correlated. Her exams are very hard. It's like she wants you to fail. She words them so you are unsure what she is asking.
Super hard, tests are nearly impossible. The test questions are trying to trip you up.

Class has a ton of random assignments that you will always end up getting a 7.1410 or some random # on them, Its never over 8 and just brings down your grade. Very annoying class, lectures aren't helpful but there's clicker Q's which force you to go. Final and MTs are like 30% of grade so other stuff hurts grade. Test Q's are based off quizzes.
Lectures were very good and really helped clarify concepts. Her lecture slides were very detailed and easy to follow. She could be a hard professor, but she is very helpful.

She is a great professor. Very patient, even if the class itself is very tedious. I think she tries her best to help her students and seems to always keep a very good demeanor. The class it self, the phage lab part 2, that was agonizing at first, but got easier over time.
She is very helpful and friendly.

Dr. Ball's lecture notes are very detailed with most of the information on carmen with an exception of some key words being blanked out, making attendance fairly mandatory. Fill in the blanks instead of taking notes solely by hand. Her exams are hard, but her questions are from a bank that you can find after googling a few of her quiz questions.
Dr. Ball is a wonderful professor! If you stay up to date with the lecture material (aka read the book before every lecture) then you will do great!
average teacher. Went over most things on exams, but not into much detail.

Know the answers to the weekly quizzes because you will probably be asked some of them on the test. HARD CLASS. If you can take bio 1101, do it. If not try to get a different set of professors. Tests are difficult and she does;t really help in office hours. Her questions are always trying to trick you.

Her lectures are interesting, and she takes subjects at the beginning of the semester people are curious about, and starts each day of with a random topic before diving in. Like a brain warm up. She also teaches Sea Lab, and seems to want to help her students, always helps with a smile. Tests are hard to ace. I assume not impossible if you study.

Dr. Ball is great! If you pay attention in class and READ your book, you will do fine. I got A's on her exams, even though they are tricky. You just have to READ the question and STUDY from the book and her notes. Don't let other peoples comments scare you. Put in the work and you'll succeed.:)

Dr. Ball is my favorite professor that I have had so far.  Her exams seem pretty difficult but you can do well if you study.  She gives you all of the information you need in class, her notes are super detailed. I did not have to look at the book once,  I simply read over my notes and got A's and B's on the midterms. Very good at explaining things.

Dr. Ball's exams are very difficult, but as a teacher she is excellent. She makes coming to class fun and worthwhile, but READ THE TEXTBOOK. My first exam I failed and when I read the book my second exam score went up significantly. Take the Sea Lab opportunity if offered because Dr. Ball teaches it and it replaces regular lab and she is amazing!

I strongly advise not taking this Professor. Office help is use less. Tests are ridicuosly hard. Don't expect a curve. Also  the special lab, sea lab is awful.I suggest if you do end up having to take this teacher take the regular lab. This teacher doesn't explain anything in this lab. assignments are graded at random and not on specific due dates.

Literally one of the greatest profs EVER! I love biology and I enjoyed the content which is key to taking her class cause its not an easy A. But she is very personable and happy to help. I was placed in a special lab where she "TA"ed the lab and I got to know her very well - which is great for a 600-people class. TAKE THIS CLASS!

READ THE TEXTBOOK! And do the end of chapter multiple choice problems. Go to office hours, they are helpful. But as others have said, her midterms are very very very difficult. The class/ professr switches halfway through and Dr. Weinstein takes over, he's also very hard. You will learn A LOT, but getting an A is tough. Take a dif. prof if possible
Very confusing teacher who asks exam questions that are are the tiniest little details. Bad teacher that expects you to know everything. One of the worst teachers i've ever had.
I thought that she was a great teacher but, her exams were too complex to take within the 55 minute time constraint.

She's actually awful. She makes no sense, reads off a powerpoint and asks you the most ridiculous questions on exams. You can't even understand them because she tries to make them "tricky" and they just end up being a giant overly wordy paragraph. Terrible lecturer, terrible professor.

Professor Ball was very concise in her lecture presentations and overall not a bad lecturer but she does not work well with students or give help easily. Did not answer questions well and often rushed through topics even when the class was clearly not understanding the topic. Not THE worst but I would not take a class with her again.

Dr. Ball is a very nice teacher, and answers all your questions immediately. She reads off the slides and explains them a little. She does not give a study guide for tests, but some of her questions come from the post-lecture quizzes, clicker questions, and questions at the end of every chapter in the book. And her hair is awesome and perfect!
Great teacher!  Takes advantage of different technology including clickers, helpful videos, and more.  Explains things thoroughly and at a good pace.

She is a TA right now but will start lectures. Very very smart and very helpful. Best TA i have ever had and one of the best teachers. Dr. Sarah Ball is one of the best bio staff members OSU has right now. And she is just down right hot!
Pick a different TA, he is very strict and does not explain well

Is all over the place all he cares about is getting out of class quickly. He'll just throw information at you without you knowing what any of it means, spends more time asking if we're looking forward to the exam then actually teaching. He does however hold review sessions that have been kinda helpful.
just no, very tough grader and makes mean comments to those who get a question wrong
He was a tough grader but his critiques made it easy to learn from mistakes. You knew exactly what was wrong and why. When asked questions, his answers were clear and helpful.
Fun person, but VERY VERY strict in grading. He reads every sentence you write and finds every point you miss. Then, you lose points here and there.

alright dr lenny has gotten some bad reviews but he is really not THAT bad. the recitation is annoying and he isnt very helpful for the lab portion but he literally tells you the answers for the lab reports and tells you what will be on the lab quizzes. he is just a little awkward but hes actually so nice. love this guy!

Recitation is a long game with convoluted question delivery. We get no review or deeper explanation out of the content, simply play the game for an hour then do lab. Procedural demonstration and explanation is minimal at best, many technique issues prolonged labs. He also demeans incorrect answers as a joke, discouraging figure engagement.

I had a terrible time in this class. Avoid this TA if possible. I asked him about my extended response answers on an exam and he read them in front of my group and proceeded to tell my why I was wrong and make fun of me. He also continued to make jokes about my responses in future labs. Also if you think it will be a quick lab you're wrong.

He's a horrible TA, genuinely take it with anybody else. He grades a lot harsher than all the other TAs and laughs when you get a question wrong in lab. Lab quizzes are also borderline impossible. He also has a game during recitation that you genuinely get nothing out of, it's boring and takes up tons of lab time. Never take him frl

He was so unhelpful, and often left us more confused. He would not answer any of our questions, even when our group clearly stated we were having struggles. Furthermore, he was particularly distasteful towards me, and would often ignore me when I tried to participate. This truly affected my overall ability to learn and my learning environment.

If you expect to be able to not put in any effort, he will not be fun. He can be a bit tough grading and his labs are long but he teaches you the material well. He is accessible outside of class, approachable, and genuinely cares that you understand the material. His online review sessions were really helpful and so I recommend going to those!

I think he is a nice guy, but lab with him was so stressful. I couldn't understand his directions; his questions were confusing, and asking him for help honestly made me more confused. He is the head TA so he grades lab reports super harshly.

Don't take bio lab with this instructor. He's such a hard grader and makes lab quizzes impossible. He's really not mentally there and has no idea how to teach individuals. If you are confused or need help, he just won't.
Very rude and a harsh grader. He really enjoyed seeing students confused and did nothing to help. He is intelligent but a horrible teacher.

He is just not mentally here - he makes objectively easy directions impossible to complete and I have never left a lab with a better understanding, only frustrated and confused. I truly do not understand how he was approved - he is not a good TA save urself the frustration.

Dr. Lenny has very high expectations of his students and expects them to know far beyond the introductory biology course. He tries to explain things as if he is talking to a professional and leaves students much more confused afterwards. Recitation is useless. His lab quizzes are very difficult and the labs almost always go past the end time.
Dr. Lenny is a great TA! To exceed in his class, participation is key! He is a very experienced and knowledgeable TA who has a lot to offer for pre-med students. He helped me get into a research lab!
Super tough grader, expects you to know what he wants even when the question is vague. Not good at answering questions about
Doesnt try to help and laughs at your confusion.

Dr. linan is a very tough grader. He will take off points and the labs are long. Given that its online, he is not very understanding. Prepare for working very hard just to get points taken off over a small mistake.
He is so confusing and his rubric for grading is very specific. Online learning with this professor was so difficult. He does not set his students up for success.

He was so disrespectful and rude to my lab group. If you have him tried to switch lab times, he thinks your failure is funny. Honestly made me hate biology with a burning passion. The class is not bad but your TA makes or breaks your grade and he has no problem breaking it.

Dr Lenny is a knowledgeable lab TA but explains things in a way only he understands and expects you to just pick up on things right away. He is a very tough grader and if you dont put something the way he would word it he will mark you points off. Rushes students to finish labs even if you dont understand and makes you feel more confused.

Dr. Lenny is a tough but fair TA for biology. He does grade a little bit tough but he cares about his students and wants to help you. Also, he does a really nice job prepping students for the lab practical. If you can, I recommend having him as your TA. Get to know him, he's a really nice guy.

Dr. Lenny is the least helpful TA I have ever had the misfortune of dealing with. He does not care about student learning, only proving his intellectual superiority. He is a picky and condescending grader and lead to an overall disheartening experience.
Dr. Lenny is one tough TA, but really fair and pretty funny. I highly recommend spending the time to get to know him, but be aware of his lab quizzes, they are really tricky.
For some reason he kept teaching me how to light fires and go fishing. He's very good at captaining a canoe. Also a DILF.
Horrible. Didn't even take the class and still know he's a bad professor. help
He was very dry and I often found myself not paying attention. I definitely had to teach myself the material. Tophat questions during class.

His lectures were dry, often unorganized, and delivered in a mumbling monotone making it difficult to follow along. You will probably have to teach yourself at times because his explanations could be confusing. I recommend getting help from TA's and watching videos on the harder topics to study for the midterms.

Dr. Mackey's lectures consist of mumbling, spending 20 min on a slide yet not getting his point across, no explaination on missed tophat questions, and rushing through a chapter when it came time to take the midterm. His constant degrading and montone voice made the class unbearable. I only went to class for the tophat and because he's a DILF.

His lack of empathy for students seemed to go hand in hand with his egotistical attitude throughout the second half of the semester. Although Dr. Mackey was clearly very knowledgeable on the subject, the difficult course content was only made harder by his monotone, boring, and sometimes degrading lectures.

Dr. Mackey was obviously very knowledgable about the topics, but he did a poor job teaching. He would spend the first 25 mins of class reviewing the same concepts from previous lectures and rush through a chapter of new material before exams. His lecture slides were also way more dense than Dr. Ball's. I pretty much taught myself with the textbook.

Speaks quickly, quietly, and mumbles through the entire lecture, making him impossible to learn from. Does not care an iota about the academic progress of his students. I would get more information from the textbook and slides than I ever would listening to him rush through class. I only attended because of the TopHat questions. Avoid if you can.

They'll tell you that these ratings don't actually reflect him, but they do. He loads up his lecture slides and blows through them faster than you can take notes. He reads off the slides and his voice is so boring I genuinely start nodding off. If you can avoid him, pls do.

Dr. Mackey's lectures were dry so it was hard to pay attention. His exam was about the same as Dr. Ball's but the info is more complex which is why some people study. Try to pay attention to his explanations in lecture and take notes and you'll do well. Review the tophat Qs and mastering HW before exams and I made study guides reviewing the slides.

Not a good lecturer - only reason for going to lectures is TopHat points. Not helpful at all. When the class average was low on the midterm, his advice was to "Do better", and gave us no resources to do so. Inevitably, the average for the final was failing. Had to teach myself everything when he was my professor.

Very boring lectures, he co-taught with Sarah Ball and his exams were MUCH harder and longer. His office hours were held on west campus, probably to keep people from going, and that was the only way I could learn anything because his lectures were so hard to pay attention to. Class average on the final was a 62%, and there was no curve.
He wasn't great. Tests hard lectures boring, long, and frankly stupid. It's all copy pasted from book. Recitation didn't help.

Dr. Mackey was a very dry lecturer. I literally could NOT pay attention during his lectures because it was painfully boring. I only had him for the 2nd half of the semester because he co-taught, BUT his exam was way too long and more challenging than the first 2 exams from the first professor. Do NOT take him, you will hate yourself like i do.
Put in the work and you'll do well. Very fair.

I thought Mackey was fantastic. The way he taught was really clear. I got a A's on all of his exams without studying that much. His exams were a little tricky, but if you take your time and think it through you will do fine!

You can't rely on his lecture slides alone for exam. In order to get an A on an exam you have to study hard and long and understand the concepts well! His tests aren't that bad they just feel tricky. His lectures are sort of boring and hard to focus  but go because you need to hear the basics. It helps with studying on your own.

David Mackey was a subpar instructor. He was incapable of lecturing well and worded his questions extremely unclearly. Mackey should not be teaching a 700 person class in Independence. Class was boring and generally useless. While I got a good grade in his class, it was because I read the book and spent extremely long amounts of time studying.
His quizzes and exams were really hard and classes are boring. For a gen ed course this was pretty tough. Especially for a bio class.

Dr. Danhart is an engaging lecturer who makes complex topics understandable. Exams require solid preparation, but his teaching style and helpful resources like unstuckstudy make the class manageable. Definitely worth taking if you're interested in biology.
Dr. Danhart was a great Bio 1113 professor! Would defiantly recommend him.

Dr.Danhart was a good professor and clearly loves biology. His lectures were a bit dull as he read off of slides in a vaguely monotone voice, but it wasn't bad overall. If you don't have any biology experience (like AP Bio or the intro to bio courses) and take this class, then be prepared to play catch-up. Overall an A is achievable with effort.
Professor Danhart is amazing. Really engaging lectures and clearly cares about his students and their success. His exams are fair and he makes sure you know what study.

Lectures have Tophats but are accessible through Zoom. He's decent at explaining concepts and if you know the slides and application questions well then you're set. Nice and funny guy. Most exam are 80% MC with a few short responses. Overall, easy class with a good professor.

The class is pretty easy overall and there were plenty of assignments throughout the semester. He provides learning outcomes for each chapter in his slides which directly correlate to what will be on the exams. Labs were confusing at times, not necessarily his fault but more of the TA I had.
His exams are kinda tough, you really have to have a good understanding of the material. He did a good job of explaining everything, and there was never an exam that had stuff that we didn't cover.

Take Dr. Danhart's class! He is probably the best professor for biology by far! Some topics may be confusing but he does a great job explaining them. The difficulty of the lab is really based off of which TA you get. But I wouldn't say his exams are super difficult if you know how to study. Find a rhythm and go over the application questions!

I love Dr. Danhart. He is clearly passionate about biology and provides an in-depth understanding of basic biology. He includes TopHat questions in his lectures and talks through the slides more thoroughly in class but he provided a Zoom option and recorded his lectures. The exams can be difficult but he provides enough resources to preform well.
I've taken 2 classes now with Dr. Danhart and i have no complaints at all.

Dr. Danhart is a really great prof.  I am not good at biology, but going to his office hours helped me so much. 
The class is definitely a lot of studying and not a lot of homework assignments, but there are a good amount of extra credit opportunities to get your grade up.  The class is weighted heavily on the 3 exams throughout the semester.

Dr. Danhart is such a gem! He genuinely cares about his students and is very kind and approachable. Exams were a bit difficult because there's a lot of memorization but he did his best to make lectures straightforward and not overwhelming. Labs were long but not challenging. I wish he'd teach every biology class I took.
Dr. Danhart is a great lecturer. However, his tests are a little harder than other bio 1113 teachers. However, I think this is offset by the quality of his explanations. Definitely would recommend.

Absolutely amazing professor. Knows how to teach and explains everything in great detail. This class is not an easy A, be prepared to study. If you follow the learning objectives you will be fine. Has lots of Tophat and HW points so take advantage. Lab is very dependent on your TA. Enjoy him while you can because he is one of the best at OSU.

If you can get Dr. Danhart for Bio 1113, PLEASE take his class. He explains things in the same amount of detail as he expects you to know for exams, and often provides mnemonic devices to help remember more of the difficult stuff. If you go to his office hours, he will like you and help you a lot with homework/projects/lab work/studying etc.

Dr. D is an amazing professor. 420 out of the 1000 points come from exams. To get an A, all you need to do is rewatch old lectures and be able to answer each of the learning outcomes. The labs are harder than what we learn in class. Dr. D is a good teacher and one of the best professors at OSU - he explains the 'why' behind everything!

This class wasn't super hard but be prepared to study a fair amount for the exams. Danhart has specific learning outcomes that are perfect to study with because he makes the exams off those. Over 1000 points in the class so not horribly test heavy. I recommend going to lectures because he gives a lot more detail that the slides don't have.

Dr. Danhart loves his to use tophat in class for every lecture, but honestly as long as you pay attention to the lecture you'll be fine. The midterms are also kinda easy because they are exactly like the tophats.

Dr. Danhart is a great professor who really cares about his students. He is very accessible outside of class. This class is difficult and it covers a lot of content but he is a good lecturer. You definitely need to put in a lot of time studying in order to do well. The labs are often annoying, but your lab grade is very dependent on your TA.
Great class and great teacher. He is always available to answer questions and his lectures were so helpful.
Awesome.
Good Class all around, and Dr. Danhart is an excellent lecturer.

Dr. Danhart is one of the best professors at osu and I highly recommend taking him. The class is difficult but he is extremely helpful and accessible through discord. When studying I recommend looking over the application questions, learning objectives, and tophat questions (his form of attendance). I loved this class and am going to miss it!

Amazing Prof. Cares a lot about his students and provides them with all resources necessary to succeed. Love the discord server as my questions were answered within minutes by him or a TA. Labs sucked, but that was because my TA sucked. I would have had a better grade were it not for my lab group and my TA. Try for a TA that cares about their job!

Dr. Danhart is funny and smart. Lectures are over only about 12-20 slides. Always read the Mastering book to get a more in-depth understand. Do the Exam Reviews before the exams. Test are based around the learning outcomes provided. There is a discord server made where one can asks questions and the professor replies instantaneous at anytime.

It is evident that Dr. Danhart prepares for his lectures. The material is quite dense, but he makes it manageable and interesting. You simply have to put in the time and effort to study his lecture notes and you should be able to get an A in the class. The labs are a little annoying, but just make sure you do your best to keep up.

This class is manageable if you put the time in. Dr. Danhart is phenomenal! Definitely read the textbook, do not cram for exams (they're hard), and go to lecture - homework and TH points will help your grade in the end! Overall, solid class and great professor. The labs are ridiculously annoying, however.

Dr. Danhart really cares about his students. Personally, I'd say if you have any background of Biology, you will do completely fine in this course. Just make sure you utilize his notes and practice questions when studying for his exam. If you have questions, Dr. D will be more than happy to help you out. Good luck!

Dr. Danhart is a very good professor. Lectures are very helpful and information heavy. His learning outcome based class makes it easy to study and focus in certain things. The labs are a little annoying, but bearable. He also has a class discord server, which is very helpful. Highly sarcastic and humorous.

Dr. Danhart did a great job at communicating the lecture material as well as caring for students. Although the course was set up with too many points and the labs were at time unbearable, I found myself enjoying the lecture. I did not enjoy the pre-med scope of the class as well.

Dr. Danhart did a great job at communicating the lecture material as well as caring for students. Although the course was set up in a manner similar to a death of a million paper cuts (SO MANY POINTS) and the labs were at time unbearable, I found myself enjoying the lecture. If you're more into plant bio, this class in your alley.

For as much as I dont like biology, this class was surprisingly not that bad, mostly thanks to Dr. D. He genuinely cares about the success of his students and he is very passionate about the material. The class discord server was a great idea, and he was always accessible there. Overall, great professor who you should try to get if possible.
Dr. Danhurt is amazing. Lectures are easy to understand, he live streams and uploads recordings. Also a very down to earth person in office hours, never condescending.

Eric Danhart made me remember why I wanted to be a biochemistry major. He made everything he taught the most interesting thing ever and explained everything beautifully. He also runs a Discord server for the class so if you have a question you can just ask him or a TA.
THIS IS THE BEST MAN ON THE PLANET!!!! TAKE HIM YOU WILL BECOME BESTIES!!! BEST PROFESSOR IN THE WORLD!!

Went too fast in lecture and was often condensing if you didn't understand the content. Did not care to help when seeking advice on how to do better in the class. The class is more difficult than expected if you have not taken a previous biology course.

He is a very tedious grader, but he was amazing. I have nothing but good things to say. He was patient with us, made us do a virus project which was fun and something different. He made sure that we understood everything not only in lab, but lecture as well. He is very understanding, so if you have a problem, he is helpful.

Dr. Danhart is a great professor. The class is structured well, and grading criteria is clear. Class isn't mandatory however Tophat q's during the lecture are important to answer. There is a lot of content, some easy some hard. The exam q's were also like that. There are nice grade cushions. He's always available to talk, even when becoming a dad.

I would recommend taking any class by him because he is such a great professor. He truly cares about his students and its easy to meet outside of class. Make sure to do tophat questions during lecture, they will definitely help your grade and are good review. His lectures move fast but are recorded so you can go back and review missed material.

AMAZING PROFESSOR so helpful in and out of class, what he expects out of you is super clear. He says he only tests whats on the slides and its true. It's bio so theres a level of difficulty but it's entirely doable and having Dr D makes it so much better. Attend the lectures, read the textbook if you're confused, and ask for help if you need it

Danhart is an awesome professor. Makes himself  very accessible to students. The exams are based pretty much on the lectures, study the learning outcomes and vocab you will do great in this class. He cares a lot about his students and wants them to succeed. He simplifies everything. Highly recommend if you plan on taking bio 1113. Very funny too!
Try to get him as your professor if you can! Down to earth young professor who really wants his students to succeed
I used to think that I was really bad at bio but taking it with Dr. Danhart changed my whole thought process and I actually enjoy bio now.
dr. danhart was amazing. have him currently and his use of discord is super cool and very immersive. he was responding to students mid hospital when his baby was being born!!!

You are probably on here to see if this professor is horrible... wrong place. Dr. Danhart is a GOD. He is the best professor you will ever have and he truly cares about his students and their success. Do not take anyone else. He is the best at OSU!
Awesome professor. The absolute best and really cares about his students. His lectures are interesting and his tests are fair.

He wears polo shirts on top of his polo shirts is really funny and has this cool plant named Phil. An impeccable lecturer gives detailed notes and tells you exactly what’s on the test. Read the text book as supplementary material and study and you will do well

He’s the best! His class is pretty average difficulty wise like the average for most tests is about 75%. But he writes all his own tests and the final isn’t cumulative. Attendance to lab is mandatory and lectures have tophats so they’re kind of mandatory.

Dr. Danhart is an amazing professor. Hes kind, chill, and actually cares about the students. The exams are not hard, and the tophat questions are good tools for review. I had him as a lab instructor also and hes even better in person.

The only way to get a good grade in his class is to laugh at his jokes and to try to get his attention in the zoom chat. The class was horrid along with the TA's who are awkward and are confused half of the time during lab. Class was bound to make you fail unless you spend all of your effort studying solely for his class. The worst professor ever.

Dr. Danhart is a real gem despite the mixed reviews people have about him. He's extremely structured and has a clear cut agenda for his students to succeed in. Also TA was extremely nice and easygoing. All in all this is a science course so expect to see many application and analysis questions on exams.

Dr. Danhart was a cool professor! I had him for an online/in-person lab hybrid kind of class. His lectures were not boring and fun to listen to. I was kinda lazy and didnt attend class all the time but make sure you do. The tests can be difficult but studying ahead of time helps lots. I recommend Bozeman Science videos as supplemental videos.

I thoroughly enjoyed Dr. Danharts lectures, even on zoom. His slides were concise, organized, and easy to understand. He was very accessible outside of class and his office hours were very helpful. I loved this class and would definitely recommend!!

Dr. Danhart is a very good professor who explains difficult concepts well. He gives a lot of easy or free points throughout the semester, which makes up for the slightly difficult exams. Provides good practice problems before exams. If you attend lectures and study you will be fine.

Dr. Danhart is an amazing professor to say the least. Having him straight out of high school is a great transition into college. This course has many available points, but you have to do well on the exams if you want to get a good grade. Also, go to lecture or you will be very confused

His class is hard but if you figure out how to study early on for exams you'll be completely fine. He's a super nice guy who knows what he is talking about during lectures. He also encourages you to go to office hours and emails back pretty quickly. It's clear that he cares about his students. If you can take him for bio I would recommend it.
Hes so bad I wanted to give him a zero but thats not possible so I give him a 1.
Dropped my grade on the last day for no reason. Went from a B+ to a C+

I personally loved Dr. Danhart. He was a very solid professor; however, I felt sometimes the questions he asked on the exams were pretty hard. I by all means could have given more effort, but I was taking ochem at the same time. If you study and practice a lot you will do well. The lab portion sucked and made me HATE life. It was very pointless.

Dr. Danhart was an amazing professor. I have never really "understood" biology until after completing this course. He was such a fun guy to listen to during lectures and was super good at explaining topics. There was a fair amount of homework, but never overwhelming. As long as you pay attention during lectures, you should do pretty well

Dr. Danhart could not have been a better professor for this class. He provides plenty of opportunities to practice and is very clear on what he wants you to know (he also gives specific learning outcomes for each lecture). He truly cares about what he teaches and wants to help students succeed. He was by far my favorite professor this semester.

If you attend and rewatch lectures, you'll do fine in the class. It's really easy to improve your study habits over time as well. Dr. Danhart does a great job at describing difficult concepts. Additionally, there a lot of "easy" grades and room for improvement
Lots of easy points in this class and exams are pretty straight forward.

Great prof. He's funny and kind. He teaches well and tries to make sure you understand everything. He also lets you choose songs and makes a playlist for the beginning of class! He cracks a lot of jokes which helps with engagement and is very interactive with his students! It's a moderately easy class and very fun if you study and interact w/ prof.
Dr. Danhart was a great professor but was very difficult with the exams. He is a 50/50 professor in learning and the difficulty level.

Dr. Danhart was a great professor! He was very caring and made lectures interesting. He would occasionally crack some jokes, which made class not always feel so serious. The content is moderately difficult though, so make sure to study VERY far in advance.

Dr. Danhart is a great professor, he explains materials and information very thoroughly. He takes his time to make sure you understand the material. He is also very funny, relatable and considerate of the students. The lecture was online but that labs were in person and they great as well. Tests aren't necessarily easy but that's biology.

Hes a really funny guy and he does his job very well. He explains things very thoroughly and you will learn a lot if you are willing to put in the time. He is a great prof to have straight out of high school, but he does have high expectations though.

If you are a non science major trying to get GEs done, don't take this class. It's bad and Dr. Danhart definitely does not have the patience to explain the material to you. And in COVID years, the labs are basically ONLINE and AWFUL. My advice is drop the class if you don't have the pre-reqs or even the time to learn the material
Exams are very difficult. Overall helpful, will go into way more detail on biochem than necessary. Recitations with him are very chill.

Dr. Danhart is hands down one of my favorite professors at OSU. He is friendly, kind, and extremely knowledgeable, but never makes you feel humiliated for asking a question or not knowing how to approach something. He consistently made himself available outside of class times to provide personalized help, and you can tell he really cares about you.

I loved Dr. Danhart. By far my best professor this semester. While the stuff he is teaching isn't easy, he does a phenomenal job of explaining it. He makes it clearer than the book. He's funny, easy to reach out to, and very kind. A great professor, especially for kids right out of highschool. He makes you work, but it won't useless. I love his dog

Dr. Danhart did amazing with the online format and was very accessible outside of class. Any homework or questions he was always more than willing to help in office hours. You can do well in his class as long as you try and are willing to ask for help. He is a very personable professor and teaches an enjoyable class.

Dr. Danhart was the best professor I have ever had. His lectures are interesting and he does a really wonderful job of explaining concepts instead of just expecting us to memorize facts. An A is definitely possible especially if you listen to lectures, go through learning outcomes, do tophat, and the course engagements.

Danhart is a very good Biology professor. The class was a little difficult online however he was very accessible outside of class so it seemed to be fine. The Lab portion of this class seemed very disconnected from the lecture. But there isn't much that can be done about that with the online stuff at the moment.

Dr. Danhart is one of the best professors Ive ever had. He is an amazing teacher and sets you up for success. Hes a great lecturer and answers any questions that you have in a way that is easy to understand. He will make sure that you can do well on the tests just by listening to the lectures. I would have Dr. Danhart again if I could.

I absolutely loved Dr. Danhart. He is such a helpful, down to earth guy. He was willing to meet with me outside of office hours numerous times, too. Lectures are not mandatory, but TopHat points add up so be careful! The textbook itself wasn't a necessity, but very helpful as he teaches to the book curriculum.

Dr. Danhart was one of the professors for this biochemistry lab. Although he wasn't my specifc professor, I always went to him for questions on the lab reports, homework, etc. He would answer so quickly and helped me a ton with confusion about questions/topics. He always implemented jokes into his emails which helped lighten the mood!

He doesn't give busy work. There's not much homework but it actually helps you learn. Textbook is a good tool, but not necessary. Dr. Danhart likes to make his lectures interesting, and they're not mandatory. He's a fair grader and is willing to help outside of class.
Danhart did his best to make the material easy for everyone. The exams were fair, but definitely have to study a good amount for them. Overall, not a bad class.

Really cares about his students and his lectures are genuinely entertaining. Covers a lot of material in lecture but it flows well. Requires you to apply a lot of material for quizzes, but this is all to aid in mcat prep.

Class can be challenging but they make it easy to do well if you put in the work. Overall amazing teacher and very accessible. Always answered emails and questions in class. Make lab a great experience!
Super straightforward. If you look at the learning outcomes and study the things written well, you will get an A.

Dr. Danhart was a great professor. You could really reach out to him at any time that you need any assistance and he would be there to help you. I will admit that there was a lot of material covered in every lecture and the exams were a bit difficult. Thankfully, the class is structured in a way that failing an exam won't mean failing the class.

My mistake was not doing the online Mastering Bio before lectures. Other than that, an easy A. Exams are pretty straight forward, but do require you to know the material well. In-class activities used a lot and at random times, so its in your best interest to attend class. Lectures could be boring, but Danhart was good at conveying the information

Dr. Danhart is a very straight-forward professor and keeps his slides simple and "to the point". This class has a reasonable amount of mastering/homework outside of class. There are also in-class activities and Tophat, so you earn points by doing those, but he usually offers more point opportunities than needed, so you can miss a few.

Very good instructor. Lectures were always pretty interesting and grading was pretty lenient - most of the points were very easy to earn. Exams were super straightforward (but he expects you to know all the details he gives in lecture). Very nice guy.

Dr. Danhart is overall a good professor. His exams are based on his lecture notes, however the exams go a lot more in depth than the lecture notes so I would recommend watching a lot of videos outside of class or going to his office hours. The grading and weight of assignments in this class is very fair.

Danhart makes it really clear what he expects for students to know for tests in his slides. TopHat points and in-class activities give several opportunities to make up points if you don't do great on the tests. He is super genuine, subtly funny, and cares about his students a lot, even in a giant lecture hall setting

Sometimes staying awake during his lectures was tough. It may be because it was at 9:10AM, but his slideshows can sometimes be lengthy and arduous to endure. Nonetheless, Danhart is a great professor who knows how to teach biology and truly cares about his students' success. He also has a sense of humor that displays his love toward teaching.

Great class, lectures clear and at steady pace, recorded so you can rewatch later for review. Online study materials through Pearson/Mastering were helpful but honestly if you pay attention in lecture and ask questions in recitation you'll be fine. Labs didn't always line up with covered lecture material, but were covered well in Lab manual.

So Danhart is a nice enough guy, but I struggle with the very fine details of the cell, which is what 1113 is. So I found his tests very difficult, and I worked really hard for my grade. Independent of that, he answers emails quick and is overall okay. Go to class though, we did tons of TopHat that really helped my grade and helped me study.

I highly recommend taking him for biology. He is very straight forward. You need to attend lecture to get in class activity and top hat points which are capped so most people get 100%. His tests are directly from his slides but you DEFINITELY need to read. Reading topics he lectures on get you an easy A as long as you do your homework and show up.

Dr. Danhart seems to be a very nice guy and is a pretty good teacher. Says class isn't mandatory, but there are graded TopHats and in-class activities. Some of the lectures are hard to follow, but reviewing through them afterwards does help. Overall, not a bad choice for a professor.

Danhart is a great professor. He cares about his students and if they do well, and hes always willing to help/meet with you outside of class to answer questions. He does in class TopHat questions that seem tedious, but theyre super helpful for review. I recommend reading the book sections before and after lectures. Easy A if you put in the work.

Danhart is a solid professor who cares about his students' success. His exams are incredibly straightforward and although you have to put in work, you can be successful as long as you thoroughly study his lecture notes. Lots of opportunities for points besides exams. Great at responding to emails and meeting outside of class to offer help.

Lectures have TopHat questions throughout for credit. It's not hard to do well. No homework except online prelectures and no textbook use. He taught the first half of the class but it was definitely the better half. Very clear in his lectures, fair on exams, helpful with questions. Genuinely cares about his students. Would definitely take again.

Dr. Danhart is a nice guy, but his class was not set up in a great way. Pre-lecture assignments were not helpful at all when preparing for lectures or midterms. His exams proved to be very difficult, even after going through all of the material. His powerpoints and lecture recordings are online, but in-class activity points and TopHat do matter!

Pre-lecture assignments over readings before every lecture. In-class activities every day for attendance. Very nice guy but lectures were confusing and easy to lose focus. A lot of outside reading necessary to understand the material, and you pretty much have to teach yourself. However, tests not weighted super heavy, therefor room for error!

Super nice guy and professor, cares about your grade and wants you to learn (definitely isnt a I teach for an hour so I can pay for my research kind of guy). The textbook is nice but not necessary to get an A. His slides are an amazing study tool, though they can be a little unclear at times. Responds to emails quickly and very willing to help.
Dr. Danhart really cares about his students. He gives numerous other point opportunities to better your grade if you're not a good exam taker. Overall, just go to class and you will do fine.

I took Biochem 5621 with Danhart. Although I struggled through the class, he made it worthwhile. His lectures are comprehensive and he cares about his students. If i had any other professor for this class, I would've given up immediately.

Professor Danhart was such a great professor. He likes using Tophat and in-class activities to help with your grade and also to see who does attend, but attendance isn't a mandatory thing. Just a fair warning if you skip this class, you will have a tough time passing exams because he makes his exams a little tougher in order to test your knowledge.

He likes to use in class activities and Tophat questions. (the attendance is the questions not actual attendance). The activities worked better than I though they would for a lecture size of 500. He is a solid choice for introductory biology. You have to work for an A but a C should be achievable with minimal work.

Danhart wasn't a bad professor and his exams weren't terribly difficult. If you took AP Bio in high school, this class will be a breeze. Going over lecture slides and in-class TopHat questions will be your most sure-fire way to pass, and honestly his lectures mainly consisted of him reading the PowerPoint slides so attendance isn't that important.
Loved his class!
Tough class, but not too bad if you keep up with homework and stuff. Exams are tough, but there are lots of other points in the class to help your grade.

Engaging lectures, even though it was at 8am. As long as you go to class and pay attention, and keep up with the material, you will do well. Nice guy and always willing to help out in person or by email.

Danhart made exams unreasonably difficult and if you question anything he will respond with attitude or Im unsure. Although you have to read each chapter to be prepared for all exams, he demands you attend his boring lectures that cover NO material needed for exams so you can do a five point class activity.
She doesn't post any notes online, expects us to review every bit of content including useless videos for tests, and does a terrible job explaining concepts. Would never take here again.

Professor Booton is passionate about the material but his lectures can be fast-paced. Practice exams are crucial, and using tools like Unstuck ai alongside the textbook helps cement the concepts. With effort, you can do well in this challenging but rewarding class.

Dr. Booton was really great. I took his course over the summer over 8 weeks, so it was really lecture heavy, but it was not unreasonable. Dr. Booton explains tings really well, just make sure to come to lecture consistently.

Not much work outside of keeping up your lab notebook and lab reports. Exam was easy enough, though there wasn't any practice to prepare for it other than him verbally giving some practice problems in class. A lot of waiting around for the experiment to run though so it could be fairly boring

The worst teacher I have ever had in my 16 years of education. Lecture chapters > 350 slides and completely disorganized. Clusters of mass information are projected and exams are given every two weeks. I taught myself the entirety of the semester. With a 89.4, Dr. Booton would not round my grade. No curve even though he states it in the syllabus.

His lectures are very heavy for example the first module was over 700 pages. He gives you practice exams for the actual exam. Here is my problem he tells you to generate 6-9 of those practice exams. Which I did and still on the actual exam all the extended response weren't on the practice exam. Just be prepared to be disappointed.

Dr. B provides the materials you need to succeed, all you have to do is use them. Go to his office hours, get to know him, and take all of the practice exams. If you do good on the module exams, the final won't be stressful. He also provides a lot of in-class points so make sure to attend even if it isn't required.

Practice exams will definitely help but exams are still pretty hard. I'd recommend taking his recitation 4500E as it's a grade booster and not that much extra work(and a good way to get to know him, he's a very nice guy). Lectures were kind of hard to pay attention and certain concepts I felt he explained fast/poorly. He tries to keep it engaging.

Dr. Booton is a highly engaging lecturer who truly understands the field of genetics and all it entails. His lectures, while they had a lot of slides, were interesting and highly applicable to today's world. Does assign a lot of homework and exams were difficult. Do the practice exams he provides - they are a great help in succeeding in his course.

Prof. Booton is a great guy and fun to talk to. However, his class is difficult with how he sets it up. Each module has about 4-5 lecture slideshows and each one is easily 100-150 slides. He lectures quickly and it is easy to get lost if you miss something. He gives you unlimited practice exams which is the only reason I am passing this class.

Dr. Booton is a decent professor and he taught the material well. My biggest issue with him is that his problem sets fell out of sync with the lectures so we couldn't usually even begin the weekly homework until the night before it was due. Also, he uses TopHat so attendance becomes part of the grade.

Dr. Booton is very knowledgeable and willing to help. He provided plenty of practice materials to help students succeed and provided strong feedback on answers. I felt grading among his TAs was inconsistent in terms of points deducted across questions. Each lecture easily contains 80-100 slides with repetitive information.

So the first time I took MOLGEN4500 with Booton, I failed the class. When I passed, I sat in the front row. To study, I converted the practice exams to quizlets. Exam questions are pulled right from the practice quizzes. Booton also will get to know you if you sit up front and really likes student interaction. Also yes, his office hours are great!
he goes through slides so fast and does not explain them. he goes through 100 slides a day and the slides do not always make sense. i spend most of my time confused in his class

Im not sure why his scores are so low because I thought he was an average/good professor. He was really kind and incorporated funny things into the lectures. He does go fast, but its a STEM course after all. Tests are pretty fair and he offers to help often during class and office hours. His grading scale is different too which made it easier.

Super caring and patient professor. He has a lovely tone and is willing to re-explain slides in another way if you ask. Exams were tricky, but if you use the module self-evaluations you'll do fine. Gives a few weekly assignments per week so you can average a B/B+ on exams and still get an A in the class.
Very boring and repetitive lectures.

Synchronous lecture classes. Lots of assignments due before every new module. One project in the middle of the semester. Uses Tophat for attendance often but even if you missed a few lectures you get full credit. Pretty kind. Majority of exam q's straight off the practice exams so do those multiple times.

Dr. Booton taught the second half of my lecture which was pretty hard to adjust to after having a different prof for the first half. His lectures are very dense and it was less clear with him than with Dr. Picking what we needed to know for exams. Overall, he was a good professor and he is also a very interesting person.

If you ask questions there's a good chance he will find your question stupid. There are a few students he simps for but he always treated me like I was dumb. I guess you have to come to office hours for him to respect your learning efforts. He is very unhelpful and listening to his lectures can be incredibly discouraging.
His class is hard but he is a great teacher. Tests are fairly straightforward and easy

Dr. Booton is by far my favorite professor at Ohio State. Although the class was online this semester he still made every class enjoyable and is just a very kind person. He really wants to make sure you understand the topic and will make sure the class is on the same page before moving on. He was a great help and I really enjoyed him! So sweet

Its a hard class. You HAVE to study and keep up with lecture material. But honestly, if you do the practice quizzes AND review lecture material, the tests are fair. Dr. Booton is very caring. GO TO HIS OFFICE HOURS. Going over the material with him helped me to get an A in the class. He wants students to succeed, you just have to put in the work.

You can really tell that Dr. Booton enjoys teaching and he really tries to keep it interesting for students. He is also always trying to help his students and he is accessible if you need help. This class was difficult when it came to exams, however. There is a lot of material covered in each lecture and tests are heavy on memorization.

I didn't really love Booton's lectures. Really dry and sometimes the in-class assignments were super challenging, same with the Tophat questions. The midterms were difficult but reasonable (you really have to study). I enjoyed the topics discussed but I wish he was more energetic. Gives opportunity to make up pre-lecture credit with study modules.

Honestly, with the COVID-19 pandemic going on, classes became easier because professors became more lenient with the situation. Booton however did not, and all he did to compensate for the pandemic was remove 1 exam from the 5 total which did not help us at all. The final was rigged for no one to finish in time and yet no curve was implemented.

During COVID19, this professor did NOTHING to help his students. Every other professor helped me out considerably while Booton only got rid of an exam (thus getting rid of 100 more points for the semester). The final was challenging and barely anyone finished all questions on time. Also, the avg was too high so there was no curve in the class.

Gives 4 exams before the final, one every two weeks. He flies through the material, maybe 100-130 slides per 55min class. He gives you practices exams (do them as many times as you can) on Carmen.
