Additionally, there were multiple days where most students went well over time and the TAs said that it happens every semester for those specific lab days.

She's great. She teaches the first half of this course and explains things very well. She breaks it down to basic understanding. She'll tell you what things to focus on for the exam and the type of questions to expect. Some trick questions but overall pretty good I thought. If you've taken bio1113 then this class is much much easier. & lab is fun.

I really liked Dr. B. She was phenomenal. I missed an A just by a few points, but I guess it is not that bad. As long as you study to understand the concepts not just memorize them, you'll be fine. The lab exercises are fun albeit long. Go to her office hours. You should focus on the lab notes and the objectives from the manual for the lab quizzes.

I disagree strongly with the negative reviews given to Dr. B. Yes, the lectures hold a lot of information, none of it is inhertly hard though. Don't cram for these exams. Dr. B does a great job telling you what she wants you to get out of each slide. Pay attention to the top hats she gives and the concepts she repeats. I learned a lot!

Dr. B is a great professor. She makes it clear what is on the exams and how you should approach the exams. There is a heavy amount of content, but you're given enough examples of what you should be learning for a good grade in the class. The course itself isn't memorization heavy, so be prepared to understand the why something happens, not what.

The course was dense, and at times could be difficult. Requires understanding of the material & not memorization. Dr. B. really cares if her students were learning, that being said she's not going to put in more work than you, so study! She's very accessible outside of the class! Fantastic lecturer, one of the better professors I have ever had.

Really engaging lectures that make hard material much more understandable than any other stem class I've taken. She assigns a very fair amount of work outside of class including lab and everything I did outside of class helped me learn the material well for exams. She is very caring and helpful when students ask questions. Knows her field!!

Professor Bullwinkle was overall a great professor. Her lecture slides were easy to follow, and she was good lecturer. Overall, the quizzes were hard to ensure students are thoroughly understanding the material. The exams were straight forward questions. She provided a lot of different resources to aid and gave extra credit on quizzes and exams.

Dr. Bullwinkle herself is pretty nice but doesn't always explain concepts well and her exams had me questioning my life choices. Doesn't post lecture recordings for some reason. LOTS of memorization so make sure to start studying early (do not start learning material the night before exams plz). Lab for this class is long but not difficult.
TA's did most of the grading and she wasn't particularly kind
Dense lectures that cover a lot but she's a good teacher! She gives you good information on what will be covered on the exam, and explains slides thoroughly.

Lectures cover LOTS of material, but she's very clear on what needs to be memorized for exams so you can get away with not studying extremely minor details. Bullwinkle is tough but she wants you to pass. I'm not the kind of person who's super smart or has time to spend hours studying everyday and I still got an A on both of her exams. It's doable!
The exams had too much content and there were 5 exams. Lectures were difficult to follow and heavy on powerpoints.

I was anxious about this class before taking it. However, I ended up loving the class. We had 5 exams during the semester, which is a lot. But I preferred frequent exams with lower percentages over less exams that weighed more. Lab was also very helpful with keeping your grade up. One remark is that she reads off the slides.

Dr. B is such a great professor and teaches the material very well. Her exams are always fair and it is easy to do well if you know the information. She is always willing to help out and is reliable when it comes to answering emails. It is a shame that she has to teach the class with Dr. Wetzel. Dr. Wetzel truly ruined microbiology for me.

I really enjoyed when Dr. B taught, she does a great job of giving you the information you need to know in the slides, and the grading is more than fair. Averages are in the 70's, but if you study you can easily get an A. This class was interesting and I learned a lot.

Dr. B was a great lecturer! She made the information easy to understand, and offered various was to study the material. She makes it very clear what will be on the exams, and the exams are pretty fair.

Dr. B is a much better lecturer than Dr. W so enjoy her lectures before they switch. Asks very fair questions on the exams, just make sure you understand what she explains in lecture (memorize what she tells you to - I made a quizlet) and review her tophat and mastering homework.

I liked Dr. Bullwinkle as a lecturer. I feel that if you pay attention it was not hard to do well in the course. Really enjoy the lab portion of this course as its very starightfoward and really fair. Exams can be difficult if you dont study as its a lot of memorize the slides. This class has been on the back burner for me and I have been fine.
I have never studied so much for a class in my life and not have my grade reflect it. Not to mentions she flys through lectures and her tests purposefully try to confuse you.

Great professor and person. Very useful slides and explained content very clearly. She teaches the first half of the class and did very well. I wish she taught the whole semester. If you memorize everything on the slides it wouldn't be hard to get an A.

Dr. Bullwinkle is a good professor and passionate about what she is teaching. If you read the slides thoroughly and have a good foundation of the material, you should do very well on the exams. Material for this class isn't difficult but can be quite dense for certain chapters. The lab portion was also fun and very very low stress.

Dr. Bullwinkle really wants students to succeed in the course and gives students the tools to do so. Lecture slides were well-organized. Exams could be a little vague in spots. Generally very passionate about the course material and about helping students succeed academically.

she's a relatively good professor but you really won't learn anything because she talks so fast. even her recorded lectures are done so quickly you have to listen to them on 0.5x speed. her tests are really difficult be she claims they are fair, which they kind of are if you think a 50% average on all the exams is a fair grade.

I enjoyed Dr. Bullwinkle, however, I did not find her lectures to be very helpful. Would highly recommend reading the textbook! Her quizzes and tests were somewhat challenging but very doable if you study well. She also offers some extra credit!

The quizzes definitely brought down my grade but overall having the option to drop a quiz and a test helped bring my grade back up. Make sure you watch the lectures and take good notes, I usually watched the lectures twice to help me. Her in person review sessions are SO helpful she makes sure you understand the material.

Had her for first half of MICRO4000.01. Listening to lectures and taking thorough notes for studying is key to doing well. TopHat questions seemed a little unnecessary as it took up class time. Quizzes/tests are all on Canvas, but questions are worded weirdly and some topics weren't really discussed in lecture.

The class is flipped format, so the lectures are watched on an asynchronous day and then material is gone over/quizzed on TopHat during in person days. Her prerecorded lectures were extremely long, and did not respect the students' time. Her tests were easy, came directly from notes, and there's 2 drops. She did not give the answers you got wrong.
I found her lectures very interesting to listen to, the course work was just the usual amount not anything terrible. As long as you take good notes you will be fine for the exams in my opinion.

Dr. B literally gives you exam answers in the lectures, so just take good notes during the videos and go to her office hour review sessions. If you do these things you literally cannot get below an A on every exam. When people say her tests are hard, it's only because they most likely never took notes.

I wish she went over the labs before making us answer questions on the material. Shes very helpful, nice, and friendly. The material is just hard to grasp and she doesnt quite help by making exam questions hard to grasp either. The exams are set up for a lecture class, not a lab class.

Dr. B is amazing. Her exams are detailed, but manageable as long as you understand the details of topics taught in lecture. Book is not even required, especially if you go to office hours and pay attention. Not to mention, she is very caring and patient if you do have questions.

I had Dr. Bullwinkle last semester in the spring of 2021 and Im not going to lie, but she was a pretty good professor. She is extremely nice and caring but definitely makes you earn your grade. Take good notes and take pictures and you will do just fine in her class.
She did not teach the concepts well. She could not explain the complex concepts well and left me more confused. Her lectures were very lengthy as well.

She is the more difficult of the two professors who teaches this class. It's not the material but she has an inability to convey complex scientific concepts where students can understand it. Read the book. Exams are very ambiguous and don't have much to complete. An exam example is "Respiration requires" it's not what you think.

She is nice, but her exams are a little bit on the harder side and she her lectures are pretty long for each section. I would recommend going to her review sessions because there are always test questions regarding the information she goes over then.
Honestly did not care about students. Hard exams for material that was never covered in pre recorded lectures or slides. Horrible professor. It is sad she is the only one who teaches this class.

Pay attention to lecture videos and go to OH (40-50/ 700 were there and she's very understanding - never made me feel stupid for asking Qs). Don't read the book - do the exercises she gives you and think about how concepts link together and big picture. Fairly straightforward to pass but hard to do well in.

Required a make-up exam within a week of a death in the family and offered no leniency on this (the death was from a parent very suddenly and proof was provided within the mandatory three days). The makeup exam was in essay format while the original was multiple choice, and she told me this was fair. She made a traumatic situation worse.

- You should read the book instead of relying on the lectures - Exams and quizzes are badly worded and a minute per question - Can't see the questions you missed or how you did compare to the rest of the class - No exceptions for emergencies for exams and quizzes even in a pandemic - Exam content is different and more difficult from lecture content
Her lecture material does not reflect her exams. She is very fast paced during the lecture and does not do a great job with explaining the concepts.

Dr. B's exams have nothing to do with what was talked about in lecture, and are impossible with the time crunch. She clearly doesn't care that her students do well, and does not care that we are all under a lot of pressure with classes being online. Honestly one of the worst professors I've had. do better Dr. B.
Her exams are next to impossible. Do not take!!!! Shes testing on stuff she did not review in lecture, and the questions are worded terribly and confusing.

Dr. B is good! She is clear about expectations and makes sure that all info is on the slides- attending lecture is a must to help solidify concepts! She is very kind and helpful in office hours, and will do everything she can to keep the course fair and doable. You definitely have to put in work, but she is clear about what is expected.

She's a decent professor who cares a lot for her students. If you show up to lecture, take notes, and stay on top of the material, this class is not difficult. There is a lot of material, but Dr. B is willing to sit down with you in office hours which I highly recommend going to. She's the sweetest person and great professor overall.

She is a terrible professor. DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS. Don't even bother listening to her in lecture half the stuff she says she doesn't even test on. Pay attention to materials on slides that are written in very small font. I was really excited to take this class but she made it boring., dry, and uninteresting. Book teaches you more than she can.

Let me make this easy for you. Avoid this class at all costs Shes an amazing person but teaching isnt for this lady. She reads off slides. Her tests have no correlation to what she teaches. Unnecessary top hat questions. Just dont please take micro somewhere else

Dr. B seemed knowledgeable and willing to help her students! She tended to read off the slides for her lectures, but the exams seemed to be based on the content included in the slides. The exams were fair, but a little bit ambiguous at times. She offered 3 points of extra credit during her half of the course!

She was very knowledgable about the subject, but her tests are very challenging. You need to be prepared to work for your grade. It is very important to go to lecture as she mentions things there that are on the exams, Practice the online modules, tophat, study each week and you will most likely get an A.
Dr. B was good, but some of the exam questions were somewhat vague and hard to understand. I found that reading through lectures until I understood every concept was helpful.

She is a fair professor. I enjoyed her section of the class a good amount, as she kept it interesting. The exams weren't too difficult, but did require studying. Studying a decent amount resulted in doing well. Going to lecture and listening definitely helped, as the exams are based off of the PowerPoints.
Doesn't prepare students for exams, doesn't give good slides, doesn't explain things long enough. Is not clear what she wants us to learn.

Great professor! She makes her exams off of her powerpoint and not from book. Exams were vary fair and not super difficult. You need to study but it not a horrible class. She is fair and throws out questions that don't make sense or weren't written well. Also does unannounced extra credit so go to class. I would take a class with her again!

Was expecting hard class and hard professor from reading on here. Dr. B is one of the best profs I've had at OSU. Makes otherwise seemingly difficult material easy to understand. Does give unannounced extra credit so I recommend going to lecture. Usually does out of class review the day or week before exam, highly recommend, good time for questions

Dr. B was okay. She read a lot of the material off the slides, but she was always quite clear on her expectations when it came to what we needed to know. Exams were difficult but quite fair. The class is fast paced and her lectures could get mundane, but it could definitely be worse. Lab is useless and barely related to lecture, but a grade booster

when i asked a lot of people about this class they made it seem very hard and it really isn't. Regarding Dr. Bullwinkle, you can 100% skip class and do well on her exams because she goes right from the slides. However, about Dr. Mia, if you dont go to class you are screwed, she uses a lot of her examples on exams. Lab exam can hurt your grade.

I liked Dr. Bullwinkle, she seemed really nice and she enjoyed teaching. Her material was just really dry and boring, and she wasn't very interesting to learn from. She reads directly off the slides and doesn't elaborate, so it's incredibly difficult to listen to. The MasteringHW is a great way to study though!

I thought this class would be a lot more difficult from the things that I have heard people say. Bullwinkle was a good professor and if you go to class then you wont have an issue with her or the material. She gives some examples in class that will be on her exams. The mastering assignments are an easy way to study and actually learn the material.

Prof. B was very mediocre. It's hard to pay attention in class or find what she is saying remotely interesting because she just reads off the slides and doesn't really answer questions when they're asked (gives a very general/unsure answer). Make sure you study the slides & look into things you don't fully understand (Don't bother with the booK.
Dr. Bullwinkle is straightforward with her expectations. Follow her suggestions, figure out her style, and put in some work and the class should go smoothly.

Dr. B is an amazing instructor and she is very very sweet! Her lab really is the climax of the microbiology major and it's heavy genetic and biochemical basis. Her three midterms are difficult and rely heavily on knowing the experimental rational, and her homeworks are tricky, but she is more than willing to help her students succeed.

i've seen reviews that said she read off the slide a lot or said umm a lot but those were from 2 years ago so she must have drastically changed because just the other day I was thinking to myself how great of a presenter she is. Everything you need to know is on the slides. i crammed the day before the exam and got a good grade just from the slides

This was my favorite class I've taken as part of my degree because Dr. Bullwinkle makes it super easy to understand what's going on and is really clear about what's going to be on the exams. Also, the exams are incredibly fair.

it's hard to avoid reading off of slides in micro; i thought dr. bullwinkle was perfectly fine in that aspect. he seemed like she cared about our learning and our success, and i learned a lot. the class structure requires hw from the book. i don't really think you need to read to do well on the exams but you need it for the hw.

She gives very clear lectures. I liked her a lot as a person too. Still had to read the textbook, but exams weren't too bad. Not a lot of points in the course, so that makes getting a good grade hard. Really enjoyed the content and lab was super easy and fun.

Overall, if you just memorize the slides (she posts them online) it should be an easy A. Attending lecture can be helpful to learn what she focuses on, but not attending would't affect your grade that much. Online homework is easy, but not worth many points. Lab can seem overwhelming at first, but is mainly participation (no lab reports like chem).

She has the worst slides I have ever seen done by a professor, they each have maybe three words on them if you're lucky & the rest are pictures that half the class doesnt understand. When studying for her exams you have BAD slides about a topic & are then expected to know everything about it for the exam. Book required but doesnt help with studying

As far as bio classes go this one was one of the easier ones I've taken.   She is good at explaining things and very approachable in office hours.  Her slides can be unorganized which is why you need to go to class to know what is actually important. You will be required to buy the etextbook.
Reads directly from the slides, so there's no point to going to lecture. If you have the lab though- its ridiculously easy.

Dr. Bullwinkle taught a great class! She was always very helpful and accessible outside of class. The lab is challenging but at a level where it should be a majors class (personally I thought it was very straightforward). She worked around some difficult schedules and even moved some homeworks to lighten the course load.

Dr. B is one of the best profs at OSU and certainly in the Microbio department. She genuinely cares about students understanding and being able to apply the material that's being taught. If you have questions, she's more than willing to help out. Very approachable and doesn't make you feel bad for asking questions. Quizzes are tough but fair.
She does a fine job. Memorize what she says and subsidize with the notes. Didn't use the textbook once. Homework kind of pointless but worth points.

Although the class was challenging, if your taking it it's your major so you should be used to it by now. Dr. Bullwinkle went above and beyond to help the students and was open to our opinions. I really felt like she valued us and helped us learn and grow as scientists. She definitely knew her stuff, was well organized and made a hard class fun!
Friendly professor and caring. Attendance not mandatory; she reads straight off the slides. If you study each slide and double-check the book for extra info, you will do fine on the exams.

This class was terrible. She reads directly from slides and says "uhhh" a lot. Also told us not to study for certain things on the exam that she ended up testing over. Her slides are overcomplicated and confusing. She is NOT helpful to learning the material. Just throws it all at you and expects you to know everything. Terrible class.

Bullwinkle (not the bar) is a decent lecturer, but she pretty much just reads straight off the slides. Honestly, don't feel bad if you skip lecture every once and a while because she posts the slides and they are pretty detailed and easy to study from. Also Hitchcock 131 is also great for naps... completely unrelated though

A nice lady, and easy exams. Test material comes straight from lecture slides. However, lecture is painfully boring and she just reads off the slides. Would recommend another microbio professor just to learn and retain the info. But overall, easy class and lecturer

Bullwinkle makes great power point slides and is generally pretty easy to understand in lecture. As long as you generally have some idea of what's going on and remember a little but from the intro Bio courses you should be set. Exams were extremely manageable.

Dr. Bullwinkle is a very sweet lady, but a very boring (and anxious) lecturer. I spent three-fourths of her lectures responding to emails on my computer and still did very well in the class. It was a joke. She reads directly off the slides with no incentive to come to class. I don't understand why I didn't stop attending lecture sooner.
Lectures were really boring. She was unclear and repetative

Dr. Bullwinkle made great PowerPoints but struggled presenting them. Would change from topic to topic mid-slide and wasn't always super explanatory. If you take the time to use the slides after lecture alongside the book to help explain the topics then you will definitely be fine. Some test questions are in the online notecard system which is nice.

Alright, so I had Dr. Bullwinkle for the first half of this semester, and  at the time, I didn't think she was that great. I thought she was boring and could be better. However, everything changed when Dr. Hopper came. I take back the bad things I said about her. Hopper is SO awful and makes her look like a great saint. Really, appreciate her.

I personally enjoyed Dr. Bullwinkle. Her midterm questions are more application based, so you actually need to know understand concepts. She is very willing to help in office hours and is very personable.

She is a terrible lecturer and always says "um" while she's taking which makes her seem unknowledgeable of what she is talking about. She also tries to assign seats and do  group activities in a 400 person lecture which never works. She basically just reads off of slides and still doesn't make sense. Only went to class to get participation points

Just took the first midterm and got a B. It was very easy. Only reason I did not get an A was because I only studied the night before the exam. I did not use the book. MOSTLY everything that is on the exam was said in lecture so write everything down Lots of points outside of the 3 exams so even failing midterms will allow you to pass the class
Lectures make you want to cry because they are so boring. She reads straight off the slides and somehow manages to still say stupid things that are completely obvious.

Dr. L is an excellent professor. I've had her for EEOB 2510, 4550, and 4520. She's clear with expectations, always available outside class, and genuinely wants students to succeed. The work and class can be challenging due to the content, but if you put in the effort, you'll definitely do well. I highly recommend taking any of her classes!

Best lectures!!! She's very sweet and friendly, and really does care about her students. She is accessible outside of class and so so helpful. She wants you to succeed. I cannot say enough good enough things about this professor, I cannot wait to take one of her classes again. If you put in the effort in this class you will succeed.
I love her! So nice. Good for quick learner who gets bored easily. Labs tough.

expect intensive lectures which are very interesting! she is a funny person and informative professor; the animals we learn about are really cool to understand; while the material is a little hard, if you engage with the lectures outside of class, the exams are not terrible. there are reading quizzes on articles each week, outlined on syllabus!
She is amazing. Take her if you get the opportunity. Her classes aren't that hard either, I have had her like 5 times and got an A each time!

Erin is an amazing professor! She is so kind and caring to her students, and you can tell she really wants you to succeed in her classes. I also had her teach my lab section of EEOB 3520, and she was just as amazing. The class content is difficult, and sometimes she can stray off topic in lecture. The exams are difficult, but homework is easy.
She's alright. Doesn't answer emails and can be pretty unclear during lectures. Good at answering questions at least!

She has the energy of a golden retriever (very nice and caring but SO MUCH energy). Her lectures are hard to follow, mostly because she talks really quick and starts sentences over multiple times. She genuinely cares for her students and will make time to talk about the material and grades. Exams are very hard - not enough time and math heavy.

Dr. Lindstedt is very passionate about what she teaches! She also is open/flexible to let students come to office hours/receive help with post-grad plans. The only thing negative I have is her exams are extremely difficult compared to lectures/book. They are extended response/math heavy and she doesn't give enough time for the amount of questions.
One of the best professors at Ohio State. Would highly recommend taking her classes.
Great lecturer! Can tell she really is passionate about the material!
Nice but that doesn't make up for the fact that she didn't explain the material well.

Erin is so adorable! She really wants her students to do well, and tries to get to know you if you attend regular office hours. She is a pretty fair teacher, and, as long as you do your work, you should do well!
This class was pretty easy, if you pay attention you should have no problem getting at least a B. She lets class out early pretty often. Also, she's a smokeshow, so I highly recommend this class.

She is by far the best profesor in the EEOB department. Her class was clear and easy to follow. She knows what she is talking about and is so approachable. If you hare having any troubles with the class I wouldn't hesitate to go up to her and ask for help. Nicest person ever and a true teacher that cares about her students.

LOVE LOVE LOVE ERIN! TAKE ANY CLASS SHE TEACHES, YOU WILL NOT REGRET IT. She is so nice and helpful and made an hour and 20 minute class seem to be 30 minutes long. She's so passionate about teaching and is very approachable, almost like you're talking to a friend. I wish I would have taken more classes with her. (not to mention shes a fair tester)

She loves what she does and it makes it so much easier to learn. Random participation points are given in class so attendance is pretty much mandatory, but they are super easy. Would take another one of her classes in a heartbeat

You will never have a professor as excited about teaching as Lindstedt. She makes class upbeat with her bubbly personality. Organismal Diversity is a fun class. Mostly dissections and keeping of notebooks. Pay attention to notebook feedback and you'll do fine!

Dr. Mendes is an incredible professor! As long as you come to the lecture and pay attention, it is very hard to do poorly in this class. The smaller assignments have a much larger impact on your grade so be sure to get all of the attendance points and to complete the homework!
His tests were very unfair. He would test us on material that had never come up in the lecture and then tell us to "read the textbook" without telling us what to focus on.

Attendence isn't mandatory but TopHat is used about every lecture for points. He does get off topic during his lectures a lot but it's all for a purpose. He is very interested in the topics at hand. Overall great professor. If you're planning on taking this class, make sure you read the textbook and know details.

Dr. Chiucchi is a really good guy, but his lectures were not very well organized. He often got side tracked during lecture. He also expects you to learn the content outside of lecture from videos on his carmen which are very boring. His exams were tough but I didn't think they were tough compared to other professor's exams I have taken.

Dr.Chiucchi is an amazing person, but he is not a good professor. The class is plagued with disorganized content, confusing exam questions, and no practice actually reflective of the exams. You watch lecture before class and do useless tophat during, so if you hate this, avoid the class. Focus on your lab grades because they can save your grade.

Dr. Chiucchi is a very nice guy, not a great teacher (I think his ratings are inflated due to that). He teaches in a confusing style, cancels A LOT of class time, and stretches out explanations in lecture. The lab and lecture do not line up, and the joke of a lab was terrible. I do like his passion, teaching metacognition, analyzing graphs, etc.

Dr. Chiucchi is a really cool and laid back guy. Material was interesting to learn as well. Lab kinda blows and its graded somewhat strictly. My biggest problem was the exams. They do not correlate well with the material that is barely being taught through his lecture videos. They were borderline unfair. Cool professor, sub-par exam style.

Prof was always late to class and you have to attend to get points. Young prof goes off on wild tangents, extremely difficult to understand his lectures, exams are extremely difficult. Prof doesn't create atmosphere conducive to learning. Inability for students to adapt in harsh learning conditions results in lower "grade fitness" to overall GPA.

The worst professor I've taken. He doesn't bother to show up on time, is always a few minutes late, and then has the audacity to keep everyone after the allotted time. Makes tests unnecessarily hard and relies on outdated team projects which basically determine your entire grade. Very difficult to keep a good grade, and gives no practice material.

Prob my least favorite science professor I've taken. I heard good things, but man he drives me nuts. Doesn't bother to come to class on time, his answers to questions are so drawn out that I forget what we're even talking about at times, and the tests were not easy. I wouldn't say I don't recommend him, I just didn't particularly enjoy his class

I love Dr. Chiucchi! He was very funny in his lecture and made learning bio fun. You need to go to lecture to answer the Top Hat questions. Tests were easy and he emphasized the important things you needed to know beforehand

He is honestly one of the best professors. If you are willing to take notes outside of class then it is very easy. Going to lecture was mandatory for easy tophat points. His lectures are fun and most days we wouldn't even do anything. He doesnt teach you anything that you dont need to know for the exams. Exams were exactly what he taught in notes

You need to come to lectures for 70 top hat points! Dr. C was a decent professor but he didn't like the online format very much. Exams can be tricky but the textbook helps reinforce lecture concepts. Grades are largely dependent on your TA and some rough grading. Be proactive, put in the effort, and ask questions to do well!

He is MUCH MUCH better in person. Seems very unorganized and less interested in teaching now that things are online. Also (and this may be do to carona) he is IMPOSSIBLE to reach, if you email him you get an automated email back saying "please wait 2-3 business days for a reply". Hes a great and funny dude, just wait till class is in person again.

heard his class was easy. lecture seemed pretty straightforward and top hat questions were easy and simple. thought i was prepared for the first exam. NOPE. got a 68. never have gotten below a B on an exam before. he does not prepare you well for the exams at all as they are way more complex than the top hat qs. wish i could change my prof.

People really like Chiucchi, but he is not my fav. Lab is hard and this class is very dependent on those grades. He says exams dont have trick questions, but at lot do have one piece of info in paragraph that dictates the answer which can be tricky. Go to lecture because tophat gives you free points, and i suggest taking notes on his slides.
Dr. Chucci is a pretty funny guy but he does not know how to present the material in a way that is easy to learn. His notes are scattered and his tests are difficult to prepare for.

He's a very funny and caring professor. This course is very passable, but you have to be willing to put in some work. He is very accessible outside of class. The labs in this course are incredibly easy, too.

Hes aight. Nice guy whos clearly passionate about the subject, but slides often include a lot of info that is not relevant to what is tested on. I did find a lot of the material to be interesting. Exam scores barely affect your grade somehow, and there is no hw to boost you up. Your lab TAs grading will pretty much determine your overall grade.

Dr. Chiucchi is a good lecturer and cares about his students success. However, this course has a lot of the problems 1113 did. Exams are hard to prepare for (no practice exams) and it is unclear what content will be tested on and what is just important stuff to know. Course can be unnecessarily difficult, as I got the same grade in here as in OChem

Easily my favorite professor of my college career. If you're reading this Chiucchi, ily. Don't let the haters bring you down. - Lots of office hours/personal help - Very funny and personable - Cuffs his jeans - Drinks lots of tea - Plays soccer with colleagues - Likes dogs - Hates when people misuse the word "adaptation" - Individuals don't evolve

Jimmy is a relaxed, funny guy that teaches 1114 well. I studied about two hours the day of all the exams and got As on all of them -- he's definitely not out to trick anyone with his questions. The worst part about the course is by far the lab component. I would definitely recommend Chiucchi over the other 1114 teachers if you can.

Makes simple content necessarily complex and confusing. His lecture slides are unorganized, and they are your only resource besides the book (which doesn't align with his lectures). He often can't figure out his own exam and tophat questions when he attempts to explain them the class. Was disappointed by this course.

I loved Dr. Chiucchi. He is hilarious and there is no homework outside of lab & a final research paper. Lab assignments are easy and completed in groups. The textbook is not required (I never looked at it despite having it from Bio 1113) and he posts his lecture slides. (I used solely his slides to study for exams and ended with a 97)

I took this class, because I saw that he was an easy teacher. BUT DO NOT LET THIS FOOL YOU. He doesn't know the answers to his own tophat or exam questions. There is no homework, leaving you with no way to practice. His exam study guides are a jokes and half the stuff on them he admits he forgot to put on the the test. He is funny but not helpful.
Very chill professor tests are straightforward and fair
Seems clueless about his students and what he's supposed to be teaching. Spends a lot of class time talking about himself. He's basically the Donald Trump of biology teachers.

Chiuacchi is unorganized and barely knows the answers to his own exam questions. He doesn't explain things well and will spend an entire lecture trying to explain, and then he will play catch up because he wasted so much time in class. He shoves all the material that he didn't cover onto the final.

Dr. Chiucchi is an amazing professor! He makes lectures really interesting. His tests are not that hard as long as you pay attention in lectures and go over the power point that he posts. He is also very easy to talk to so don't be afraid to go to his office hours and ask him questions!! He is seriously the best professor that I ever had!!!

Dr. C is hilarious! He keeps his lectures interesting with funny videos and makes the material easy to learn. The lab portion and the final paper make up the biggest part of your grade so if you don't do well on his tests, which are pretty easy, you'll still pass!

He is redundant, confuses himself, and his lectures are boring. He is terrible at writing TopHat and Exam questions which is really annoying. His class is too easy but he is friendly and for a class with relatively easy concepts it isn't bad. Also I can't believe he is rated hot, have any of you sat up front or actually talked to him after class?
Dr. Chiucchi is a great professor. What determined my grade was the lab portion, so getting a good TA is important

One of the best science classes I've taken at OSU. Lectures are required in order to get in class TopHat points but he makes the material enjoyable and easy to understand. He also made me laugh at least once a lecture. Unlike other science department classes, Dr. Chiucchi has a fair grading system/style. Wish he taught more of my classes.

Solid professor. In my opinion, he made the material interesting. However, sometimes his lectures became rambling and his power point notes sometimes didn't help too much when studying. Overall though, his exams were very fair and he kept the class interesting. He seemed to care about students learning and enjoying the material.
Keeps lectures interesting, tests are based on his slides not the book, as long as you have a decent TA you're set.

I got As on the midterms and final and still was fighting for my grade because the TA graded so horribly. There was even a "curve" or basically 5 free points added to even out the grades. Horrible lectures. He doesn't really care. Do not recommend.

Getting a B- to an A- is pretty easy as long as you show up to class, put some effort in, and study the slides for the exams. An A, however will take some work. His exams are kind of annoying, but doable. You have to attend lectures for tophat, but he is all over the place during lecture and it's hard to follow him and pay attention.

OK everyone loves this guy because he's got a dry sense of humor and tries to be cool, but really his lectures are all over the place and his attempts at fitting in are repulsive. He also never answers emails and comes across as arrogant when you talk to him in person. His class is pretty easy if you study the slides, but lectures a waste

The best professor I have EVER had. I failed the first exam and was devastated, so he suggested I start going to office hours, which helped tremendously throughout the semester. He was SO helpful, has a great personality, and loves/cares for his students. Lectures are very fun/interesting & labwork is awesome. Take his class. You wont regret it.
Okay, he is honestly the best professor. Funny, smart, clear. It's not hard to pass, but not easy to get an A. PLUS he's so hot you definitely won't want to skip class.

If you want an A, you need to attend class. An A is attainable but you have to work for it. He provides several opportunities to earn points, so it would be difficult to fail. It is true that he is pleasing to behold.
Dr. Jimmy is very enthusiastic about biology. His lecture was always entertaining and fun. Lecture wasn't always well coordinated with the lab work, but I still enjoyed 1114. He's funny too.
He's passionate

Dr. Chiucchi is the ideal professor. He tells you what he wants you to know and doesn't try to trick you. Still, you NEED to study. This class is NOT an "easy A." Most of the points come from lab and the TAs are tough!  You will learn a lot if you take the course seriously. Also, he has a fabulous sense of humor and is VERY easy on the eyes! :)

Chiucchi has been my favorite prof. so far. He truly cares for his students and makes an effort  not to trick them on exams. Book is not necessary - everything comes from PP - and his slides are concise about what you need to know. He's funny and entertaining, and I would gladly take another class taught by him. Take his class!
Best prof I have had at OSU. Would take every class with him if possible

He was a great professor. Really funny and makes lecture interesting. His tests are based off of his lectures, but I still found the questions somewhat difficult and abstract. Overall, a really good guy... but be ready to study and think critically.

He is willing to answer every students question in lecture. He was very clear and made topics easy to understand. He does get distracted sometimes and we get out of subject, but that's what made class fun. Awesome professor.

I really liked him as a person and would definitely recommend his class. At first I wasn't a total fan of the way he lectures, but it really grows on you. He actually tells you not to buy the textbook, so the exams are totally based on his powerpoints which is nice. 2 papers, but they weren't difficult at all. Overall good class and super cool guy.

Good looking guy. Lectures move really slow but the concepts are discussed in depth. Don't need book, lecture slides are all you need. Midterms and finals are important. There are two scientific research related writing assignments  in the class. Not very difficult. Test are easy but the course is not an easy A. Uses Tophat. So go to classes.

The content of the class itself was pretty easy, lab portion was a lot of busy work. Lectures consist of 400ish students and he pretty much never or very slowly responds to emails, so hopefully you have a good TA. What I loved most was that he made his own lecture slides and you could just study the powerpoints for exams

Dr. Chiucchi was very engaged in his lectures and it's easy to see that he really loves what he teaches. Sometimes he would go off topic and that pushed our schedule back a few times but he made lectures enjoyable. He was also really funny and poked fun at students. Tests were straight from his lectures, so review all of his powerpoints.

Jimmy is an awesome person who you would definitely like to hang out with, but he is an unclear lecturer. He has discussion in a 400 person lecture and never really clarifies what the right answer is. He leaves most things up to interpretation, which isn't great in a science course. Overall, it's a decent class and he is good looking so that helps.

The lectures are actually a really good representation of the exams so textbooks aren't needed. There is a grade for showing up to class to answer questions. He's a pretty engaging lecturer, and was helpful when I met up with him in office hours. Most laid back professor I've had at OSU. The only thing hard about the class was the labs.

-participation only matters for tophat, other than that his PPT's are online and say exactly what you need for exams -exams are easy enough, no tricks -no need for text book -lab matters, be nice to TA, be ready for quizzes  -writing assignments were easy enough

Dr. Chiucchi is easily one of my favorite professors at OSU. If you spend time to get to know him he's a great guy, but even if you don't he is still a great lecturer and teacher. He clearly conveyed concepts and was pretty clear about what was on the test. To do well on the tests you do need to know definitions and apply the concepts.
Doesn't use the book at all. All the exams are based off his power point lectures which you have to study. Labs were a lot harder than lecture

The class itself was great! The exams were not too difficult, but not that easy. I feel like you have to be a good test taker to do really well. Or just study really hard. Lab was the part that brought my grade down. My TA was just a really hard grader, but still you have to try in lab in order to pass the class!

Dr. Chiucchi is probably the best professor I have had at OSU. I hope he reads this because he deserves to know how much I enjoyed his class. He lectures were extremely clear and his tests were more than manageable. He was also very fair and did not ask too much of his students. I wish all professors at OSU were as nice and engaging at him.
HES SO FREAKING CUTE!!!!!
After getting a C+ in 1113 with Weinstein, I actually loved 1114 and because of him I am now a Biology major. Great class, no textbook needed.

Dr. Chiucchi is a great teacher and advisor. Uses clickers so you need to come to class. Final exam wasn't cumulative. Tests are fair, not too difficult but you have to study to get a good grade. Pretty laid back guy, and easy to talk to.

I loved this class and Dr. Chiucchi. He's really funny and he actually made the classes interesting and made me enjoy going to class. His tests are pretty much straight off his powerpoints and clicker questions and are super easy if you pay attention in lecture. I'm honestly going to miss this class. Not to mention he is a flaming red pepper.

Easiest class I have taken here so far. Go to lecture for clicker points and just study his power points. He never tries to trick you and really wants everyone to do well. I would definitely recommend him.

Dr. C is a great professor!  His lectures weren't too boring.  The only time they were a little rough was when you can tell he was only talking to hear himself speak.  I personally liked the classes best when he showed up in his black sweater. The tests were based on notes and not on the book, which made me angry for wasting money on the book! $$

Dr Chiucchi is HOT. I mean his parents must be Gods to have created such a beautiful son. Besides that, his tests are solely based off his powerpoints and he uses clickers. He can be funny at times and tries to make class interesting. However, he talks about his research a little too much and I only paid attention during movies.

Dr. Chiucchi was a good professor, his class was solely based off his powerpoint notes and exams were very fair and not that hard if you studied. The lab practical was tough so definitely study hard for that. Actually try in lab because that actually brought my grade down rather than save it.
I don't want to say too much. Class is interesting. But this course ruined my interest on Biology.

Professor Chiucchi has definitely been one of the better professors I've had so far. He is a good, clear lecturer and has his notes up ahead of time. He is very fair and whenever there was an incorrect or debatable quiz or exam question, he was willing to look into it and give back points. He doesn't use the book at all, exam are based off notes.

Jimmy was a great professor. Funny and good looking. He never used the textbook and only tests you on notes FROM HIS LECTURE. He explains everything well and doesn't try to confuse you. All of his lectures (most of the time) were posted BEFORE lecture and he keeps them all on carmen throughout the entire semester. He uses clickers for points.
Great guy who loves his students and is very open to discussion, especially during lectures. Get to know him! Also an advisor, so he has a wealth of information even outside the realm of biology.

Dr. Chiucchi really cares about his student's learning and wanting them to succeed, but also understanding the subject. He's passionate in his lecture and makes attending lecture enjoyable, but it also helps that he's cute. The book is not really necessary, if you go to lecture and pay attention.

Dr. Chiucchi is a pretty laid back professor so the class is manageable. He is super funny and wants his students to succeed. Lecture is somewhat mandatory as you get clicker points but they're easy points to get
Fantastic professor, really clear and his exams are fair.  Basically doesn't use a book, but there really isn't a need for one.  One of my all time favorites.

Literally my favorite lecture. He is such a great teacher and honestly wants to help his students succeed. He makes sure that he covers everything on his exams and then makes the exams very fair. His questions are easy to understand and he doesn't try to trick students :)
He's based, but not the Based God. He is helpful, engaging, and brings laughter to class when it starts to get boring
Very clear, engaging, approachable, and funny.
Jimmy is amazing, uses clickers so need to go to class but i also found the questions helpful and engaging. He is super nice and also very cute!

He's a lab TA for Bio 113. Jimmy's very willing to help and always comes prepared. He's a nice guy and he's patient with his students. He's pretty laid back and relates to us well, but he definitely puts work before play. Good-looking guy with a pretty smile. He made lab enjoyable.

Every class he complained about something in his personal life via long petty rants. He would flirt with students making the class uncomfortable. Also, he was condescending when students asked questions instead of engaging in self-reflection regarding the nature of his job. He was commonly insecure, which had an obvious effect on his teaching.

The class structure made sense and was straight-forward, but I do not think he put much effort into the course material. His lecture slides were very basic and simple, not very interesting. Also, he talks very quickly and it is sometimes difficult to hear what he is saying.

Have him for GE launch seminar. Easy grader, pass/fail class. He kinda understands that no one really wants to take the GE seminar haha. He's funny, tells good anecdotes, although sometimes feels like I'm being indoctrinated. I'm pretty liberal and it still feels like he's trying to push me further left. Otherwise he's nice, would recommend.
Dr D is passionate about teaching. I enjoy his class, even though I struggle. Tests are difficult as well. He cares about us passing and doing well in his class.
He expects you to work but doesnt have unrealistic expectations. Pretty funny and gives good feedback

Hes a good person, however, hes a bad teacher. Exam questions dont even relate to exams. And homework doesnt even help you in studying for the exams. I am a Bio major and now Im even questioning my major. If you do take his class just drop for another teacher or another class.

Dr. D was a solid choice for this class. His exams werent that hard as long as you studied and asked questions just for any other course. He was generous and gave multiple opportunities for extra credit and giving points back on an exam. Stuck to the syllabus and was a laid back but respectful, professional guy.

He can be condescending at times, and it can be frustrating to get a clear answer. He isn't nearly as bad as people make him out to be, but he can be a handful. You need to take detailed notes - in some cases just printing diagrams from the powerpoints for your notebook - but it is doable with a minimal amount of effort.

Dr. D was a good professor, you had to study a lot to do good on the exams which is normal and expected for any college class. Did not give study guides though which was kind of annoying because half of the notes wouldn't be on the exams. Was sometimes hard to pay attention in lecture but other than that I had a good time in his class

Overall not bad but not awesome either. Does in class quizzes for grade. Exams are moderately difficult. The course material is hard but doable. lectures aren't awesome, but do attend. Funny guy. Wears nice shirts.

Tests were basically based on lectures (powerpoint slides). I had already taken AP Bio and therefore had read the Campbell book. All I did was study the slides--and easy A. He mumbles a lot, which gets annoying and confusing. Other than that, he's nice and funny, but tests are definitely a challenge. We had pop assignments in class so had to attend
Dr. D isn't for everyone, but I found him easy to connect to and laid back. He's helpful and cares about your understanding of information.
tough professor,much better than hopper though

Dr. D is great at lecturing. I know people disagree with me, but I found that he explains things clearly. I know he mumbles but he tries not to. I recorded his lectures so that helped. His tests are based off his slides and lectures. Clicker questions were helpful and he put them on his tests. I got Bs on his exams while Weinstein, I got Ds.

He was good at first although he mumbles and doesn't always explain everything clearly. Clicker questions are used as attendance for 1 point a day. Quizzes are easy as all questions can be found online on Quizlet. Exams are out of control. 60% average with NO CURVE. Find another prof if you can.

I never take the time to do these reviews, but this one was necessary. If you ever get Dr. D'Orazio as a professor.. RUN. Drop the class while you can. His tests were unbearably hard and he made you feel like an idiot when asking questions. I am an A student and have never struggled with a class as much as this one.

Dr. D'Orazio ruined Biology.  First off, in lecture, you cant understand a damn word he says.  He mumbles.  His material is poorly explained.  His tests are basically impossible.  Run, run far way and do not look back.  I should have listened.  No matter how hard you study, the potential for an F is always a possibility.

Lectures covered surface while tests asked for much more detailed information. Definitely want to read and re-read textbook, though certain information was only mentioned in class. Man is also a fitness buff, so if it relates to muscles or health, take a note and star it. It will be on exam. Try to find more difficult problems than are in textbook.

Dr. D'Orazio was an extremely difficult professor. I found this class even harder than chemistry not because of the material, but because of how it was taught. If you do not read the textbook you will not get anything better than average on a test. The class averages were around a 60-65 where other sections were around a 75-80. Unnecessarily hard.

Dr. D'Orazio had bad ratings, and he admitted that he had changed due to the ratings. I definitely loved him as professor. He had lectures that were easy to follow. I did not even try to learn but the way he taught engaged me. His clicker questions were great and he even used some on his exams. I did not touch the book and got Bs on my exams.

His lectures are confusing. He will tell you that you don't need to know certain things for exams that are in his powerpoint, and skip through multiple slides. The material itself is not the difficult part, it's just poorly taughtorganized. He will tell you that you don't need the book but if you want higher than a C you better have it.

D'Orazio is a pretty tough professor. He knows what he's talking about and expects everyone to know everything. He can be jerk at times. Take pics of the clicker questions because they are not available to you and may show up on exams. Overall, this class was challenging and harder than an intro level bio class should be.

Not the worst professor I've had, but definitely challenging. Attendance is mandatory and recording lectures is helpful  since he moves through the material fast and mentions small details that will be on an exam. Listen to lectures and go though the book. The class not impossible. Also, don't be afraid to ask for clarification on an exam.
He mumbles and talks extremely fast so it's difficult to understand. He offers no help and expects an illogical amount of effort from the students. If you get this professor run away.

Dr. D is one of the tougher professors I've had. He is very passionate about what he teaches. In my experience, if you need help in the class, just ask him and he can be very helpful! He does require a lot of work and effort out of his students.
He taught the first half of class. He mumbles a lot and quizzes/exams are way harder than anything he goes over in lecture. Mostly read the book. No curve.
Worthless. Exams were hard, unclear, averaged between 60-70 and no curve. The course coordinator amy kulesza was also very unhelpful. Neither cares to see you succeed. Avoid at all costs

Just don't. Seriously the worst professor I've ever had. You can't understand what he's saying, he goes through slides ridiculously fast, and his tests are so much harder than an intro level bio classes tests should be. He's also rude and condescending towards students and in general. Hate him, and because of him I now hate biology as well.
I would avoid this professor if you can, his tests are ridiculously difficult and I honestly loved biology before this class.

I loved bio coming into this class, but he managed to make me hate it. He words his exam questions horribly and expects you to remember tiny details. He'll go through a ton of unnecessary information in the grand scheme of things. Nothing stuck and it was really a waste of time. Study his slides and maybe get some back up from the textbook.
cannot understand what he is saying lecture, isn't clear, doesn't annunciate. just reads from the slides. exams are 10x harder than clicker questions

This is the worst professor I've ever had. He is unclear, fast paced and doesn't answer your questions. He's rude. He doesn't give resources to study from either. Clicker questions are not available unless you take a picture of the slides. I hate him.

Very uninspiring. Does not explain topics clearly, if at all... You will be reading every textbook chapter for specific details. Exam averages ranged 65-73 for my section with NO CURVE. He is very condescending. Related asexual reproduction to Peyton Manning.
Not a good professor. You can't hear him during lecture and you basically only learn from the textbook. One kid tried to ask a question during class and D'Orazio made him feel like an idiot.

He is very interested in the material, but also expects a LOT from students. Attendance might not be mandatory, but clicker questions are heavily used. If you don't read the chapter prior to class, then it can be difficult to get them correct. He isn't the easiest grader and exams require a lot of application of concepts; you can't just memorize.
Anthony was a super hard professor! He assumed everyone understood the material. His test questions were super hard and complicated.

make sure you read the textbook and assigned chapters prior to going to class.  you'll need to buy a clicker.  he does clicker questions everyday so you must attend.  he doesn't really answer questions, he just says "it's in the book". he's a cool guy and easy to talk to, but not the best teacher

Cool guy, but I had I hard time understanding him during lecture. I think his mike was too low? He uses clicker questions a lot and they are for POINTS so attend class! Also, he posts online notes that you can fill in during lecture which is nice. But, seriously, READ THE BOOK. The class is fast paced!
Very interactive, and helpful. Some people say he is a hard grader, but he uses mostly scantron so he grades very fairly in my opinion. He does not get off track often and when he does its about bio.
He sucks on grading!! I advice you not to take him.

Anthony is a cool guy, but sometimes is a little rough on grading, but usually fair. Assignments sometimes aren't clear, but overall not terrible. Not awesome at explaining things, but he tries. Not recommended for intro classes, but fine for advanced.
Anthony seemed to care more about talking about his muscles and crazy diets than anything else. He was way too tough a grader for a freshman bio class, but at least he answered questions.

Nice guy, but a really tough grader. Probably a little too tough a grader for a freshman bio class. To his credit, he is very good about answering questions and helping students out with the material.

Anthony is actually a really nice guy, and is genuinely interested in helping you learn, even though he looks scary. He grades very hard, but the key is to not be afraid to ask him for help/questions. He will go out of his way to help you understand concepts, and that way you can score well on the assignments, because you actually get them.
I liked Anthony. He is sort of intimidating at first, but he really wants students to learn and is very willing to help you and answer any questions.
He runs lab well, and he is very helpful is there is something you don't understand.  Don't be scared to ask questions, because even though he looks kind of scary, he's not!
Great teacher very down to earth and is very approachable if you have questions.

Anthony is a good TA. He wants to run class with an iron fist which is cool cause he's a alright guy. He keeps your focus with fear and intimidation. His biceps which need a larger shirt scare me to death and everyone but he's a cool guy
Pretty helpful and knowledgeable. Kinda of intimidating though
No Comments
He's a great lab TA.  Knows his biology and is always willing to help.

I took this class online, get ready to study but the professor is amazing and understanding. You have many chances of getting a higher grade so if you get a lower grade on the first exam you have a chance of getting it up

This class is a majorly about your exam grades. There were 5 exams in one semester? The exam questions were way more difficult than the study guide posted or homework from previous weeks. The averages on the exams were always very low which is concerning considering they are 'open note'. Way too much busy work. Required online discussion groups.

I took this class online. Easy class to pass. There is a good amount of assignments but it is not overwhelming. Due to the amount of assignments they really carry your grade. Only complaint I have is the tests are hard but open notes. You think you know the material but then you go into the test and the questions are worded weirdly.

Exams can be difficult but she goes back and sees what the most missed and such are and usually gives back points. There are many assignments though, so as long as you complete lecture activities and homework well then your grade won't be terrible. She also did graded discussions, which were free points as long as you tried and participated.

You have to be in class if you want to learn anything. If you prefer to do work alone, this class isn't for you as you are constantly working with a partner. Learning definitions won't work; you need to understand how parts of the body function/how they function in specific scenarios. Midterm questions are very abstract and confusing.

such a kind soul! dr. herrmann is genuinely so sweet and wants nothing but the best for her students. she is so supporting and genuinely eager to see her students do well. great at answering questions! lots of lecture though!

This class is hard, lots of work, & requires lots of studying. Memorization won't work, so make sure you know the material. Watch the lecture videos & take notes on all the assignments. Exams are difficult (there are 5 of them). She is very smart & is good at teaching the material. Just pay attention, actually put in effort, and you'll be fine!

This professor believes her class is the only one at the University. She requires you participate in an enormous amount of homework. Her test are extremely EXTREMELY abstract. Memorization will not work in this course. You will need to understand an explain what she is teaching. Be prepared to put in a lot of time. Takes away from major

Lectures are boring and too much Tophat. She simplifies everything down too much. You could spend an entire class talking about one calculation. Her tests have confusing wording, so even if you know the concept you could get the question wrong. Talked to her a couple times and didnt seem like she cared about fair grading. Have had better profs.

Good professor, lectures are important and theres a ton of TopHat to keep you engaged. Her tests are worded confusingly at times but overall its not too difficult, especially if you study the lecture slides (which are online but omit key words/phrases that you can get from going to lecture, or lecture capture on Carmen). Some grade-boosters too!!

Dr. Herrmann is a good professor and you can learn a lot. Attendance and participation are taken daily via Tophat. Her lecture slides are posted online but she omits key phrases and terms making attendance a necessity.

Good class. Bio is hard but overall if you put in the work you can do well. More points are given in Lab than in lecture and/or tests. Kill the labs and easy assignments you should be fine. Only complaint i have is the wording on her tests can be very confusing. Other than that a good prof! I would recommend.

Dr. Herrmann is an outstanding professor. Her lectures are always interesting, her tests are not too difficult if you study for them, and she provides many opportunities to earn points outside of tests. I have never had a professor who is so genuinely excited to teach, and as passionate about their subject as Dr. Herrmann is- she's fantastic!

Awesome prof. You have to go to the lecture to get the content but her lectures are interesting and hobby quickly because they aren't boring. Also, she's pretty funny. Will meet with you outside of class to talk about grades or just whatever. If you have to take this class, take it from her.

Pay attention in class and take notes and this class is not hard at all. There is very little homework outside of class, and lectures are really good and easy to sit through. If you put in a little effort into the class and study, you'll enjoy this class.

Dr. Sam is super smart and is by far my favorite professor, but she is so difficult. You cannot simply slide by in this class. Attendance is mandatory (graded by TopHat, which is both for participation and actual credit, so good luck), and she flies by with her PowerPoints. Smartest lady I've ever met, hardest science class I've taken.

Students love her. She genuinely makes an effort to know her students. Quality discussion in class. Grading can be tough, but that's definitely more to the TA's credit, not hers. Conveys material in a light, conversational, intriguing manner: encouraging discussion, including real world examples and the occasional video. Would definitely recommend.
Unclear grading criteria (would always take points off for the silliest things), unnecessarily difficult tests and quizzes, not accessible outside of class, just no.
Her lectures are ridiculously long.
She is inflexible and rule oriented. Directions are unclear and she is unwilling to work with you.
Hard grader, not flexible or willing to work with you! You have to pay an extra fee to take the midterm and final at home even though it is an online class.

She's a great teacher, however this class will not be an easy A. She makes you work for every grade you receive. If you show up, you will do fine as long as you pay attention, which isn't hard to do because she is a fine woman.

Dr. Herrmann loves her students and is super passionate about what she does. The course coordinator makes the class 10x harder than what it needs to be. Gives a lot of easy test questions but you'd only know the answer if you went to class. You have to understand concepts, not just memorize stuff. Hard class but she makes it great.

She's a great lecturer because she keeps things simple and clear. She provides Powerpoints with some blanks, so it's easy to take notes. One odd thing was she made her final harder than the previous 2 exams by filling it with tons of trick questions! So that wasn't cool, but overall I enjoyed having her and the class was easy enough.
She's nice.  She is not very helpful though. Your grade will not be based off of whether or not you know the content.
Very personable. Really cares if you understand the material and if you don't understand, she will sit there and help you until you do.

Dr. Herrmann is a very passionate and knowledge professor. She has a great personality  and makes the class fun. However, the course coordinator makes the class harder than it should be for a entry level biology class. The questions on the exams are not straight forward. With this being said, you have to take what you learned in class and apply it.
One of the best professors so far.

Very intelligent and easy to talk to! Great personality and sense of humor! This course involves a lot of time, especially for the project portion. There is so much information covered which made studying for exams difficult especially since there was no list provided as to what to even specifically study.  Definitely not an easy A.
No help at all. Her tests are difficult. She doesn't give out study guides. She goes through lecture notes way too fast. Would not recommend for future students

She's one of the coolest professors I've had. She goes pretty fast during lecture but if you ask her to stop and explain something she will. Don't have anything bad to say except that you definitely wanna study for tests. Expected to end the class with a C and got an A-. Go to class/recitatation it will definitely boost your grade a lot in the end
One of my favorite professors! She's so chill and funny and really cares about the students. She will teach whatever the students are most interested in. A lot of grades so very easy to get an A.

Honestly, take her class even if you don't like science/ biology. take it even if its hard. I promise you you will enjoy it. There are a few movies that you have to watch for recitation which takes up a lot of time but the movies were very interesting except one. Lecture felt like it was really short, maybe because she's such an amazing teacher

I've never seen any teachers/professors like her. (In a good way) her classes are pretty interesting although biology is my worst subject. There are at least 3 movies you have to watch and it takes a lot of time, also a group project. I feel like her tests aren't really that hard if you studied and prepare yourself well.

Definitely one of my favorite professors. She knows a lot about biology and is truly passionate about what she is teaching. Tests are tough, but if you pay attention in class and study, it's not bad. She makes lectures really interesting and bases them off of what students are interested in. Not much outside work, but a group project and one paper.
I love Prof. Herrmann. She makes class interesting and enjoyable. Although her tests are difficult, if you pay attention, go to class, and study, you'll be fine.

She is by far my favorite professor. You can tell she actually cares about our opinions and teaches us material that we want to know more about. Her lectures are hilarious and really interesting. Tests are a little tough but there's plenty of other points offered in the class that will help boast your grade.

She's  a very nice person, and clearly cares about her students. Her tests are extremely difficult, but there is enough other assignments given where you should be able to save your grade as long as you go to class. I enjoy her lectures, but I do not think the tests are worth it.

Pretty tough grader, but very nice! There's a ton of extra credit, so if you do them all then a good grade should be easy to achieve. She goes through the PPTS really fast - so I would suggest bringing your computer to class. Gives PPTS ahead of time, just have to fill in the blanks. Tests are pretty tricky but don't have to buy the book!

This class was definitely challenging. You have to work hard to get a good grade. The instructor was really nice and really helpful! She does go through material a little quickly but is always willing to slow to down if need be. Tests are tricky. I would definitely recommend not waiting until the last minute to study. Does give extra credit often!

As long as you go to class and pay attention this class is really easy and she is really nice! The final exam is just questions that have been on previous midterms she couldn't make it much easier to get an A in this class especially because there is always extra credit available.

Very polite and down to earth. Will answer any and all questions.....  Bad news is she flies through slides too fast and her tests make you want to put your head in a grinder. She covers material decently but the test questions are tricky and hard. TESTS ARE HARD. GRADING IS HARD. Find another instructor if possible. Do not take this class...
GREAT teacher! She takes her time to explain fine details of a topic you're confused about until you get it! Physiology is a hard topic but she makes it easier to understand. Wish she taught a class!
She is a nice person but this course is difficult. If you want a high GPA, do not attend this BIO1102
Very helpful on what to put on exams.
She was wonderful! There were great class discussions and everything was very hands on. Oh, and she's not hard on the eyes!

Dr. Foster is an amazing person, he seems to care about the course and the students. He is not a great professor. He consistently has mistakes in his slides, sometimes going unnoticed until he references the slides later, his lectures are unorganized, and he is not great at explaining topics. It feels lecture is his first time seeing the slides too
Worst professor you can ever have. He never knows what he's talking about. Often skip slides, BUT THE SKIPPED SLIDES WILL SHOW UP DURING EXAM! TRY NOT TO TAKE HIS CLASS TO SAVE YOUR LIFE.

This dude messed up in lecture so many times that it made attending not worth it. You basically had to self teach yourself all the material which made it impossible to learn stuff like multiplicity. Seriously made me consider the BA for biochemistry due to the horror of taking Pbiochem 5722.

Never had a more unorganized professor, wow! He seems kind, but his lectures were disastrous. Often had to end early because he got lost in his own slides, or couldn't figure out the algebra of a problem that he put in his slides. Side note; no calculators allowed on exams, which is unnecessarily cruel in my opinion.

Dr. Foster has a destructible pattern of teaching that goes something like this: 1. At the start, he is very ambitious in the amount of material he wants to teach & expects students to retain. 2. About half way through the semester he can't keep up with his own course & blames it on his students. 3. By the end, he gets sloppy and crashes. Beware.
Terrible. Don't expect good lectures, example problems, a decent understanding of material, or fair tests.

Dr. Foster knows what he is talking about, and if you are willing to put in the effort, he will make sure that you know what you're doing. Lectures could sometimes be confusing- would definitely recommend reading before/attending office hours after. HW assignments can be lengthy, so start them early! He was receptive to our feedback.

This class will test your knowledge of coding more than pchem. We were told when our exams were with little notice (and sometimes he decided to change the exam time the same day of the exam!). The coding made this class 10x more difficult than it needed to be & the frequently canceled lectures also didn't help. The HW assignments take hours on end.

Biochemistry is full of unintuitive concepts that can be hard to understand. Fortunately, your professor is there to clarify things to prevent misunderstandings, right? WRONG. Mark Foster has the unique ability to make students leave his lecture even MORE confused than when they came in. Then he wonders why 75% of the class doesn't attend lecture.

Dr. Foster wants you to learn. The class was difficult but if you watch the lectures and do the homework and actually understand it you should be fine. It was an intimitating class at first (since it includes coding) but he helps you out with it as long as you reach out. Communication was still difficult thought, wish it was in-person.

Hes not the best nor the worst. I wish he could be more approachable this semester in a pandemic. He complained about attendance in class & office hours. But i wish he could be more interesting then people would actually show up. Just goes over dry notes. I think he and Magliery are the only ones teaching it. Bot are exceptional. May the force bwu
Nightmare of a class, no clear schedule or guidelines, lectures and breakout rooms are unproductive

I get COVID makes everything difficult, I really do. But my God, this guy has no idea what he's doing. The lectures are just him reading the notes he posts to you pretty much verbatim. Poor communication, constantly changing due dates, no set schedule or clear grading guidelines in the syllabus. An absolute nightmare of a class.
Great teacher and very good slides.  Exams weren't that bad.  A very knowledgable and cool professor.

The only compliant I had was that I felt like her lectures were very rushed, otherwise she did good at explaining the topics and seemed approachable. Attendance is graded through tophats and she does have weekly quizzes but I never read the textbook and was fine. There is also a lot of extra credit.

She's a very good teacher and incredibly smart. I think the previous bad reviews are from her teaching lab, which she stopped doing this semester. I will say her tests are kinda hard compared to the notes, but still not bad. I don't like ecology, but I didn't mind her class. I also never used the textbook or went to office hours, and got by ok.

Dr. Beggrow's class is great...there is really nothing to complain about. If you show up to lecture and participate, there is no reason to not earn the grade you want at the end of the semester. It is evident that Dr. Beggrow was also highly knowledgeable about the subject matter, and I am really glad I got to take 1114 with her.

idk everyone's mean on here so maybe she's changed her style but i thought she was awesome. Really responsive and caring during office hours. I thought the class participation aspect was really useful for this class. Nitpicky grading but i think thats a bio department thing

Some of these reviews are kinda dramatic or maybe she has just adjusted her teaching and exams. Dr. Beggrow is very sweet and it is clear she wants students to succeed. There is A LOT of opportunities for extra credit and points outside of exams. Exams are difficult compared to content but are still very doable.

Literally the worst class I have ever taken. Super easy content but is graded harshly plethora of busy work. Attendance is graded. Lab is excruciatingly painful as you do nothing for an hour and then rush to finish actual lab, which parts are expected to be completed outside of the lab period. Asking for help doesn't even improve grade.
