I liked her passion for biology and the way she challenged us to think critically. However, this class was harder than it had to be with the grading. I took the peer led section so that was a bigger commitment and had a lot of vague, subjective discussions about evolution that were kinda boring.

Dr. Beggrow definitely wants you to succeed and she lectures on antibiotic resistance for 8 weeks which is semi-interesting. The class is mostly writing assignments which are graded pretty difficultly. Luckily I had Dr. Beggrow as my TA so she is more than willing to help and outline what she expects from you.

If you're willing to put in the effort you'll be okay, but she is an incredibly tough grader and doesn't always give the best feedback because she can be condescending and not helpful. Avoid having her in lab and you'll be okay. Her tests can be very hard but there's a lot of easy points to make up for it in the class. She's decently nice.

Dr. Beggrow is a very nice person but her class is very complicated. A lot of the material does not seem very intense, but she grades labs very hard. Her lectures are very informative and I highly recommend attending them. Work hard on the labs, the grades will catch up to you.

She's a great professor, despite her tough grading and lots of class points (1000~ total points in the semester) her lectures are very in depth and require good note taking, but if you genuinely enjoy biology then it's a great class! She's a very kind person and is always open to help. I would take this class again if I could.

I loved Dr. Beggrow as a person, but not as a professor. She grades very tough and no matter what you do it never seems to be good enough. The tests are very tricky and a study guide is provided. However, with all study guides and reviews she gives, there is no answer key. How are you supposed to confirm you're even studying the right answer?

Dr. Beggrow is nice but her class is awful. Lectures are easy but the tests are purely application questions that have no way to be prepared for and barely have anything to do with what she teaches. She grades labs super strictly and kind of seems like she wants her class to be impossible to get an A in.

If you can take another prof do it she is the absolute worst! Nice to your face but grades like a psychopath she will not let any thing slide. Condescending and not helpful with answering questions. Assignments are nothing like  what is seen on exams. I could go on forever

This is the first 5 credit class I've taken that had a helpful lecture. Her use of top-hats, in class assignments, and call and response was soo helpful to learn the course work. If you go to class and follow along with her "fill in the blank" slides, you'll do well. Lab makes up most of your grade, ask the TA for help with lab and you'll do well.

Lecture content appears to be easy however exam questions and quizzes are extremely difficult and have almost nothing to do with the lectures. My TA once said he had to google multiple questions on the exam because he did not understand them. Lab heavy course, however TA's will take off points for any little mistake in lab reports.

Though I did not enjoy the fact that Dr. Beggrow's exams were significantly harder than her weekly quizzes (and that the class was basically memorization), I appreciated her as a person. She took the time to include the scientific research of diverse groups and wanted to ensure that her lectures were very engaging!

Im currently in Beggrow 1114 and I have an A+. If you come to class for attendance TOPHAT points and you take notes or actively listen this class is very easy. If you have a lab TA that is not Beggrow, lab is also very very easy and is lots of group work. All quizzes open note. Skim the textbook too! Easy if you put in the work

Had her as a lab coordinator and TA a couple years ago. She absolutely picks favorites and takes off points for minuscule errors. Office hours were useless as even if she point blank told you what to write on an assignment, she still found ways to take points off. Avoid if possible.

Beggrow is nice but she is a tough grader. Most of your grade is from lab and she grades it to the harshest degree. When asked questions she gives cryptic answers or is condescending. She reads off powerpoints but have to go to lecture for participation. exam questions are obscure & don't make sense. refuses to take critiques & blames the student

Dr. Beggrow is nice, but the way the class is structured does not make sense. Theres two exams worth nothing (basically). The grade you will get in class will primarily be based off of lab points, which she grades to the toughest degree possible. Let me remind you, your lab work will likely be due on a Sunday and is collaborative. Good luck!
Not as bad as people say. She grades lab reports harshly and is not very helpful in lab, but her lectures are good and she is pretty nice. Don't skip lectures.

Dr. Beggrow might be the worst professor I've had at Ohio State. She takes off points with no explanation and for things that aren't put the way she wants it to be. I had a ton of obstacles come up during the semester such as covid and she was no help at all and continued to dock points on things that shouldn't have been. Very condescending also.

Very critical grader, if you don't answer questions, especially in lab, exactly how she would answer them you get points off. Took of points for trivial errors. Can be condescending when asked questions. Doesn't listen to feedback and instead blames the student. An additional 1 credit hour class is required and is a waste of time.

Honestly I'm not sure why Dr. B has such a bad rating, I love her class. She does grade lab assignments harshly and there's lots of group work which is annoying at times. But her lectures are interesting, with a good mix of discussion and lecturing. She's very kind and enjoyable to talk to outside of class; she even learns everyone's names!

She was my lab/recitation TA in Summer 2021. The content for this class isn't hard... I got A's for the midterm and the final. But she is basically looking to take off points on every assignment. Not wording your answers the way she wants will take off points. If you can get another TA, you should. She's decently nice though I guess.

Terrible professor, try to take any other person. The class content was very easy to learn but she would consistently ask questions that depended on information that was not presented in the question. She also doesn't let you see what you missed and on assignments, she would dock points with no explanations.

AVOID! Course content is easy to understand but she makes exam questions ambiguous and very tricky. She wastes your time with dozens of small assignments (which she grades very harshly) and lets class discussions drag on and on without saying if you're right or wrong. I love Biology but absolutely despised this class and her "teaching" style.

Don't be fooled by the grade, only A- of the semester. Took this class last year, honestly miserable. Her practice exams did NOT correlate with the actual exam at all. She docked points for literally EVERYTHING. For writing her thesis on how to teach evolution, she is the WORST. I could go on forever about her, but I have limited characters :)

Actually one of the worst class experiences of my career. She REQUIRES you take an extra class no other professor requires so that she can use data from it for her research without telling you. She's nice to your face, but a nightmare to deal with. Makes you do group work CONSTANTLY even when she asked us our opinion and we said no.
Beggrow teaches very well and the information in her lectures are very concise. However, she can go a little fast sometimes, and the tests are difficult.

I took her for my Biology 1114. Her lectures were terrible. It was examples and no content. I did not learn anything. Her tests were super heard for no reason and very specific. I studied so hard and still ended up doing poorly. Her class average was terrible and she did not even care. The class is based on more discussion than actually teaching.

She is a harsh grader. Shell take points off if you make small mistakes or dont include the specific wording she was looking for. Her lecture drag and she spends most time talking about examples rather than the consents themselves. Shes sweet and easy to reach out to but shell likely not answer your questions and go on a tangent.

Terrible. She takes points off for small grammar mistakes during the labs and her test questions are much more difficult than her practice exams are. Easily accessible but not very good at explaining. She also words the questions so weird as if she were trying to trick you; knowing the material will not help you do well. MUST BE AN ENGLISH WHIZ

LOVED Dr. Hopper, was super easy to approach outside of class and she cares a lot about her students. She is great at recommending students for labs and sees the potential in everyone. Her class was very beneficial for anyone looking for research and didn't know where to start.
She's the best.
Dr. Hopper was the best! Granted I had her for a career and research opp. class, but she was always looking out for your best interest. Do as she recommends and youre set!

She is a good instructor. Exams were very hard, but fair. Well representative of the material covered. Nice lectures, very nice powerpoints, but certainly have to work for the grade. Not an easy course (molecular genetics 605). She is very clear on what you need to know and what you do not. Unless you are going into genetics, consider molgen 500.

Good intentions, bad professor. Seriously lacking clarity. HW problems are extremely obscure, takes an excessive amount of time (up to 4hrs). Tests are fair. Information is presented poorley in general. She is a nice woman though, she throws out candy to people in lecture.

I took this class online, and it was by far the easiest GE I have taken. The work consisted of usually one discussion post based on the class book and one quiz every week. The discussion posts are graded on whether you did them or not, and the quizzes were open-note. I recommend that anyone take this GE if they still need it as a requirement.

I took this class online. It is graded on quizzes based on the textbook and discussion posts. The discussion posts are graded on participation and quizzed aren't very hard. There is a final paper which is pretty easy. Overall, if you do the assignments on time you'll get an A.

ONLINE bioethics would be incredibly difficult to fail. Weekly assignments include a usually 20 multiple choice quiz based off the textbook in which there are PRACTICE QUESTIONS that are word-for-word on the actual quiz. Open-note, open-textbook quizzes. Pass/fail 400 word discussion every week, meet the requirements and you pass. Very intro-level.
Super easy discussions once a week for participation and a quiz once a week that is super easy based off the textbook
His workload is very manageable. He is very organized with his modules, you basically do the same things every week. As long as you do your work, you will ace the class.

Dr. Vest provided like 3 (outdated) videos of himself the entire semester. Everything else was outside resources and the textbook. So essentially, he was pretty nonexistent for the course itself. Didn't really matter, though, since the course was easy, and essays were easily able to be BS.
he's good

All of his quizzes are easy, and not that many questions. All his discussion post may get tiring but its literally on the stuff you read. TEXTBOOK MANDATORY!!. you could always get it off z library. quizlet!
class was pretty easy, just a lot of reading

Ignore all of the five star reviews this teacher has! I will be completely honest with you when I say this was the worst class I have ever taken. The amount of reading for this class is insane and good luck getting any points on the final paper (which has super ambiguous directions) unless you read. Weekly quizzes answers are on quizlets I heard.

The class was pretty easy to follow through the modules and due dates are at set times. Dr. Vest does not provide a lengthy lecture and instead introduces topics through a short clip weekly. There is a fair amount of reading, so try breaking it up into little segments for the quizzes. Discussion posts are easy and graded based on participation.

This class was pretty boring. Requires a lot of reading and the videos assigned are all very old. Weekly quizzes are pretty easy and answers can be found in textbook. Final is very long so don't wait until the due date to start.

Professor Vest was not very involved with the class outside the weekly module intro videos, but he was easy to communicate with by email. There was a weekly quiz and discussion board that were fairly easy, you just have to apply some of the concepts that were mentioned in the textbook. Overall, should be an easy A if you put in a little effort.

This class is pretty straight forward. If you follow the directions of what to do then you will get a good grade. The issue is that there is SO MUCH READING, with very very little spoken lecture content. If you have trouble concentrating on written content, you will have issues with this class setup.

His class is pretty much straight forward. It is online based and mostly independent study meaning you study and post on the discussion boards by the end of the week. His quizzes are easy as well and multiple choice. The class is pretty much an Easy A and i'll recommend taking him if you're trying to get your GPA up lol

Weekly quizzes and 400 discussion posts, both really aren't bad if you skim the reading. The final was eight 400 word discussion questions, essentially. I did a little every day and ended up okay, but DO NOT procrastinate on his final. Overall, good class, solid teacher. Definitely recommend.
Took this online during COVID. Super easy only took me 2 hours for each weeks work. Final exam was also easy as long as you did the readings.

I sent him completely valid complaints about the terrible quiz questions he has that are full of trick questions, ambiguity, and typos. He told me he can't be expected to completely literal with his questions and invalidated my complaints. I'm a good student and looking for communication and he was a brick wall. I will never be taking him again.

Anyone complaining about the workload of this class must be lazy. The material is interesting, requires no more than 20 pages of reading (that even if you skim you'll be ok), a discussion post graded pass/fail, and easy quizzes where the answers are easily found. Take this course, you won't be spending a ton of time on it weekly. Easy to get an A.

Bioethics 2000 with Dr. Vest was extremely easy. Every week, we just had to complete a 400-500 word reflection with a 50 word peer response (graded as pass-fail), and a 20 question quiz usually based on the reading, and the answers could be found online. The final was lengthy but not difficult, and you are given more than enough time to complete.

Don't take! You will have to write 500 words paper and 20 multiple choice quiz every single week. Most importantly, this course has the best final exam I have never had, you will be asked to answer 7 questions with total 2500 words. These questions are short, you will begin to talk nonsense repetitively because there is nothing to write about.
Mr vest is a grades the final exam ridiculously hard which makes up 25% of the grade.

I took this class while I was doing an internship, is it was a little difficult for me to keep up with the workload at times. Every week you take a quiz and post a 400 word discussion post online. I did not see any of the films due to lack of time. The final is 7-8 questions that make you think critically on Bioethics, is don't wait or uwillbesorry

If you are looking for an easy Culture and Ideas GE, this is it!! Easiest course I have ever taken. Do the work and you get an A. The class is probably more interesting taught in person, but the online version is super easy.

Easy GE & decently interesting (especially if you're in the healthcare field). Weekly discussion questions (400-500 words; pass/fail based on participation)and open book quizzes (most on answers on quizlet). 7 discussion question final. You need the book, but its only like $15 to rent, so it's worth it for an easy A!

Bioethics is a great class for anyone considering a career in healthcare. The grading is mostly based on completion of weekly discussion topics, weekly reading quiz (16-20 questions), and a 7 question discussion style final. Oh, and bonus point opportunities, which I highly recommend doing.

Dr. Vest is not that involved in the class, it's mostly just you logging on, doing a weekly quiz and discussion post, and that's it. Not too hard or tedious. Quizzes require some reading but it's open book. He provides scans of the first few chapters but after that you need to buy it. I enjoyed this class, and picked up a bioethics minor after it.

Dr. Vest is not too involved in the course other than sending occasional reminders. The class itself is easy, yet those who do not like online classes may find it tedious. Weekly quizzes and discussion posts are the majority of what you do. The final is written and includes seven short essay questions which require work but are not hard.

Easy GE, also pretty fun/interesting. Weekly discussions that are pass/fail--so participation. Weekly quizzes that are easy if you do the reading. Final exam was discussion like short essays that were really easy. Also extra credit for watching ethics films. The professor isn't too involved--very independent class, but he is there if you need help.

3 credit online bioethics class, it's a must take for anyone. Easy A, all the points are on open book quizzes, and all of the answers are easily accessible on google, but unfortunately you will need the book because the weekly discussion posts are based on the passages, but it's pretty inexpensive. I would recommend this to anyone.

I had her for biology survey and she was super nice and funny. The class info was kinda boring but attendance is optional (although she claims it's not, she never did any type of attendance but the first day) so it was fine. Every assignment is due at the end of the semester and if you need more time past that she is very forgiving

I only had this professor for the biology survey course as well, so it was a slight class but ultimately very helpful. Her lectures cleared up many questions I had as a first year in my first semester. We only got into groups once, so if group work scares you, then there is nothing to worry about here. The three mentors for the course were great.

Had her for biology major survey and she is amazing. Totally chill and she is funny. The class does seem pointless but TBH everything you learn about is important and necessary. Since the class is required Lydia Rall is definitely the professor to have for it.

Love this TA! The class is somewhat difficult because the writing must be done in a specific way, but the directions are usually clear. It was a little hard to adjust to her grading, but she gives so much feedback that you improve really quickly if you listen to her advice. Study guides are provided so you will be fully prepared for any lab tests:)

Very fun and goofy lectures. I admittedly already knew the material from a previous course by coincidence, but I was still interested and engaged regardless. You can really tell he loves what he does and he is a very caring professor.
Dr. Chordas is an engaging prof who makes lectures fun. Exams focus on lecture notes, so staying on top of those is key. unstuckstudy was a huge help for study prep.

This man is hilarious!! His lectures are so easy to follow he keeps things fun yet gets straight to the point. He allows you to vote if you want collaborative quizzes and also has you vote on how the exam is set up. Attendance isn't completely necessary in my opinion but I did go to all of his lectures just because he was so easy to follow TAKE HIM

Certified Yapper, is what I call him, but ties it into the subject well. Material is easy and the exams are easy (read the slides!). Literally did a poll in the beginning so we could choose basically the entire grading criteria. Pretty awesome guy! Attendance not 100% mandatory but you will have to go a decent amount to maintain a good grade.

Dr. Steve is an amazing professor. He made our 80 minute lectures entertaining with his comedy. The exams are very straightforward and only relies on his lecture notes. The only downside to this class is a lot of points being from lab. If you get a TA who's a tough grader it is difficult to keep an A in the class without doing well on exams.
Dr. Chordas is an amazing professor.  His exams are 100% based on lecture material which is easy to remember if you pay attention.
This is by far the best professor I have ever had at OSU. The class breakdown is very nice and he always brings in stories about his life and keeps the course interesting.

Dr. Chordas is a great person and professor. He is very goofy and will not hesitate to crack jokes during lecture and does a great job of keeping his students engaged. He allowed us to vote on how we wanted the final and in class assignments to be set up which was very nice. I would 1000% recommend Dr. Chordas.
His lectures are entertaining specially when he relates lessons to his entomology research. Try on Packback, reading quizzes, and exams and you'll be fine.

Dr. Chordas was amazing, such a nice professor who had interesting lectures. At the beginning of the semester, he asks you how you would like to be graded and the majority rules. Would take again, great teacher and course.

Did well in Bio1113, expected this class to be easier. Dr. Chordas himself is a fantastic lecturer and his exams aren't difficult at all, but the lab portion of the class was incredibly tough for some reason. If your TA is not lenient when grading your lab worksheets you are going to be in for a tough time for this class. Be prepped for lab.

Such a chill class. Would recommend taking his class if you don't like science but need the credit. Attendance for lectures is required but the lectures can be very entertaining. Students are also allowed to work together on reading quizzes and there are only 3 quizzes.

Chordas is a great lecturer and loops his own experience into each lecture so it makes sense. Attendance isn't mandatory but he doesn't go off of slides or record lectures so if you don't go you could miss things. Very funny and likes to make class fun even though its over boring topics.

Dr. Steve is a great teacher. He encourages his students to work together on quizzes and class assignments. He let us vote on the point distribution and how we wanted the final formatted. Very personable and humorous. Also cares a lot about the students that make an effort.
Dr. Chordas is very passionate in teaching and tries to make lectures as interesting and engaging as possible.

He is so engaging and genuinely loves teaching students about nasty ticks and mosquitoes. You would think learning about bugs is boring, but he makes it so interesting that you can't help but listen when he is speaking even if you are not fully paying attention. Exam was not bad at all. Just pay attention in lecture and you will be fine.

I seriously loved Steve and his class! His lectures were so interesting and made it very easy to learn and digest the material. Exams were pretty straightforward as well, no trickery. I wish I could go back and take this class again!
Super nice and has cool work experiences that he shares in class. The class can be a little unorganized but it doesn't matter because it's super chill. Enjoyed him and the course.
Class was easy but his exam was closed note and pretty hard. Encouraged students to work together but was an online class.
If Easy A was a person it'll be Stephen Chordas. Let that sink in well

Chordas was definitely the easier of the 2 professors that you get for this course. The lectures did not seem to interest me at first, but I quickly got drawn into them because I believe Dr Chordas has a great way of delivering them. The questions on quizzes and the exam was very clear and there were no trick questions. Watch lectures and get an A.

Bio 3401 is a 2 module class. Dr Chordas taught the first module on vector borne diseases. The content is very interesting despite learning a lot about mosquitoes. Take good notes on the lectures and you will be fine. He does not make questions to trick you and as long as you put in a little effort and complete the assignments you'll get an A.

Dr. Chordas is such a down to earth and humble professor. Everytime you email him, he is so nice and gentle. His lectures are amazing and his exam can be a little confusing but all you need to is to go to his lectures and take good notes. Also, he is so helpful outside of class. I wish I could take all my classes with him.

At the beginning of class, he lets us selected how we want to be graded so that's nice. Coming to class is encouraged because his lecture notes are kind of bare so it's easy to miss important information. You can tell he is passionate about the topics and he cracks jokes often. In-class quizzes and assignments are very similar to the exam
Steve is a legend 100% would recommend. He gives me the willpower to continue with a BS in biology.

He truly cares about his students, very straightforward, makes material concise and easy and fun. You know exactly what you need to do to get an A and it isn't hard. He's also hilarious and makes it interesting, but if you don't come to lecture you won't get the material.
Best professor at OSU, let students vote for class set up. Very straight forward grading. Go to class.

Dr. Chordas was the best professor I ever had at Ohio State. He is incredibly enthusiastic, he finds a relatable way to understand concepts and has an awesome sense of humor making it easy to look forward to lecture. You are doing yourself a disservice not to attend lecture.

Dr. Chordas is one of the best professors I have had at OSU. He is so down to earth and loves teaching and inspiring students. His section was so much fun and he could make any subject interesting. You got to choose all aspects of the class (test format and quiz format etc). Dr. Chordas never failed to put a smile on my face. He's amazing!
Very funny and made those 3 hour lectures a breeze and entertaining.
Awesome instructor! His quirky stories allow you to be relaxed an enjoy his lectures. Would recommend doing all the assigned "homework." Almost guaranteed to get perfect scores if you attempt it.

Very down to Earth. Always there to help you. His class is fairly easy. Just do the assignments, and you'll guarantee to get good grade. Not to mention his exam is super easy. Go to class because most of the assignments and quizzes are done in class.

AWESOME. Best professor I've had yet at OSU after 3 years. He makes information easy to understand at all levels and interesting no matter what you're learning about. Very helpful and very friendly when approached. Wish I could take another class with him!

It's been 2 semesters since I've had Stephen Chordas but man was he a great professor! He was very relatable and didn't sound like some stuck up science professors we have around here.  His class was a breeze. I barely had used my book.

Dr. Steve's portion of the class was super easy. Show up to class for the pop group work for participation points. My only complaints were that the class had a lot of worksheets and in class group work, which gets tedious. I also wasn't a fan of all his long winded stories, but most people think they're hilarious.

Dr. Steve is great. He is funny and he knows what he is talking about. There are pop quizzes throughout the semester so attending lecture every day is highly recommended. He is very engaging and kept me interested throughout his lectures.

Dr. Chordas is a really engaging teacher. He is so excited about the subject matter and it makes it easy to stay interested in the class. He would go above and beyond to help any student and helped me to secure a research position with the government. I would take any class that he teaches.

Funny, knowledgeable, easy going. This prof. makes Biology super interesting. I would recommend this class to anyone. His lectures are fascinating and relevant. Enjoyed every class. Attendance is not mandatory but I strongly recommend it because there are pop quizzes which are easy if you take notes. Class power-points are posted on Carmen.

Dr. Chordas is my favorite professor of the semester.  He makes his lectures interesting and very entertaining.  He's very clear to understand.  You need to go to class though, he does pop quizzes, his notes are not online, and we do not go with the book (don't even buy it).  I'd definitely take more classes from him.

Steve's lectures were to the point and entertaining. He tried to get a class of 200+ as involved as possible. He does not give study guides for exams so you have to learn all material on lecture slides. That being said, he is very clear of what topics are being tested over. Come to lecture because there are pop quizzes. BAD HAIR.

Dr. steve was probably one of my favorite professors at Ohio State. He made things easy to learn and so interested to listen to. He is always very friendly and helpful when asked. If you get a chance to take a class with him, snatch it up!! (hotness rating because of the sick waterfall mullet)

If you need to get your Bio Gen Ed out of the way, take 1102. Steve is my favorite professor this semester. He does a good job making the lectures interesting. He gives out pop quizzes, but they're very straight forward. Exams are not too difficult. Not textbook needed. If you go to lecture, take good notes, and study for exams, you'll do well.

Steve was awesome, if you participate then you will do well. Pop quizzes but you did them with the whole class, so pretty darn easy. He also gave all the assignments the 1st day, so you had plenty of time to do them.
Book not needed. Lectures are entertaining. Pop quizzes are easy if you pay attention in lecture. Take this class with Dr Steve, you won't regret it.

He's awesome. Makes lectures super stimulating and is extremely helpful if you reach out to him. He also really considers the students and lets you vote on a lot of aspects of the class. His personal stories make the class easy to pay attention too. Take all assignments seriously though!!

Best hair on campus. Seriously he is still rocking a mullet so clearly a chili pepper for this dude. Also the best teacher I've ever had. He cares about the material, provides excellent examples, tells personal and relevant stories about the material and teaches it well. Take this class to fulfill your gen eds. You will not regret it.

This guy is great. I wish he was here for the whole semester. He explains things so wonderfully you'll remember what you learned in class and won't need to take too many notes. Very entertaining guy. The labs are never related to lecture though.
Dr Steve is amazing and very helpful. He makes his lectures funny and interesting. One thing about this course, take all the assignments seriously including the exams.
Funny guy. Open to any and all questions. Makes class enganing and worthwhile.

My favorite professor at Ohio State. Makes lectures interesting, funny, and his tests are fair=if you study you will do well. Very easy to get an A in the class if you do all the HW and go to class and take notes. TAKE HIME!!!!

Best Professor at OSU. Every time I asked him a question after class he explained it really well. He was so laid back and funny. A lot of professors are a bit intimidating but with him it was completly different. His exams and quizes are very fair!
Amazing Professor, he's very helpful, kinda funny in a cute way. Fav class of the semester! If you have him, you will love Bio!!!!
Awesome professor! Classes weren't too difficult and he was hands down my favorite professor at OSU. I definitely recommend this GEC.

Chordas is one of the best professors if not the best I have ever had at osu. Keeps lectures interesting and makes you enjoy bio. I don't like science at all and I liked coming to his class. Easy A and you will actually learn a lot more than you would if he made mad the class difficult. Hes also a very funny guy.

BIO 101 with Steve Chordas was one of the easiest classes I've taken at Ohio State. The one project he assigns is a cake-walk. I got a B- while I had mono and literally slept through 5 quizzes and didn't do a single thing. Unless you come down with an energy-killing disease that wrecks you, expect an A.
Steve was awesome. If you went to class you got an A.
Steve was awesome. His lectures were interesting and I still remember all of his funny stories. He wins for telling the most stories about his wife. Definitely a professor to have
Dr Steve is amazing. He makes you interested in Biology and his stories stick with you through college. I still remember random things biological because I'll remember a story he told us.
Easily one of the best professors. I hated bio but man he makes you want to come to lecture! DO NOT TAKE BIO WITH ANYONE ELSE!
Dr. Steve was great!  You will get an easy A if you attend lecture and DO your work!!  If not...you won't!  Pretty simple..huh?
Chordas was so cool and easy A.
Great lecturer.  I enjoyed lectures.  Would highly recommend.
I absolutely loved Chordas! His jokes are hilarious and he does an incredible job making the class interesting and interactive.

Dr. Steve is an excellent lecturer. I wish he could lecture all my classes - he's funny, he explains thing incredibly clearly, and he's definitely motivated about teaching and helping students.  Don't buy the book -- completely useless. He even puts copies on reserve at the library.
super funny and is always telling stories that relate to what we're talking about. even in a lecture of 200+ people, we can still still ask lots of questions and interact.
Dr. Chordas is a great lecturer, I haven't missed a class. He's funny, tells hilarious stories and is friendly and entertaining. Class material is super easy and well-paced.
Dr. Steve teaches in a very laid back atmosphere.  Lots of great information given in an easy to understand manner. He gets an A.
He was a great teacher! I hate Biology and he made it bearable!

Dr. Steve was great!  This class was easy but very interesting and helpful. Take the class and with the professor.  He is funny, loves the material, teaching and life! One of my favorite teachers so far.

He's the funniest professor ever! Always interesting, cracks jokes constantly to keep the course material bearable (which is not bad, just basic biology, you probably learned it in high school). I would definitely recommand this prof!!!
Awesome! Need I say more? Dude, Dr. Steve is the SHIZNAT!
Great teacher. Communicates very well with colorful and entertaining slides. Take him for an A
He was just the course coordinator for this course, but he was so helpful. You could go to his office hours and he would clarify everything the crazy lady teacher said.
He was really understandable and kept everything basic. Unannounced quizzes every couple classes that weren't too bad.  I would definitely recommend his class.
Very good professor class was pretty easy. Dr Steve understands its a GEC so he does not go much in depth and is very easy to do well.He does make lots of wife jokes but there not that bad
He is a very clear teacher

Dr. Chordas was by far the best professor I have had at Ohio State. I never thought Biology could be so interesting, and he always throws in hilarious anecdotes to keep things going. Also the easiest class ever! TAKE HIM!

A gentleman and a scholar. Steve Chordas is the best professor I have ever had the pleasure of studying under. He was extremely thorough and clear, but his best quality is that he puts the students and keeps the class interesting and fair. Attendance shouldn't be an issue in this class because you'll actually look forward to his lecture/story time.
dr chordas was my prof. at columbus state. a great teacher for every one in the class.
I hope Dr. Steve checks this so he can see how awesome he is! This guy is what the other Ph.D's at OSU should emulate...class act, treats students FAIRLY, and just a happy go lucky kind of guy!
His attendance policy was not strict. You had to attend labs but lectures you did not. He would "take attendance" by having random-ish quizzes.

He is the only reason why I go to BIO. He is what the class needs to make it tolerable. The other professors are a train wreck!!! Only wish he taught a module too. Super great guy, likes the students. You can just tell he loves life and his job...unlike the rest who hate the world...and their students

One of the easiest classes I have taken so far at Ohio State.  He was interesting and made everything clear.  He also was pretty funny and made lots of jokes in class.  It's hard to get anything below an A in this class as long as you attend lecture.

great guy. He was the course coordinator for this class and was very clear in everything, was extremely helpful and understanding and just fantastic. Really balanced out the poor quality of the other teachers in this class and made this class somewhat enjoyable and worth going to. Fantastic course coordinator and is exactly what we needed.

Dr. Steve is the best Bio 101 teacher ever! Attendance is not mandatory but if you attend lecture you will do well. He is funny and interesting and plays not tricks, its an easy A if you go to class and take notes. This was one of my best classes so far.
He is so funny! I find biology interesting, but HIS teaching of the class made me actually enjoy the subject and the class. Plus he's just really nice and a very easy prof.
One of THE easiest classes I have taken so far. If you want an A+ take this class!

Awesome professor! If you can get this guy for biology, definitely go for it. His classes are easy, he's always ready to help, and he keeps the class fun and entertaining. Also, if you're not the biggest fan of science, this is the class to take. He recognizes that most people are in there just for the GEC req.
He's a genuinely nice guy.  Makes lectures very fun and interesting.
Great teacher. ery easy class. Pay attention and you will do well. I was in the class with a 100 on the midterm. AMAZING.
Awesome teacher!!!!
A+ professor. Class was very interesting. Tests and quizes are very easy. This is the man you want for Biology.

Best Professor Ever! I actually looked forward to going to his class. He explains things very well and throws in funny jokes to keep it interesting. Definitely take this class...you will be glad you did.
No Comments
He is soo awesome! He makes lecture actually enjoyable and I look forward to going! He'e hilarious too.
Take this class!! If you don't you will regret it! Its so easy

I love it! He makes the class easy and enjoyable, I don't totally dread going to the class.  He makes the notes fun and short which def makes it easy to remember.  He gives quizzes, so going to lecture is a good idea so you don't miss one, but they are straight forward and directly from the notes. Def take him, he's awesome!!!

He is a great guy, his jokes are kind of ridiculous but, still, very fun-loving. The class was really easy because he is very understanding of college students and what to expect from us. There are no outragous assignments, and his lectures are very clear so that you sort of just... remember.
The best professor in the world. Take him.

Unbelievable guy! Just gave 650 kids in my Biology lecture 100% on their midterm exams just for showing up to class. Thats like 20% of our overall grade! He's a legend and if you don't take him your making a mistake!
Very good teacher! Funny, smart and really into what he does! Made me consider biology for a major!
This class was great. It was really easy. Dr. Chordas helps out alot makes class really interesting. Also tells wife jokes

Great class! Biology 101 with Dr. Chordas is easy, humorous, and even somewhat enjoyable! He has a great sense of humor and relates many bio. topics to personal stories (which often involve his wife!) Exams are extremely straightforward, as are pop quizzes. Wants you to succeed! Highly recommend this course!
The absolute best teacher ever!! He is so entertaining, funny and energetic! Class was a breeze, very straightforward! TAKE HIM! You'll love his class!

He makes Bio fun and there were times I was actually looking forward to class.  Very easy to understand and the exams are not hard whatsoever.  Also, he is very easy going when it comes to questions or responses

Doctor Chordas is by far the best science teacher I have ever had... Maybe one of the best intro instructors I have ever had! He uses real-life examples that are interesting... Information you will actually USE! He's entertaining, smart, and honest. Take this class!!

Awesome professor. Easy A. 2 exams, which are barely any harder than the quizzes. The quizzes are extremely easy and the answers often follow a pattern, such as a b c d e aaaaa. One project, you get all quarter to do and it's easy and counts for as much as an exam. TAKE THIS CLASS!
Easy and fun.  Biology can be interesting with this guy.

Professor Chordas is one of the best I've had! I hate science and he made it a fun class, very funny guy. Doesn't talk down to you, very approachable. Do not take any other proffesor! Class isn't mandatory but there are pop quizzes. Book isn't necessary either. This class should have been an easy A but I got high C due to myself!
GREAT GREAT GREAT PROFESSOR!!! I hate science and he made it fun and interesting. Loved going to class!!! Dr. Chordas is the best!

Great Professor! comes across very clear and does not teach you boring stuff you don't need to know. Would recommend going to class, tells hilarious wife jokes and tells you exactly what you need to know.  Do not buy book! you need to only read short pieces and can go the library to do so. Great class, very easy A

Great class! I was worried about this class- a long class and about science! Ugh! Don't worry! Flew by and had fun! Notes are online! Never a dull moment! Learned a lot and use the info in my other science class from his notes! Luved the class! Best prof!

It is the best class with the the best prof. I was worried about this class- a long class and about science! Don't worry! Flew by and had fun! Notes are online! Never a dull moment! Learned a lot and use the info in my other science class from his notes! Luved the class! Best prof!
Great professor! Makes a long night of lecture entertaining. Has many hilarious stories about his wife. Overall cool dude.

Good professor for a long night lecture.  I hated biology in high school but consider it tolerable now.  If you have taken any chem class at osu you will notice that they treat you like babies in the labs.  Bio101 is so much easier than chem101.

Has slides posted on carmen with some blanks to fill in during lecture.  4 best of 5 pop quizes. Labs are boring but easy, research assignment is easy and can be done in one night.  midterm and final are straight from notes.  likes to put "words" in Matching and quizes like, NOBIGDEALK or DECAF...look for those, go to reviews, easy A.  great prof!
what a professor ! take his class !!

Dr. Steve is awesome. He makes the 3 hour long lecture go by so fast --- he's really fun and makes biology interesting, his tests are what 101 level tests should be, definately take his class if possible.
If anyone needs to fulfill a science GEC requirement at Ohio State. I highly recommend taking Bio. 101 with Chordas.
If you want to know how to make Biology fun ask Steve Chordas.

Chordas is the best professor I've ever had. He is super cool, and tells jokes all the time. I love to go to his lectures even though they last till late night. The only bad thing about this class is the Lab, which I feel boring and not really helpful. But that again could be the problem of my TA.
You the man, Steve!!!
Definitely recommend taking his class and going to his review sessions for the exam ;)
GREAT! PROF. Cool Guy! Love the stories. And he keeps it REAL. I am a non traditional student and I would recommend this class to anyone that has been out of school for a long time.
Steve is pretty amazing! He made  a GEC interesting. I would recommend him for bio 101. Library project is a pain, but it is easy

Great Professor if you just want to get biology out of the way. Short, clear lectures and his jokes are pretty funny. His final was awesome b/c most q's had an outrageous answer that makes you laugh, which is a nice help during a bio final. His fu man chu is almost as cool as his mullett too. Oh, and labs are a joke.
He is a great professor, prob. my favorite so far at OSU! He is really great, and the tests are not hard!! He has a review.
Made learn FUN

He is a great teacher! He understands that his students are not bio majors and relates the lectures to things that will affect you, they are interesting.  REALLY EASY.  the library project was an easy 100 pts and if you do the labs you will get an A
I LOVED him! Great Teacher :)
All around a great guy, exams are easy, and classes are usually interesting and funny
I usually struggle with science, but this class was so easy.  He keeps it basic and is able to relate to his students.  I would advise taking Bio 101 with him!

Dr. Steve is an extremely nice guy, who goes out of his way to help students. He actually remembers when he was a poor student with bad professors so he's strives to do well. VERY FAIR TESTS. Also has very amusing stories which are related to material. I didn't think I'd take anything away from this class, but I did. He's a great prof.

Dr. Steve is an extremely nice guy, who goes out of his way to help students.  He actually remembers when he was a poor student with bad professors so he's strives to do well.  VERY FAIR TESTS.  Also has very amusing stories which are related to material.  I didn't think I'd take anything away from this class, but I did.  He's a great prof.

If ur good @ memorizing.Take this class!Because that is all u have to do for the exams.He is a great great prof-helpful,patient,and wants u to get that A.Bonus pts are everywhere.Only recommendation i can give u is pick the right TA(that is the key)Get that A in the lab and ur set.The rest as i said is straight up memorization.JUST LIKE THAT- A

If ur good @ memorizing.Take this class!Because that is all u have to do for the exams.He is a great great prof-helpful,patient,and wants u to get that A.Bonus pts are everywhere.Only recommendation i can give u is pick the right TA(that is the key)Get that A in the lab and ur set.The rest as i said is straight up memorization.JUST LIKE THAT- A

This guy is the greatest, he wants students to do well so he makes the class easy.  As long as you go to the majority of the classes and study a little bit, you're guaranteed an A.  SOOO much easier than any other bio teacher!
Had a good time in class, though lectures are long and boring...If you take it at night he WILL keep you til 9

one of the easiest classes i've taken!! his lectures aren't boring, he keeps your attention and makes it interesting by making it simple, explaining everything, and telling jokes and stories. he tells you what to study for the exams, and his tests are super easy. he gives tons of bonus. and puts almost half the notes online... take this class!!!!!!

Dr. Steve is a smart man with three PhDs! Don't let that scare you; he is very clear in lecture. I hate Biology, I'm all about the social sciences, but Dr. Steve made Biology tolerable and do-able. The tests are a little hard because there's so much information you have to know/memorize, but the questions aren't trick questions. HIGHLY RECOMMEND!

Dr. Steve is a smart man with three PhDs! Don't let that scare you; he is very clear in lecture. I hate Biology, I'm all about the social sciences, but Dr. Steve made Biology tolerable and do-able. The tests are a little hard because there's so much information you have to know/memorize, but the questions aren't trick questions. HIGHLY RECOMMEND!

Dr. Steve is the man. He tells you exactly what you need to know for exams and is one of the nicest guys you'll ever meet. His sense of humor makes lecture enjoyable, and he usually lets you out of very eary. This guy is a great professor.
Awesome teacher all around.  Made learning fun!  Didn't make you learn things you would never need to know in life.  Extremely helpful.  You have no idea until you take his class!
Excellent professor with a wonderful sense of humor. Precise in explanation, helpful in every sense of the word.
Comprehensive class, but he took out the fluff and it was nice and easy.
I would definitly take another class of his.
Cool Professor. If you attend class, you can get an A. He is a nice guy and tries to be funny, which he is most of the time. He does NOT have a chip on his shoulder. Fun class

Dr. Steve, you don't have to call him dr., was a really good professor. SOOO much better than Prof. Rissing who also teaches Bio 101. He was sort of boring but he put his lectures, most of them, on WebCT for us.  Overall, I really liked his class.

For me the lectures were impossibly boring. His jokes were so lame too. His tests are pretty easy though. Usually they spell something. If you like men that have mullets and bash their wives then take this class. If you hatelate night classes then don't.
Made lecture fun to go to, which was a plus. Tests are not hard, and half the final is exactly the midterm. He usually gives hints answers on the quizzes (abcde or all b's, etc.).

Good lecturer, even though the talks were somewhat boring.  He did make an effort to make the class interesting, and that's why I did well.  He's easy to understand and comfortable to talk to.  Knows his stuff, and has a sense of humor.
Steve is a really great teacher!  I'm planning on taking his 102 when it's offered!
Easy to understand and very helpful yet doesn't go into too much detail in non-major courses because he believes that should be saved for major courses, also a pretty funny guy when he wants to be:)
No Comments
No Comments

I cant recommend enough! If you do the work and show up for discussions you will not miss any points. Exams are take home, homework is light, and the class is neat. I think really great movies were chosen and I have been able to remember/learn all the content really easily by being able to see it incorporated in film. Dr. W is passionate & great

Evan is a sweet man, decent lecturer and tries hard to give his students a good experience.  But he was so in over his head at times. Told us grading would take 1 week, in reality it took 6ish weeks. Also, his test questions suck and are made unnecessarily hard with weird wording and qualifiers. He would be awesome if he was more straightforward.

Dr. W makes this class way too hard for an intro bio class. I have friends taking the same course with other professors who have much better understanding of the material and their grades are much higher. Evan is kind of all over the place and his exams are MUCH harder than they need to be. There are constantly assignments to do. Lots of work.
Good professor but an unnecessary amount of work for a GE. Exams arent easy either.

Interesting professor but exams are extremely difficult. There are a lot of assignments to help boost your grade, but the lectures can be a bit disorganized as well so it's hard to know what is going to be on the exams.

Dr. Waletzko is clearly passionate about what he teaches, but often struggles to get his point across. Lectures are a bit unorganized. There are several errors in slides and even exams. TopHat is used every lecture. Grades exams toughly, and multiple choice questions are weighted extremely high for no reason (3+ points per question).

Evan Waletzko is passionate and dedicated to what he teaches, and tries his best to make lecture somewhat enjoyable. On the other hand, class participation is huge and he is a tough grader for no reason. His lecture is EXTREMELY unorganized and tends to get off topic frequently. This GE credit harder than it should be.

Dr. W is a funny guy who is passionate about what he teaches. He can be disorganized at times, but he gets the point across. He is fond of daily TopHats so it's worth attending class. Also, he tends to dance around on the lecture stage a lot, sometimes without shoes, so he's pretty entertaining.

Awesome professor that kept lectures extremely interesting. Sometimes would jump around from topic to topic but syllabus clearly explains what topics the class was discussing. Exams can be an easy A if you read the textbook and go through the top hat questions. Also super helpful one-on-one if you need individual help.

His lectures were informative and somewhat interesting. This class had split professors which didnt really allow time to get used to either teaching style. Class was just okay. Exams were similar/same as simutext and lecture based.

Inspiring professor, interesting lectures. Required to show up at least 80% of time to get 100% on participation. Interactive lectures. Some easy extra credit ops to raise grade by half a letter grade. Two exams and final make up only 30% of grade so focus on labs and homework grades especially. Exams are wordy and confusing, so don't rely on them.

Evan is such a good Professor! I really enjoyed his class. His lectures consist of slides he prepares but they are very interactive. He is such a funny guy that he makes the lecture bearable. Exams are pretty hard but he has sooo many grades. If you do the reading, show up for all your lectures, and labs along with putting in some effort, A.
I made this solely to express how hot he is
Great class! He cares about his students and is passionate about biology.

This class has been awful. The amount of work between the online homework and projects for lab is insane. I spend at least 15+ hours a week just on the homework and projects and then add in the studying. Lectures are boring. Attendance is mandatory. The online homework/textbook is hard and makes losing points easy. I would absolutely not recommend.

Would not recommend Dr. Waletzko or Ecology to anyone trying to satisfy a biology lab requirement. There is excessive amounts of work required for this class, beyond the norm. Homework is due before each lecture, attendance is mandatory, there is lab work and a very time consuming semester long group project. Avoid if at all possible.
Evan was not the easiest class but I learned a lot from his class, exams get much harder from the first one and no curve is given but plenty of extra credit is offered to boost your grade
Tests were way too hard and harshly graded for a GE.  No curve.  He's a very nice guy but take with a different prof if you don't want a gen ed to hurt your GPA
Harsh/critical grading makes this GE course difficult.  Very particular about assignments and lectures are somewhat confusing

BIO 1101 is way more difficult than it should be with this professor. This class should be an easy GE for non-bio majors but the exams are very difficult and grading on everything is very high-expectation. Don't take this class if you don't have to. However, Evan is a nice guy and gives you all the slides, and attendance isn't mandatory.

Great Guy, awesome to have conversation with outside the classroom, very interesting and extremely intelligent. Transfers that to the class room and is very helpful and fair, I would highly recommend him.
He was really nto helping students, and would never glaze over an answer to a question from a student.

Dr. Taylor is a great biology professor. No boring powerpoint presentations; she actually lectures and knows her material front to back. Literally type/write down EVERYTHING she says because it will probably show up on the exams in some form. Her exam questions are tough and thorough; study your notes and you will do fine.

Best professor I've ever had. Took 1114 as a freshman. You need to attend almost every lecture because you get bonus points and midterm questions are created from SPECIAL material covered in lecture (not in book). Be thorough with your lab worksheets and writing assignments. Write down IFAT questions and study them. Review the textbook. I got an A.

Dr. Taylor was one of the best professors I've had at this university. She was very funny and passionate about biology and focused on teaching students to "think like a biologist," which I believe is more useful than facts in a textbook. You'll need to show up to class, but she keeps you on your toes, so you won't have to worry about falling asleep

You need to attend lecture to pass this class. All test questions come from her lectures so make sure you take great notes and write down EVERYTHING from examples to side comments. Tests can be tricky but once you start thinking from her perspective, they become easier. Don't slack on lab either because you want those points.

I really wouldn't recommend this class. Bio 1114 was supposed to be easier than Bio 1113, but I didn't think so. Like others say, her lectures are rather sloppy. She forgets what's on her slides and easily gets distracted which leads her off onto random tangents. However, she is really passionate about biology and helping students, but be warned.

Lecture is SUPER IMPORTANT! You get extra credit for going.  Her tests aren't hard if you know the concepts so that you can apply them.  Highly recommend her study method - outline and make up a fake test, then take it.  When I made regular flashcards I got a B, but doing her method got me A's

I would not recommend Dr. Taylor to anyone. Her lectures are very sporadic and she flies through the material. I will read the book and it doesn't help me on tests whatsoever. Her questions can be very tricky and even after all the studying I have done, the best test score I have received is a 75.

Very unclear and skips around. We would be on one topic then go back to one we previously talked about then skip back ahead of where we were. She expects everyone to think the way she does. The book does not help very much in her class. Though she was sporadic in her teaching methods, the exams were easy. Knowing IF-ATs help your score on exams.
Very passionate about biology, very engaging, and if you go to lecture the exams are not hard. Highly recommend if bio is something typically boring for you.

She's definitely super passionate about biology, no one can dispute that. Her lectures were super energetic. All of her questions come from lecture, so you definitely need to attend. No need to buy the book. Her class was pretty easy for me. Bio1114 is all about the big picture, keep that in mind, and you'll do great.

Dr. Taylor is knowledgeable and passionate about biology; however, her class is SO FRUSTRATING. She expects a much higher knowledge than a 1000 level course requires, and she makes you feel dumb for not meeting those expectations. It's essential to learn her ways, in order to pass. Attendance not mandatory, but points are awarded by answering Qs.

Dr. Taylor can be a little eccentric at times, but it is obvious that she loves teaching biology.  She is funny and wants her students to succeed.  Her exams come straight from the lectures, so read over the notes a few times and you will do fine.

Not only was Dr. Taylor distractible, but she was also just downright rude at times to many students. Makes it tough to participate and ask questions because she may ridicule you for certain answers or questions. Not a great professor and would avoid as she makes the class harder than it needs to be.
Everything in this class had to do with the wording. You have to understand the concept. Lectures are sporadic.

1) You have to attend lectures because every question is off her lecture slides which and what she says 2) You won't have enough time to write everything down 3) Reading the book won't help much  4) Extremely sporadic.  5) Your grade won't depend on how well you know biology, but how well you can interpret her questions 6) Won't help MCAT prep

Terrible lecturer.  Questions are purposefully written to be convoluted.  The lab for this class is quite interesting and fun--lecture on the other hand is what I imagine hell is like.  Avoid at all costs.

I'm not sure about all of the hate she's been receiving. I'm an average student at best, and I loved here class. She's super funny and the lectures are interesting.   Note that you DO have to go to class, and really understand what she's saying. This isn't a "memorize and get by" class. In fact, there is very little to actually memorize.

She is so interested in bio, it's scary. However, she doesn't know how to teach. She goes off topic a lot during lectures and asks about them on exams... Expects you to read chapters word for word. She won't even answer some of the questions asked in lectures... TAs can be really helpful to get through, especially Tony.

Taylor's Biology in Cinema class was an interesting way to get a natural science credit. I did not put full effort into this class and still got a B, which is a good sign of a fair class. She's a pretty good teacher, though scatter brained at times. Tests are pretty tough; participating and doing the rest of the assign's will insure a good grade.
Super interesting professor, really cares about the class. She's such a nice lady

I loved Dr. Taylor! She had very interesting biological examples almost every class. I really loved the npr stories. She is also fundamental in making sure that you really understand what evolution means. If you are serious about going into biology she will really make sure that you have an excellent foundation to work off of.

She is AWFUL, avoid at all costs. The textbook does not help whatsoever, and you need to go to lectures. Her lectures are useless because she is so obnoxious and scatter-brained. Her exams are also frustrating because her questions are constantly trying to trick you. The material is not difficult but this class is really, unnecessarily  hard.

she is AWFUL. her lectures are pointless, she's obnoxious and not willing to help students, but you need to attend lecture. exams are ridiculous and have so many questions where she tries to trick you. the material is not difficult, but she makes the class unnecessarily hard. avoid her at all costs. textbook does not help whatsoever. so frustrating

Her midterms are on irrelevant little things you learn in lecture, and her notes are absolutely horrible. She was very disorganized but a nice lady. I am just shocked at how hard her midterms were because of the minuscule topics (like random examples) we learned from class.

All you have to do is understand the big concepts, don't waste time on the little ones. The book is good for review, but do not read it word for word. She cares so much about the subject and would often meet me in office hours to talk about the class. Her lectures are a bit confusing sometimes, but overall I left this class with a lot of knowledge.

How to get an A: REVIEW textbook CONCEPTS, but don't worship them. She doesn't follow it, and it may confuse you more than help. GO TO CLASS. She doesn't post notes, or type many out, so LISTEN. If you can't pay attention or can't write fast enough to catch everything, RECORD lecture. Then you can figure out what she finds important (&tests on).

She's iffy. Her lectures are her speaking with no words on the powerpoint and you're required to write down pretty much every word she says. Her exams are worded pretty awkwardly and it trips most of the students up. She is very passionate about biology, but not a very good professor in my opinion.
I would try to avoid her class. Her exams were very difficult. She is very picky about wording as well.

If you are in her class for 1114 SWITCH PROFESSORS NOW. Her tests are impossible and I read the textbook, attended every lecture, and recorded the lectures. I am a straight A student (taken both chemistries, other biology classes and calculus) and this class was the most difficult and ridiculous to sit through.

I had a 4.0 at OSU until Dr. Taylor. Every question I missed was because the material was worded poorly or confusingly on the midterm. The only way you can do well is if you know what she is looking for and can interpret her opinions on the subject matter. I thought her lectures were very entertaining and logical, but her midterms ruined it of me.

If you can help it, do NOT take any classes with Dr. Taylor.  She uses the Socrates Method to teach classes of 300 people and her exams are full of wordplay and trick questions, sometimes over things barely mentioned in the class.  I've never had a Dr as an instructor that didn't tell us what she was specifically educated in. Worst class ever.

she puts topics she barely touched on in class on the exams and if a question was worded badly she doesn't acknowledge it at all, makes it so she really was right. write down everything she says in lecture and don't worry about the chapter readings unless you really struggle with bio

Worst professor I've had yet. Lectures make you want to pull your hair out. No organization, awful slides, constantly sidetracked, makes insensitive comments. When you ask questions she tells you to go read the book. Tests are full of incredibly unclear trick questions quizzing you on random facts she mentioned in lecture. DO NOT TAKE.

The absolute worst professor I have had at OSU. Trick questions on the exam that do not test your knowledge at all. Taking two upper level chemistry courses simultaneously with this course, and the chemistry courses were a breeze compared to this terrible class. Expects you to know every word she's ever said and other non bio related garbage. AVOID

She's an intelligent and passionate woman, but a poor professor. Her lectures are all over the place and unclear, she tries to trip up students constantly by testing over extraneous info that she mentions in passing, and she asks trick questions on the exams. Don't take her if you're looking to receive a straightforward education of biology.

Very annoying teaching style. Relies on students to know the answers, and if someone doesn't come up with the right answer she tells us to look in the book. Hardly any notes on her slides, just expects you to be able to hear other students and her without any repeating. Goes off on tangents and is very awkward and quirky.. laughs at students. Bad

Robin was a sub for my bio 1114 class for a few weeks and I did not think she was a good teacher at all. She was extremely ADD and jumped from topic to topic constantly. You may learn some of the random fun facts about bio that she speed talks through during class but if you actually want a decent base in bio, take a different teacher.

Do not take her film class. She is a horrible lecturer and incredibly hard to reason with. The writing assignments she gives are graded like an English teacher and it is almost impossible to receive full credit. Thought this would be an easy class for a semester full of hard classes, but turns out this is the most difficult one. Take any other bio.

I had Robin as a fill in and did very poorly when she took over. I need not elaborate on why because there are plenty of reviews to show, but if you can, I suggest taking Bio 1114 with Jimmy Chiucchi. He is funny and great at explaining and never ever ever tries to trick you. He answers any questions you may have and is appealing to the eye.
Tough professor but keeps the class interesting. I didn't do well on the first two midterms but I went to her office hours several times before the final and did significantly better.
the worst teacher I have ever had- clearly liberal watched michael moore and npr- not relevant to biology-- but that's what you're graded on as well as random sob stories from the class

Dr. Taylor is an awful professor.  Avoid at all costs.  She talks a million miles an hour and expects you to understand concepts that she does not explain well.  Uses completely useless examples in class and expects you to know extraneous topics like Latin to answer some of her questions.  Tries to trick you on exams. Will call you out in class.

One of the best teachers though most can't take her. If you have interest in organism biology & won't judge her for her (entertaining) quirks, you'll see how intelligent & passionate she really is, and not just some batty lady. Class is absolutely mandatory, as well as good notes, as everything she says is important whether you believe it or not.

She is literally the worst teacher ever. She talks a thousand miles an hour and expects you to be able to follow and write everything down and will yell at you if you try to take a picture. She has no idea how to use technology and she's clueless. She's also really strange and will say that everyone will have an unexpected pregnancy.

She is downright rude.  She yelled at a student for taking a picture of the board, yells at students for whispering in a 300+ person lecture, and will single people out to scold them.  She also says that almost every other sentence is going to be a midterm question.  She is rude, unfriendly, and unhelpful.

Dr. Taylor is a horrible teacher. She is all over the place and its impossible to follow along with what she says. She doesn't teach from the book but she does not give you many notes. Her midterms are basically over things that she says in class. Unless you are amazing at hearing someone talk and memorize every word they say, don't take this class

Dr. Robin Taylor was a wonderful professor, she made going to class from 6:30PM-9:30PM exciting and fun. She was one of the most interesting and informative teachers. Her teaching style is very engaging - humorous and outgoing.

Dr, Taylor makes you learn. She is an awesome, informative professor that only asks that you try. Shes great and I learned a great deal from her. Definitely take her film class, shes great. All the people here who say shes bad didn't get the grade they wanted because they either didn't try or didn't attend class. DON'T MISS A CLASS!

Worst professor I've ever had, I honestly don't know how she's teaching at a major public university.  Poor communication skills, sidetracked easily, tests on material she hasn't covered yet, and unknowingly embarrasses individual students in front of the class.  She does not have the social cognition skills to teach a large lecture course.

She takes the class far too seriously for it being an intro level GEC. I worked hard, attended every lecture and ended up with a B+, 0.6 away from an A-. Her quizzes suck and she intentionally tries to mess you up. Not the worst professor I've ever had, but she is a new breed of obnoxious and needless to say, she doesn't round.

Her lectures are very entertaining, attending is a must even though its not required. Not your typical exams though and are entirely based on the lectures. Paying attention and comprehending the material really helps. But in the end I learned a whole lot thanks to her. Never a dull moment with her.

I actually liked Dr. Taylor her lectures was like watching the animal channel when steve irwin was on there. Her exams were solely based on lectures so you dont need the book. She does jump around a little but you just have to write down everything she say. sometimes she present important facts in jokes which can cost you points on exams

Worst teacher I've ever had in my entire life. She and the course were completely horrible. Way too difficult for a GEC. Daily quiz and exam questions were incredibly cryptic and tricky, and often had glaring spelling/grammatical errors. Also, she was an all around closed-minded and difficult woman.

Seriously the worst professor I have ever had. She expects you to be able to elaborate on something she spent 1 minute on in class and is not in the book. Even if you go to every class and study your notes, you will still do terrible on the exams because she is terrible at wording and will put choices that are too similar only she knows the answer.
She is the worst lecturer I have ever had.

She's a great professor! Very entertaining and knowledgeable, she actually made me interested in bio. Exams are based entirely on lecture, don't waste your time with the book. Don't miss class and write down everything she says. Study your notes and you'll be fine.

One of the worst professors that I have had the honor to learn from.  Her lectures dictate what is on the exam, so you'd think attending every lecture would correlate with a good grade.  Wrong.  She says and shows some obscure stuff during class that comes around exam time.  Avoid by all means.

A good and humor professor. But really awful test, I even thought it was a history and philosophy exam when I took the mid-term. U'll never get good grade even if u record every single word she said on class.= =#The worse thing is nothing except assignment will be posted online.

Awful professor. Questions on tests are often unclear, and many times TA's have trouble explaining why two answers are right but one is the best. You don't really have a choice though, she is the only prof for this class as of the time i took it. Try to take as many pictures of her slides as you can, she loves the flashes of cameras.

She was a good professor.  She was clearly passionate about biology which helped me be able to comprehend the lectures.  As long as you put in the effort, you will be successful.  The grade is solely a reflection of your effort.

Very passionate about the subject; made it relevant through everyday examples.  Attend lecture (EVERY lecture), listen carefully (even to obscure details), and take detailed notes.  Study off the notes, and you'll do fine.  Labs and writing assignments were easy.  However, Pop-Ales were irrelevant to the subject material.  DO NOT BUY THE BOOK!
Exams based off only of lectures.

Talks fast and doesn't put the important slides online, which would be ok, except she says important stuff so fast. Really rude to people who have questions during lecture. Irritating - she expected my 600 person class to be quiet all the time. If we have q's, and she's won't answer w/o making us feel dumb, then we should be able to ask each other.

One of the worst professors I've ever had.  Her lectures are solely based upon information in her power-points that she doesn't even understand at times. Never able to meet outside of class. Her exams and midterms are very challenging, often containing information mentioned only once in lecture (sometimes as a side note). Avoid her!

Dr. Taylor's class is solely based on lectures. Her exams are based on lectures, But some of the questions on the exams are the stuff she never ever mention in class. The only way you can get a good grade in this class, if you are super genius at guessing. Lectures were interesting. Exams were hard, and her questions don't make any sense.

Worst teacher I have ever had. She stops in the middle of lecture from some1 wearing a necklace and it reflected light to her. She doesn't know why she put half the slides on her slide show. She should not be teaching. Find a different teacher ASAP
Most frustrating teacher I have ever had. If you are trying to take a bio 101 class, find another teacher so that you can have somewhat of a shot at getting an A

Do not use the book at all. No clarifications or any help if you are lost or confused. Lab is difficult but doable. Her views are the only right way. What you may have learned previously may not be true in her class. You have to listen to every single word she says.

Attendance is absolutely mandatory. Tests questions comes from lecture. Don't buy the book. Lab practical is really hard. I got a B in the class because of the practical. Overall, I wouldn't take this class again. Taylor goes all over the place and is a poor lecturer. Pay attention to blue slides and NPR.Write down everything. GO TO LECTURE

Very energized professor so makes lectures very interesting. Exams are directly from her lecture so don't need to buy the book. Attendance in lecture is necessary if you want to do well on the exams. Shows interesting NPR stories. People who don't like her probably didn't go to lecture.

She is high energy and gives entertaining lectures. The people who don't like her probably don't like coming to lecture. Slides are posted but only partially filled in. Exam questions come from material left off the slides.

Overall an interesting and worthwhile class. "Blue slides" and NPR's on her P-points are exam questions. Posts P-points AFTER class, so just write down everything she says that's not on the screen. Tricky exams, tougher lab practical. Writing assignments graded hard. Watch grammar and follow every direction.

She loves the subject and it rubbed off on the students (or at least me). I loved how she incorporated real stories with what we're learning to give us context. The modterms and final comes from her notes. The book wasn't even used. I would love to take another class with her.

Exciting professor who clearly loves the subject matter. Makes lectures interesting although some times she rushes just to get to NPR segments. Doesn't use the textbook. Exams are based solely off lecture so attendance is mandatory if you want to do well. Exam questions often worded in a tricky way, only complaint I really have.

Don't take this class. She doesn't use the book so lectures are mandatory if you want to do well in this class. You have to memorize her notes. She doesn't seem very interested in students or teaching and is much more interested in her own research and NPR stories. Find a different teacher that actually wants to help students and isnt inaccessible
Don't take this class. She wants us to remember every number she mentions on the class and includes them as the questions in the midterm and final.

Extremely interesting lecturer.  She is funny and very interested in the material, which makes you interested.  You don't use the text book at all so don't bother even getting it.  My advice is to go to lecture (EVERY LECTURE) and write down every word she says.  Those are all you have to study.  She won't help you if you didn't go to her lecture.
I have never had an interesting teacher that I actually WANTED to listen to before Taylor

Very poor professor that only seems to be liked by females in the class. Doesnt teach out of a book, everything is off her slideshows, but she talks a million miles an hour so its hard to catch everything. Hates pre-med kids. If you get taylor I would recommend trying to find another professor.

She's interesting but you will learn absolutely nothing. I got an A- and only crammed a couple hours before each test. Overall I'd say if you don't actually care about learning bio and just want a decent grade it's an ok class. Labs kind of suck though.
As long as you come to class, it's an easy class. Her writing assignments are graded very harsh. Her 102 class is a film study class, which makes it very intersting. I liked her.

There seem to be negative reviews for Dr. Taylor, but this was the most interesting biology course I have ever had. Dr. Taylor's enthusiasm and comedic personality made me want to go to class.
