You do not need to use the book at all, as long as you attend lectures you will get a good grade. She emphasizes in class exactly what will be on the exams.

Amazing teacher, really good at explaining and solidifying concepts. She posts some of her slides online, but she goes really fast. Her tests are fairly hard and very detailed. You have pretty much no chance of getting an A unless you go to class because she tests on a lot of info she doesn't post online. I studied A LOT and did fine.

Dr. Taylor was one of my favorite professors. She clearly LOVES the subject matter & her excitement is contagious. Her lectures are fascinating b/c they apply to the living world around us. Who wouldn't want to go to her lectures? Write down what she says, NOT the slides since she provides those, then study both, and you'll Ace her exams. :)
Overall I thought the class was easy but I still only got a B-. Her exams come straight from the lecture and there's no reason to even open the book.

Ok, anyone who says they think she is a horrible professor just didn't get the grade they wanted. All you have to do to well is attend every single lecture, and study all those notes to do well on the tests. As for her teaching style, yeah she may be scatter brained, but she keeps the class INTERESTING which I think is very important.

Just a horrible professor. She goes on unrelated tangents that are useless but still testable material. All she really cares about is NPR stories, and she will rush through lecture notes to play uninteresting stories. If you're premed, don't bother.  None of the material she talks about will help you on MCAT.  Avoid her if possible, she's terrible.

taylor isn't a hard professor, but her exams are based ONLY on what is said in lecture. she will ask questions about topics not related to bio, but just to see if you attend class and can write down what she says EXACTLY in lecture. don't take her if you actually plan on applying any knowledge you would get from bio 114 since shes doesn't teach it

Easily the worst professor I've ever had. Her notes follow no logical pattern, she jumps around from slide to slide and talks about whatever she wants. If the goal is to get kids to come to class, then she's a genius because you'll fail if you don't. If the goal is to learn, then she's the worst I've ever had. Bar none.

DONT TAKE THIS CLASS! I read these comments before and its NOT worth it to take it, I regret it. Take Chordas, guarenteed a better grade.They should name is class Taylor101, you dont need to really know Bio!  Just pay attention to her lectures and TAKE NOTES preferable with a comp, and even write down what happens in the videos she shows. GOOD LUCK
dont say she's awesome. she's AWFUL teacher. avoid at all costs. should be retired or fired soon. m worried about final exam. I donno what to study coz I learned nothing from her.

Would recommend not taking her class.  She does try and keep things interesting, but she goes off topic and doesn't help prepare you for the exams at all.  Exams were very tricky and hard to study for.

AWFUL. Imposes political beliefs and is only interested in student sob stories that are barely related to any topic covered. Only cover what is "interesting to her" and do not learn anything useful. DO NOT TAKE, even if to complete a GEC. not worth it.

Very entertaining.  Also, very useless if you need to retain any information for future classes/professional exams.  Tests covered info she found interesting more than core concepts of evolutionary biology. Jumps way too fast through slides to get to NPR broadcasts that don't always relate. I don't recommend her if you're pre-med.
if you have to take a night class (like i did) take her! she's a little crazy and OBSESSED with NPR but she made the class easy and fun!
The Power-point slides showed are not ready. She just jumped from this point suddenly to another. She wasted too much time in the lecture talking about something useless and helpless to the exam.

Dr Taylor is awesome! Has a great sense of humor and gives good real world examples which make it easy to pay attention in class. Attendence is mandatory, as all material is in lecture notes and she will put specific exam material in there. Go to class and pay attention...you might enjoy it.

Before taking this class, I really liked biology. After the class I hated biology. The class itself isn't hard, and Dr. Taylor is interesting to listen to, but she is a TERRIBLE lecturer. She jumps around ALOT making notes useless to study with. Class content was also a waste of time, I didn't learn anything.
Hilarious

Awesome professor!  I took 101 with her and enjoyed it so much I took 102 even though I didn't have to.  Attending her class is key, if you attend and actually pay attention instead of chatting with friends or texting you'll likely get an A in the class.  She is very random which just made class that much more fun and material easily remembered.

Prof. Taylor was awful. She just goes off on rants about things in class that don't make any sense her material is in her slides mostly. But she jumps around in class and doesn't make any sense some times. Oh! And She is the most liberal woman ever. I got a B+.

Don't even bother buying the book for this class. You won't need it. Her entire class is based off of lecture and her notes. She often times says something in class and puts it on the exam, so be prepared for that. Go to lecture, take notes, and listen carefully. Her class isn't too difficult, it's just dull at times.

She is very intelligent and conveys necessary info. As long as you go to lecture and pay attention, this class is not hard. Everything on the exams is from information she gives you in class. You don't even need to buy the textbook. The only problem is she talks very quickly and jumps around a lot. I recommend typing notes if you can type quickly.
She is the worst professor I have never had

So we all have pet peeves.  She makes hers known - no talking in class or coming in late.  Jot down the stuff she mentions will be on the Final or on a blue slide - study that and you will do fine!  Keep an open mind about profs that aren't all the same cookie cutter crap and the class is easy.  She's ADD but she's a hoot and loves to teach.

Spent several weeks on the topic of Transexuals.  Not sure what that has to do with Biology but she sure spent a lot of time on it.  Also, stresses her liberal beliefs in class and criticizes anyone with a differing opinion.  Easy class, but would look for a different prof if you have to take Bio102.
She is what you call an easy teacher if you have heard the material once before. Don't expect she'll teach you. Her clarity and office hours she claims she has are non-existing.

I'm currently in her Bio 101 night summer class and I like her alot. Yeah, she's ADDish and all over the place. But she's interesting. And I couldn't care less about bio, I'm a humanities major. She gives you an overall basic view of what you need to know. It is a GEC after all.  Don't bother buying the book. It's simple.. GO TO CLASS = easy A.

I personally loved her teaching style. She's a bit crazy, but at least it is interesting. Attending lecture is a must,I missed two lectures before the final and you could tell from the grade difference. This was probably my favorite class that I have taken so far. A great class for students interested in environmental science, not so much for preme

Terrible professor. Wanders off topic constantly. Tests are hard to study for.  Makes students feel like morons when they participate and then complains when they stop. Also a bleeding liberal who worships and assigns NYT articles, plays NPR & loves Michael Moore.  Believes that if you do not share her view ur simply ignorant. Didn't learn a thing.

Worst teacher I have had at ohio state so far. The lab is the only worthwhile part of this class. Dr. Taylor only posts notes after class and often there are 5 or 6 slides she has never gone over. Her exams are overly based on her opinions and she ridicules premed majors. i dropped from honors to take this class, worst idea ever.

Constantly qualifies prior information she gave instead of just giving the bottom line. Rambles. Info given one lecture, may be changed the next lecture.  Also does a lot of ad lib comedy, too much, makes you lose concentration on the subject.  You have to attend class because you dont know what may change.  Dont have to buy book.

OMG!!! WTF is this lady on?  The reviews are correct.  She is all over the place.  She yells at people for talking and calls them stupid in class.  She complains about participation but scolds anyone that participates.  Please avoid this class at all costs.  Especially if you need to know stuff for the MCAT, like alternation of generations.

i'm sitting in her class right now, and i want to DIE. from her stutter to her stupid humor, to her raspy voice, to her jumping around all over the place and having no idea where she is or what she's doing, this class is UNBEARABLE! but you have to go to it, or you will fail. period. take honors, it's 100 times easier and minus the psycho screaming

ENTIRE exam is based on random anecdotes from lecture, and if you leave even a few minutes early or arrive a few minutes late, you'll lose AT LEAST 5% on the exam.  Her "personality" is annoying and exaggerated and it's not the way to start the day.  If you're in honors, take that...it's a million times more straightforward than this psycho's class
she needs to read darwin's black box

Class was easy! Dr. Taylor is weird/ wack job. Really strict on people coming in late to class on movie days. She has a slight stutter. Writing responses for the movies are either a F or an A. Midterm was easy final was a little harder. She talks about sex alot. Overall good class but weird teacher.

Great professor- truly loves to teach.  Her enthusiasm is catching, and she has a sense of humor- something desperately needed for dry topics like phylogeny. Attend lecture!  If you attend lecture and take notes, you'll no doubt do well.  You're paying tuition to be taught anyway, don't try to just "learn from the book."

Wow! Fun professor, interesting class. She is open to your questions. Film format rocked!! Wish more classes were as much fun - content was made very relatable by connecting topics to mainstream films.  I couln't help but be interested in material.  Attend every class, not tolerant of absences. Have to take Bio 102? Take Dr. Taylor, she is awesome!
Easy class, and a lot of fun topics, just ignore the ignorant close minded kids and you'll enjoy it.

Easily the worst teacher i have ever had.  The class is super easy if you attend all the lectures, but you will learn nothing.  She skips the important topics and will talk for hours on a detail that is irrelevant to the material (and this is what you will be tested on)  If you just need a good grade take this, if you need to learn biology skip her

I'll admit, I didn't go to class often. But I shouldn't have had to -- I read the book daily. So why did the exam have LITTLE to do with Biology and test you more on whether you came to class? Come on, this isn't high school where they play little attendance games.

Dr. Taylor was very interesting. She is really the best Biology teacher, and if you plan on taking the MCAT someday, having her as a teacher may come back to bite you. It's very easy to get an A in her class. Just study her notes. Study for the Lab Practical well in advance! If you don't go to every lecture, well good luck with that.

Great Professor!  Very enthusiastic, interesting class.  Liked her unique format.  Wished other classes @ OSU were more like hers.  Speeds thru the PP slides, but posts them on Carmen, just write down the "blue" slides in class, get the rest off Carmen later.  Didn't use book.  Don't talk/make noise with a food wrapper, you'll get dirty look.

by far the easiest class i've taken at ohio state.  go to lecture and when she says "this will be on the final" write it down, cause it's gonna be on the final.  no need to buy the book because she doesn't use it at all.  very enthusiastic, hates hates hates it when people talk in lecture and she will call you out in front of the 500 other people.
very easy teacher. she pretty much hands over the questions to you during the lecture. the first exam av. was 86% and the second was 79%. no curve because no one needed it.

Dr. Taylor is a great teacher who loves her job and wants everyone to learn the material. She tells you during class, slides that will directly be on the test. Her notes are straight forward with the test which makes it easy to study a class that can be potentially hard. Go to class and you should get an A, I think lab hurts grades if anything...

To be quite honest, she probably knows what she is talking about but she cannot transfer the information to others.  As someone else said, her slides are confusing and she is extremely unorganized.  I'm sure she tries really hard but she doesn't convey the information well.

Guarantee you an A if you attend class. So attend class and actually listen and you will be fine. TRUST ME. In terms of teaching she is off the wall but very good about teaching the material in ways you understand.  Take this teacher and go to class and you WILL get no lower than a B. My word.
Dr. Taylor is wonderful. She loves what she does and she makes class fun. Her class is easy if you attend.. It would be a mistake not going. I would reccomend her to anyone!

This prof is ridiculous, she really doesnt teach anything, Lectures are random and tests are not based on biology stuff. Dont take this class if you can, I really think that I learned nothing from this class.

Awesome biology instructor! Not sure why she'd get a bad rating... Energetic, full of enthusiasm for the subject, keeps students engaged. Clear in explanations of subject material. Textbook is optional. Easy to get a good grade if you attend class and pay attention.

I have never had a professor that was as unorganized as she was. Her lectures were random and confusing and she got off track all the time. Her midterms and finals were completely random and were focused on very specific facts that she never stressed. Also, focused way too much on NYT articles and it was hard to study using articles.

Very energetic! Gets excited so she talks very fast. Tests are easy if you go to class and learn extra things given in class such as word of the day. Not going to class is a mistake.  You miss too many small details not in the notes that are presented on midterms.  Teaches you interesting things related to your own life.

Class was ridiculous.  Preparing for midterms was a crapshoot.  Said everything would be from lecture and then stuff wasn't.  Rambled in class, seemed like useless trivia, then that was the exam.  Never felt tested over actual Bio concepts. She didn't even know what lab was going to be for the week.  Avoid if taking BIO 101.
Really fun, energentic teacher.  Classes are interesting and entertaining.  Exams based of lectures, so its pretty necessary to attend, but if you go they are not difficult!  Great professor.
She is really funny and full of energy...she is a really cool teacher that tells you things that are helpful for your life...not just Biology stuff.

Yeah...she's pretty bad. It's like her exams aren't even a test of your abilities as a student. It's just chance what you focus your studying on. The book was no help because following her lectures in the book is like a terrible, terrible educational scavenger hunt. I got more use out of Wikipedia. Good luck!

This woman is EVIL!!!  She goes extremely fast through the notes and doesn't give you adequate time to write things down.  She also rambles off the topic and makes students sit in every other seat to prevent us from talking.  The exams are ridiculous, and cover things she barely mentioned in lecture and aren't in the notes or the book.

An excellent professor. Do your work and study and you will do just fine. Make sure you're thorough in lab. Go to lecture, easy in-class activities that are only participation. Exams have a lot of graphs/charts - overall not bad. Dr. L wants you to do well and is always willing to explain. Fun professor, get to know him!

Attendance not mandatory but need to go to get TopHat points. Class is very easy if you are good at analyzing graphs on exams. Likes to put trick questions on exams but I always got an A on the exams.

His lecture is interesting and short, not like labs. The tophat questions are relatively easy, but that requires you to attend every class. No need to buy the textbook, it is useless. You will pass the exam with lecture notes. The labs are kind of boring, and it is too long, three hours straight. There are three hard midterms, so prepare for those.

Dr. L is really chill and makes class as interesting as he can. We used tophat instead of clicker questions and had optional exrta credit through those questions. He also gave in class assignments which help boost your grade. We also had weekly online quizzes which help out with grades too. The exams are hard for almost everyone.

He was a really nice guy who seemed to know what he was talking about. The test have absolutely nothing to do with the book or even lectures. His tests consists of graphs and how to read them. You have to show up to class to receive a lot of the points for the class. Pretty easy A if you go to class.

Tests have little relation to the material from the book, or even the material taught in class.  It is more application-style than anything else, and subsequently very difficult.  Average for tests was usually a C-.  Gives extra credit, though, and is nice.

Very nice and helpful, test and quizzes affect your grade but not too much to where you can't succeed if you were to bomb it.  Test are hard, and not concept based more application based and data analysis. Was compared to the style of an ACT by many peers.

Dr. L is very clear and to the point. I never opened my book once and just studied the notes and I passed. He was also my lab TA and never hesitated to answer a question in multiple ways to ensure you understood. In-class activities are nice but there isn't a lot of feedback on whether your answers are right or wrong. Traditional teaching style.
You answer online questions or do in class activities for points every lecture which are a nice grade buffer. He is very nice, clear, and helpful. Midterms are pretty easy. Labs are interesting.

This class is not organized at all. You go from learning about the origins of life on earth, to how kidneys work. He mutters, so you can't really hear what he's saying, and his slides aren't helpful. And then the exams are more in-depth than what you've covered in class. Reading the book definitely helps, but it's not really mandatory.

A lot of material for just 2 exams. Most of the material is straight forward, and he only tests over what he covers in lecture. Use the book to clear up any cloud topics. You must go to class to pass, and you must take excellent notes since he doesn't give out power-points. Only problem is he doesn't have practice midterms.

Did not speak clearly at all in class; Hard to hear. VERY boring. clearly did not want to be teaching such a low level class. Questions were very wordy- most difficult part was figuring out what he was asking. Go to class for clicker Qs. Study questions at end of chap in book!

He was somewhat boring in class but that was more of a subject material problem than him. Get the testbank and know the questions at the end of the chapters in the book, he uses these word for word on his tests

He mumbles a bit sometimes, but other than that I thought he was a good professor. Many of the students in this course are fresh out of high school and don't understand how disrespectful it is to talk during lecture. That is what troubled me the most in terms of getting anything from his lecture.. I couldn't hear him because of other students.

I loved this guy. Everyone else complained about the boredom and randomness that comes with his course, but I thought he was clear, concise, and often very funny and quirky. If you pay attention and listen, rather than sit and take pictures with your phone like most seem to do, you'll be fine.

Most random professor ever. Loves birds and nothing else. Can ramble on about anything related to birds. If birds touch it, its in this class. Boring as watching wood grow. Clicker question=useless. Find another professor.

I actually found him to be an excellent teacher, but perhaps that was because he was teaching a more involved class (behavioral ecology), and not an introductory course.  He really knew what he was talking about and was extremely prepared for the class. He did not have outrageous demands on students and his exams were straightforward.

Professor Nelson aka Bird Call Nelson had no desire to teach this class. He does not care about his students. A tip, all of his questions are from the From the Cambell and Reece Tesbank 9th edition, read the book and study the test bank and you'll get an A.

Not exactly as bad a professor as most people are saying here. His tests are often more wording oriented rather than straight facts, which made them somewhat time consuming and difficult. They were still doable though, and all answers came straight from his powerpoints, so minimal studying was involved. Just memorize the slides and you'll be fine.

He literally has the most ridiculous expectations of students on his midterms.  I have never been more frustrated with how unable I was able to learn in a class.  He picks out the tiniest details from the lecture slides and expects you to apply your knowledge to an insane degree.  Not helpful and not engaging.
His midterm was ridiculous, way too hard for a 100 level class.  sad that several people in the class are doing better in o-chem than his bio class.
one word..TERRIBLE

He hates his students, or at least that was the impression I got when I asked for clarification about a midterm. Was very sarcastic and rude in his response. Also, incredibly boring voice/lecture, and mumbles, so it's a bit difficult to understand him.

Does have a very monotone voice.No need for the book if you go to class and take good notes.I didn't buy the book and still got an A. He seemed to be very interested in animal behavior and was willing to help you. Make sure you right down the examples he gives in class.

boring isn't even enough to describe. this guys talks in the most monotone voice... and ezpects you to hang on every word. don't try skipping lectures and reading the book either- he always throws something on the exam that isn't in the book and was only in lecture.

this is the most boring class i've taken in my college experience, or even educational experience.    the material is interesting enough, but the presentation is horrendous.  he will write down a word on the overhead without any rational explaination and expect u to know where he's coming from.  BAD
Take someone else.  Drones on and on, whether the students understand or not.  No real access or care for students.

Lectures can be boring but are beneficial to go. Takes attendance by "clickers". She posts all notes on Blackboard which is super helpful. Only 2 midterms/ exams. Weekly homework assignments but they are easy. NEVER USED THE BOOK.
Very nice and cute. Very helpful if you ask, and even if you don't. French accent, but easy to understand. Says idear instead of idea :]

good prof, puts slides on carmen so you can print them out before class.  you have to write a term paper but you can pick the topic.  one page of notes for exams which is awesome. love Dr. Pangle! ask her about hyenas :)
As long as you used the clicker, you got full attendence points. The overall class was very easy, I slept through most of it and still made an A

Very clear in her lectures. Provides lots of info and case studies to make things clear. You can bring a page of crib notes to the exam which helps a lot; exams are short answer/essay but come straight from lecture notes. Just be sure to go to class! Term paper required as well. Very passionate about the subject. Textbook is optional.
Very easy
pretty clear in her lectures. covers all the material. if you attend the lectures and labs you should do fine. i've never been an "A" student when it comes to the sciences but i got an A in her class

Class is very easy. She went over material well for such a huge class. The cheat sheets for midterm and final help but make the test harder. Labs are boring and hurt your grade if your TA is a hard grader.
Lectures are interesting.  Use of the clickers forces you to pay attention.  Her accent makes it hard to understand at times.  Labs are a waste of time, though.

She makes Biology 101 as easy as possible. yes, attendance is mandatory, but clicker points do add up ALOT. she allows us bring cheat sheets which is nice. I had a good TA, so labs weren't that hard, so it just depends on your TA. She's helpful too. I don't have problem understanding her.

Pangle is a little hard to understand because of her french accent, but is an easy professor for college.  She lets you use cheat sheets on the midterm and final.  Attendance is mandatory, and you get points for using a "clicker" in class for participation.  I suggest taking her but make sure you get a good TA, the head TA grades extremely hard!

Very nice teacher. This class was very easy. You get to make a study guide and use it on the exams. Though the exams are essay format, they are non-comprehensive and very straightforward. As long as you put in a mediocre effort you'll get an A no problem.

if you're a bio major, this class will be cake. A lot of people in this class seemed to have a very poor understanding of science in general. Loved the class format, as exams were not worth a lot. Most leniently graded class I've ever taken at OSU. Pangle's really nice, you can understand her fine. Attendance is mandatory, but class is interesting.

At first you think this class will be extremely hard because she is foreign and just talks instead of reading off the board.  This class was not an easy class as it covers alot of material but she made it easier by making it interesting. She always has an anecdote to help you remember material.
Very picky grader, your grade has little to do with your knowledge of ecology. She penalizes for every little thing. Talks too fast at times, Voice gets too high pitched and annoying.
She's great!

I don't like her lecture style very much. She uses slides with a black background so you can't print them out, then she just sort of rambles on. Its hard to pull out the most important material. Having said that there is not all that much material. If you try I'm sure you can do well in the class. I however did not. I like her accent.
Dr. Kane was a pretty good teacher. He has some good jokes and some lame ones, and he can be a little loud, but he knows what he's talking about and knows how to teach it.
Great class and prof. I highly recommend it!

Tony is an excellent TA. He makes sure you truly understand lab and will send out lengthy emails every week before you turn in your labs to make sure you have EVERYTHING. Genuinely tries to make lecture less confusing and makes sure you see the big picture with it all. Also ask him questions because his answers are sometimes test answers.

Loved him. Didn't care to waste anyone's time but always taught super well. Makes tough quizzes, which wound up being my weakness in the class but if you work hard, the grade you get will reflect it. He was funny and seemed to care about how we did, even though he made an effort to seem like he didn't care at all. Take him if you have the chance!

GREAT lab TA. Lets you leave lab as soon as you're done and doesn't waste your time with useless recitation activities unless the class wants to. Every week he sends out a detailed lengthy email explaining exactly how to do the lab worksheets and what to expect on the quizzes which is extremely helpful. He's hilarious and a great dude. Take his lab

Tony is by far one of the best - he's hysterical and has the ability to make boring labs amusing and worth your while.  As long as you read his emails THOROUGHLY (no matter how long), you should easily be able to get an A as far as the lab grades go. If your class schedule allows it, I definitely recommend you take Tony as your TA - he's awesome!

If you read and take good notes from the book, it shouldn't be hard. I don't understand why some people don't like him. I had him for my lab and he was great. I will say, however, I took detailed notes from the book for every chapter covered and that was the biggest reason I did well in the class.

Not a professor you want. He has little to no organization and his lectures are pointless. Doesn't give you any instruction on what is on the exam. Put a lot of work into the class and it doesn't matter how much you study, the exams are not impossible, but if you do not know specifics about irrelevant information, it is tough.

Rothacker is hands down the worst professor I've ever had. My TA even said he's a terrible professor. You have to go to class to do stupid in class activities. He goes so in depth during lecture, but exams aren't in depth. He goes SO fast, don't even try to take notes. Your grade depends on how hard your TA grades, which mine graded hard.

His lectures drag on, are random and give no direction. He is no focused on class matter, he tends towards evolution. It is a waste togo to class, but he makes it mandatory. NEVER TAKE HIM. Every poor comment is true and he needs to be let go. No wonder he makes so little at this university. Good luck guys.

Quite frankly, he's an awful professor. I did well in the class (A-), but as a pre-Dental student, I don't feel I learned what I needed for the DAT. In fact, halfway through the semester I had to go to both his lectures for the in-class activities and Sarah Ball's lectures where I actually learned the material. Simply put, don't take him for 1113.

Bombed both midterms and the final and still managed to get a B+ in this class. There is a lot of extra credit so make sure you always get 100% on the online quizzes because that saved me. Lectures are totally pointless but you have to go to get attendance points. Read the book and make sure your lab group is good! Would not recommend this teacher

I suggest you don't pay attention to these comments. Dr. Rothacker was one of the nicest and helpful professors I've had. All you gotta do to pass is show up to class, pay attention and read the book. Also pay attention to the quizzes on MB.

Don't take his class. He should not teach. He says he will grade things and do things one way at the beginning of the semester, and completely change it by the end. His slides are not helpful, and attendance is mandatory to listen to him ramble on about something you will not understand. There aren't enough characters in this box for me to go on.

Lecture was essentially a waste of time. If there weren't participation points, I would never show up to class. The lecture hardly scratched the surface of the material, making it so you have to read and take your own notes from the book. He claim that the lecture slides are a supplement to the textbook readings, but they were not organized at all.

Dr. Rothacker did not seem interested in being in class. His lectures were not always relevant to tests and labs. The grading for labs can be frustrating, because you get graded with your lab group. So, make sure you have a good group. The midterms are exactly the same as the quizzes that you take online weekly

Like beer and pizza? If you answered yes, this class is for you! Besides dropping the occasional F bomb, his lectures are more boring than watching grass grow. His lectures are not related to the tests whatsoever, however, you are forced to attend class to partake in graded "participation" activities. His test questions are all pulled from quizlet.

He came to Otterbein to take over bio halfway through the semester, and was AWFUL!! he refused to put the power points online so we all got bad grades, and during his lecture he wouldn't leave the slides up long enough for us to write all of it down, and then would get mad at us when we asked him to go back. DO NOT TAKE HIS CLASS! He is of no help.

Dr. Rothacker is a good lecturer. He wants to keep people engaged so he does do a lot of in class activities, but they are not harshly graded so really I do think it's worthwhile practice. His midterms are pretty hard though, and they will be harshly graded, they include drawing your own graphs and are essentially all short-essay questions.

This was my first semester of college and lets just say he didn't make it easy for me to transition.  Lectures matter because you do in class activities all the time.  Tests do not relate at all to anything you cover, just the online questions.  The book is useless so don't waste your time or money.  I would reccomend avoiding this class.

DO NOT buy the book, it was never used. All of the test questions come from the practice quizzes, so don't bother reading notes, just literally memorize the practice quizzes. I ended up with a good grade (from teaching myself), but try to avoid him at all costs.

Exam questions are difficult and often unrelated to lecture. However, if you skip lecture, you'll miss the constant random 2 point busy work assignments this professor pulls out of his ass at the last second of class. These assignments add up so you can't miss them. I taught myself most of the material because the professor doesn't want to help.

Is intro biology class supposed to be that tough? Quizzes are unrelated to lectures and lectures are pointless. However, you can't skip class because there's in class assignments during every lecture. He even let you write down PARAGRAPHS at the last minutes and turn it in for credits.
Did not like him as a professor.  If you can avoid having him, do at all costs.  Assignments every class, pop quizzes and more.  Also does not help if you have a question either.
spend whole class period doing group activities instead of lecturing. i feel like not learning anything from his class.
Often use the whole class time to do group activities instead giving a lecture.

Honestly the worst teacher I have ever had. Doesn't write his own tests/quizzes, midterms and final felt more like a list of random bio facts that were never discussed in lecture. He actually believes that birds are reptiles. I'm not kidding.
Terrible teacher. Absolutely no interest in students. Avoid him at all costs. Midterms are based   completely on online quizzes. Lectures are pointless

AWFUL professor. Lectures are pointless, but mandatory because of in class activities. Exams consist of a lot of quiz questions, but there's so many it's impossible to remember them all. Avoid this professor at all costs! Goes off on random tangents all of the time and usually learn nothing important in lecture. NYTimes assignments are pointless.

Syllabus was inaccurate and riddles with errors. The online quizzes contained duplicate correct answers, but only was correct. Lecture was mandatory but the material was almost entirely unrelated to the mid terms and final, which were ludicrously hard. DO NOT TAKE intro Bio with this guy.

Too difficult for an intro class.  Professor was unorganized (syllabus was confusing and didn't match up with what we were learning, being quizzed over, etc.) and wastes a lot of time making jokes instead of teaching.  Tried to self teach myself but the midterms were very tricky.  Overall frustrating - Don't recommend.

His lectures don't match what we are graded over. He is not very clear, yet has strict guideline on grading. You teach your self the material, your TA helps explain after you've taken your test and he stands at the front talking about beer and topics you were test a week prior on
Nothing in the class that is taught by him comes in the homework, quizes or midterms. Goes completely off topic in the class. Use of a textbook is mandatory to pass. Avoid if you want a good grade.

I loved the organization of the class (ecology/evolution to evolution of life). The exams seemed impossible though. I felt they didn't reflect what we focused on in lecture and some questions were off-the-wall. Lecture is somewhat helpful, but you could probably read the book and do just as well.
Terrible professor, hardass quizzes and tests over material he never mentions once. Terrible jokes. Avoid.

This class, during the semester season at Ohio State, has had to probably be one of the most stressful courses I've ever had to take in my life for two reasons: first reason, what was supposed to be simple was in the end was wordy and complicated. Second reason, way too much work and no compromises. This is a weed out course, don't take this guy.

I stopped paying attention when I realized that his notes were poorly organized and would not get me through the class with an A. Some advice is to BUY THE BOOK AND READ IT. Don't be cheap!!! Also if you do OK on the exams and do ALL the other work you should be able to get a B or A. Good luck... you'll need it for the final ... :(

This class was generally very easy, but it really depends on how you learn.  His lectures are useless, so you have to teach yourself everything from the book if you want a good grade. Lots of busy work makes exams worth less than 50% of your grade, and lots of extra credit. Not too bad, but I found his class to be more time consuming than necessary

I had Rothacker for 1113 and 1114. Put the time in to read the book, because his lectures are unorganized with lots of typos. However, an A is not difficult as long as you read the book for the most important chapters and take advantage of the MANY small, easy grades. In my opinion he's a pretty lazy prof so don't expect an easy way out.

Come on guys, give him some credit. I do think he is a great lecturer, you can tell he is trying really hard to entertain us as non-science majors. The thing is, the material is really unorganized, and you don't really have the time to read everything on the textbook. You have to go to class though, those in-class assignments can make or break you

He is the worst professor I have ever had. He had way to many assignments throughout the class and his tests were impossible. The exams covered detailed things that we only brushed up on in lecture. WORST PROFFESSOR AT OSU. He makes a 101 bio class extremely difficult to do well in

He knows a lot about BIO and teaches several classes. However, he cant tell the difference between the bio majors and the non major entry level classes. He takes attendance points by making you answer questions in class, but doesnt do it daily,  His tests and work load are unreal. DONT TAKE HIS CLASS. For  an entry level class this was very hard

Dr. Rothacker is by far the worst professor at OSU. His lecture material is jumbled, unorganized, and it is obvious that he hasn't prepared beforehand. He doesn't respond to emails, is very arrogant, and tests on the most menial things he says. Avoid taking a class with him!

Absolutely, hands-down, the worst professor ever.  He is the kind of teacher that claims to use the 'teach yourself' method - which is an excuse not to teach.  PowerPoints are terrible, jumbled and impossible to follow.  His thoughts and lectures are very poorly organized (read: impossible to follow)  - whatever you do - CHOOSE ANOTHER PROFESSOR!!

Rothacker seems unprepared for lectures, knows the material but clearly has a TA putting together lectures and class is the first time he sees them.He's unprepared to lecture for entire class, he comes up with crazy, mostly irrelevant, in class busy work assignments to fill the time.Mandatory attendance is clearly more forhis ego than for learning

Is he helpful? No, he doesn't answer questions if hands are raised. If you email him, he just forwards them to TAs. The lectures are terrible. There is so specific focus points, so you have no idea what to study. He says he's vague, but the exams have details, details you barely learned.

This guy is full of crap. all he does is talk about orchids in lecture, you're better off just reading the book and not attending lecture. And massive amounts of homework that take forever to do. he treats you like high schoolers and is very disrespectful

Thought exams would be easier considering it's a beginner bio class. I read all the material, went to class, studied and still didn't get the grade I wanted. He tries to explain things but just ends up being really vague, especially if you ask him a question. Lectures are mandatory because you have to do in-class assignments.
Absolutely horrible professor. Taught us nothing and then made really difficult tests. Avoid at all costs!
Dr. Rothacker was an ok teacher, but he will not go out of his way to help you. Read the textbook!

This has been the worst class I have ever taken. Dr. Rothacker's lectures were EXTREMELY confusing. He claims that he doesn't go "in depth" but that is definitely not true. The midterms asked pretty detailed information. Make sure you read the book - this is the only way I learned. If there's any way you can changed professors, do.

His lectures were basically useless. The tests were unbelievable but if you read and study the book like crazy it is possible to get an A range. Treat every little point like it counts because it can determine whether you get an A or B. his lectures  were ridiculously boring i literally had to teach myself biology the entire semester.

Lectures are mandatory because there are random in class assignments worth points yet they are pointless. His lectures are boring and not helpful. I was one of the very few who got an A in the class. As long as you do very well in lab, and just well enough on the exams you will do okay. Read the book and take detailed notes from it!!

This is the worst teacher I've EVER had.  Everyone failed the first midterm so without telling us before hand he had us retake the same midterm again.  He can't teach and just mumbles nonsense throughout his entire lecture.  80 people in a class of 750 got an A- or above. And there was still no curve.  Avoid at all costs.

I know that Prof. Rothacker will be reading this. His approach was very dry, and not because of the material. I love Biology. He's arrogant and treats students like complaining customers when asking for advice. He is not helpful and says that 'everything' is fair game. His exams are nothing but a plethora of trickery. Otherwise he's knowledgeable.

Rothacker isn't a nice guy in lecture and he doesn't care about his students that just show up. If you want him to actually be useful you must go to his office hours. Also, always read your book, or you're screwed. Our TA told us she didn't like him because of the way he treated them outside of class so that says a lot. Try to avoid him.
Avoid him at all costs!!!!! Ive had some pretty bad professors, but he is by far the worst.

Pathetic excuse for a professor.  Exams are ridiculously and there is NO CURVE which he mentions constantly. He must get a rush from seeing students study the material and then still be unprepared on his nearly impossible exams. He doesn't try to help students and his lectures suck. Read the book and memorize it! Thats your only chance!!!!!!!!!!!!!

He is probably one of the worst teachers I have ever had! I studied more than I have for any other class and his tests were still insanely hard. He tries to word the questions to trick you and the averages were horrible. Don't take this class!!

He is a tough professor, but he is a great one! i feel very well prepared for the bio part of the MCAT because of him. I am also taking him for bio 1114. I'm not going to lie in lecture he comes off as a jerk, but he has to in a lecture with 700 students. If you take the time to as him for help he will do anything to help you!
overall a good teacher. he seemed very clear to me in lecture and generally interested in helping.

At the beginning of the semester, Rothacker had mentioned the reviews he received on here and simply said they weren't correct. He couldn't have been more wrong. He is the WORST professor I've ever had at OSU (& trust me, I've had some bad ones). His exams are unbelievably hard. His lectures are POINTLESS and you'd be better off teaching yourself.

Honestly, I can say that Dr. Rothacker is one of the worst professors I've ever had. Biology is my favorite subject, and basically the field I hope to enter. Dr. Rothacker is a terrible lecturer, dives way too in-depth in a class that is supposed to be basic, and then makes insanely hard exams. I highly recommend another professor. Any, really.

If you don't understand the lecture, you need to ask him after class or visit office hours. He DOES answer all your questions. People are complaining about the clarity of the slides, but there is so much material that it's not realistic for you to understand the slides without additional studying. Prof is passionate about the field and means well.

Rothacker thinks he's doing everyone a favor by having the most obscure slides and moving through them like we're on quarters still, but he's really not. You have to rely on the book almost entirely and your ta's. Rothackers exams are also extremely difficult and not curved. My suggestion, find a different lecture.

Didn't really like him before first exam, but now I hate him. Studied everything in the lectures and read the book and still failed. Not sure what else I was supposed to do. He isn't understanding, and he just made the exam unnecessarily hard. I've never heard anyone else say that bio 1113 was the hardest class they ever took. dont take his class
Goes way too fast through everything. He thinks he is the best professor ever but by the multiple negative reviews obviously he isn't. I would suggest dropping the course or finding a new professor.
Terrible professor! Full of himself and thinks he knows everything.

Terrible. Very unclear, generalizes, and doesnt appear to understand analytical concepts himself. Class is boring because he spends most of the time giving examples to simple/obvious concepts. Is very easy though. Just read the first page of every chapter in the text, he never has anything remotely difficult or complicated on the test.

Dr.Rothacker is a muscle head. He overgeneralizes important concepts which he claims you don't need to know but you really do. His slides are full of mistakes and lack any detail. He is very unusual compared to other professors but he is mildly enthusiastic!
Very boring.  Would not answer questions at all. Take different prof if possible.

Class was very boring and tiresome. Most of his teaching came from the book, and most of the exam could be completed just from learning the book, however there is some material from lectures. Overall not a bad professor.
AWWWSUMMMMMM. really an exhilirating class!!!!

very very dry lectures. I understand the material is as such. however, when the TA's had to fill in for him they were much more clear and cut out the material that was pointless. He gives test banks, poorly worded and most of questions were unclear. If you do the test banks and read the book you will get a C. You have to go up and beyond.
Great teacher!! Tries to make jokes and keep your interest... Not always easy but he does try!!!

Very unfocused and uninteresting.  Seems like he doesnt wanna be there.  Lectures are boring and jump all over the place.  Random hard questions on midterm.  Had to take detailed notes from the text book to pull of an A

He meant well. His lectures at the beginning seem helpful, however, later into the quarter, they were very sleep-inducing. The first midterm was not like the test bank at all, and the second one was exactly like the test bank and the final was exactly like the test bank. It is easy to get an A. Read the book and test banks. He is NOT horrible.

It was extremely difficult to stay awake during Dr. Rothacker's lectures. He doesn't seem to have an in depth knowledge of the subject material he is presenting, and his slides are riddled with errors. He gives the same testbank of questions every quarter, and the questions are horribly ambiguous and vague. HORRIBLE.

I never opened the textbook.  Save your money.  He was a really boring lecturer, and he always told jokes which were not at all funny.  The subject matter is horrible, and I would not retake his class if you paid me.
AWFUL professor. Doesn't care about students- told us not to show up to office hours.  He is very arrogant and rude.  He is just plain awful.
He knew enough about the subject but had a pompous attitude.  He overcomplicated his examples and lectured straight out of the textbook.
Good teacher. Clear. Study outside of class to get good grade. Attend office hours. Don't get on his nerves.
not a bio major but he made the class fun. I really thought his lecture on sexual selection was entertaining! highly recommend a course by him
James is the best. He really cares about students understanding the concepts. He is really easy going and approachable. He always answers questions and gives good feedback. He is an angel, literally.

THE WORST! This was one of my favorite classes but only because the 2nd half of the class is taught by a different prof. Dr. Herbers was extremely unhelpful and unclear. She would give us one answer in class and then count it wrong on the exam.. She is very sarcastic and does not seem to care if you do well. Smart but not a good teacher.

If you have to take this class, don't worry. She only teaches the first half of it. Dr. Herbers rushed through her slides and didn't explain any concepts. We would constantly ask her to explain the material and at best we would get a sarcastic smile and a confusing overview. The material isn't too difficult but she isn't doing us any favors.

If I had to give her a grade it would be C. Not a C based on the normal grading scale but a C to describe a word that she is the perfect embodiment of.  This is a classic example of somehow who is over qualified to teach but merely does in order to continue doing research at OSU.  Gets upset when you don't understand her poorly taught concepts.

She teaches the first half of the class. I failed the first exam, but still ended up being able to drop the final and still had a 97% in the class.  There are so many points in the class you really do just have to do the assignments and you'll be fine.  If you read the book a lot more will make sense.  She is better at teaching than Dr. Sabree.

Dr. Herbers was like an angel compared to Dr. Sabree. She mostly tests on bolded words found in her powerpoint, and the people who noticed this usually do very well. Recitation points are almost guaranteed as long as you show up. In order to get an A in the class you need to get around a B on all the exams and thats about it, not a terrible class.

Dr. Herbers is very thorough whatever isn't in lecture appears on the exam. Make sure that you do some reading and pay attention to minute details that sound like tangents and seem irrelevant. Her answers are right, not factual evidence.

EEOB 3310... Herbers is terrible her tests had literally 15 multiple choice questions with wide ranging scores from 24% to 90%. acts like her students are dumb for not understanding her when she refuses to explain concepts. STAY AWAY unless you must take it

Good teacher to learn from if you're trying to become a dictator. Comes up with really stupid rules and then takes away points and tells you it looks like you learned the hard way, when everyone misses the same thing because they are unclear on the rules (because they're so stupid) Her way or the highway...she should get on a track with Limp Bizkit

Taught an ecology module as part of bio 402. Her lectures were generally interesting and she is very clear. She utilized classroom polling well with clickers. Content taught by her was easy to learn and understand. Her final required a great deal of utilizing this knowledge in a not-so-obvious fashion. Practice questions would have been useful.

Dr. Daly is great, she definitely cares about the material she is teaching and answers any and all questions you could have. Her tests are open book, just go to class and draw everything you dissect and copy the notes down too. She puts them online so you don't even have to write in class. There's no final, but there is a group debate that's easy.

Dr. Daly is one of the best professors I have ever had at Ohio State. She is smart, engaging, funny, and brings out the best in students. She genuinely cares if you understand the material and also makes every day fun.

Dr. Daly is wonderful.  She's one of the funniest teachers I've had here.  The homework is hard if you don't pay attention in lecture.  There's a lot of taking the concepts you've learned and applying them to situations and thinking out of the box.  If you like evolution, I definitely recommend taking this class with Dr. Daly.

Well taught class. You need to attend classes and have lecture notes already printed out to take notes on. As long as you pay attention and make sure you know the details you can do well. It is not enough in this class to just know main ideas. She also gives out a good amount of extra credit for participating.

Beware!! This class is so hard. There is no curves, and don't expect the teacher to help you on concepts. Very confusing. The TA's are competely unhelpful, they make you feel stupid. Make sure you get every single point possible or don't take the class. The teacher is aweful.

I'm a zoology major, exams short answer ?'s that come from left field that they deem your responses appropriate or not even if you completely know the information it is possible to get the answers completely wrong In responses to ?'s she's very vague and just says to look in the book The HW is on difficult lengthy readings with vague ?'s Avoid her
She was very inconsiderate and thought that her class was the only class that mattered. Her class was only a prereq for my other classes.

Really enjoyable class. Great lecturer. She is clear, helpful, and understanding. She is very good at explaining things and is always there to help students out. Her classes are tough, she expects you to study the material. I always enjoy her classes and recommend them to anyone interested in biology. She's a super lady!

Book is useful for references, but that's about it. Lecture seems easy, but so much info makes quizzes hard, esp w/ her ?'s. Her in class activities make it fun, and they are easy points, so GO TO CLASS. Thought her portion of class would bring my grade down due to quizzes, but with curves, I still got an A. Not a bad class!

Don't need the book at all.  Go to recitations...they really help.  Do the hw ahead of time and go to office hours!!! She is extremely helpful if you talk to her.  The class might seem boring and stuff that is easy, but the multiple choice on exams are very difficult.  Do the hw...huge grade booster.  Overall not a bad prof, and she's nice.

Great prof.  Class is fun and she more than knows her stuff.  Fair, engaging.  Doesn't just take off points like most profs on exams.  If you get an answer right that most people don't, or answer particularly clearly, she might give an extra point or two.  Not a pushover.  I'm sure anybody'd love to research with her.

If you're a dolphin-hugger or whale-lover, this is NOT your course. That said, this class is amazing. Professor is very enthusiastic, helpful, and smart. She has awesome lab competitions, even though I was cheated from the title.

Very good lecturer and always organized. Not too exciting of a class but everything you need to do well on exams is in the notes. Exams are NOT hard at all, as long as you can understand material and answer essays instead of memorizing it and answering multiple choice like other bio classes. She gives tons of extra credit for going to class.
great lecturer/professor but exams are EXTREMELY hard!! if u want to learn the material well take her but if you're looking for an easy A don't. she's hot too.
No Comments
Great professor, keeps student's interests, tests are difficult but study and you can earn a solid A.

Judy is a caring instructor for Biology 5001. She values the sharing of opinions and is open to dialogue about methods of learning. She does provide critiques of thought, but motivates growth through this process as well. She provides flexible options for the course and takes professional development seriously.

I also had an unpleasant experience in a meeting with her. She's extremely short tempered and will shoot down your suggestions but if you're quiet she'll get upset with you for not being 'creative enough'. Also, I think she mocked my accent.
This woman screams at her students, particularly during the many mandatory private meetings with her. Avoid if possible.

This professor was absolutely horrendous. He made me hate the class more and more every lecture I attended. I strongly disliked his teaching style. I understand that your research revolves around birds, but that doesn't mean you should spend 95% of lectures talking about birds. His lectures were very difficult to follow along. Very poor teaching.

The man is near insane. He was funny, but his tests in this course were beyond tough. I found more trouble in his half of the course than in Organic Chemistry. He was teaching the physiology portion of the course, which I did not like.

Joe did a great job teaching this material. I do suggest taking another physiology course before this one (not a necessary prerequisite). As long as you go to class and take notes you will do just fine on the exams. The curves are monstrous and he gives us all the material necessary to succeed. It is just a matter of putting forth some effort.
His lectures are very fun.  One of the biology classes where I am constantly engaged.  I recommend him!

I'm a senior Biology student and had a blast in this course, although it wasn't an easy one. Williams made an effort to get to know students in lecture and was a pretty fun lecturer to listen to. I recommend, especially if you've already taken biochem.

Okay, all of his ratings before have been horrible but the class is not hard... I think he is engaging and funny. Everyone else in the class did pretty poorly but I am doing just fine. All you have to do is go to the office hours of your TA and ASK QUESTIONS. They will tell you exactly what you need to know for an exam.

Worst professor I have ever had at Ohio State.  Lecture is useless.  I attended every lecture and recorded them before the first midterm.  I relistened to every lecture and still did awful.  The class average was a 50%.  Avoid this class at all costs.   Impossible to tell what to tell.  The lecture material is scattered and unorganized.  Horrible!

Not a recommendable professor. Juvenile teaching method w/ over emphasis on extreme details. Perhaps better suited for research. I attended every day and preformed badly for the lack of consistency with notes and class exams. Basically he is lucky to have a teaching position. He believes he has risen above the book, which is a bad for an instructor

I liked his teaching style, but the exams were very difficult.  Tests on details that don't mean anything in the scheme of understanding the concepts (seems to pick out the most obscure things in the notes, so study those...).  My grade did not reflect the work that I put into this class (A LOT), which is unfortunate and extremely disappointing.

Worst class I've ever taken. This guy wastes more time telling stupid internet jokes than saying any material relevant to exams. He simply does not care about students. He thinks we were all taught in a flawed education system so his solution is to bring down our GPA's (that'll show the university). He's really full of himself. Stay away.

save yourself hours of useless studying. tests on DETAILS never gone over in class, not many concepts. no review. easy recitation, but exams are ridiculous. office hours are useless. he spends ton of time on his experiments, but never tests on them. he thought that was funny. book only good for recitation, very few questions on tests. know ETC!!!

This Class was terrible. I went to office hours and he made me feel like a dumbass. He does not teach anything but will expect you to know everything that comes out of his mouth and every tiny detail in the book. He does not take responsibility for the class performance either.

students need to know everything from textbook, notes, and additional reading. He does not provide any review material. One midterm includes 3 lectures of material, and the second one includes 11 (no joke), and he's very proud of it. Terrible professor. He blames his poorly designed course on everything but himself. Do not take his class.
didnt really teach, all tests were fill in and pretty hard

By far one of the best professors at OSU...if you study the review material and attend lectures, you can't fail this class. Great sense of humor, awesome curves added to every test. Won't dumb down material and expects you to know your stuff, but is willing to help and tests in a reasonable manner.

This class was challenging but I found very worthwhile and one of my favorite at OSU. It does require some effort but is not impossible. As mentioned - there are generous curves and much detail spent on his research. His research does, however, correlate to the course material and I had no problem listening to it where as I have in other classes.
Bad, really bad.

Hard professor because of the amount of information taught.  However, not too hard if you take good notes in lecture and then study with his review sheets. I really enjoyed his lectures, and actually took a survey with him the following quarter that was great!
Probably one of the worst professors I have ever dealt with.  His lectures are terrible, it seems as though he has no interest in teaching at all.  AVOID AT ALL COSTS!

Worst class ever taken at OSU. If you want to learn about animals and their environment, go down to the Columbus Zoo and watch the apes throw crap at eachother...alot more fulfilling than wasting your life in this guys class.

egotistical, rude, and apathetic towards teaching you anything that wasn't HIS research. he's a decent lecturer, but goes really fast and wastes a lot of time making dinner plans with his students. refuses to answer any questions directly, even in office hours. tests are really difficult but had huge curves, hence my B+. id never take another class
Swenson had a quirky personality and was entertaining in class. He definitely makes you work for your grade, and I was very glad I had taken AP Bio going in to it. I would recommend him

Dr. Swenson is a brilliant guy but something gets lost in translation when he teaches. He glosses over difficult material and expects you to understand the first go around. Weekly online assignments were not very helpful in my experience and the exams are really tough. If you want an A, read the book before each lecture, go to the TAs office hours
Professor Swenson is one of the most boring professors I have ever had, however he is super nice and he will give you points if you go and talk to him!
Make good use of your TA's and use Mastering Biology religiously - especially for midterm reviews. He's not terrible, but his lectures are a bit rough to sit through.

Swenson is one of the worst professors I've ever had. He's nice to talk to, but he'll spend more time in lecture telling you why he is NOT covering something instead of just going ahead and talking about. He answers questions vaguely, but at least his exams are decent. Boring as all get out, and I will NEVER take him again.
A little boring in lecture, but he explains everything well.  He is very organized and easy to follow.  Just do the reading before lecture. Exam was moderately difficult.
He is nice, boring in lecture but helpful. Review sheets and practice exams were very useful. Exams not too bad, just had to read over the book.
Sweason is a genuinely nice guy.He appears to act uninterested in helping his students yet he gave us a sick study guide to help us with our exam. Lectures are  monotonistic as all get out
Nice guy, at least more interesting than the other lecturer. Not too hard, but you have to read the book and teach yourself because an early morning class is pointless.

you guys aren't studying right if you can't get at least a B on his exam.  First of all, the exams make up the bulk of your grade so do well!  Read the book the night before the lecture so you can follow the next day.  He gives you review sheets.  DO THEM.  Dr.  Swenson is really great!
I have to disagree as well. His test are so easy. They are not detailed at all i aced the test.  Read the book. He is a poor lecturer, and his slides come right out of the book.

I have to completely disagree with previous reviews. Dr. Swenson is very nice and very prepared to answer questions via email. His exams are EXTREMELY Fair--- Not Easy. Fair. Read the book and review with notes. Get to know him. Whatever you do, do not cram before the tests. Make sure you spend at least 6 horus a week studying for Bio.

You know it's bad when your TA says, "I don't think I could take this exam and pass" after the midterm. Went to all lectures, took notes, studied what prof said to study, read the book and still failed the midterm. Was completely taken aback with level of intricate detail in exam questions when so little detail presented in lecture. Awful. Run.

No matter how many times you hear the words "it's not necessary to know this...", you need to pay attention anyway. His exam focuses almost entirely on vague concepts that he only briefly will cover in class, or in just enough detail that you have to consult the book anyway.

I have never ever been told by any other Proff, its not my job to help you go ask your TA. These were not his exact words but the point came over that way. This guy is not confident and stumbles over things. When he feels pressured he lets a TA handle it. He rushed thourgh slides and mummbled.
I slept through 90% of his lectures, he is so monotone and his voice just relaxed me. But he goes straight from his notes. Had to study quite a bit for a B though.
boring and asks too many details on tests for a 100 level class

hes a nice guy- should not be teaching- he has no enthusiasm while reading his lecture notes which are direct sentences taken from the book- a lot of additional studying needed to get a b on test (a is pretty much impossible)glad it was team taught!

Knows what he's talking about but really just shouldn't be trying to teach other people. You cannot stay focused in the slightest because he really is monotone. Make sure to read the book - using the cd version was actually easier for me...tests were hard, but labs and the project grade help to balance your grade out

If I'd wanted to sleep, I would have stayed home and taken sleeping pills. Impossible to stay focused on material with his monotonous voice. Average on his midterm was a 64. The book is a much better teacher than this guy.
Super friendly class coordinator
takes off points just for fun.  way too intense for biology 101.  might be one of the biggest tools ever. thought about punching him in the face on a regular basis.

Great guy, easy class. Definitely cares about his students and knows that they're there to fill a GE requirement so he's easygoing. He gives you everything you need to do well in his class, and he WANTS you to do well. Overall, just a really really nice guy and fun class.
Great Man. He is incredibly passionate about what he teaches which make mold interesting. He realizes the class is a GE and just wants to see his students learn not ruin their GPA.

Mitchell is amazing, although my academic focus is completely on the other end of the spectrum from Plant Path taking his class actually tempted me to switch fields,. His lectures are fascinating and relevant and he gets awesome guest lecturers for special topics. Class is easy to do well in but you will learn so much! One of my faves at this uni.

Tom is an amazing instructor-- eager, energetic, and passionate. It was an honor to be in his class, and I would recommend it to anyone.  He is a fair, many times lenient, instructor. But the grades should not be a worry, you should take his class for the wealth of information he has to provide.
great teacher, great class take!!!!!!

She basically went through the slides like road runner. It was very hard to catch up with her. Especially with hard chapters like photosynthesis and cellular respiration, students need to learn that. Test weren't hard but if you didn't have a clue about what was happening in lecture don't expect an A. Also there is no curve in this class :(.

I liked Dr. Alonso. She was, however, difficult to understand at times and went through lectures extremely quickly. She typically just read the information straight from the slides. There would TopHat questions every lecture for credit, so you have to go to lecture. Exam material came from slides, but some questions were obscure.
absolute garbage lectures and extremely specific test questions

Ana seemed to be knowledgable, but did not portray the information very well - basically read off the slides and elaborated based on the points. Going to lecture is really important in terms of TOPHAT and IFAT, but otherwise I wouldn't have gone at all. You basically just need to read the book AND understand the material to do well on the exams.

I enjoyed her, but I also speak French. To everyone else she was probably very hard to understand. Her midterms were hard and she didn't post any practice exams. To be honest, I'd usually go for top hat, play video games in lecture, and learn everything on my own.

I enjoyed Dr Alonso's lectures. She knows the material she is teaching. I had the opportunity to go to her office hours and she addressed all my questions, really nice. Her slides contain the main information to know for the midterm. The problem is that she posts the slides just before the class, and I would like to have them further in advance.

Dr. Alonso: Is a nice person but... - Is hard to understand. -Has no idea how to lecture effectively. -Basically just reads off the power points (which are provided). -Attendance is mandatory as you will have tophat questions every lecture for credit. -Some of her exam questions aren't mentioned in class or on the power points. -NO STUDY GUIDES.

Dr Alonso does seem generally interested in the subject she teaches, but simply went far too quickly. Her lectures consist of her reading her slides off then skipping to the next not allowing to do notes. Requires you to be in class for Tophat and IFAT questions but get ready to teach yourself your foundation course in all future biological science

Hard to understand (thick accent), hardly audible, and fast. Seems interested in biology, but she literally just reads the slides. But you have to be there in lecture for the TopHat and IFAT questions.
Dr. Alonso goes super fast through lectures and is hard to understand at points. Need to be in class for TopHat participation, but otherwise you really just have to teach yourself.
Amazing professor for Advanced evolution, class is set up easily, and makes topics interesting. Would highly recommend

Mixed opinions about Gibbs. There is a lot (40 double spaced pages worth) of writing about the STUPIDEST cases from dumb journals. The exams werent too bad but our papers were 40% of the grade and the TA ripped the**** out of them. Papers were due every friday at 10:30 which was awful. Overall I would say the whole class was a little disapointing

sorry but this guy is f*ckin boring... put me to sleep almost 100% of the time... i love evolution too... even my advisor agreed he's very very dry and admitted to not attending gibbs' talks... this class COULD have been awesome had he not been do damn boring...

Dr. Gibbs is a Canadian man with a great knowledge of EEOB and, not to mention, a great sense of humor.  He fosters alot of interesting discussion in class... basically, he's not boring at all.  Not only that, but he's always willing to help you if needed. Great professor!
Easy grader, very interesting class. Pay attention and study a couple days before the tests and you will be fine

Eric is an interesting lecturer because he shows a lot of animal videos that relate to lecture. He knows his stuff and is very willing to help, and he always answers emails promptly. He is fair and kind. He's cute too :)

Would NOT recommend this class to anyone. Avoid taking Ecology if at all possible. The lectures have TopHat questions so attendance is mandatory. But, lectures are boring and dull. Homework is due before each lecture in the online textbook. Lab is a waste of time. And there is a semester long research project completely outside of class.

I understand she is smart and resourceful, but the amount of work and level of difficulty is graduate school level and the assignments are overwhelming and not coherent. WAY TOO HARD FOR UNDERGRAD COURSE AND IT SUCKS THAT YOU HAVE TO TAKE HER CLASS TO GRADUATE.  IGNORE ALL GOOD COMMENTS UNLESS YOU LOVE READING AND DOING CHALLENING HOMEWORK MATERiAl

She is smart and talked a lot in class. Many points are offered in this class but they are easily taken from you. Lots of reading required, literally they are almost impossible to read due to time constraints. I was taking 34 credits when I took the class though.
She's a smart woman, she just doesn't communicate what she's trying to get across clearly. Tons of reading outside the class, but you have to teach yourself so they're somewhat helpful.

The worst professor at OSU. Class is extremely boring. Although there are a lot of points offered, they easily take them away from you. She gives ridiculously long boring readings you will never understand the point to. You have to teach yourself throughout the entire module. Terrible class, even worse professor for it. AVOID HER!

The long readings don't help for preparing the exam. too much reading and homework required. the class is so boring that you will be rather in a filibuster. Don't buy a Text book just spend 5 hours a day to study. only way to survive. or dodge the class.

Wow, I don't agree with others on here. Dr. B was amazing and extremely helpful. She didn't grade hard like Dr. Klompen, and always offered assistance. I love the Cancer Module Compared to that of the Malaria Module. Come to class and do your work. Not hard at all. Just time consuming.

Some people aren't meant to teach. She is one of them! Office hours were useless bc she refuses to give straight answers to questions. When lecturing, she goes off on tangents which makes note-taking nearly impossible. The TWELVE pages of study guides for the exam weren't even straighforward. I work hard for my good grades, but this was overkill.

Uhh. The readings weren't as bad as everyone makes them out to be, but the fact that it took over a month to grade the midterm and even longer for HW was ridiculous. Also, she wants people to participate in lecture which is annoying and wastes a lot of class time. The reading summaries and study guide for the midterm were helpful.

Like everyone else says, assigns loooong readings and doesn't really explain them to you.  Lots of self-teaching going on here. Attendance is mandatory.  SLOW grader, midterms were graded over a month after they were taken and some HW assignments even longer than that!!  You also get graded on clicker questions.

Breitenberger is, by far, the worst teacher I have had. She gives long reading assignments that are at the graduate level and gives us quizzes on them every class period. She never tells us how much time we have for quizzes.  Usually we will get 5-6 minutes to read paragraphs of information and answer multiple questions about it!
If you pay attention in class, study, and ask questions you will have no problem with her exams. She does challenge you BUT is readily available for any questions.

Dr. Breitenberger is no doubt a very hard professor, but she knows her stuff and is always willing to help students. People don't like her because she makes you read very difficult scientific literature. They fail to realize that she is preparing us for the much more difficult bio classes down the road. Work hard, you will do fine!
Dr. B gives insanely long and difficult readings and then does not explain them to you.  Her whole module was about teaching yourself cancer!  Whatever you do, do not take her class!!!

I feel the same way as the last 2 posts. I LOVE learning about biology, but she was not able to make us understand this module...and the HW study guide the night before the exam was a little absurd! She is intelligent and a brilliant woman, she SHOULD NOT be a professor. Even the basic information is difficult for her to "translate" to us.
Ludicrously long readings, homework for every class, and she doesn't do much to help clarify the graduate level readings you do. I absolutely love Biology, but she found a way for me to hate it.
Posts HW answer key and study guide resources 11pm the night before the exam...??? This just screams "I want my students to fail" Beware students, sadly she is the only option for BIO majors, BEWARE!

I really regret having to take 402 and I even skipped a quarter to collect myself before taking the class in the spring only to find out that SHE'S LECTURING AGAIN FOR 402. I guess I'm going to just keep postponing it until they can find a lecturer that kids can learn from or just scrap it from the major all together. She really is that awful.

This professor is no doubt an expert in her field, but is unable to make us understand the basics. She can't lecture, and the entire class was confused with her teaching methods. She should stop assigning graduate level readings to undergrad students, with an insane amount of work...

She knows the subject material but had difficulty making it clear to the class. She also assigned way too much difficult reading in a short amount of time and only provided summaries of the reading a day and a half before the final. I attended her office hours and found them to be even more confusing.
All the other ratings on her from Bio 401 have been removed so that should be a hint to not take her or the class.  All I can say is awful oherwise they'll remove the rating again.

PLEASE NOOOOO!!!  If there is any way, any way at all that you don't have to take her or Bio 401 I would HIGHLY suggest it.  I pity everyone that has to take it and I pity myself for still needing to take Bio 402.  Awful class and awful teacher.  She'll make you hate life.
It felt like she spent most of the lecture on minute details of processes the class was already struggling to understand. Very confusing, didn't often have a point in her lectures.
very slow
I'm sure Caroline is a very intelligent person but she speaks like she has no idea what she is talking about.

Worst professor and worst class I have EVER had, she will make you HATE biochemistry! She makes you memorize a ton of stupid details, terrible lecturer, assigns pointless homework which she grades like she is mad at the world, and she gives no curve. I was really interested in biochemistry after 614, but she absolutely ruined it for me.
