Dr. Breitenberger basically doesn't answer questions and talks superfluously. She is a total waste of time. I hope she'd removed from the teaching program, but one can only hope. DO NOT RECOMEND.
Need to read textbook

Dr. Stetson was by far one of my favorite professors at Ohio State.  Lectures were interesting and easy to pay attention to. If you study the material he gives you (lecture notes, textbook) this class is a piece of cake.

Dr. Stetson is a wonderful man.  He's brilliant and genuinely cares about the students.  However, he doesn't spend nearly enough time on the basics and rambles about little details.  He also gets way off topic at times.  He's a good person though, and I love picking his brain about all sorts of topics.

Easily the worst professor I have ever had. When he does talk about biology, it is only about utterly irrelevant details that will not be on the final (not that he tells you what WILL be.) Impossible online quizzed at unannounced times, pointless projects, and only a mystery final. Avoid at all costs.

Can't say enough about Dr. Stetson in 350 characters.I'm not you're wiz kid and loved his teaching style.Exams? Um study his effing notes and look at wikipedia, the book, and youtube (in other words. STUDY) and you'll do fine.  I have no clue what these other pple are whining about.He's funny and willing to help.  Don't let the beard scare you. lol

Stetson rambles all class about whatever he wants, I learned nothing from this guy. READ THE BOOK, no midterms only a final, all the grades come from pointless projects, everything is online like the quizzes he doesn't tell you when they are, I missed on and lost 2 points on my average, other people missed 3. Many people missed assignments.

Pay attention to the ratings on here.  Those who had him for gen bio generally didn't like him, those who had him for 415 or 630 did.  He is good at teaching biology and making you think about things in a way that allows for personal discovery of information.  Great professor.  Very willing to get to know his students and help them out as well.

He's very knowledgeable but his method of teaching is different. You have to read the textbook chapters. Write one question on an index card and submit it in each lecture. The lecture is him just reading and answer the questions on the cards. So, he doesn't really teach you the material, you do. Pre-lecture quizzes are difficult. It's a hard class.

I didn't really see the point of a lecturer in this course, since we basically have to memorize the textbook and Mastering Biology material in order to pass the exams. However, Stetson wasn't a bad lecturer. I would like to add that, contrary to her own opinion, Betsy Wrobel-Boerner is 'not' cool.

Stetson is NOT like other profs who want you to memorize info and spit it back out on exams. His exams make you think, but he is lenient when grading. He covers relevant topics in detail and integrates life experiences. Don't worry about the lab-it took maybe 45 mins even tho it's scheduled for 3 hrs. Great class- do the work and you'll get an A

He would be better suited for teaching upper level courses instead of intro biology for all science majors. His lectures are completely useless since he posts his notes online. He always emphasized how important it was to attend lecture, but I attended every one and feel like I got nothing out of going. I did fine in the class, but no thanks to him

Don't take a class with Dr. Stetson if you expect an "easy A".  He does not teach that kind of course.  This course is intended for science majors, so I don't understand why people complain about having to study difficult material.  Biology is an intricate subject, and Dr. Stetson does his best to present you with conceptual material.

Many of these negative comments are likely from freshmen who still expect to be spoon fed information they will retain only to pass an exam then forget it later.  Dr. Stetson is NOT one of those professors.  He encourages analytical thinking and understanding concepts fully. Unconventional teaching style but teaches info useful down the road.

Stetson is extremely knowledgeable, unorthodox, insightful, and adaptable. He does not intend for his classes to be onerous, but rather to teach students lessons that may be broader and ultimately more useful. He is honest and fair. Would certainly recommend for THIS class.

Rarely went to lecture and when I did I was lucky if I got half a page of useful notes. He would go off on mini tangents that were sometimes interesting but not relevant to information that we were tested on. Tests were worth a hundred points and had about five questions on them. I read the book before each test and took my own notes and did fine.

These comments are making me laugh. "He's expects us to interpret his information" and (my personal favorite) "Everything was based on evolution." It's BIOLOGY, what were you expecting? The same stuff you learned in 6th grade? He's good once you get used to him. But biology isn't easy, so don't complain if you're expected to do work.
Probably the most interesting professor at OSU.  Definitely one of the most intelligent.  HE PLAYS THE TUBA!!!!  and he'll take you out sailing...

Stetson is very knowledgeable and interesting.  Although intimidating at first he really seemed to warm up to us and I found him to be a great professor.  Tests were all short answer/essay so thorough book studying wasn't great...I found attending lecture was truly the best way to learn the material for the tests.  Not an easy class, though.

Amazing professor, really knows his stuff. Obviously a 'big picture' guy, who wants you to learn TO THINK in a certain way than to regurgitate all the time. However, requires a huge time commitment and lots of effort. Overall, if you plan to go into a bio- related field, Stetson is your man.

He encourages his students to think differently about the material-he didn't just feed us facts.  You NEED to read the book and attend lecture!  The class is not easy, but he will teach you a lot and encourage you to think and learn in new and different ways.  Go to office hours and ask questions in class!  Be willing to learn from him!

Everything in the class ties down to evolution. I'm pretty sure if you didn't know the answer to a question and argued evolution, you would still get points. The lectures are not structured so if you're a free spirit or like wasting your time, take Stetson. Stetson teaches students how to think. I learned a lot from lab and reading the textbook.

Requires prior knowledge to succeed. Lectures do not match material covered in book. The online quizzes are really hard! A lot of the questions aren't in the book. If you are a bio major or interested in attending med school then take this class. You will learn a lot. If you just need a GEC, take 113 and avoid him at all costs!

If you are a person that needs set structure (like defined notes, or study guides) then I wouldn't recommend this professor. But if you are open-minded and willing to learn in a different way, then I would recommend this professor.
only teaches evolution
hes a loser

Some of these comments are completely ridiculous. He expects you to 'interpret' and 'research' things? In a SCIENCE class? Honey, that's what science IS, and you should never go into a class (especially biology, even if it is 101) expecting an easy A. I thought he was a capable professor with very REASONABLE expectations.

Whatever you do... do not take stetson for bio 101. He is impossible to follow, the quizzes are completely ridiculous, and the labs are totally irrelevant. Seriously take ANYONE else. He's a very smart person and obviously knows what he's talking about but cannot articulate his knowledge in an introductory level class. (I got an A... only because m

I thought the class was very easy. The only time I studied for quizzes was an hour before the class started. I ended up with a strong A. Although the quizzes have questions from the text book, you really don't have to go buy one since you'd probably read it few times.

Labs are easy, (I got an A) but the lecture quizzes are insane (I got a C). I always did really good in biology but he just really kicked my butt and I had no clue what in the world he was talking about. Don't take him, seriously, take someone else.. I worked my butt off and I'm barely getting a B.

I'm sure he would be an awesome molecular genetics/evolution teacher, but he's way too hard for Bio. 101. He's TOO smart to be teaching an entry level class, and it's impossible to follow what's going on during lecture.

Really hard for a 101 course if you go in expecting it to be a breeze. He has quizzes at the beginning of the week which aren't hard if you study everything from the book and take notes while he's teaching. It is IMPOSSIBLE to stay awake in this course.. within the first 10 minutes, half of the students are asleep or leaving. Also he's on match.com

I still have not figured out what exactly we are supposed to be learning. The class seems to be on everything and nothing at the same time. He expects people to care about biology a little bit too much even though its a GEC. Avoid taking him because the class is not at all organized in a good way.
I agree with everyone

SUCKY.  Failed with Stetson, even though I went to class, lab, and office hours.  Took 101 again with Wenzel, and it was Amazing.  Don't take any class with Stetson - especially Bio 101 - take it with Wenzel.

His slides and lectures have nothing to do with what the class is about or whats on the exam, if ur unfortunate enough to have to take him, dont go to class and study the textbook. he will go on blabbing about HUGE words and bio stuff thats TOTALLY irrelevant, bio 101 is 'sposed to be an easy A but not with stetson, DONT TAKE HIM.

Makes you think beyond the normal limits of a science class. The class is difficult and forces you to tie together many different things you've learned before to see things in a new light. Get to know him and you'll be fine, he is very helpful.

Puts weird questions onto tests. Has random information he talks about during his lectures that are not on the slides. I had no clue about how to sort out the important information from the useless information.
Random

As a person Stetson is nice guy and he's funny. His lectures need to be structured better so you actually get something from them but his tests are difficult. If you stick with it and do around average or better on the tests you be fine.

His lectures are intellectually stimulating, but the tests are completely ridiculous... I really enjoyed the class based on the lectures and labs... the tests killed me, but that's not all you're graded on. Give it a try - ask him for help if you need it. He keeps talking about how his job is to eliminate confusion (which he first creates).
He gives you random information and expects you to interpret it on his midterms.
no need to go to class or buy the book.  He throws random information at you for the entire class and then expects you to research all your exam questions.  BAD!!!

Okay, so I may not have liked it as much as the guy before me wrote, but all in all this class was cool. It is a different way to learn science. Classes at times got boring but were spiced up with the right questions. People who hate on Stetson either (a) haven't had him or (b) just suck at life. This should be one of the easiest science classes yo

I really loved his class.  Stetson makes you think outside of the box.  Tests were pretty difficult but so interesting it was worth the work.  If you love learning, Stetson is great.  If you're only able to regurgitate facts, try a different prof.
Boring class, unless you can follow the subject matter based solely on diagrams your in for a long quarter especially at 7:15 in the morning.

he thinks hes smarter than he is, and if you ask him a question he thinks is stupid in class he will reply with a degrading response or just completely ignore your question and go on with the lecture.

The guy is a dickhead.  The quizzes are easy and straightforward because they aren't written by him, but on the midterms he asks some of the most specific questions about the littlest, most irrelevant details you can imagine.  I do not recommend taking his class.

I didn't think this class was that hard, esp. since the final you are pretty much guaranteed a 75 3/4ths of the questions were taken DIRECTLY from the quizzes. I got a B+ and totally missed one of the quizzes.

this professor knows his stuff. he's funny too, but you have to be smart to understand his jokes. If you do poorly in his class, you should probably get out of the field of biology. he teaches relevence and doesn't make you regurgitate stupid stuff. I love this guy!

His lectures were very boring, he only copies the diagrams directly from the book and read the captions. His quizzes were so hard. Luckily there was a big curve because otherwise the whole class would have failed.

Awesome professor. One of the few that I have had that acually cares. He changes class by making you think outide the box. Also, he is alot of help if you want to do research. Just ask and he will help with anything.
hard but fair
This was a tough class but he did everything he could to help you pass. He is actually interested in helping students and listening to their concerns unlike many other profs in this department.
this guy is so smart it's ridiculous! He really cares that students learn, but he doesn't cater to you if you are dumb. If you have a shred of logic, you should be able to understand.
I thought he was a good professor. He was always willing to help outside of class. Made you really think about the material.
Hard class :(  He isn't all that interesting, but I've had worse.  Occasionally he'd come up with an amusing story.
His class was very unorganized, unstructured, and unnecessarily difficult.  The material itself is manageable, but his manner of testing on it is ridiculous.

He makes the exams so hard that the average grade is failing.  His lectures are very unhelpful and unclear.  The exams usually have questions that are never covered in class or in the book.  Stay away!

An awesome professor, she's really interested in what she teaches and it definitely gets you interested in the course too. She's always ready to answer questions and is very helpful . Also, she incorporates hands-on experience into her class, which really helps to learn the material.

Awesome class. Field and lab work was fun and interesting and Dr. Dassler's enthusiasm is contagious. I feel completely awakened to the world of plants. I would easily take this class again. She's always available to answer questions and she gets excited about students learning. Highly recommend this class if plants interest you at all.

Taught the plant part of the class (split w/Bronson). Was very knowledgeable & brought in live examples of plants. Quizzes/exams were kinda tough but could do well if prepared. Attendance only mandatory b/c have 'participation points'.

Surprised by other comments. I enjoyed Dassler. She was funny and quirky. She always had a smile on her face. Her notes were yes, a bit unorganized, and her quizzes and tests were quite difficult. But plants can be that way. You do really need to study for this portion of the class, but she is very fair and helpful. Plus she brought in food!

Don't know what the other ppl were talking about. Quizzes/tests were straight memorization off of 'list' notes.  Her in class activities made it interesting from a usual lecture, and it meant you occasionally got food. She would tell you specific diagrams to learn, and explained things clearly. Her portion of the class was a breeze. Don't need book

Blech.  This class made me feel like I was in 6th grade - fill-in-the-blank notes, and ridiculous, useless "group work" and assignments.  Ironically, you'll probably end up killing a few trees just trying to print out her notes.  For every line of relevant information, there's about 16 slides of full-color images.  I hate plants.
Her demos were interesting but her lectures were very dry. Way too excited about plants and didn't understand when students did share her excitement. Avoid her if possible.

Very stupid and stubborn. Tests you on the smallest details. She assumes all students are PCMB majors. Took 2/3 the quarter on plants and left only 1/3 for animal portion. Once done with her plant section, she rarely showed up for the animal portion. We had to eliminate HALF of the animal portion. She TOTALLY ruined the class. Total weirdo.

she doesn't seem to realize that most people coming into this class have no background in plants. her lecture slides are filled with pictures and have no fluidity (making one lecture ~60 slides). she presents everything in the most convoluted manner i've ever experienced. maybe she'd be a better pcmb teacher? she's terrible.

I HATE THIS WOMAN. She teaches this class like she is lecturing to 6th graders, complete with ridiculous in-class activities that alwasy include drawing. This class is a survey in diversity, but she expects memorization of minute details and tests you on them. Constantly lectures over the time period and starts the next lecture if you finish early

She expected us to remember every minute detail about plants and asked obscure questions on the exams. She had a bad attitude toward students and constantly went over time in lecture.  Her teaching was good but she was still the worst prof I've had.

I completely agree with the comment before mine... She expects students with no background in plants to memorize the most minute details that she mentions once. Continuously held class over and kept lecturing. She was also unhelpful and talked back to students. She apparently didn't care to understand the audience she was lecturing to.

I really hated her. She gave way less time to the other prof to teach the animal section and she had us doing really stupid in class projects. The tests included minor details that were mentioned once which were worth alot of points. You have to make sure you memorize everything! And she's always saying Plants are "WAY Cool" it's really annoying.

She was extremely disorganized. She did not lecture well, and did not test what was emphasized in the notes. This was a team-taught class, and only gave the other prof half the time they were supposed to have. Group activities were extremely disorganized and not helpful. She showed little to no respect for the students, the other prof, and the TA.
just what you want in a bio teacher.  taught the important stuff, tested the important stuff and genuinely knew her stuff.  Good teacher

She was clear with her portion of it and for the test you just had to memorize the power points. She did hands on activities outside of classtime, which were mandatory and extremely unorganized. This class was extremely boring. Also, I didn't buy either textbook and still managed an easy A- .
Dr. Dassler was well organized and helpful. Her notes were clear and she obviously really loved her subject (plants) which served to make her lectures more interesting.

I took EEOB 405.01 and she taught the Plant Biology portion of the course. What I liked most about her was that she genuinely wanted to help her students. Also, you could tell she was completely enthralled about her field. She just loved plants. Her enthusiasm helped to make the class more interesting.
Very clear and analytical. questions are tough if you are not analytical yourself. Recommended

Dr. Dean is a good professor and will provide you with help as long as you ask for it. However, you have to read the text book before every class and some of the midterms are very detail specific but it's not completely out of the blue. He certainly has a love for the subject and wants his students to learn. Be ready to work if you take his class.

his teaching styles were horrid. he always backtracked and made the exam harder than it should of been. the problem with his exams were that they were always asking for small little definitions instead of asking how things worked. His online quizzes are easy however his question were still pretty much just random parts of the readings.

Dean is a scientist, but I don't think a teacher. I believe he's retiring soon, and it may be about time. Though he is clearly knowledgable on the subject, I think it is difficult for him to convey this knowledge in a way students can understand. I believe that he cares about his students but he is not very friendly to suggestions.

Hated this class even though I'm a Bio major. Reading load is a chapter a night (chapters are reallyyy long). In class clicker quizzes in class was really unfair because they weren't multiple choice. Midterms were alright but final was difficult and unfair. Most of the class got B's. Maybe like 2 A's.

We covered less material than 113. His lectures are completely useless.  There's a quiz in every lecture. He'll find the most BS reasons to take points off. Almost everyone in the class got a B. I regret taking Dean's class.
You can tell he loves teaching and loves biology. Be prepared for a lot of reading and a quiz every lecture but the material wasn't too difficult, just a lot of studying.

Seems to know a lot, but can be hard sometimes to follow his course of thought. His exams are very difficult and the reading load is one chapter a night. I like how he is into new ways of teaching like having a clicker quiz and persuading his students to buy the electronic version of the book. Overall, he was a good proffessor.

He's very interested in and knowledgeable on the material he teaches, he get's tripped up sometimes, but very responsive to corrections. He wants to help students, tests are difficult, but he tells you that off the back, very fair grader.

A very boring professor. Difficult to stay awake and focused on his lecture. Doesn't relate to students well. Puts all notes on carmen. Tests are ridiculously difficult. Questions are more about specifics instead of the ideas which is very frustrating because its impossible to study every little detail when so much information is thrown at you.

Dr. Dean is a really nice guy.  He was the lecturer for the second half of 615.  His lectures were a little boring at first.  He eventually started to tell more jokes and make the lectures more interesting.  Ask him about his influenze joke.  Overall he wasn't a decent professor and he was very clear on what you needed to know.
He definitely likes his subject, but this class was very hard.  Class is all but useless, only the book helps.  Tons of material!  No curve.

Dr. Dean is useless as a lecturer. He goes off on tangents and hardly mentions useful facts that arent on the slides. The notes were posted word for word online. Lecture was a waste of time, and usually caused more confusion that just avoiding class at all. Tests were generally easy and repetitive.

I usually fell asleep during his lectures.  He reads the slides verbatim only to digress upon things which will not be on him exams. The first midterm was easy.  The second was incredibley hard and the final was half old exam questions and half really hard.  Good Luck!

I'm told they used to call him "Dizzy Dean" when he was in graduate school, and it's very clear why. Avoid him and anything he does.  Don't cross him. Don't challenge him. Dont engage him. Don't trust him. Dont rely on him. Don't take his courses, and DONT ask him to be on your committee. Many have suffered under Donald Harry Dean. Now you know.
very helpful and he cares about students.  sometimes forgetful but he definitely knows his stuff.
Lectures were irrelevant to tested material, he often gave incorrect information as well.
Great professor! Very enthusiastic and knowledgable.  Very helpful and definitely a nice guy.

Dean was unfortunately the worst teacher I have ever had here at OSU. He is very intelligent, but an awful teacher. Assignments were unclear up until the due date, which was also unclear. Tests were insultingly easy at some points, impossibly hard at others. Lectures make the most interested student want to walk out of class from boredom. avoid him

He's a nice professor, but he basically reads from the notes for the entire lecture and when it comes to his mind, he adds on additional terms we should be familiar with. Acts like his class is easy and then demolishes everyone with the midterm. Midterm Avg 73.5% with a low of 38%. Most unorganized class ever.

Really good teacher and interesting class. Covers material that is in the book and relates it to modern problems. Assignments are not clear at times, but it doesn't inhibit learning what you need to know. Does lots of activities, videos, and projects.
He was awesome!
Great TA, but at times I was too distracted by his rockin' bod.
He is funny and always makes the lecture active. It is really useful and helpful. But if you are looking for an easy task, he is not for you.

Horrible. 8th grade material taught in the most crass, crude, vulgar way possible. Negative, "we're all going to die" attitude; dissuaded me from ever taking another bio class. He should be empowering students to find solutions to human problems. Shame on him. He has a wonderful grad student; recitations with her were great.

Class was very intriguing, fun, and easy. Topics were unorthodox but awesome at the same time. He's a great guy and really funny. He does tend to take on a "doomsday" mentality and go a little over-the-top on some topics though, so don't buy into his idea that "We're all about to die!" Also looks and acts like a grown-up version of Michael Cera.
great professor! very tough midterm and final. he makes class fun though. i would recommend if you enjoy biology and not if you are looking for an easy A
Tried being funny very Dry Not the easiest either! Does not come well prepared for class Exams can come out of no ware and no curve!

His notes are hard to read and he gives incorrect information. He taught the second half of the  semester for me. Midway through his half he was replaced because he was so bad. Do not take any of his classes if hope to learn something.

The class itself is quite easy because he speaks to us like we are 10 years old. However, it is impossible to get an A because his exams are ridiculous. The book is pretty pointless and everything comes from class notes. Also, he sometimes gives incorrect information. He has no business teaching an honors course or even any college-level course.

Probably one of the worst teachers I had this year. Taught the wrong material in lecture, is awful at grading, and refuses to admit when he's wrong. The biology department as well was no help in getting grades corrected. Avoid his class, you will learn nothing.

He taught us like we were in middle school and yet expected honors college level testing. On top of that, lectures were filled with incorrect information. By the end of this class, it baffles me how he could possibly have a doctorate in biology with the level of knowledge he displayed on the topics throughout the lectures. Thank God it's over!

Wilson will attempt to charm with that southern drawl of his, but do not be fooled! His lectures, while basic, contain frequent errors. He does test from the notes, but test is used loosely because the pieces of paper handed to you on midterm days contain the most ambiguous and meaningless questions you will ever see. Honors Bio is a scam at OSU.

Wilson is funny and explains things relatively well, but his class consists of copying notes for 48 minutes. Sometimes he seems confused and doesn't answer questions well. He occasionally gives wrong information. His tests follow his notes closely, but he throws in odd questions sometimes. His notes can be confusing and need the book to make sense.

Tom Wilson seems like a nice guy but don't be fooled! He constantly gives wrong information, he doesn't care about student's grades and his tests contain information not covered in class. I suggest reading the book because his lecture information is wrong. Overall, I am glad to be done with him.
I love this guy.
Great teacher! very nice guy and gives very reasonable tests based off his lectures

Favorite quotes from class:                            - "Gotta have hemoglobin"        - "Gotta have variation"            - "You wanna get up here n teach?"      - "Now, mouse A is a real stud-muffin"             - "Now, looking at the exam questions, you can see that I've had a couple of beers before I start writing these questions"

Yes, it's true that he was relatively easy, but his tests were "nit-picky." He chose somewhat minute details. Don't even bother reading the book. Go to lectures and take thorough notes (every word if you can) and study the notes. DO NOT READ THE BOOK. It's a complete waste of time.  Also, be prepared to hear about "corn" and "drosophila". These wor
His tests are very fair and completely based on lecture.  Go to class! He's a good lecturer.
He is just happy as pie. You will love this guy. It's impossible to listen to him and not smile. He enjoys teaching and tests from the notes--score!
Great
Kara is super laid back and a great TA! She is very helpful and really knows the class material.
Kara is an excellent TA. She explains concepts clearly and tries to make a rather boring class interesting. Doesn't make you do unnecessary work. The teachers are poor, so having a good TA is useful.
SUPER AWESOME!!!!
BEST TA EVER!!!
Kara is very easy going with a great personality, which makes the boring material not so boring.  There's never a dull moment when Kara is your TA!

Kara was easy to get along with, a little crude sense of humor, but very fun.  To be honest, evolution was a very boring class, most of the material was common sense though so it isn't hard to get a good grade.
Kara was an awesome TA for EEOB 400. She kept a rather boring class entertaining and had a great sense of humor.
This TA is absolutely awful. Her grading is ridiculous, impossible to get full credit. She will take off .1 point before giving full credit. Rude towards students and not helpful in any way
Somewhat helpful. This was a small class so we got to know her. Really nice person. Too much information for a 7-week class.

Smiley is a TA for bio 1113. She is not helpful to students at all. Spends more than half of lab talking rather than letting class do the lab. She is pretty rude towards students asking questions is MIA during lectures most of the time

He's friendly and tries a little too hard to be funny. He tends to get side tracked talking about his research so we get off track quite often. We're pretty behind in lecture... The exams are pretty difficult but he gives extra credit on them. Come pretty much from the book but expects you to know examples from lecture. Points for going to lecture.

Very difficult class.  gives 2-3 abstract research articles every week.  But the worst thing about class is that the notes consist of graphs, charts, etc that he never explains.  problem sets take HOURS, are colelcted, and are just time wasters...tests are fair though, you know what to expect.
awesome professor, tons of extra credit awarded, go to lecture everyday for bonus points, tests are multiple choice and very easy
A great class to take a nap in. I would have stayed in bed, but he gives you points just to go.
Lectures are quite boring, if it weren't for the points given I would have just read the book.  Tests should NOT be hard except for the fact that the wording is made very difficult.
lectures aren't too bad tries to be a tricky **** on his multiple choice exams.  Wording on exams also sucks.
No Surprises on tests.  Soothing voice.  Reminds me of Mr. Belvidere.
Bio 113 covers way to much material and lecture is boring and not helpful on exams. Pretty much reads powerpoint slides. He's probably great in upper level coarses.

Boring lectures ruin great subject matter. Multiple choice tests made confusing so you do bad. Outside of class, he is very helpful to undergrads with questions about majors/classes, esp. research interest.
Horrible Professor. Very Boring. Test are multiple choice and a real pain.

I doubt after this semester he will have a job. Horrible! As the previous person said, he lost all of our stuff ( which is questionable because he claimed his book bag was stolen yet still showed up with the same book bag everyday) and would not give us any hint as to what he was going to do about his incompetence. DO NOT TAKE A CLASS WITH THIS TA!
He's super helpful and very very intelligent. This is one of the best teachers I have ever had. He is so intelligent it's literally attractive. He will inspire you.
Really funny dude, and he'll go way out of his way to help you understand a topic. Had him for 1113 lab/recitation, and he even holds review sessions before every test.

Lectures seemed pretty irrelevant to a lot of the testing material. Would often talk very in depth about one animal during lecture and expect the material to be broadly applied. I found it a bit confusing. Attendance is necessary, there are clicker questions every lecture. Study and do as many practice worksheets as possible.

When you ask her questions, she will just reread the question to you or have you reference something else. She teaches the course as if it a 3000 level biology class when it is just an intro. Her power points and lectures are irrelevant. She tells you to just do the study guide and study notes but you really need to READ the book. HORRIBLE.

Lectures are so boring and seem very long. Not very clear on topics and the slides are hard to follow. Tried to make a 300 person lecture interactive with discussions but all it really did was make lectures take forever and we barely learned anything due to the wasted time. This made the exams much more difficult than they should have been.

If you have Dr. Federer, the best thing you can do to make sure you do well is read the textbook. Seriously, read each chapter multiple times if you have time. Lectures often focus on one specific element of a chapter. Also, DO THE REVIEW QUESTIONS IN THE BOOK. Several of the midterm questions are word-for-word copied from the textbook's questions.

READ THE BOOK. The test averages in my class were very low, and it was because no one read the book. She does not emphasize this at all, and I decided to because I was having a hard time understanding her lectures. I got solid B+'s on the exams. Also, her lectures are sometimes irrelevant. Go to class, the clicker points were huge.

Too difficult to be an introductory level course. She is not helpful at all. The best part of this class is the lab and that's if you have a decent TA. She needs to be appointed to a 2000 level or 3000 level course.

I don't understand why people think her introductory biology class is that hard. Much of the material I remembered from high school. The lectures are pretty clear. If you show up and take notes, the exams aren't too hard. The lab assignments aren't that hard and are done in groups. Online quiz and assignments can be numerous, but aren't that hard.

In my opinion, she teaches 1101 as if students are Biology majors. The lectures are very confusing, she is not clear at all. She and the TA's grade very tediously. This course is specific for non-bio majors but if you take this class I recommend that you really be interested in Biology and considering studying it. If you don't, do not take Federer.
Her lecture is confusing and the quiz is tough.

Her powerpoints were not very easy to understand. The way she tried to convey the topics like case studies were not helpful for the exams and just made you more confused. The extra clicker points from lectures was a difference in a letter grade for me so go to lectures!

The lectures were very disorganized and I had to teach myself many concepts since her powerpoints did not convey the info well. The book helped me and definitely do not skip class, the extra clicker points from participation was a difference in a letter grade for me.
I am a little regretful to choose this "introductory" biology course...

She is very passionate about what she teaches but her exams were much more difficult than the lectures or study guides seemed. When students would email her with questions, we were just directed to reference the syllabus or study guide. Points were taken off of assignments for silly reasons, making it very difficult to get an A in this course.

I didn't find the class too bad. I put the work and effort into. If you go to lecture, read the recommended book, study, and ask questions, you'll be fine. I always made sure I knew the material thoroughly because the tests were best answer and somewhat tricky. However, if you put the effort into it you'll get an A. Received almost a 100%

I feel like many other review are being extremely harsh, but the things they're saying aren't entirely untrue. There is a lot of busy work in this class (ten short papers and a final write up, plus 10 homeworks plus 6 quizes). Luckily you rarely work on lab stuff outside of lab day. Tests are definitely frustrating though, many of the 's are annoyi
It is difficult for an introductory class.

Her lectures have nothing to do with all the quizzes and exams.  The average grade of our midterms are C or D. She never gives you sample exams or quizzes to practice. The study guide she gave is very general and you don't know where to start.  The homework is too much. I spend 6-7 hours to do homework  every weekend.

Passionate for biology teaching. Questions on exams and in class clickers poorly worded. Exam questions were overly difficult for introductory course (class average was D). Way too much work. expect 12+ hours per week for lecture, lab studying and homework.  Other classes suffered bc time commitment.  Should realize students have other classes.

DO NOT TAKE HER. On carmen she puts all your clicker points in but then tells you only 50 of the points count (which may be less than what you have). She doesn't cure an exam even if our class average was a 63%. Goes on about topics in lecture that are never on the exams. Says the book is recommended but need the book to get a B.
Impossible to get an A or A-. If you work hard on this course, congratulations, you may get a B. Get barely nothing on the lecture. PPT has nothing important and study mostly on my own!!!!!!!!!!
Very Hard, boring class filled with busy-work and hard exams. Good luck, she's horrible and hard professor
Her exams are hard. They have nothing to do with the lectures, the quizzes are the same way and are timed for 1 minute per question. Not a class i would recommend.

This is the WORST CLASS I've ever taken at OSU, worst professor in the university. Her lectures have nothing to do with the exam questions. She beats certain points into the ground, and brushes over topics that will actually be on the exam. Clicker points are for accuracy, and our average exam grade was a D. Avoid her at all costs. Seriously.

Dr. Federer is not a great lecturer, and pretty much all of the assignments for the class are just garbage busy work that don't have a real benefit.  Lab is easy enough, but the lecture is a bore. Clicker questions have to be right to count for participation, and the questions are NOT easy.

Very Hard tests, Labs are easy but theres only 2 exams and a final! they are very difficult and the nothing from lecture is on the exams, you're better off reading the book! The first exam will be a wake up call! Go to class she gives 40 participation points and 10 bonus for attendance. GO TO CLASS !

Her tests are very difficult and nothing what you expected compared to the lecture notes. Every question is about applying the knowledge rather than knowing the concept. She is  a nice professor but a very difficult class. Make sure you do all the assignments and go to class. She gives out lots of participation points, and you will need them all.

Her lectures completely mislead you to understanding what is on the midterms. Her study guides also do not help at all and her lectures are not helpful for exams. She's a nice person and seems to enjoy the material she teaches, however she totally does not prepare you for her tests and quizzes. Good Luck!

The course was split taught by two professors.  This instructor's portion sometimes coincided with textbook material or articles read for class.  When the assignment content didn't and I asked for help via email,  the help I received wasn't very clear. I feel like more clarity could have made the difference.

Dr. Miriti - though monotone and often unorganized, is extremely intelligent and helpful.  I was always able to get hold of her outside of class.  I took this class during may term, so there was a lot of work to get done in the four weeks.  It's totally manageable though and I HIGHLY recommend you take Ecological Methods.
Completely awful teacher. Unclear, monotone, boring, uninterested in teaching, and also uses clickers, so obviously lazy. DO NOT take a class with her if you can avoid it
Ive never had a more disorganized, boring, and generally useless teacher.  also, she makes you use clickers, so obviously too lazy to grade quizes

terrible professor/person. she has no personalitly and is very useless when it comes to help and is the most unsympathetic person i've ever known. class is extremely boring. DON'T EVER TAKE A CLASS WITH HER!
Wow...  worst professor ever...   very arrogent and explaining vague !!!!!!
Nice guy. Puts all the lecture powerpoints online. He only taught the second half of the course but his midterm and final were easy. Everything was straight from the lecture slides.

His powerpoints are posted online which is helpful.  He's very dry and I found myself drifting off in lectures a lot which is not good because he drops a lot of details that show up on tests in lecture. The biggest problem is that the class seems really easy until you get to the exams and realize how much information you've actually covered. Study!
sharp, knowledgable
This class was really easy - the lab brings the overall grade down. He is very boring too.
No Comments
Horrible professor.
No Comments

Dr. Ibba is an English man with alot of microbio knowledge and a sure sense of humor.  He Power Points his notes, all made up in a very clear manner - but don't miss lecture!  He adds some very interesting material that shows up on the tests.  A very approachable and likeable professor.
knowledgeable but a mess

He doesn't seem very approachable but his review sessions were very helpful (especially for the essay questions), he practically tells you what's going to be on every test. If you go to class and listen to his lectures there's no way a halfway intelligent person can't pass.

He tries so hard, but he's very unorganized sometimes. I was often confused on what he wanted for an assignment. Field trips were the worst as they took far longer than nessacary and they were on saturday mornings. The class was good though, like natural resource policy ,  wildlife management and eeob class smushed together.Sometimes too much work

He obviously cares about helping students learn. His notes posted online were a very helpful supplement during lecture. Exams (total of 9!) were poorly written at first but have improved as the quarter goes one. Read the text! His lecture notes aren't thorough enough to understand everything and get a good grade on exams.
the class is very technical... and dr. harder makes it worse than necessary. He enjoys the fact that he knows more than you and he wants to keep it that way.

Dr. Harder is VERY technical, but then this class is VERY technical.  A 400 level class is not easy, but he conveys the ideas quite clear.  He is a bit critical, but an excellent professor.  If you have problems in this class, choose a new career!!!!!!!!!
No Comments
he's not helpful adn he makes it impossible to understand what the point is. I wonder if he even knows what he's trying to say.
It's a chore for him to teach and grade and even deal with you.  And he lets you know it.
No Comments

TA for bio 101 labs. what a horrible experience. she never once let us leave lab when we were finished. she made us stay the full 3 hours, even if it was just to hear her explain something. she desperately wanted us to be interested in this class, but it just made it intolerable. take lab from someone, anyone, else.

I hated everything about this class. Lectures are overwhelmingly boring along with recitation. Random information is thrown together on a ridiculous number of slides. I would not recommend this class to anyone.

DON'T TAKE THIS CLASS unless you have to. It might be "Bio 1102" but it's more like Bio 1113 or 1114. The exams are super detailed and difficult, I failed the second one even after studying a ton. Way too hard for a lower level GE class.

Don't. Just don't. This class ranges from memorizing each and every name of species of homosapiens to nutrition to diseases to the nervous system to menstrual cycle to detailed DNA/genome sequencing material. Lecture quizzes are easy and recitation points help boost grade BUT exams... If this is your only choice, may the the odds be in your favor.
This class is too detailed, the ppts are like 79-100 slides long. Too much information to retain even if it's just for a test. Recitation points are super easy though.

If you know whats good for you, take the class with another instructor. Has an accent but not too hard to understand. Gives quizzes during lecture, but those are easy (points for attendance). Read reviews before taking and thought: those people are just being picky, I'll be fine, I'm smart. Exams are DETAILED, its ridiculous.

Of all the classes I've taken at OSU so far, this is the one I regret taking most. He stands up there and rambles about random information and doesn't use the textbook at all. Lectures are dull as dishwater; he's monotone and boring. I would highly recommend taking a different class to satisfy a biological sciences GE requirement.

The assignments in recitation and everything are very easy and you get points for showing up in class and asking the questions on paper, but the exams are way too difficult for a GEC class. Lecture is extremely boring. I wouldn't recommend taking this class, choose another for your GEC.

Classes are not mandatory but he does fun little survey things to keep you interested in coming and he always encourages students to ask him questions about biology he wants to know about. The first day he'll tell you he wishes he didn't have to give out grades because that's not what it should be about, but his exams are very detailed!

Hard to understand because he is British and does not speak very loud, especially in a large lecture hall. However, he is genuinely interested in helping students understand the relevance of the material. He knows his stuff, but you have to pay attention to fine details on lecture slides and questions are hard and detailed on exams.
Classes aren't mandatory, but he does ask questions that are 5 points at each lecture and they do add up.  He's British so he is hard to understand sometimes.

Ok, there is alot of info to cover but in no way is it hard to remember, and never did I stress about it.  The only thing that makes this class difficult is the way he words the questions on  2 midterms/final (66/68/72 averages).  Everything else in class are gimmie points.  Also, he does NOT curve. Overall: too hard for a 102 class.

Ignore below comments. This class is a little difficult only because of the material, not him. There's alot of material to cover and he does a good job explaining it. Question on midterm come straight from slides-are a lot of slides though. Rec. is boring, poster presentation is stupid.  I got an A- with him, just work HARD and memorize ALL SLIDES!
I COMPLETELY AGREE w/ the comment below. This is supposed to be a 102 class and it feels like it should've been a 400 level class. This class is NOT worth taking!

UPDATE: He is no longer easy. Only two videos are now watched in recitation, the rest are boring "case studies." He has a monotone British accent that gets very boring. He makes the questions for the exams, and they are extremely hard and tricky. Both exams so far have had D averages, and they are not curved. Avoid at all costs.
Very easy.  Lectures do not follow class that well.  Make sure you study his notes because that is what the exams are over.
VERY easy, no need to go to class. no labs! just recitations where you watch videos. There's a group project but it's crazy easy.
A good class to take following 101. Attendance isn't necessary for lecture and notes are online. No labs!! and recitation is simply showing up and watching videos.
I hate biology, but I liked this class.  Lectures were pretty relevant and stimulating, and recitations gave you points for just showing up and watching videos.

Dr. Fredrick is an incredibly clear and all-around amazing professor; very nice and understanding guy willing to help. Attending lecture and reviewing PowerPoints is more than enough to ace his exams, as he is very straightforward and doesn't try to trick you. As long as you actually know the material you will be more than fine. Highly recommend

Memorize everything from the powerpoints and you'll be fine. Tests aren't as easy as people make them out to be because of how much material you covered. He also throws some questions on that are literally one line from one slide that wasn't even a major topic. He has a very soothing voice so staying awake in lecture was a struggle.

Kurt is a solid teacher, nothing too special but he gets the concepts across to you well. Most, if not all, of his tests are based off his online powerpoints so you don't need to go to class to do well but it helps. This was a class where it was easy to get a B/B+ but if you want an A you really have to work your as off since the curves were low.
real cool.

You're probably reading this because you already know this is the professor you're going to have. Things to know: he's a great professor. Lecture is explained well and he's always willing to talk out of class. I thought his tests were fair, but not nearly as easy as everyone seems to say. If you have a very good memory you won't have trouble

He is a very good teacher and makes all the infromation very clear. He knows his stuff so when you ask him a question he actually gives a comprehensible answer. Material is decent but the hard part is lab which brings your grade down so watch out for that. Overall, one of the better professors in the department
Great teacher.  Easy tests.

Cool dude, lecture is easy, study all the notes very well, you will know exactly what is coming on the exam if you study the end of lecture questions.  The lab is what you gotta worry about.  I had a 94% in lecture, but lab brought me down to an A-

Lecture is cool if you actually go to lecture. The lectures are very boring, but the material presented in the lecture isn't that hard, so you can not go to class if you want. The only problem is lab, good luck with that. I hated every moment of it.
Not a difficult course if you attend lecture regularly...or even if you don't. Dr. Fredrick keeps the material interesting and is a fair grader. Good luck in lab!

EXCELLENT! Heard horror stories about him, but he is wonderful and very helpful. Takes an interest in each student, tries ot learn names and majors etc. One of the top virology people in the country, and used to practice around Columbus. He expects a lot, but grades leniently if you make an effort; no book, whatever he thinks is important/current.

I usually struggle with this kind of material but Dr Ahmer broke it down in a way you can really get. He's really fast paced but he gives you the tools to be prepared like printing everyone copies of the slides so you can go over them before the lectures
best professor at osu hands down
Dr. Ahmer does a great job of explaining complex material in a way you can understand. The only professor who devotes this much time to helping students outside of lectures
Dr Ahmer is always there when ever you need him or have an issue an incredible person truly has an ability to clearly and thoroughly teach unlike an professor I have ever had. H

Dr. Ahmer flew through his slides and made jokes about repeating his lectures. His test cover everything from general concepts to little details (he is especially fond of dates as that was 1/4 of our final)

Micro 581.01 Dr. Ahmer flew through power point slides (averaged about 50 slides every 48 minute class) that were very text and diagram heavy.  When asked what we should focus on for the tests, claimed "everything."  Sp10 was his first quarter to use multiple choice and scantron tests.  Used the word "carnage" to describe the grades on final.

He is a great teacher I absolutely loved him!  He is really cool and helpful in class.  He had a nice teaching style and makes great jokes!  I guess it also helped that I was really attracted to him, he is a total stud!  Its to bad that he is married...

Go to class. He presents an overwhelming amount of material, but is clear about what he wants you to know.  Read the book for clarity, paying little attention to detail.  Study prior to the review session, and ask questions. He does not use the review session to highlight what you need to know. Study old midterms & quizzes for the final.

Brian is a good guy.  He is a little full of himself at times, but overall is a good teacher.  He will teach you what you need to learn, so you know what is important while you are studying.  CLASS ATTENDANCE IS A MUST!  If you skip a lot, take Artsimovich, you will need to go to Ahmer's class or you will fall behind and the course will be hell.

This class was easy if u wanted a C. For those of u who r in ur final year and want to score A's in all classes u gotta put some effort. Brian's teaching is very casual and sometimes making complex stuff casual makes it harder. He is also a busy man and has barely anytime for u outside class. Hope u enjoy the class more than i did.
Easy class. Good prof
Probably the best teacher at OSU!

Great teacher! The material is hard but he does everything in his power to make it easier and more clear.  He really prepares you for the tests - not one of those professors who pulls tricks or makes the exams way harder than the lecture material.

Bio is very new to me, and I suck at it- I found him to be very helpful. He went out of his way to clarify what I didn't understand, and if he wasn't completely sure about something, he would research it and then email us so that we had the right understanding. Laid back atmosphere, he was really great!
He was helpful and kept the class in a relaxed mood. He was a little hard on the grading and takes foreverrr to finish grading and post them up online. Ive been waiting a month for my project grade.

I dont understand what everybody is complaining about, especially since he has only taught one class, I know I was a member of it. He gave out phenomenal study guides for exams, answered any question ever asked,  and was very chill. Class was a highlight of my quarter. The fact that I had a middle school girl crush on him didnt hurt! I mean hot!

He is this random undergrad student TA that grades overly hard because he has an elitist attitude. Another guy in class told me he posted stuff about his section on Facebook. My recommendation? Try to find a a more qualified/mature TA for your Bio class.
tough grader

Very cute and fun... Played music in class and tried to keep things laid back. NOT AN EASY GRADER! Isnt always the clearest on instructions but is more than willing to answer questions and help if need be. Def Recommend!
As a TA, he was more knowledgeable than the professor. He was generally interested in teaching and very passionate about the subject.
No Comments

Alex is the best TA I have ever had at Ohio State. I learned more from him that the prof...Go to his office hours, he's great at helping you learn everything you need to know. Very friendly, easy if you read and put in some effort. Ask for help on the lab assignments/quizzes.

Awesome TA. Super helpful. Asks some tough questions on the practical and quizzes but it's completely fair and all you have to do is pay attention in lab. He will definitely try to help you get the right answer and if you ask questions, he is EXTREMELY helpful and will work with you until you understand everything. :)
Great guy and really helpful but he takes points off on labs just because he thinks you should have that in your answer, even if your answer is correct!! Stay way from him!
lectures are powerpoints straight from the textbook..he counts attendance for points..tells you he will give you a sheet with formulas for the midterm/final, then DOESN'T?! Drop him!!

Avoid this professor if possible. If you don't hate plants now - you will when you finish with this guy.
HE is horrible, he has a monotone and will put you to sleep. AVOID. Class attendance dropped significantly for the week he was there. He is just plain horrible and he read from the slides.
it seems like he's not in class to help you
He was very rude and unfriendly.  I did not learn much in his class

He is an **** that talks down to everyone. He says he never makes mistakes. He says Americans eat bad and don't think at all.

Horrible prof. v difficult to understand.the only thing you will understand is her bragging about her research and grants money she doesnt know where to spend. I dont think she cares at all about teaching, just an opportunity for her to show off.

The class has been changed since previous years to make it easier, and it is.  Tests are straightforward if you study the lecture notes.  The lab is fairly easy, just Carmen quizes and 2-3 reports.  Don't bother to buy the book, you won't need it and it's not very good anyway.
She really is not that bad, the tests are not that hard even if they are short answer. No one went to class. Lab sucks, no one knows whats going on during the last 2/3 of lab. good luck with that.
SUPER ****. Take her class if you want to leave science!

she is hard to understand, the tests are all short essay.. she hates multiple choice, ohio state's microbiology, and the united state.. beware! but, if u do take her do the extra credit b/c she gives up to 85 points
terrible...i don't think i learned one thing in this class. Lab was also hell. Maybe if i knew what we were doing i could have actually produced a quality module report.

wow, what can i say about this guy (my TA for eeob400)... no social skills, cannot communicate his thoughts clearly, awkward, laughs at your questions, doesn't seem to know the material he's teaching. This guy should NOT be a TA.
Do not take Bio 114 with him. Wait and take it with a different prof. He makes it more difficult than it should be.. Not worth your time.

Cooley was a great prof in my opinion. Lecture is basically mandatory and exam questions came straight from lecture notes. I barely opened the book, just studied notes and aced the final. Not always crystal clear, had a very different approach to lecture but gives plenty bonus points and willing to listen if you argue points back. Would take again

He was a mediocre lecturer.  Much of lecture was spent talking about one or two topics in great detail and then the rest of the book wasn't even tested on.  As long as you have a decent TA and pay attention in lecture it really isn't that bad, but good look listening to him for an hour and 18 minutes

Dr. Cooley is a nice guy w/ good intentions. Unfortunately, his intentions are not always realized.  VERY BORING. He tries to make class interesting, but is mostly unsuccessful. Read the book to learn the material. Lecture is only for bonus pts and to find out info covered on the test. He loves to talk, a lot! I will say, he is a very fair grader.

I thought Dr. Cooley was a solid educator. He made lecture interesting most of the time and loves to give out bonus points. I actually found that his exams followed the content of his lectures more so than the textbook. Overall not a difficult class, especially with all the extra credit.

WORSE, I honestly mean the worst teacher I have ever had on this campus! He would emphasize multiple things in lecture that didn't even appear on the exams, and really didn't give us any insight as to what he expected us to know. We had a midterm and a final on the same day. What the hell! If I were you I would definitely avoid his classes!!!!!!!!!

His communication skills in lecture were poor and left much of the material to be learned on our own.  Dr. Cooley made the final exam and our third midterm on the SAME DAY- terrible planning.  This class was much harder than it really has to be; chem is the weed out class, not biology.  I used to love biology, Dr. Cooley makes it unenjoyable.

Way too much work for a 3 credit hr class. Ridiculously hard in grading assignments and moreover no matter how much you try you aint gonna get a good grade unless u are an exceptional writer. His way of teaching sucks, unorganized, basically wont learn nythin from him. Out of 90 students only 12 ppl got A or A-. Avoid this class at all cost :(

This class is way to much work for three credit hours. It was supposed to be about extinction yet he gives us assignments in which your based how well you write (very unfair). Boring lectures and makes grading more complicated than it should be. Thinks he is indeed more clever than he is. Avoid at all costs.

This class was too much work for a 3 credit hour class.  Lots of tedious assignments.  Dr. Cooley is a pretty good lecturer, but this class was nothing special.  Some things were interesting and I think overall the class wasn't too hard, but it was a lot of work for a class worth so little

Extremely unorganized. Loves the sound of his own voice. Thinks he's more clever than he is. Put all that together and you get long winded, boring lectures that are rarely relevant. Also, waaaay too many stupid assignments for a 3 credit hour class.
Josh was really nice and always helpful.
Awesome TA.  He was helpful and seemed like he wanted to be there.
Helpful
He was really helpful in lab, and answered every question we had very clearly.  Tried to make bio lab as fun as it possibly could be.  He is also SUPER hot!
No Comments
Informative, helpful and available. Wants students to do well. Nice attitude and quite reasonable. Answers all questions in a helpful manner - no matter how silly. Great.
No Comments

She is not helpful at all!  Once she actually sent out an email to the class saying, "I am going to bed and will not check my email again until after your assignment is due online."  Not cool since we all had questions about the assignment
She does not clearly notify the projects and does not quite helpful.

I agree with the last person, doing in class activities and HW did feel like high school.  but overall it wasn't a difficult class.  just make sure that you go.  lots of quizzes in both lecture and lab, also essays on the test.  but the essay come directly from lecture so they're not hard.  never once had to actually read the book

Dr. Olson is all around pretty fair. If you attend lectures and actually pay attention, an A is easily within reach.  My only problem with her is the fact that she gives out HW assignments that are due the next day, has pop quizzes, and does lecture activities where she tries to involve the entire class. Kind of felt like I was back in high school.

Exams are a combination multiple choice and essay.  Homework assignments and 5 pt. quizzes in lecture, but they are pretty easy.  If you go to lecture, you will be totally fine.  I think the person below probably just never went to lecture.  This is college people, don't expect to be hand fed information.  I thought she was a pretty good prof.

the absolute worst teacher I have ever had in my life!!! I have a lo of bad profs but none of them tops her. She is unfair, she just really sucks. GET OUT OF THIS CLASS IMMEDIATELY. if you dont you will suffer. I would rather be hanged and tortured than have her again.

Interesting class, and Dr Olson is genuinely interested in what she is teaching.  Lecture is interesting, and she is very thorough and fair in her grading.  Very nice also, and willing to help.  However there is a lot of homework type assignments in lecture, which is weird but easy.  She wants you to read the book but it's not necessary.

he is the hardest biology TA out there. He seems like a nice guy and is always prepared and he also makes powerpoints for his labs. However, his quizzes are near to impossible, he never give you a good grade in lab reports. He makes biology a lot harder than it needs to be. the only thing he's good for is that he prepares you well for the practical
MIKE is so GREAT. He is helpful, funny, nice, caring, and AMAZING!!! He is everything anyone would ever want!!!
He was the TA for this class and was extremely helpful. He made class much more enjoyable. He took the time to explain things in a clear way. I highly recommend taking any class he teaches.

New professor...always willing to help.  Go to class for participation points! Exams were complicated as there weren't many questions so if you missed some it could hurt.  Overall, great teacher.  Recommend this class.
He was super nice. Pretty cute. Reasonable grader if you put in some effort.
British accent!!! However, extremely hard grader.
Passionate about teaching. Would probably rather be teaching another subject. Won't fuss with you about little points in grading. Pay attention, try, it's not so hard.
he was great
fair, just had to study
hard but fair
awesome!

What a jerk!Awful TA; when half the class (like 200 out of 400) either failed or came to close to failing the midterm, he said, "well I didn't think it was that hard"-well of course u don't- if u did,u wouldnt be trying to get a PHD in plant bio, would you?complete tool;get in another section.
this guy was not a good TA; didn't seem to care at all and wasn't helpful
Very hard, not helpful; does not answer questions in office hours, and won't help you out on the labs, either; not a very nice person.
No Comments
Lectures pretty dull & lab is an absolute joke. Can totally BS lab reports. Probably want to attend class b/c he includes stuff that aren't on the slides & than used on exam.

I enjoyed Chang. He is a good teacher to learn from. He gives you everything you need to know in the notes so it's worth while to go. Don't really need the book for this guy. He is very helpful. Just read the notes and you'll do well. Aced his test.
Prof Chang is a really nice guy. His tests are tough but the majority of the questions were in his lecture notes. Study , read the book, and go to class an youll get a good grade.
Tough class, hard to stay interested during his lectures, test was really hard!!!

I had Dr. Chang as the first lecturer for Bio 113.  His notes/slides were very simple and he used a lot of pictures.  His exam was pretty hard.  The average was 66%.  He seems like a pretty nice guy and not boring.
He is soooo easy to listen to. He gives so many examples and explains thoroughly the material. Nice guy. STUDY the book too though. Tests and quizzes are hard.

Chang is great.  He's full of little insights on science and working as a scientist.  Speaks decent English (relatively clear).  His weekend take-home test is excruciating, so don't put it off until Sunday.  Fantastic professor overall.
Emphasizes main idea rather than details
This class has a lot of reading, and you cover 21 chapters throughout the quarter. So you have to stay ontop of it.. or its hard to catch up! He has good notes, and he's funny
Awesome lecturer and lab instructor.  He was also very approachable as he very kindly wrote me a letter of recommentdation for grad and med schools.

A ridiculoulsy knowledgable lecturer.  If there were 2 changs teaching Bio 113, I think I would have done better.  The questions he puts on the exams are relevant to exactly what he says in lecs. Sometimes it will seem as if he spoonfeeds us, but when many of us have a busy schedule and are taking OChem, it is sometimes needed. The best lecturer.

He teaches at a good pace, emphasizes things you'll need to know for the tests, and occasionally makes a good joke.  At first, I thought his accent would be a problem, but his strange pronunciation of some vocabulary actually ended up helping me memorize it.

Professor Waddell is a pretty decent lady.  She presents the material in a clear and organized manner.  This class takes a lot of outside work, since there is so much material covered in a short period of time, but if you are willing to not be lazy you should do well.  I would take another of her classes.

Dr. Waddell is very nice, her lectures are crystal clear and exams were fair and easy if you attend the class. The exams are from the in class lecture slides. I never bought the textbook but still got an A. This class is a joke I would recommend anyone who is a bio major to take this class with Dr. Waddell instead of EEOB 410 which is hard
She is boring, basically just reads the notes. Exams were pretty hard, I had to read the book to do well. Exam days were so unorganized! Professors freaking out about where people were seating etc.
worst teacher you can ever have. she doesnt explain the materials well. her exams are hard. the midterms average were 60%. stay away from her unless you wanna mess with you gpa..
talks very softly and monotoned so staying awake is really tough

Terrible teacher, the class was too much for 4 credit hours his expectations did not go with his notes, there was alot of bio and chem when the class only required 1 class of bio.  The final was rediculous, in a class like that the average should not be in the D range

Worst professor I have had at Ohio State.  His exams are worded horribly. He did come to the recitations before the mid-term and final, however he told us on the last class (class before our final) not to bother him with questions, he was going to be really busy over the weekend so direct them to the TA?s! He mumbles and makes the material so borin

He was bad. I could not stand listening to him. Attendance was important to lecture because of quizzes on Thursdays. These were bad because he words the quizzes by the way he talks so no one gets them. I was disappointed because the evolution topic is really interesting and he made it so boring. Also the TA?s seem to not want to help us.
He should not be allowed to teach!!! Half of the class would not fail his midterm if he knew how to write a comprehensible test question. AVOID THIS "teacher"
Class is confusing and he doesn't do much to help

I was really dismayed that Prof. Abdul-Salim really didn't know what he was talking about.  During the lectures where I actually knew the material prior to taking his class, I caught so many mistakes that it was alarming.  When I asked about them, there was a lot of hemming and hawing, and I was told that we were both correct.

I do not recommend anyone take EEOB 400 with Abdul-Salim.  If you do, go to every lecture where in class assignments are given and every recitation.  Class assignments are the best way to get a passing grade.  The exams are written and graded poorly, don't expect to get the bulk of your points by taking them. Avoid Salim, or take my advice to pass

Easily the worst class I've ever taken.  It's supposed to be an undergraduate level evolution class, but it definitely was not.  He doesnt test to the material.  He tests you on case studies, not what he taught you.  Avoid taking this class with him.

HORRIBLE TEACHER...the textbook doesn't correlate to lecture which doesn't correlate with the exams. He is arrogant, rigid, and a hard grader. He has extreme difficulty communicating the most simple concepts. He doesn't follow his own guidlines and even puts material on the tests that he said not to study. Do not take this class when he is teaching

Lectures are quite boring and his Mid Terms are bit on the tricky side (average for first midterms was 68%). Also, he assigns around 5 home work assignments and the last one had strict deadline on Carmen (no late submissions). I missed it and lost 20 points. Till now I had a solid A, now I don't know. Pretty unforgiving policy.

Professor Abdul-Salim is one of the worst professors I have had at Ohio State in my 3+ years at the university.  Evolution 400 is an entry level, undergraduate class that Prof. Abdul-Salim teaches at a graduate level.  His lectures and powerpoint slides do not represent his tests well at all.  If you have to take this class, aviod him at all costs.

He said to study this, study that for final. I studied ppt slides and knew the material like the back of my had. The final had nothing to do with lecture material. We were given 3 scientific articles and asked to answer ridiclously tough questions on them. I wasted precious time. I could have studied for other classes. He stabbed us all in the back

Just graduated so I can say this is the worst class I've ever taken at OSU. Very arrogant and unhelpful when approached. 2 exams, homeworks, and opportunity for credit. Memorized 500+ slides for each exam, but all info was irrelevant (half of test was interpreting data). Got a B+ in class w/ curve after having a 98% because avg was a 52% on the final.

Kobe is the worst professor I've had in two years at OSU! He says "um" about 100 times per lecture, mumbles, and merely reads off the lecture slides. Going to lecture is almost pointless, besides when he offers extra credit. Tests are ridiculously confusing and tough. Avoid this guy at all costs!

Plainly put, he is a bad teacher.  The notes he uses for the class as well as the midterms are not his, and all he does is read from them...  He tries to make the class difficult by giving vague directions to his assignments.  Average on midterm was 66...so  he blamed us for being bad students.  Thanks Abdul, you made me hate evolution.

This class was very interesting with the help of Amy Kovach. She was very helpful and really tied in current events to every section we learned in class. If you go to lecture and ask questions the class will be a breeze.

Amy is one of the best teachers I've had in life sciences.  Her slides and use of internet material (articles, YouTube, etc) made Bio 114 incredibly interesting.  I didn't touch my text book once and got an A in her class.  The lab practical is challenging but the rules for doing well in her class still follow.  Attend lecture and office hours.

She gives you the lecture slides, and if you study those it's pretty easy to understand what she thinks is important--she'll make it clear during lecture. She's really nice and explains the material well, but doesn't go into much detail, but it was bio 114.
She's okay, interesting, read book, exams a little tricky in questioning but overall really neat assignments and discusions in class.
She was friendly and tried desperately to explain concepts, but most people just ended up even more confused than they were to begin with. I learned nothing from the lab. Avoid her.

Lina was very friendly, but it was very difficult to understand her. When anyone would ask her a question, she struggled to explain it clearly, and would often tell us "you should know this or your exam will be hard". Yeah thanks for update captain obvious.

Dinosaurs isn't his area of research, but he is extremely knowledgeable.  Course may be difficult if you haven't taken other EEOB classes. Test questions taken from slides he posts especially the parts he leave blank. Book is worthless. Class may be boring at times so be prepared. Overall, I would recommend him only if you are a EEOB/Zoology major.

He was an amazing prof! so far the best I've had here... didn't even buy the book, just studied the PowerPoints and did just fine. Told jokes in lecture to keep it interesting, he is actually quite funny!! Lectures are as interesting as they can be. Exams very straightforward

Never opened the book once. Lecture was super interesting most of the time. Study the power points and you will do awesome. He curved each midterm. Go to class and gets the answers to the questions he puts in the slides. He asked tons of questions and really acted like he enjoyed teaching.

On the midterms, be prepared for questions such as: Is the answer A, B, C, A and B, or B and C. The information on the midterms is directly from the powerpoint notes. Don't read the book, it's a waste of time, because he does not follow the book.  Go to lecture, but only to answer the questions in his powerpoint notes. You don't have to listen.

Seemed nice and interested in teaching however, lecture material was very random and scattered test formats were very confusing and not straightforward.  Class material could have been way more clear and easier than how it was presented.

Seemed nice and interested in teaching however, lecture material was very random and scattered test formats were very confusing and not straightforward.  Class material could have been way more clear and easier than how it was presented.
he's interested in what he's teaching, so it's rwtty interesting. He's a little confusing somethimes, but always willing to slow down and explain.
I decided to go into a phd physiology program because of this class.  Highly recommended.

Great teacher. The notes are clear, and he leaves out portions on the notes that you you have to fill out which is helpful in remembering the information. When the other professors teach the other sections you tend to miss him!

He was very easy-going. Fantastic at explaining concepts and terms. Book is useless. I recommend getting BRS Physiology and reviewing it before and after class.  The practice questions he gives are easier than actual exams but not by much.

his portion of the exams were very straightforward. his practice tests are a little easier than what's on the exam. very helpful during office hrs. all multiple choice exams. the other profs teaching the course were decent, but this guy is the best (he's the main guy too). pretty easy A if you're a bio major. helpful for mcat if your premed.

for physiology 311 and 312. really clear notes and straightforward exams. you buy a notes packet and fill in the blanks in class. kind of boring but a good class to take if you're pre-med. slight accent (belgian) but it's never a problem. class rotates diferent lecturers, but he is the main one and the best. class pretty easy!
